description:
Totopos con Chile and Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón were so good! I do wish the Quesadilla had a little more acid, as it was super rich. 

Service was quick, our server was great, and the atmosphere was nice too. Would definitely go back!
author: Parissa A.

description:
A very close friend took me to here for lunch and the food here was exquisitely delicious! I had the pleasures of trying out their Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón, Gorditas Campechanas, Tamal de Birria de Pollo, Almond Horchata, and Strawberry-Almond Horchata! 

The quesadilla was very unique in its look as it wasn't the usual round sandwich type that you usually get at Mexican places. I was told it was more authentic and something you'd find on the streets of Mexico, so already, the visual of the quesadilla piqued my interest. It was very crunchy, and the pork belly was juicy and seasoned well. I also appreciated how the cilantro did not overpower the dish as I'm not a huge fan of a lot of cilantro.


The gorditas were also very delicious! It was my first time eating gorditas and I expected the chorizo to be drenched in oil, but the oil was not overwhelming and didn't make me feel nauseous (which usually happens with oily foods). I thought it was a very well balanced dish with meat, lettuce and sauce.

The tamal might have been my favorite dish. I am used to the typical tamale style that are kind of small and skinny in size. But this one was a larger version of it, stuffed with shredded chicken and smothered in a delicious, spicy red sauce. The sauce wasn't really that spicy, but it had that nice punch which isn't too wimpy but also not too spicy at all. It definitely had a subtle spice to it. Usually I don't find tamales to be very filling as a meal. I'd have to eat several of them to feel satiated, but this tamal alone would have been enough for me!

The Almond Horchata and the Strawberry-Horchata were also very delicious. They tasted like they were made fresh and on the spot. A friend in Mexico had been taunting me for months about how Strawberry Horchatas were a thing there, and now that I was able to have a sip of it myself, I can say that I was not disappointed. You can definitely taste the "real strawberry" in it! Even the regular Almond Horchata was very creamy and delicious.

Another thing I really appreciated about this place was that they did not give you the typical salsa and chips as their complimentary dining-in services. Instead, they give you these roasted, salted, spiced garabanzo beans that were quite addicting!

Overall, I think if you go here, definitely try out the Tamal and the Strawberry Horchata!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood and had dinner for the first time on Saturday. We arrived around 6:30 and put our name on the sign in sheet outside. Our table of 2 was seated about 15-20 minutes later.

After we were seated, we received menus but no waters. We looked over the menus and a few minutes later, a server arrived. He did not say anything. It was a little awkward.

We ordered two of the agua frescas (Tepache and Strawberry Lemonade), and the Ensalada de Melones con Chile y Limó to start, and the fish tacos and the Caldo Tlalpeño con Pollo to share as our mains.

We were given some crunchy garbanzo beans to start, and our drinks arrived a couple minutes later. My boyfriend then asked for water, and the waiter brought us a pitcher as well.

The melon dish was flavorful and a nice refreshing start to the meal. The drinks were also fun. The tepache had a kick to it and the strawberry lemonade was more sweet. 

As for the mains, the fish tacos were a hit and the Tlapeno was a miss. The Tlapeno was a soup, and was super light on all the beautiful vegetables noted in the menu. It was served with warm corn tortillas, but it was a little odd to pair with a rather soupy (not thick) soup. Also, the soup itself was pretty bland.

Finally, if you need to use the restroom, you have to exit the restaurant and re-enter to the spot where you pick up to-go orders. Kind of annoying.

Overall, an A-OK place for fresh Mexican food with a more upscale casual atmosphere in the neighborhood. I subtracted 1 star for the sub-par service and 1 star for the disappointing soup.
author: Roya B.

description: Update: went again and the food was great. The mole sauce was so tasty. Went with my parents visiting and everyone loved the experience.
author: Neil S.

description:
Nice place for Mexican food. Everything was pretty good at Nopalito! It's kind of trendy in here, and also really bright/clean. They have some communal seating as well.
Seemed like there was good variety in the menu. I had the carnitas tacos. Really good, really flavorful, and really fresh! Everyone seemed to enjoy their food because plates were cleaned. In general, dishes are on the smaller side. Not a bad thing.
On that note, would probably not recommend the guac appetizer as it was too small of a portion. We annihilated it in 3 bites. My friends weren't thrilled with it, but it was still good nonetheless.
Just like the food menu, the drink menu is solid. I was happy with the paloma.
Try it!
author: Mala L.

description:
Came here at 8:30 on a Friday night with a party of 4. Took us about 30 minutes to get a table.

Was pretty excited to try this place and got what some people recommended. Got the carnitas, Totopos con Chile, quesadilla Roja con chicharon, and strawberry horchata.

I must say, I really enjoyed the quesadilla. It was basically a large hard shelled taco with melted cheese layer like a quesadilla. It was such a nice balance of flavors and texture.

The totopos con chile was a little soggy I thought. I didn't think there was too much flavor there. Idk what happened there.

The carnitas was pretty boring I thought. The meat was tender and soft, but there wasn't much besides it. It was essentially just soft pulled pork...

The horchata was also pretty meh. It was a softer and more subtle flavor.
author: Victor D.

description: Food was good, but we found a nail in one of the entree's. A STEEL nail was discovered while eating the quesadilla. After alerting management, nothing was done about it. The manager did not even bother to come over to apologize. Nothing was done about it... instead they dropped off dessert for compensation. Thanks for tetanus in exchange for flan!
author: Paul M.

description:
When I was going to night school, I ate a lot of Mexican food - sooooo much that I overdosed on it and I've kinda been avoiding it ever since.  For 2018, I wanted to go through SF's top restaurants and Nopalito has popped up on multiple lists (Bib Gourmand, Top 100) so I gave it a try.  

Based on the server's recommendations, I ordered the carnitas tacos, the quesadilla Roja con chicharon and the strawberry horchata.  As a starter, they gave each table spicy garbanzo beans. Everything was great!  It's enough food for two but I devoured it.  Not that they made me fall in love with Mexican food again but that was definitely worth the calories.  

Service was awesome and the restaurant is nice and open.  Including tax and tip, this meal was $40 (again, enough to be shared by two people).  I think Nopalito is the rare gem that has great service, good food and relatively affordable prices. Highly recommended!!!
author: Andrew S.

description: After a long few days of exploring SF, my partner-in-crime and I knew that we cannot leave here without trying tacos. We found this place via Yelp and we're staying not too far from this restaurant. We read a lot of positive reviews about the Tacos de Pescado al Pastor so we decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, we both were really disappointed. We felt that everything from the taco shell to the fish to the garnishes really had no flavor what so ever. The texture of everything on it was all over the place too - one bite of carrot over here and another bite of orange over there. It was also very pricey for two tacos. I guess premium ingredients really does not work. Customer Service was great despite the tacos.
author: Cynthia D.

description: Finally had enough of this place's general rudeness. They've always been bad at seating even when you have a reservation Three of us waited for 20 minutes while looking at an empty, set table that could fit us while watching several other groups after us on the list be seated first. Finally we were seated at a two person table with a third seat crammed in that was next to the drafty door. No one wanted it so we just left. The 3 star food, just isn't good enough to put up with this.
author: Mark F.

description: Excellent food and excellent service!! Nopalito serves authentic and delicious plates, I also recommend their dark chocolate & cinnamon popsicle as dessert. I went with my sisters and friends, we ordered a variety of plates from the menu and all had a taste of those. Definitely returning when I'm back in the San Francisco area.
author: Andrea G.

description: Perfect for a casual weekday dinner. My sister and I came here for a quick and light dinner that still felt fun and special. The food was very good and the waiter was very helpful in terms of my sister's allergies. The highlight was definitely the different types of margaritas.
author: Sharvari J.

description: My foodie friends and I came to Nopalito for a small first dinner--yes, you heard me--while waiting for very late dinner reservations at a restaurant nearby. Our server was very nice and amicably pointed out some choice small plates to share for our purposes rather than being miffed that we were merely grazing rather than eating a full meal; he was so friendly and relaxed that it felt like talking to an old friend. We chose to share the chips and a chicharrones quesadilla, which one of my friends had remembered fondly from her previous time at the restaurant. They offer complimentary fried chickpea snacks, which were addictive. Surprisingly, the chips were the standout of the night for me. One would think that tortilla chips can only be so good but the way these chips were tossed with salsa made the texture delightfully not too dry but somehow still crunchy. Of course, the cheese sprinkled all over the top and the ramekin of straight-up sour cream as dipping sauce didn't hurt either. The quesadilla had a homemade looking tortilla and crunchy pieces of pork skin inside. My friends and I still talk about the chips! We are looking forward to another appetizer filled meal at Nopalito in the future.
author: Amy G.

description:
Nopalito was solid-- but I think I might have personally ordered the wrong dish. 

I got a strawberry almond horchata to go with my lunch, and it did not disappoint and I love me some horchata.

We shared the Totopos con Chile that everyone raves about, and they were definitely the highlight of my meal. The chips (drenched in a ridiculously flavorful sauce) maintained their crispiness and added to the overall dish for sure. 

I got the gorditas, which for me were a little under seasoned  and lacking flavor and didn't stack up to the expectations I had after trying the Totopos. My fiancé loved his fish tacos though which gives me high hopes for the rest of their menu which I would go back and try again.
author: Siobhan F.

description:
Gosh this place is such a little gem in the area ! Most things around are so overpriced but here...you get what you pay for. In the best sense. 

My "elegant" chicken taquitos were crunchy, fresh and so tasty ! The chicken was marinated to perfection and that guacamole sauce added bliss to the meal. The savory meal satisfied my hunger but didn't leave me super full/overwhelmed or with leftovers that I'd dread to drag around the city. 

 My boyfriend's chicken mole enchilada was also exceptionally well-balanced. Mole is a pretty rich, bold sauce that can be a bit much for someone who doesn't like super saucy dishes such as myself. HOWEVER (caps for emphasis), their chicken mole had a such a well-balanced combination of flavors that although prominent as its meant to be, it's not overpowering. Bold but not overwhelming. Rich but generously balanced. You get the point. 

So yes, I highly recommend this gem. Enjoyed my experience very much. 

Oh and the service was very kind and efficient. Parking in the city is always a challenge but stay positive and you'll find something. Enjoy!
author: Dani D.

description: This is not your typical Mexican place, they offer a variety​ of traditional ​dishes, my favorite is the Torta with Shredded Pork, the Tacos are really good as well, I would highly recommend this place but if you are expecting the typical Mexican​ spot, this is not the place.
author: P E.

description: We came here this evening with a party of 7. Everything was great, until a nail, yes an actual steel NAIL was discovered in one of our meals. We asked multiple times that the manager come speak to us, but our request was not honored. Instead, they offered us flan for a dessert like it would make up for it. Such a terrible experience and we will never be back. The food was actually delicious, but so disappointing how the entire restaurant handled the situation. I've worked in restaurants for years, and this is the worst service recovery I've ever seen.
author: A T.

description:
Boy oh boy. Where to begin... 

So let's start with seating. There is one person who is greeting guests. Sadly she training and running in and out of the building seating one group of people every handful of minutes. So there is a long line making it seems like it's popular and packed when in reality it's probably 70% capacity. 

The seating arrangements can be fun. Shared tables which I like because you can interact with some new people when eating. 

I initially was planning to get some kind of mixed drinks but when I watched the bartender under-pour each drink while using a jigger I quickly lost interest. 

Next the bathrooms. Or should I say ONE bathroom. It's a neutral bathroom and extremely disgusting. The smell is horrid. Definitely need to figure out a way to keep this clean and operating smoothly. 

The service was short. The service was NOT overly polite or attentive. I come from a place where "please, thank you and you're welcome" are customary. Sadly here it's just too much to ask. 

The food: 
Pretty uneventful here. I mean they don't even offer a complimentary chips and salsa. Obviously not a big issue but hey it would go a long way. 
Serving sizes are rather small for the price point. 
Wife had the special which was red snapper. Under seasoned and not worth coming back for. 

I had the carne asada which was equally as bland as the red snapper. The toughness of the steak was similar to cutting a car tire. And the marinade/seasoning was so minuscule that my little wedge of lime overpowered any of the flavor. Normally when I have carne asada the lime marinade is sharp. The beef is tender and small tug of a knife across the grain of the beef allows it shred and cut easily. 

The only thing worth getting her is the smashed black beans. The richness of the seasoned beans really comes alive especially when nothing else on the dish has any flavor

All in all a pretty heavily overrated place with lackluster meal options. Of course I'm from the south and know what GOOD Mexican inspired cooking is supposed to be. Sadly this truly misses the mark.
author: Robert B.

description:
NOPA is one of my favorite restaurants and Nopalito doesn't disappoint. I would still choose the former any day though. 

Totopos con Chile - This was highly recommended by someone I knew who loves the restaurant but also by a lot of Yelpers. It was really good. At first, I saw that all the chips were coated in the salsa... and thought oh no, they'll be soggy like chilaquiles. But they weren't at all. They remained crisp even by the time I got to the bottom of the bowl. So good! Even their sour cream tasted like they made it. 

Quesadilla de Roja con Chicharron - Not your ordinary quesadilla. It's made with a chile-corn tortilla so it has a rougher texture but it holds up to being fried and stuffed with a lot of stuff. I like how the crispy pork belly was chopped up--it worked well with all the other fillings and wasn't just dominating the whole dish. The quesadilla reminded me of a breakfast food for some reason. 

Pozole - Really rich flavor but same thinner consistency as a traditional pozole. My husband loved their take on it but I prefer the homier, simple version. Not bad at all though! This also came with a side of tortilla chips which means there was something crispy in every dish we got. 

The Almond Horchata and Andytown Coffee were perfect complements to the meal.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I loved the buzzing atmosphere. Seemed like a popular place for dates. It had a warm atmosphere with adorable succulents planted around the perimeter. 

[ Ceviche ] This was my first time having ceviche so I don't have anything to compare it too. I enjoyed the fresh, limey taste of the ceviche. The portion size was small but perfect for an appetizer. 

[ Quesadilla de Calabacitas ] I loved the blue corn tortilla tortilla, which almost tasted more like a taco shell. It made the dish very different from most of the quesadillas that I've had before. I really enjoyed the squash and variety of cheeses.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Really tasty and beautifully plated. I really enjoyed the lunch menu, very diverse. My trio split 3 different plates and had a little appetizer, so I feel like I got a taste for it. 

The Mole was bomb! Very rich and flavorful. The fish tacos had a great seasoning and were cooked perfectly. 

I did not appreciate that my tortilla fell apart and I couldn't eat the tacos with me hand. They tasted yummy, but I don't want to eat tacos with a fork and knife. That just ruins it for me. 

The service was nice and relatively quick, and the overall aesthetic was relaxing.
author: Eden C.

description:
Love this place. Great food, great service. I've always enjoyed the food every time I've been here (which is quite often). Even if there is a rush, the staff is polite and helpful.
I've tried the brussel sprouts quesadilla (quesadilla de repollitos) and Totopos con chile multiple times and keep coming back for more. 
On a recent visit, BF tried the Marinated pork tacos and looked like he was enjoying his food.
Micheladas are spot on!
If they have any almond biscotti available- do try some.
author: Dhanashree K.

description:
We heard great things about Nopalito so we made sure we stopped by during our visit to SF! The restaurant itself isn't too large but we were able to get a table in the covered patio area. I loved the decor inside because it had a nice rustic feel to it.

Our server was so helpful with his food recommendations. The food was authentically Mexican and super flavorful. We ordered a few different dishes to share so that we could try a variety of items from their menu. Their drinks were pretty good too. 

One of my favorites was the free spiced garbanzo beans that they give each table while you wait. They're so addicting to eat!
author: VyVy V.

description:
Somewhere, on a "Top 100 Best Restaurants In SF" list, Nopalito can be found. I know this, because I saw the list and bookmarked it for that reason. 

I wasn't planning to come here any time soon (OCD, gotta get the previous bookmarks first), but one day I was in the area exploring, and my date and I got hungry.

Since we were going to a pricey vegan sushi restaurant for dinner, we tried to keep a low profile at lunch (that means I didn't get anything to drink).

As a temporary vegetarian, I got the blue corn quesadilla, and my non-red-meat-eating date got the chicken enchiladas with mole.

The quesadilla was alright. Nothing too special, aside from the blue corn tortilla being...blue. It had squash in it, which was interesting, but didn't add much in flavor for me. I got a picture of the inside of it; at least it looks pretty.

My date absolutely loved his enchiladas. I obviously didn't try them, but their presentation alone made me feel better about this restaurant than my order did. I'm sure they're tasty.

Looking back at the pictures of their drinks, I'm pretty disappointed that I didn't try any. Their most appealing options seem to be their drinks and their dishes which contain meat, so I feel like I sort of missed out.

At least the service was pleasant and the restaurant was beautiful. We sat on the patio, which was more like a room with windows taking up the walls. Lots of light, and I think there were some nice plants. Lots of color.

This is a cute, modern restaurant, which I think would please older generations as much as newer.
author: Colby D.

description: Absolutely delicious food, we had the quesadilla Chicharrones and the Gordita (small stuffed taco pockets) & they were absolutely delicious, especially the Quesadilla.  Great flavor, perfect portion, texture was heavenly, and it was a wonderful balance of all through and through. The service was fantastic and the patio setting was very open, fresh, enjoyable, and cozy all at the same time. There is ample opportunity to people watch and the ambience felt warm and caring. It was obvious that providing an excellent guest experience was their #1 goal and I am now a willing enthusiast of this San Francisco quality eatery.
author: BC Q.

description:
Came here to enjoy a lovely day in San Francisco and of course enjoy delicious food. 

We got a large sampler of food including the rotating ceviche, spicy chips, pork belly quesadilla, carnitas tacos and popsicles to finish the meal. 

Oh and can't forget drinks! We all got something different but I tried the Sweet Heat (or sweet heart) which is a spicy margarita. The drink was refreshing and had a good hit of tequila and lime but sadly not much heat. 

The winner for food was the pork belly quesadilla. We all shared a couple of bites which was the perfect amount. A full serving would probably be too heavy and greasy, but great to share as an appetizer. 

I heard rave reviews about the carnitas. Which were moist and crunchy at the same time. Yum! However the tortillas and taco toppings were so boring and not flavorful I ended up just eating the carnitas on its own. 

Popsicles were sooooo boring! I was disappointed in both the texture (weirdly slimy and gritty) and lack of flavor (I couldn't taste a different in any of the popsicles). Lame!!

I don't think this place is worth the hype and wait times when there are so many phenomenal restaurants to visit in SF.
author: Issy D.

description:
Another 'Diner, Drive-In, and Dives' location that we had to check out!  

Location: Cute location sitting next to a market and a Peet's coffee.   On the other end you can order to go/coffee.  Has a few parking spots right in front, but there's a parking lot further in.  

Food: The ceviche was yummy, but a bit too pricey for quantity & taste.  The Totopos con chile seemed like a play off chilaquiles and I was IN LOVEEEEE.  So simple & yummy.  The Quesadilla Roja con chicharon was super tender and had great flavor.  The carnitas tacos had a good combo of pickled veggies and flavors, but the carnitas was on the drier end.

Service: took a while for the service to notice most things.  We got seated rather quickly, but after that we were only checked up on when food was dropped off.  Was not fond of them wiping off tables and crumbs before we were done or off the table.  Quite off putting.  

Overall: Food was a very solid 4.  Service was closer to a 3-3.5
author: Victoria K.

description:
Nopalito is the perfect restaurant for unique Mexican food! 

To start our meal, we were served spicy roasted chickpeas, a refreshing change from the traditional chips and salsa. These tiny chickpeas packed a punch and were delicious! Their menu had so many different dishes I wanted to try that it was difficult deciding what to order. My group started by ordering the Tacos de Pescado al Pastor, Tacos Dorados de Pollo, Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón, Ensalada de Nopalitos, and the Whole Pinquito Beans. 

Each and every dish was fantastic! I'm a big fan of pork al pastor, so I loved the unique twist of the fish al pastor (plus pineapple!!). The tacos dorados were a fun dish to order -- the dish was beautifully plated and I loved the flavorful sauces. I absolutely LOVED the chicharron quesadilla! I'm not a huge fan of chicharrones, but they added so much flavor and a delightful crunch to this dish. The nopalitos salad was interesting, especially for someone who hasn't eaten cactus before. Even the simple beans were flavorful and delicious. 

To round out our experience, the beer selection was great as well! The Berryessa Mexican lager and Fieldwork juicy IPA were delicious and well-priced for SF at only $6.
 
Each time I've eaten here, I've left wishing I had a bigger stomach that would allow me try more dishes. Such a fun restaurant!
author: Elyse W.

description:
So delicious! I was very impressed. Worth the wait.


Love the mezcal and honey cocktail. The margarita was perfect as well, not too sweet. 

Everything we ate was DELICIOUS. We had a lot more than expected!

Favorite thing on the menu: TACOS ARABE! Highly recommend.

The tamale was also so tasty and the texture was perfect.

Chicarron quesadilla was great too.

Would definitely return!
author: Kimia M.

description: Finally came back here after a few years and wasn't as good as I remember.  Got there at exactly 1130am on a Saturday so got a parking spot and was seated immediately.  Got the carnitas tacos, and even though they were pretty flavorful, the meat was on the dry side and lacked the juicy fatty goodness I was hoping for.
author: Simon L.

description: Was looking for authentic Mexican food and this was recommended to my friend and I. While it was good it was not the authentic it was more nouveau Mexican. We started with the fried garbanzo's which are served to everyone. They were quite tasty. I had the mole poblano and asked to substitute the rice for refried beans. They did not have any refried beans! It is a Mexican staple, how do you not have refried beans??? My girlfriend had the huarache and asked for another meat since it seemed to only come w beef tongue, after some asking they were able to substitute it with Beef Brisket. All the food was tasty just not very traditional. The margaritas were fantastic and fresh, that i did
author: Monica F.

description:
I picked up some takeout (that I immediately ate a block away, so it didn't sit and get gross). The best thing about my experience was the woman handling the takeout, who was a rockstar and clearly highly competent; that said, the food was much less impressive. As a vegetarian, I get that the dishes I tried were not going to be their standout ones, but they shouldn't have to be -- it should all be good. I love Mexican food. I've lived in Mexico. This had a lot of the components of really great, authentic Mexican, and I really wanted to love it after seeing all the different named components of each dish on he menu. But it really missed the mark, which made the high price point sting a bit.

The Tacos Dorados de Papa were, in some ways, pretty spot on authentic. But they needed more seasoning and some serious elevation. The avocado salsa was basically like a watery guacamole that I didn't understand how to eat other than as a dipping sauce. There was some cabbage and queso fresco on the side, but it didn't seem to be dressed at all; I mainly ate it because I like cabbage and it added some flavor and texture to a pretty bland taquito de papa. The crema, which seemed to be regular sour cream (it was certainly way thicker than the avocado salsa), was much needed. The potatoes themselves were delightfully fluffy, but the whole thing needed more seasoning (and I didn't taste any jack cheese at all). 

The Quesadilla de Calabacitas was sloppy and one-note. The green habanero salsa accompanying it was my favorite part, though it was still missing something for me. The veggies tasted as though they'd been sautéed with little to no fat; The whole time I ate it I kept thinking how drastically it could be improved by a few pinches of spices and even a modicum of caramelization of those onions. The queso fresco, while lovely, didn't make any sense; there was a ton of it in there, and I would've liked it much better if it were replaced with a smaller amount of something more flavorful, like cotija. I also think this would benefit from the addition of garlic and roasted corn. 

Lastly, the horchata. It was comforting, sweet, spicy, and filling in the way you want an horchata to be, but pretty texturally unappealing; it had a thick, dusty mouthfeel that cut at the back of my throat and made me wonder if it hadn't been sufficiently strained or blended. 

I really, really wanted to like this more than I did. I'll probably give it one more shot to try a few more things and see if there's an improvement, but ultimately I wouldn't really recommend it at this point.
author: Aly P.

description:
I think I expected more, which led to the disappointment. 

The food is good, my favorite was the garbanzo beans with the chile. 

We had the tall woman server and she was okay. I was not aware they just has agua fresca so when I asked for something else, she was sort of annoyed. 

We placed our food order, it arrived and the portion shocked me. I ordered the Huarache. I ordered these before and they usually with many toppings and so filling. Not this one. This one was thin and not filling. Paid $15 and I was still hungry. My waitress never came back to us. But the table next to us had plenty of her attention. 
She did put her butt on my wife (the tables are sit together) but she would bend down to show them something. My moved away twice. It was uncomfortable to say the least. 

It is a trendy place but not for me.
author: Jayden R.

description:
I have heard so much about this place and been wanting to go for awhile, and I am so glad I finally made it. Overall - cool spot, tasty food, good menu with lots of small plate / sharable options, good drinks, and excellent service. I am a bit mixed on my # of stars, as I do think it's a little pricey for the cuisine type, atmosphere, quality, and plate size. 

First, we had the Ceviche de Temporada (the spring version). Light, fresh, and flavorful, it was a nice way to start. The combo of everything made the green sauce on the bottom tangy and acidic. I liked that it had two different kinds of seafood (halibut and calamari), and the pickled onions and shaved asparagus brought a different aspect over other ceviches. The chips were nice and thick, but I always think they can use extra salt. 4 stars, as I think it could have used a kick of umami somewhere for that 5th star.

Next, we had the Huarache con Guisado de Lengua, as I can't resist a good tongue (insert joke here). I liked the thick, almost spongey, tortilla on the bottom; it really created a nice base for the dish. The tongue was cooked perfectly and was nice and tender, but of course, I wanted more of it! It was very good, but again, giving the same 4 star note as above, as I just wanted a litttttle bit more for that 5th star.

Bonus - we had a pitcher of the Killer Bee cocktail, but substituted tequila for the mezcal. I do think we got 4 cocktails out of it, although I don't think there was much of a price break for the pitcher vs glasses. 

Our server was great! Gave us all the time we needed to order without us feeling rushed, and offered substitutions when she overheard us discussing various items. Very attentive without feeling overbearing. 

Overall, great experience, and I will be back to try more dishes!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
A decent choice for dependable, tapas-sized Mexican dishes. The tamal de amarillo con calabasa was a nice, soothing way to start the meal, and the torta de chilorio (pork sandwich) was a decently meaty way to sate the appetite. The flavors weren't necessarily in-your-face mindblowing, but the flip side of that is that everything tasted fresh, good-quality, and good-for-you.

Service was also helpful, although it does give me pause every time I go to, say, a Latin American or Asian restaurant and see front-line staff composed largely of Caucasian folks while prep staff are composed largely of non-Caucasian folks. Not only are the prep staff usually paid less, but the implication is somehow that they're not worthy of being front and center. Overall, a nice, well-established restaurant for the area.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Pozole Rojo - bland water pork

I've had amazing rojo, mole and other mexican dishes - this was absolutely the worst.  Disclaimer - I did order on Cavier - but the resturant should be judge on what they deliever - not on the fact it is delievery.

No napkins, spoons, or guidance of how to combine the 4/5 different containers.  The soup/water was tasteless and boring - making me question if I should just order from somewhere else or deal with this miserable pile of shit in front of me. Think Chile water - and thats this soup. 

I called and let them know - they offered a manager but really its just good to know never to come back.  Worth $25 to find that out.
author: Chase N.

description:
It's located right next to the supermarket with this greenhouse like setting where the outside blends indoors. They have a greeter at the door who helps with coordination. They don't have a wait area inside so the greeter acts more like a friendly guard.  Once inside, the seating area can be a bit small but manageable for just two people. It has this chill, relaxing, yet still high end feel to it. I guess that's probably the classic San Franciscan chic. 

It's just a good place to relax and it's been great for brunch espicially. I've tried the different juices and really like the hibiscus orange. We tried a bunch of different foods from ensalada, quesadilla, etc. They taste good and it's more of a fusion and maybe a bit experimental type of place. I find this to be a wonderful place to hangout and chat.

The only downside is that to get to the restroom, you need to exit the restaurant then walk around the side to enter another set of doors. I don't know why the design is so complicated, perhaps it's because the bathroom is right next to the kitchen and they wanted to separate them?The bathroom is very clean, large, and sleek. 

Protip: You can call ahead of time and put your name down if you think there might be a wait.
author: Lana W.

description:
I came in around 4 pm after waiting at the DMV for a couple of hours.  Restaurant only had a few people inside.  

My server was attentive and polite - much better than the standard SF service.  I had the carnitas tacos (around $12).  The portion sizes are small, but pretty cheap for a sit-down restaurant in SF.   Small portion sizes are not necessarily a bad thing, if you want to try different dishes.  3 entrees for 2 people is probably the right number if you're hungry.

I had the carnitas tacos.  It was a big portion of meat inside a fresh corn soft taco, with onion, carrot, cilantro and salsa verde.  It was good but kind of plain.  I found the simplicity charming.  The flan is very sweet, with fresh diced apple and tiny mandarin orange slices.  I did notice that the menu had many vegetarian options.  

The restaurant has an enclosed patio area, and they have strong heaters that keep the dining area comfortable.  They also had their cookbook on display, which I enjoyed browsing with my meal.

Overall good, not pretentious food at a reasonable price point and good service.
author: Holly P.

description: The ambiance at Nopalito is laid-back yet chic. We enjoyed two beverages: their sweet fermented pineapple beverage and the nearly unsweetened hibiscus. Both were delicious. Between the two of us, we split three dishes: the empanada, vegetarian quesadilla and mole torta. All three tasted very good. The flavor combinations were unique with every dish, with just a bit of spice on the torta. I've been here before and will return again.
author: Gaya G.

description:
The place is clean & airy. The food is really good too.
I wasn't a huge fan of the Totopos con Chile (their cheese topped chips) even though that seems to be one of their best things.
The Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón was remarkable! Crispy, cheesy, rich goodness-defiantly recommending this.
They also bring out cooked chickpeas that have nice flavor and good kick to them. You can buy a bag if you like them (which is what I did)
author: Ece K.

description: Alright. Nothing more nothing less. Super incredibly loud and they didn't even give chips and salsa as a starter.... they gave chick peas?? Don't bother coming here if you're vegan! They cater to fit your dietary needs but I've had much better vegan Mexican food and a much much cheaper price.
author: Lia P.

description:
So delicious! Worthy of all the recommendations.

Since you can't make reservations at Nopalito, you may have to wait a while. However, you can ahead of time to put your names on the wait list (which is what we did). Because of this, when we arrived we were insta seated at a bar high table. 

If you get seated at a large table, you may end up sharing it. Since there were only 5 of us at an 8 person table, there was one person seated at the far end we didn't know. Not a big deal at all, but something to be aware of!

To drink, I tried the white sangria. It was delicious and unique from the typical sangrias-- definitely worth a try! Food-wise, I don't think you can go wrong. Since I'm indecisive, I ended up trying both the tamal and memela de tinga. What can I say, I'm a sucker for food.

I've loved tamales since I was a little kid, and the masa on the tamal was definitely up to snuff. The memela was also delicious-- the blue corn tortilla was nice and thick and the chicken + other toppings blended together beautifully.

In addition to the food that I ordered, the restaurant also provides some (baked?) chickpeas as a pre-dinner snack which were da bomb. I couldn't stop my hand from dipping into the bowl and ruining my appetite. We also ordered some guac for the table. This was the only disappointment for me, as there weren't that many chips included. However, given the quality of all the other foods, it's something easily forgiven.

Overall a great meal. Come hungry, because otherwise you'll be sad you can't finish your food.
author: Angela C.

description:
My girlfriend and I came to California for a family trip and our cousin luckily took us here on our first day. We came in for lunch and sat in their patio section. The restaurant only has a few tables but it wasn't too packed when we got there. Parking is kinda hard to find but luckily we were able to find a spot outside that said "two hour parking only".

This restaurant was featured on TV and is known for their Mexican food in the Bay Area. We ordered three different entrees so we could share (highly recommended since everything on their menu sounded so good!). We had a few alcoholic drinks as well and they tasted fantastic. I tried their baked garbanzos which had a little bit of a kick. They are incredibly addicting so beware! Everything was perfect and our server was also friendly and helpful in deciding our meal! This is definitely my #1 Mexican restaurant that I'll have to go to whenever I visit San Francisco again!
author: Bobby C.

description: We started with some drinks. I had El Diablo (pink cocktail) and my husband had La Fuerza (beer). We enjoyed both drinks. We wanted a light meal so I opted for the Ceviche de pescado y calamari. It was perfect but not too big. It came with tortilla chips and was delicious. My husband ordered the Chicken Poblano which came with mole sauce, rice and was pretty spicy. Both meals were great and not too expensive. Nice atmosphere but can get quite full on the weekends since the place is not too big.
author: Ali A.

description:
If you need to eat all of the carbs in the shape of corn, go here.

This is not a taqueria or a place to get a 3 meal burrito.  This is a higher end location with a varied menu, a great selection of tequila and reality czech on tap.

Totopos are a great start.  I'm a little sad that the carintas have been downgraded to tacos vs a dinner plate, but they are still on the menu.

If they have anything with tinga, order it.  The cafe con leche paleta is the best choice of post meal coffee ever.
author: Molly M.

description:
Every time I've eaten here with someone, they've absolutely loved it 100% of the time. It can easily become a habit that's hard to break!

Think outside of the generic Mexican food scene... it's time to discover some of Mexico's distinct regional flavors unique to each of its different states. 

Nopalito's menu incorporates dishes and flavors from all over Mexico, including Oaxaca and Yucatan.

This is my tipical M.O....

Killer Bee (Mezcal cocktail)
Smoky & Sweet.

Totopos con Chile
Tortilla chips, salsa de arbol, cotija cheese, onions, cilantro, crema and lime. 
It's somewhere between chips & salsa and nachos- pretty and fresh. 

Panuchos de Pollo al Pibil
Black bean stuffed corn tortillas, citrus-achiote chicken, pickled red onions and habanero salsa. 
You get TWO! An explosion of Mayan flavors that will change your life! 

Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón
Mulato chile-corn tortilla, crispy pork belly, salsa cascabel, jack cheese, queso fresco, onion and cilantro.
So delicious, you may not want to share... Layers of "crispy" and "fatty" wrapped in a taco-like edible shovel. 

If you're still hungry, order the Carnitas:
Pork braised in orange, bay leaf, milk, cinnamon and beer; Cabbage Salad with pickled jalapeño and salsa de tomatillo; Tortillas, so you can make little pork tacos. 

The complimentary spicy hominy appetizer and complimentary Mexican wedding cookies for dessert are a nice touch.
author: Mitzi G.

description: Great little restaurant in a more residential area of San Francisco. A friend who is a local brought me here for lunch. Started with delicious margaritas and shared a few bites. Solid Mexican food with creative twists and good service. There is a convenient little parking lot that is shared with a shopping area and we were lucky enough to get a spot. Would definitely go back!
author: April H.

description: The young lady that helped us was very kind, helpful and attentive.  We appreciated that.  The Torta de Chilorio and Gorditas Campechanas were both very good!  The Tacos de Pescado al Pastor was so-so as was the Tamal de Birria de Pollo though the ingredients seemed to be of very good quality. We also ordered the mexican rice (so-so) and beans (quite good).  My wife is Salvadorean and knows quality when it comes to latin american food.  The portion sizes were on the small side and price a bit high.  We rated Nopalito a 4 due to the excellent service and overall good food w/ quality ingredients.
author: Don M.

description: Came here with my friends from out of town the other day. We ordered 5 dishes and chips and guac and shared it family style. According to the waitress the dishes were made to be shared this way. The food was good and we were seated right away. It was a Monday evening so there wasn't much of a wait. When there is a wait, you could always put your name down on their waiting list. I also love how there is parking right outside the restaurant. The only thing this restaurant lacks is a restroom inside.
author: Christina P.

description:
Nopalito is the smaller cousin of Nopa, the classic Californian restaurant around the corner. Nopalito offers up traditional Mexican food using high-quality ingredients--and there's always a wait and a line! Luckily, you can call ahead to reserve your spot in line, so when I arrived for dinner on a Saturday, we were seated right away (by that time, the wait for a table of 4 was 2 hours!). The service was friendly though quite slow, and the atmosphere is clean and modern (definitely not a grungy spot). But while some of the dishes were good, I was somewhat underwhelmed by others, as they seemed a bit lacking in flavor or balance.

On our table soon after we sat down were some delicious spiced chickpeas for snacking on. We started our meal with a large round of appetizers--the totopos con chile (spiced tortilla chips with cotija cheese) was good--kind of like Doritos but much fancier. The panuchos de pollo al pibil (black bean stuffed corn tortilla with citrus achiote chicken) was nice, as was the ceviche served with even more tortilla chips. The ensalada de lechuga (lettuce/avocado salad) added a nice vegetable component to our meal, but my favorite appetizer was definitely the huarache con huitlacoche--a large, oval-shaped corn tortilla (we described it as a Mexican pizza) with beans and mushrooms (king oyster?). Sounds simple and unspecial, but the mushrooms had an amazing, deep umami flavor that went so well with all the different toppings!

After waiting for what felt like an eternity, we finally got our entree--the carnitas served with a spicy salsa verde, cabbage salad, and plenty of warm corn tortillas. The carnitas were delicious--you could really taste all of the different ingredients that went into the marinade (primarily orange, milk, cinnamon), and putting all the different components of the dish into a taco really made the flavors come together. 

Overall, while some of the things we ordered were delicious, many of them didn't stick out all that much, and I felt that many of the things on the menu (especially the appetizers) were tortilla-focused, and I wish I got more of a balance. While I definitely would not wait in line to eat here, this was certainly a great meal and a fair value for the quality food.
author: David K.

description:
Just finished a fantastic Friday night dinner here with the boyfriend. We were driving to SF from the east bay and decided to call ahead and put our name on the wait list (highly recommend!). We were bummed to hear it would be an hour and a half wait, but went for it anyways since we were still 40 mins out. 

We arrived about 30 min ahead of our estimated seating time, but were kindly greeted and directed to the standing bar where we had a beer and a delicious margarita (no pre-made mix to be found - just the way I like it!). We were served some awesome spicey and crispy chickpeas to munch on as well. We were tended to by 3 separate people which I thought was nice. At no point did I feel we were unwelcome at the bar, a common occurrence at busy SF restaurants. 

We were seated 15 mins earlier than anticipated. We ordered a salad, tamale (outstanding), pork belly quesadilla, and empanada. Everything was great and our expectations were exceeded! For dessert we enjoyed a spicey watermelon popsicle and dark chocolate cinnamon popsicle. We will absolutely be back! 

I should also mention that parking was a breeze at the ramp right next store! Not common in SF - especially Hayes Valley! That was the cherry on top of a great night.
author: Kim A.

description:
Nopalito is very good
 And that is hard to do in a city with as much Mexican food competition as San Francisco.

The 2 items i tried came in bigger portions than i expected, the tamal was delicious and the empanada was good (if you like fried stuff).
author: Oleg H.

description:
Service was good, though I'd have to say the food was quite dry. We ordered the nachos, deep fried quesadilla with pork belly, sangria, and Mexican coffee.

The nachos were soggy and dry,; cheese looked amazing in person and in pictures but actually didn't taste like much.

Deep fried quesadilla was decent though also slightly dry. I couldn't distinguish what exactly I was eating and it lacked the fresh taste you get eating Mexican food with lime, salsa, and also the kick from hot sauce.

Sangria was good and strong, though the Mexican coffee tasted like regular coffee.

I wouldn't come back here, prices are expensive for Mexican food that I can get at a cheaper price.
author: Brittani C.

description:
Location: in NoPa, has free parking (what?! in SF?! yea). Don't be like me and go into the DMV parking lot lol - go into the one that says Falletti's Plaza. 

Service: you can call ahead to put your name on the waitlist. Overall we had pretty good service

Food: 
-Totopos: yum! they're like the chili fritos topped w/ cheese. I'd love if it could be chip, cheese, chip, cheese - so that cheese isn't just on the top chips. 
-Gorditas: pretty darn yummy but messy b/c all the oil from the chorizo leaks through and then looks nasty.. but recommend!
author: Shelley K.

description: the carnitas here give flores a run for its money. they are savory and rich, but not too fatty. the tortillas are homemade, and the green salsa served with the dish is bright, citrus forward and brings everything together, including the veggies served with the dish. i had a margarita, and boy had the almond horchata, which was delicious as well (it was my first horchata, ever).  we also had the ceviche, which was nice, but slightly overpriced for what you get. i would come back for the carnitas, and trying a few other entree items - including the mole that we ordered but never received.. service is friendly, but they seemed a little disorganized.
author: Christina L.

description: We've probably ordered most things on the menu, and everything has been delicious. My favorite so far is the skirt steak with cactus leaf. Their margaritas are tasty too. Expect to wait a bit for a table, but you can usually get some roasted chickpeas and drinks while you wait.
author: Michael W.

description:
Always hit the spot!! Amazing food, friendly service and cozy atmosphere.

My favorite was the **Totopos con chile! I love hot sauce and when you add chips and cheese to it, thats just amazing. **The Carnitas was tender and juicy. Come withs 2 tortillas to make you own tacos. **Chicharon Quesedilla. Yes chicharron on a somewhat fried quesadilla. YUM! Been craving for Napalito since my last visit and now one of my very favorites go to mexican restaurant. 

For drinks, I love their wine with ginger beer. Refreshing! 

There will be a wait, you can call in to be on the wait list or go earlier.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Service was incredible and overall excellent - our server seemed a bit tired but was polite and didn't rush us. Everyone else was incredibly nice, and I also appreciated the diversity of the waitstaff. Unfortunately we just did not like the food. It seemed a bit greasy and uninspired. Totopos con Chile - we ate every last bit but found that the chips became soggy, quickly. I ordered the pork belly quesadilla - nothing crispy about the pork belly, and chunks of cotija cheese were strewn across the quesadilla. The chicharrones were good. However, the tortilla was deep fried and very wet with oil and grease. It was heavy, and just bad. Still ate half bc I'm an immigrant and I cannot waste food. Husband ordered the mole which came with rice that straight up tasted like the Rice a Roni "Spanish Rice" box for $1 (I guess it is a San Francisco treat?) Mole sauce was too sweet. Chicken was well cooked. I got the chocolate paleta to finish and it was chalky AF. Husband's to-go box def missed the 3-4 tortillas that he left. Probably got thrown away. 

There was also an incredibly rowdy table right next to us which seemed to go unnoticed by the staff. Unfortunately we will not be back - I couldn't peg a single authentic note from this restaurant. I am really confused as to why this is so popular. We'll stick to the Excelsior for quality flavors.
author: Veda R.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening without any reservations. Place was quite packed so we were pleasantly surprised when we were seated after only waiting for five minutes.  

We tried the totopos con queso, were super tasty. The green ceviche was extraordinary, fave dish by far. The carnitas were good and moist, did need some fresh guacamole maybe to add flavor to my taco. The pastor fish taco was very good and had some interesting flavors. Michelada wasn't that great but they're cocktails were on point. My kids loved the almond horchata, will definitely come again when in town.
author: NO' L.

description:
Wish it had more flavor, but is tasty and legit ingredients.

What I do like is that they use fresh masa, and seem to really care about their preparation style. I'm not Mexican or have extensive travel experience, but I do lust over food documentaries and Mexican cookbooks. Seems like they've got a decent spread even if it's all taco+++.

Just wish they'd branch out a bit more since they're already doing a lot in terms of authenticity compared to your typical taqueria.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Nopalito has been on my list to try for a long time.One of my vegetarian friends told me it's a favorite of hers, and since I am a recent vegetarian convert, I was very excited to eat here. Even on a Monday night, it was busy, so we opted to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table (our hostess refused to tell us which table was on their dessert course so we couldn't helicopter them into leaving). 

Me: What vegetarian items do you recommend?
Server: I can tell you what vegetarian items we have. 

She proceeded to point them out on the menu, which, I am literate; not helpful. She did tell me about an off-menu veggie enchilada (broccoli, zucchini, cauliflower) that I ended up ordering. I asked if I could get the salsa on the side, to which she said it would defeat the purpose of an enchilada if it isn't wet. She offered to bring me a sample of it, which was nice. It was pretty spicy, so I asked for it to be lightly dressed. 

C ordered the totopos con chile (basically chips/salsa/shredded cheese) and chicken taquitos. The chips were SOOOOO spicy that I could only eat 3. C also had to stop soon after. I wish our server had mentioned how spicy this dish would be, given that she knew we'd be sharing it, and how concerned I was earlier about my dish.  C was lukewarm about his chicken taquitos.

Me: Do you split checks here?
Server: Not usually. 

I know many restaurants don't do this, but it doesn't hurt to ask. I can't quite put my finger on it, but her attitude was just off-putting and it made me feel uncomfortable. They used to give out complimentary wedding cookies with the check. WHY would they get rid of a good thing?!
author: Karen S.

description: Outsanding Mexican, small plate bistro type restaurant in Nopa. Three of us shared 5 plates including the Empanadas, Tamal del Amarillo, Quesadilla de Primavera, Mole Pablano and Caldo Tialpano, all of which were outstanding. The service was great, my only complaint being that it seems the servers overlap on the tables so we got asked multiple times the same questions, not a bad problem. Crowded even on a Tuesday evening. They don't take reservations. Overall a great experience.
author: Vince C.

description: Great menu, fresh ingredients and creative dishes. Terrific for lunch and casual dinner.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Wow just wow enough said!!!!! 
Make sure to try everything except michelada they can work on that.
author: Eddie M.

description: I had the chilaquiles, not that great, mostly tasted like lime than anything else. In the past at other restaurants I've had this dish with a fried egg on top  in red sauce instead of green sauce doused in creme and this is what I'm comparing it to. Just doesn't quite match up to less expensive places because there just isn't any variety in the flavor of their version of the dish, and the egg could have been executed better, it just hides under the sauce and becomes filler, adding nothing to the dish taste wise. Straight lemon lime ish flavor overpowered everything else, even the cheese. The ceviche tasted good, but the portion was super tiny, and had very little avocado. This was the special which was suggested by the waiter, and it disappointed me tbh. Some great things are the Oaxacan horchata, though on the sweeter side, if you've got a sweet tooth you will definitely like this drink instead of the regular horchata. Probably won't be back as it was a $40 tab for one person and I was unsatisfied with both things I ordered.
author: Mona L.

description: The food was good, but be aware you are paying more for the upscale environment than the food.  $75 for a family of 3 and I left hungry.  Service was good, but I would probably not visit again.  Lots of other options with great food and more reasonable prices.  For the upscale environment, it also would have been nice if the table next to us was not discussing their frequent drug use and sexcapades in front of children, but as always, ymmv.
author: Matt T.

description:
I have been wanting to come here for some time now and I finally took the time to make it happen.  If you want to get in and out quick come a different day than Friday night.  We waited about 40 min due then being really busy but it was worth the wait.  We ordered the following. 

Apps: 

Gorditas: great flavor, tender meat, perfect for an app but a little greasy. 

Guacamole n chips: really good. 

Entree we shared the carnitas. They were tender, flavorful, n cooked perfect.  The only thing I wish it came with is beans n rice. We ordered a side of beans and they were delicious.  The homemade tortillas weren't that great either.  

Also, the drinks were delicious as well.  If you like some good Mexican, you need to come try this place out.
author: Will E.

description: What a fantastic place. The food was amazing. We tried it all! The waiter was a huge help in recommending a sipping tequila. Definitely will be back.
author: Andy O.

description: Tacos were amazing, we had both, fish taco was our favorite. Ceviche was tasty as well. We also ordered the quesadilla, which had unique flavors and was also tasty, a bit on the dry side though
author: Jessica P.

description: Friend treated me out to dinner here for my birthday (date of visit 10/2017). Everything we ordered was amazing and everything else on the menu sounded amazing! Loved this charming little eatery! I would definitely dine here again!
author: Kandice H.

description:
Our plan was suppose to dine here for supper but ended up going during lunchtime. I was too hungry to wait and Mexican sounded good for lunch. 

We ordered:

- Totopos con Chile = great starter to share with everyone. Love the spicy kick added to the tortilla chips.

Tacos de Pescado al Pastor = two seared fish tacos topped with orange slices. Yummy!

Quesadilla Roja con Chicharron = crispy pork belly with queso and salsa was 

Dessert: key lime sorbet Popsicle. Good palate cleanser and refreshing. 


That was quite a lunch meal and I felt good after eating it. It was not to heavy and definitely a tasty meal. Service was also very accommodating. I would recommend this place to everyone.

I hope you give Nopalito a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: I saw this on Diner's Drive-in's and Dives and it looked delicious.  The restaurant is nice and not a diner.  The service was average but the food was not good,   I got the Posole Rojo which looked delicious but was tasteless.  I actually had to add a bunch of salt to it to try to bring out the taste and then it tasted like salt.  My husband got mole enchiladas which were ok but a little mono-flavored.  So overall food was not what I expected.
author: Cara N.

description: I have eaten here about 6 times now (most of the times after a damn DMV appointment). It always lifted my spirits. Love their crunchy garbanzo beans, perfect Torta de Chilorio (pulled pork sandwich) and amazing Chilaquiles. I normally am not a fan of Tamale, but this place is where I love it. Overall great value for money.
author: Balu V.

description:
Dined here last night with two other girls and we had a great time. The mexican is more expensive but we ended up a little stuffed, 3 cocktails and a bottle of red wine for $50 per person, pre-tip. I think that's pretty good... Anyways, below are the dishes and drinks we dined on: 
Drinks: El diablo margarita with mezacal (great), bloody maria (great and actually worked well at dinner), frescita (too sweet for my liking but wasn't my drink)
* Totopos con Chile - 2 stars Very thick tortilla chips, dipped in light chili-sauce (spicy kick) and topped with cotiga cheese and green onion. Personally I wouldn't order again... the delicious topping is only on the very top layer so most of the dish are thick chips that aren't worth wasting space on 
* Empanada con Deshebrada de Res: 5 stars very large empanada that could feed 3 - 4 people. Shredded beef was so tasty, not too salty and I highly recommend for an app
* Ensalada de Lechuga con Duraznos: 5 stars Little gem salad, nice fresh break-up to the meal that I recommend
* Esquite - 5 stars Corn in cheesy mayonnaise sauce - shits bomb just get it  
* Carnitas - 5 stars. Large portion for 3 people to get ~2 tacos each or 4 - 5 people make single taco. Meat was delicious, veggie accopaniments were awesome and their tortillas are also great. 

So with that said - that amount of dishes is too much for 3 girls (cut the chips). I will definitely be back to try more of their tasty menu!
author: Aryn C.

description: First tine been here with my friend. Since he originally from Mexican All of the food & drink was he order for me. I like their Mexican beer tasted like very good. I really like it. I like their inside decor, very relax it's a good place for ppl hangout. Will come back
author: Yueming G.

description:
Nopalito is a classic. Anytime I need a place for lunch or dinner, I bring people here because it's an instant hit. It's affordable if you're not too hungry and great to share.

They serve tapas and larger plate options in a really clean, fresh environment. Their gordito is bomb and one person in my crew always gets it. Their salads are really refreshing and delightful. Their homemade desserts are really yummy too.

HOWEVER: They had a cocktail listed recently that includes strawberry. "Fresitas" I think it's called. It takes like liquified rubber tires or wood cleaner with a squeeze of lime juice so steer clear. Nobody in my party liked it; it's truly repulsive.
author: Kristen A.

description: I am really impressed with the quality and taste of the food here. There are very few restaurants throughout the bay with this style of cooking, and being from Mexico City myself can say that the flavors from Nopalitos top the rest! We left as very satisfied customers, will be back! :)
author: Alejandra F.

description: Food was so good! We had the ceviche and pork belly quesadilla, both very tasty. The spicy fried chic peas they have you when you are first seated are also really good. Good service as well. However the portions were kind of small, but for the price you can easily get 2 dishes and still spend less than you would in most restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Bethenny J.

description:
We ate everything too fast that we didn't get to take any pictures but my oh my! Best chilaquiles! 
The food seem to be a bit on the spicier side at this place but it's fabulous! We also shared la frijoles which was wonderful as well. 
The service was great as well. We will be back for sure!
author: Ghazal P.

description:
Napolito is an very nice upscale Mexican restaurant. However, I found it to be a bit forgettable. 

The food is delicious, no doubt about it. However, at the price range that they charge, I would have hoped for slightly more generous portions and better service. We had a reservation for my girlfriend's birthday, but were seated twenty minutes late and the hostess was rude when we inquired when our table would be ready. 

The drinks are all takes on standard cocktails but exclusively use tequila and mezcal. Think a Moscow Mule with tequila etc. A small amount of fried garbanzo beans was given to our table of 6. While delicious, there were only about enough for 5-6 beans each. This set a tone for a night of being hungry. 

The food was truly tasty. The carnitas were the most generous portion out of all the dishes we ordered. As a vegetarian, my tacos were nice, but nothing to write home about. 

I think this restaurant is a bit overrated. It consistently ranks high in reviews, perhaps due to being an elevated Mexican restaurant and having a sort of trendy feel to it. I wouldn't go back, but if there aren't many other options at your fingertips, it may be worth a try.
author: Ben S.

description:
My first time trying this place out 
I fell in love instantly 
I am a tourist so when I came back to SF 
For my boyfriends birthday 
I knew were we had to go for brunch 
We got the  sweat potatoe tamale as an appetizer 
Then I ordered the huarache and my boyfriend went with the shredded pork torta
I would highly recommend this place 
It's so delicious , you might experience a slight weight due to the popularity of the restaurant but you have Pete's coffee and a local market to walk around and be entertained
I love everything about this place
author: Daisy P.

description:
Nopalito lives up to the hype!

While they don't take reservations, they DO take call aheads. For a party of 5 we called around 530pm and they had a table ready for us at 7pm. 

The menu is quite limited compared to your average Mexican restaurant.. However, the beverage menu is quite extensive ;)

We got the totopos con chile to share as an appetizer. It was Nopalitos version of house nachos with onion and cotija cheese. YUM.

The white wine house sangria was delightful and tasted really grapefruity- I ended up getting 2 glasses!

Got the carne asada as my entree as the waiter recommended. It came with onions, bell peppers, a side of black beans and cilantro sauce. It was yummy but too big of a portion for me.  Probably could've just done with one of the smaller plates! 

This is my classic Mexican restaurant move.. I always end up filling up on chips. 

Will definitely be back to Nopalito!
author: Nehal P.

description: We arrived right at opening at 11:30 am and the place was packed quickly.  Our group of 6 chose to eat in the cute back patio.  We were served quickly.  I loved their fish tacos, with a slice of orange in it.  We also ordered the Mexican rice and the corn warm salad as side dishes to share--they were both excellent as well.  Rather than chips and salsa, they serve spicy chickpeas that were yummy and encouraged us to order drinks.  We chose Hibiscus Orange and Strawberry Lemonade, both delicious.
author: Julia N.

description: I got taquitos and the margarita - the latter was quite strong but good and I loved the delicious, vegetarian option of tasty, crafted taquitos. Also loved the green themed atmosphere, definitely would recommend.
author: Madeline C.

description:
Great for Tapas. Come here to enjoy the Totopos, it's like tortilla chips tossed on salsa with shredded cheese and onions. Soooo good! 
Also the carnitas and steak plates are great to share.
author: Bruna C.

description:
This is my favorite place to come whenever I visit SF. I used to live near it and couldn't get enough of it. Whenever friends or family visited us, this was always at the top of the list of places to take them. If you have never been, go now, order the Empanada and the Totopos. Then send me a message and make me jealous you went and I didn't. 

PS also get the margarita
author: Ross R.

description: I didn't realize Nopalito served gluten-free, organic Mexican food. I ordered a coffee, which came in a really cute and small French press. The cerviche was really fresh but it came in the smallest portion that was definitely not worth 16 dollars. I also felt it lacked salt. The tacos de carnitas appeared dry but they were really tasty. The pickled vegetables that came with the tacos were surprising. These were probably the healthiest tacos I've had, which unfortunately means that they were not the best tacos I've had in my life.
author: Kim X.

description:
I came here on a friends recommendation. You can call ahead to put you name in. I suggest you do and go hang out nearby because there will be a wait. We had about an hour wait once we called. But it was well worth it. 

We were seated in the covered and heated outside area. Started with some guacamole and chips which was great. The real highlight was the chips tossed in salsa covered in cheese. It was insanely good. I then had the carnitas which was a sizable portion and perfect. Both tender and crispy. 

I'd definitely come here again. Simple, delicious, in modern setting.
author: J. Karim A.

description: Upscale Mexican done well.  I was pleasantly surprised with how delicious the tacos araibe and the Michelada were.  Now I wish I saved room for the mole poblano! The gorditas needed more salt or cotija. And if only the tortillas had that popcorn flavor like in central Mexico! Ironically the spicy chickpeas that come with your beverage are a little too salty. The mezcal Paloma was solid but not quite right in the balance. And the ensalada with the litte gem lettuce had too much of that and not enough of the tasty stuff.  I think I'm still adjusting to the fact that what would have been $25 and incredible in Mexico is $70 and ok in SF.  The price we pay...
author: Rich P.

description:
Nopalito is located near Divisadero Street and they have two locations. This is the orignal location. 

I visited for lunch with my sister and two other friends. The best way to sample Nopalito's menu is to come with a group of friends. We shared everything so that we were able to try five different dishes. 

We started with guacamole and chips. The guac was made really well, but I thought that they could've given us a few more pieces of chips. 4/5

We ordered the fish tacos and the carnitas tacos. The carnitas tacos were a 5/5. The carnitas were made perfectly with a bit of crispiness. The salsa and spices in the tacos made it extremely refreshing. The fish tacos were are also a 5/5. The fish was fresh and you could taste the spices they flavored it with. If you don't know what to order, you can't go wrong with the tacos!

Huarache con Suadero y Chorizo 4/5. Really good flavor combination, but nothing too special. Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón 4/5 - our server raved out this dish, so we ordered it. The pork belly was really good and the chicharron added a nice crunch to the quesadilla. 

Our server was really friendly and made our experience pleasant. I would return to Nopalito, but only if wait isn't too long. I would definitely pick Nopalito over Tacolicious though!
author: Lydia H.

description: Very overpriced. The food itself was not memorable, the service even less so. The cost factor alone will keep me from going back.
author: Tony C.

description:
Nice place , great service 
I really like neighborhood and their menu
There is many options and classic styles as well
My pleasure fir great lunch and ahmazing service will be back 100%
author: Angelica k.

description:
Stay for:
- Tortilla chips 
- Chrozio 
- Pollo 

Pass on: 
- Cocktails 
- Dessert 

It is not cheap, but worth it if you are having a fun night out with friends. The cocktails are fine but getting a glass of wine or beer will be a better money spent.
author: Anna S.

description:
Oh Nopalito, thanks for a fantastic dinner once again. The community style set up paired with the great service and tasty food, you can never go wrong! My main reservation for this place is the lack of seasoning in a few of their dishes, other than that, this is a great place to spend with friends! 

Favorites:  
-Totopos con chile - Hot sauce flavored chips with crema, cheese, cojita cheese, and tons of flavor. A MUST GET. 
-Panucho de Pollo - one of the most juiciest chicken tacos. Theres just so much layer of flabors.
-Chicharon Quesedilla - Not your regular quesedilla. Great crunch with the chicharon and 

The Bad: 
-Queso Flameado con Chorizo y Nopales: lacks so much flavor and lacked the cactus flavor. 
-Hurache con suadero: a little too heavy and oily - would really avoid.

Drinks ($11 each usually, unless you get a shot)
-Their drinks are very light and refreshing - if you want a kick - just get a shot. 
-The bloody maria and sangria are missing that punch these drinks usually have, BUT the mezcal paloma and killer bee (very sweet flavor) are great to start off a meal! 

After some drinks and great bites, I highly suggest getting a popsicle. For 3.50 a pop, you can't go wrong. They have five flavors and go great with the mexican wedding cookies in the end. Also, huge kudos to our server for always asking us if we wanted a drink or something else to eat. Talk about hospitality!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Tried two dishes. The chilequitos were really dry and needed something to help balance out the dish. Some pico de gallo would've been nice, but no fresh tomato was available in the kitchen. First Mexican restaurant I've ever been to that had no fresh tomato. 
The quesadilla was much better by comparison. But overall for both dishes, I just felt like the fried food flavor overwhelmed the rest of the dish. I don't think I'll be back. Will drive the extra five minutes to the Mission next time if I want something more authentic, tasty and not so overpriced.
author: Tricia B.

description:
took the staff for lunch. really really yummy. would def  recommend.

tasty food
good service.

Serving size is a bit small. Ended up ordering an additional entree as we were still hungry. Two taquitos for 12 bucks... two orders.. four taquitos. 24 bucks ‍
author: Ernest S.

description:
I'm such a sucker for good ambient music at restaurants, and this place won me over with all the best pop latino from the 2000s: Bacilos, Reik, Juanes, and, of course, Shakira. And my hips certainly don't lie when it comes to how yummy the food is. We got the huarache con suadeo y chorizo (so good you'll think it's beef) and the taco arabe. Also got the house horchata with strawberry puree to share, but next time I'm definitely getting my own. 

If you want some gringo-friendly Mexican food a la northern California style (gluten free options) that is more authentic than your neighborhood chipotle (don't get me wrong, got mad love for those burrito bowls), then this is your spot!! Servers are very attentive, always ready to refill your water glass and offer to take away your plate when you're not quite ready (sorry still sopping up the sauces with my tiny piece of tortilla).
author: Lisa K.

description:
On Tuesday, I headed to Nopalito for lunch with my mom and aunt when we went into San Francisco. We were excited to try this spot for a casual and delicious lunch. WOW!

The service started out strong, not only was our server friendly, but he also had a lot of recommendations. We were overwhelmed by the menu at first because there were so many great options to choose from. Our server recommended the Totopos con Chile ($8) to start. I like to call them "fancy Doritos," they had the perfect amount of spice due to the salsa de arbol. The spice was cut by the cotija cheese and crema. Yum!

I ordered the Tacos de Carnitas ($12). The two tacos were filled with braised pork, orange, bay leaf, jalapeno, onion and had hints of cinnamon and beer. On the side was a fresh salsa de tomatillo. They were great and I especially appreciated the home made corn tortillas, made fresh daily! My mom and aunt also enjoyed their dishes, see my photos.

I highly recommend dining here for lunch since there wasn't a wait when we visited. Although they do have call-ahead seating (check it out on their site www.nopalitosf.com). The Broderick Street location is their smaller location. For great service, tasty cocktails and awesome Mexican food at a fair price definitely head to Nopalito!
author: Lauren R.

description: I went to Nopalito at the recommendation of a friend. I wanted to like it and was very disappointed, from the service to the food. Sorry to say, I have received better service at McDonald's. I did like the garbanzos that they serve. The totopos are okay, the cheese on top is the star. I had the pozole and it was flavorless. The margarita was okay, nothing to write home about. I wanted to like the place. Last, the service was not on point. It was late after lunch, the restaurant was almost empty, and plenty of staff walking around, but no one checked on me, until almost the end of the meal. Very awkward. Not only did I not feel welcomed, the food was disappointing, which results in 2 stars. I hope they train their team for better service and also food that is more authentic.
author: Lina M.

description:
Mexican joint with great food, attentive staff and with good beats.  Will definitely be back! 

Allowing people to call to get on thee waitlist is great!  You don't need to sit there and ... wait.
author: Frank P.

description: Bomb! Very fresh ingredients and great taste! Very close walk from the painted ladies! Definitely a must try!
author: Steven S.

description:
I will fight a grandma with a walker for that delicious frijoles puercos con huevo!
That's saying something. The texture of the buttery bean stewed in the juice of homemade red chorizo with the aftertaste of limey bacon... Gosh, my mouth is watering again!
The quesadilla roja con chicharron was good too, albeit a tad too oily and dry. The margarita is so so. But yeahhh for that frijoles!

Looking from outside, Nopalito gives the charm of mexican fusion dishes. Honestly, I wasn't expecting much at first, given the previous tacky experiences with mexican fusion which similar to a boy with identity loss. But boy, am I wrong. And am I glad to be wrong! Nopalito chefs work it out like a boss. 

PS: The complimentary almond butter cookies were a nice touch.
author: Jenny T.

description:
This Mexican food has such an authentic flavor. Especially their salsa. 

The asada plate is by far my favorite fir sure. 

The vibe is cool and service is good.
author: Chris M.

description: OMG I love the pork tacos!!! I love everything here! Food is yummy and servings are big enough to share which is good because the dishes are so filling.
author: Guc T.

description: Delicious food as always. Most of all, thank you for kindly refunding my quesadilla when I was ordering take out this evening. As you could tell, I was disappointed it wasn't ready, but it made my night and showed you cared!
author: Yvonna C.

description:
TLDR - solid Mexican food, good catering option as well; the totopos con chile are a must!

Came here recently with a group for lunch on a weekday. It's a small restaurant but it wasn't busy during the day. Casual spot that felt like it was completely outdoors even though it was technically indoors or covered. Relaxed, laid-back atmosphere.

I've also had their catering, which didn't stand out to me in comparison to other Mexican options or Mexican food in general, but it's a solid catering option. The meat was cooked super well (especially for catering), but was pretty greasy and lacked a wow factor.

My experience dining in was more memorable though. Not sure if it's because I ordered something different or because dining in is generally better than catering (or because of both), but I liked the food and overall ambiance enough to want to come back.

They started us off with some complimentary fried garbanzo beans, which had a nice crunch and were flavored well with some sort of spices. My group shared the Totopos Con Chile as an appetizer and I ordered the Caldo Tlalpeno Con Pollo as my entree, and both were delicious!

-TOTOPOS CON CHILE ($7) - 5/5
[tortilla chips, salsa de arbol, cojita cheese, onions, cilantro, crema, lime]
