Addicting! The tortilla chips were thick and crunchy and loaded with toppings. Lots of cheese but cojita isn't overly cheesy. It's not served with any guac but we asked for some on the side. The best part is the sauce the chips are covered in - some sort of spicy buffalo sauce that makes you just want more.

-CALDO TLALPENO CON POLLO ($14) - 4.5/5
[chicken consomme, cauliflower, broccoli, carrots, garbanzo beans, avocado, queso fresco, chipotle adobado]
I honestly would've never expected to love a soup from a Mexican restaurant, but this was surprisingly good! And it was really healthy, which is something I always struggle to find at a Mexican spot. The chicken was cooked really well, the broth was light but flavorful and there were plenty of healthy veggies. Super filling, warm and satisfying, especially for a cold winter day.

*** From catering ***

-ENSALADA DE LECHUGA Y DURAZNOS ($9.50) - 4/5
[lettuce, stone fruit, pickled red onion, pumpkin seeds, tortilla strips, cotija cheese]
I'm always a fan of salads with fruit in it. The apples gave it a little sweetness and the cotija wasn't too cheesy

-CARNITAS ($21) - 3.5/5
[braised pork, orange, bay leaf, milk, cinnamon, beer, cabbage salad, pickled jalapeño, salsa de tomatillo]
Huge chunks of pork. Tender but superr fatty. Flavor is solid but not super memorable.

-POLLO AL PIBIL - 3.5/5
[shredded citrus-achiote chicken]
Cooked pretty well - good texture and not dry - but rather greasy. Flavor is citrus-y but still lacking a wow factor

-VEGETALES - 3/5
[carrots, zucchini, potatoes, onion, broccoli and cauliflower]
Roasted nicely, but MUCH greasier than I would've expected from a vegetable dish. I really liked the carrots, broccoli and cauliflower. Would be a 5 if it weren't so oily!

-GUACAMOLE - 2.5/5
Average guac, but a little on the salty side.

-CORN CHIPS - 3.5/5
Not super special but I like that their chips are a lot thicker than average. Super crunchy, not too salty and very sturdy for dipping in guac and salsa!
author: Jessie L.

description: Really good spot for vegetarians! Highly recommend for its unique flavors. Be warned that portions are a little small
author: Aditi G.

description:
The food is great, but this place should be known as a tapas place as the plates are very small and the prices high. The margaritas, well if you took the ice out the glass may amount to a couple ounces of liquid.

Service is super, food is good. Value - just is not there.

Not on my lets visit again.
author: Steven H.

description:
They do run a tight ship out at Nopalito, which I understand, all restaurants have their own way of running things... But does the restroom have to outside around the corner? So when my whole party arrived we finally were sat, then it took 15 mins for us to even order a pitcher, and another 30 to order food... I ordered a plain quesadilla (I'm basic, i know, but nothing really jumped out at me...) It was mehhhh... not even melted all the way with absolutely nothing else on my plate (not even a garnish!) ... What a rip offf!!! 

overpriced and overrated
author: Bianca C.

description: horrible i hate it disgusting not good!! if i could give 0 stars i would because the food was horrible and waiters are rude. they don't know how to cook. my 6 year old daughter is better than them!! don't go here i recommend going somewhere else.
author: Sophia G.

description: I loved this place, it's very small and intimate plus I definitely ended the night with a happy ending
author: Chris M.

description: Great Mexican food find in San Francisco!  Visiting from Boston and popped in for dinner, Nopalito did not disappoint!  It was busy but we were seated immediately.  Our waitress was great and the food was fresh and delicious!   Group of 4, we all split Totopos con Chile to start- my boyfriend is still talking about how good the chips were!  I can say with certainty that if I was to go back I'd order the Tacos de Pescado al Pastor (Fish Tacos) - did not disappoint!  Great for those who are gluten free- all but one entree was gluten free (per the waitress).
author: Jo B.

description:
I loved the place !
Really nice outdoor seating and an interesting food section.
We tried several items of their menu and they were all really good!
Their staff is friendly and I would definitely recommend trying that place.

Side note: bathroom is in an awkward spot, where you have to leave the main restaurant, walk outside and back into a new place/bathroom.
For a slightly higher end eating establishment, this is weird and reminds me of some fast food chains. Specially gets bad when it's warm inside and cold outside, not very healthy for the suppressed immune system.
author: Jad A.

description:
A highlight of our meal was the service. My friend brought her dog so we sat in the outside patio. We were seated next to a man who didn't like dogs and he was being extremely rude and loud, escalating the situation. We were a little taken aback by his rudeness and my friend told him there was no need to yell. The waiters immediately saw and moved us to a better spot and came and apologized for the man later on. Great customer service already gives them a good mark in my book!

Now on to the food - delicious! We ordered the Gorditas Campechanas and the ceviche. Ceviche was fresh and seasoned perfectly! Gorditas Campechanas were little tortilla pockets full of meat, veggies, beans, and queso fresco. They were delicious and full of flavor with every bite!  Portions were on the smaller side, but it was perfect because I didn't want a heavy meal.

Definitely want to come back and explore the menu!
author: Winnie T.

description:
Food was blah, and service was horrible. We walked in and the hostess said it would be an hour and a half wait. We said that's fine, put our name down and went to grab a drink. There were several tables open. 5 minutes later she walks over and says we can be seated; odd that she was giving the 90 minute window to people at the door, when there was plenty of seating at 7:15pm. 

We ordered the carnitas which was okay, and the fish tacos again, only okay. Not flavorful, very bland food. The drinks were good, ordered a margarita and a watermelon drink. 

No chips and salsa available, only a salsa covered chip dish. 

For the hype this restaurant has been getting, I was very disappointed. We were visiting from LA and had read a lot about the restaurant on Eater and looked at yelp reviews and wanted to try it out. Maybe it was an off night but it's sub par, Modern "Tex-mex" Mexican food. 

Everything is ordered a la carte and you add rice, beans, salsa after.
author: Shez A.

description:
I went here a couple days ago. I was super excited, but things didn't go as smoothly as I thought they would. First off, I was directed to use the bathroom around the block. Literally. The one bathroom facilities forces you to actually leave the restaurant and then go through the pick up food room. I probably wouldn't have complain about this, but it's Winter and there was a line that force me to stand in the cold for the bathroom. Not a fan. 

Next the food. I ordered the Ceviche which was alright, nothing to write home about. It came with tortilla chips that they said were made in house. I feel bad ragging on their chips, but I'm pretty sure they use the same exact recipe as Fritos. For my main dish I got the fish tacos. They  were decent. Overall I wasn't impressed. I really like the ambiance of this place and I think they have a lot of potential, but they're just not hitting it yet.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
This was a nice find on a recent trip to SF from Palo Alto. The staff were extremely welcoming and professional even though we didn't have a reservation on a weekend. We had the margarita and a grapefruit rum drink (mezcal Paloma). The margarita was average but the grapefruit drink was very tasty!

We had the pork quesadilla which had a very unusual homemade shell which was thicker than I would have liked. It also, for my taste, was too rich with beautifully cooked pork. I would have preferred more cabbage or some sort of picked veggie. 

I loved the tacos dorados and would definitely order again. Such a great bite size treat!

The last item we ordered was the huevos de caja which was average. 

I'm giving it 4 starts b/c the service and staff are excellent,  and the tacos dorados and mezcal Paloma are amazing! 

One quick tip about the bathroom- it's outside the restaurant and there is only 1 co-ed one so the line can be quite long!
author: L S.

description: The food was great!!! Drove from San Jose just to eat the chicharon quesedia! On point!
author: Kings S.

description:
The food here is amazing!
I came here for lunch with 2 friends and all of our dishes were delicious. Everything is organic and super fresh, I would definetly come back and probably one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Definetly going to come back here again to try some other dishes =)
author: Cheryl P.

description:
Great margaritas. Great fish tacos. BOMB POPSICLES. We called at 5pm and put our name in which was nice.  

Next time I'm in town I will come back. My friend got the meat tacos and the smoky flavor was mouthwatering.
author: Madison S.

description: We went to Nopalito on a whim after hitting the De Young museum, so worth the quick drive! We sat in their covered patio, very casual with a nice breeze. Our waiter was sweet and explained the menu to us, even though we knew spanish lol. I had the Quesadilla roja con chicharrones. Its was delicious and definitely filling enough for one person. We shared the margarita pitcher and it was quite strong for their house blend. Would highly recommend to someone looking for great Mexican food without having to find parking in the Mission.
author: Laura D.

description: The atmosphere and indoor patio are great! Food is okay.. margs are strong, so not complaining there. If you are looking for a fun place to chill spot for drinks, this would be high on my list. If you're looking for a tasty meal, I'd recommend elsewhere.
author: Drew G.

description: Synchronized uniques delicious recipes! Amazing margaritas, and a really cute atmosphere! Loved it. Will be back
author: Leah F.

description:
Dinner review. Second visit.

Huaraches - 3/5 
Queso - 3/5
Quesadilla - 5/5
Carnitas - 5/5
Flan - 4/5

Overall, carnitas and quesadilla are "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: I was disappointed by the food. The service was slow. We came for a late lunch, so it may have been at the end of a long shift.
author: Vern S.

description:
Always great food and service. Thank you Jesus and staff for a beautiful early dinner and your patience with the baby. Think he might be a new regular. Never seen him have such a good good time. 
GRACIAS!!
author: Fabian F.

description: I have patronized this restaurant for several years.   In my opinion the noveau Latin food is some of the best in the City.   It's innovative and delivered hot.    I had an issue at the restaurant a couple of weeks ago, which Jeff the manager rapidly efficiently and appropriately resolved.    It's a true test of a person or establishment when having an issue, to resolve it, and make peace.    This they did.   I was impressed.     Will be coming back for more.    Thank you
author: Chris S.

description: Great tasting food! A little main-streamed and it definitely had a chain restaurant feel to it but the food tasted good.
author: Alicia S.

description: We loved our lunch!  Atmosphere is bustling and bright. We sat at the counter. Food arrived quickly and was FANTASTIC.  I had the Tamal de Amarillo con Canmote and it was filling and really good. My daughter ordered the Panuchos de pollo al pibil and was happy with her choice as well. Food tasted fresh and presentation was pleasing. Our server was attentive and kind. Great, all around!
author: Sarri T.

description:
Nothing but good things about Nopalito! We don't go out and choose Mexican food often but I'm glad we checked out this place. We have been to a mom and pop place near Sac State called Nopalitos but they are not related. This place is a quaint little restaurant next to a Peet's coffee. They have a indoor sunroom type patio, and they welcomed dogs! During our stay we saw several other dogs dining in as well. 

We started off with the almond horchata, of course. If I'm gonna have Mexican food, I've got to have horchata. We had the totopos con chile as a starter, per recommendation. They were delicious! I thought they would be soggy because of all of the toppings, but they were far from soggy...very crispy, topped with onions, cotija cheese, cilantro, lime, and a side of sour cream. 

For my entree I decided on their ceviche, since it sounded refreshing and light. It wasn't quite your typical ceviche - no shrimp - but it had calamari and fish, with apples, corn, avocado, red onion, and cilantro, meant to be eaten with their blue corn chips. It was the perfect serving size with enough to share with others too. 

Great stop in the city if you're looking for some tasty Mexican food with bold flavors!
author: Ashley C.

description: Came here on a thur evening to celebrate. Waited for over 45 minutes and was offered a communal table. Now don't get me wrong. I love communal tables. But this was literally a five seater small table to be shared with three other people. Ordered the naranja salad which was  very fresh and delicious. But the portion was absolutely abysmal. Then ordered the veggie quesadilla. It was bland. No flavour nothing. Only giving one star for the sangria. I'm surprised this place is well rated.
author: Ashmita V.

description: In my short list of my top places to eat in the city. Their quesadilla roja is a must-order, and definitely try some of their various salsas to spice up your meal. Pozole and carnitas are both strong highlights. Bring friends and order everything you can to share. If you're feeling boozy, their mezcal and tequila drinks are not to be missed.
author: Matt L.

description:
This is a fancier and more expensive Mexican place than what you'll normally find in the city. You'll usually have to wait to be seated, even on a weekday, but it's not too bad. 

Be aware that portions may be a bit smaller than what you're used to in other places, which is totally fine for me, but maybe not for you. 

The carne asada is amaaaazing. So good.
author: Marta F.

description:
Came here on Thanksgiving eve.
I love that they let you call to see the wait and put you on a list and txt you when the table is ready.

LOVED the fried, spiced garbanzo beans they serve.

The carnitas were amazing!
author: Amy W.

description: Portions were small. The snapper had a suspiciously strong fishy flavor. There weren't enough tortillas. Worst of all, the $12 margarita was tiny and mostly ice.
author: Patrick S.

description: Food wasn't memorable and fine AT BEST. I expected better quality tasting food for the price. Whole aesthetic of the place was nice , but the only good things was the service and drinks. Didn't even finish my dish and neither did my company.
author: Celeste Z.

description:
Great was food but the service sucks. It wasn't that busy and we were seated pretty late or should I say last. I felt that the server had a little attitude and it took forever for the drinks and water to come to the table. They actually forgot the beer so we just ended up canceling it. I wasn't a fan of their bloody marry..maybe its because they add too much tequila to it. Didn't have that taste I was looking for. 

Things I ordered:
- Taco Arabe estilo Puebla (it was okay - should've ordered the fish tacos)
- Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón (SOO GOOD)
author: Jenn L.

description: Tuesday was my second visit.  Had chicken mole enchilada, and it was easy to taste that the mole was made with love.
author: Linda M.

description:
The staff here was really nice.  I rolled in on a Saturday at like 3PM to see if we could get a table for 11 a few hours later, and they totally accommodated me!  So big ups for that.  The restaurant design/aesthetic is really cool and comfortable as well.

I kinda wanna rate the place a 4.5 cause a few things were just OK, and for some of the prices they should be quite good.  But other stuff was stellar and fully deserving of a 5, but alas that is not an option.  So they get a 5.

Of the 11 people at our table, nobody had anything bad to say and most people agreed the food was worth the cost.  The complaints on cost vs taste were entirely on the drinks.  The Sangria was pricey and received marginal reviews.  The Margarita pitchers were the same.  So just get beer if you go.

The food though was excellent.  I tried the following:
Chips & Salsa
--6 Salsa options, all of which were distinct
Totopos
--This was crazy good, the waitress said it was a house specialty, and I can see why
Carne Asada
--Plenty of flavor here.  Good tortillas too
Empanada
--Very good
author: Corey S.

description: They should name this joint Nopabandito considering the prices and the small portion size.  Basically they throw a lot of ingredients on crispy tortillas and charge you a lot of money.   No problem with the service, that was actually very good; attentive, informative and quick.  Kudos for non-dairy cheeses.  The beer came in small brandy snifters, causing an exchange of glances between the men at the table.  We knew.  One day the hipsterish throngs that line up to eat there will wake up broke and still hungry and realize they've been eating the plastic Mexican food display instead of the real deal.
author: Eye W.

description: While wandering around, my friend and I decided to swing by Nopalito and try their food out. I ordered the Torta de Chilorio while my friend ordered the Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón. The torta was good and balanced, but not particularly flavorful, and my friend said the quesadilla tasted too fried. Overall, a good early dinner exploration, but I wouldn't go back.
author: Andrew T.

description: Terrific meal at Nopalito. The corn chips are a little on the thick side but other than that amazing experience. The ceviche is dangerously yummy. Fresh quality ingredients. You can really tell. It's the way I love to eat.
author: Brighton L.

description:
Emphasis on the first letters of this restaurant's name! ...Still prefer the one on 9th Ave. 

Came here on a seemingly innocuous Wednesday night around 8:30 and was told to wait half hour, only to be seated at a crowded shared table in the dim corner of the restaurant.

While the place itself is located on an easily recognizable corner besides a parking lot, that was the only thing going for me, as it is very compact and cramped inside, only to be made more hectic by the blaring music and overall lack of lighting. This Nopalito did not provide me the sophisticated and intimately casual experience as the one on 9th Ave did on a Friday night, instead serving us a night of disorienting frustration...

I found myself constantly shouting over the music just to talk to my friend across the small table from me while the couple next to us did their best to elbow us as little as possible, which was hard because it was a full table of 8. Our service was half-mindedly rushed, which can be understable due to the number of people that night, but it took forever for us to take our order and our check. When the food finally arrived, it was spectacularly flavorful as always, but was just not worth the price for the tapas serving they offer us. 

Overall my enjoyment here gradually declined and I would not come back unless I really craved some Nopalito (which is pretty often actually...) and happended to be in the area. Might I recommend the calmer and more ambient one on 9th? And you get the great Green Apple Books right across from it!
author: Kyrie S.

description: Carnitas. CARNITAS. Come for the carnitas, stay for the....carnitas. Easily some of the best pork I have ever tasted. Perfectly cooked, beautifully seasoned, layers and layers of flavor. Served with a delicious, perfectly dressed cabbage and carrot salad. Awesome salsa verde. Get a side of the rice, too. Highly recommend the guacamole, the chicken on the blue corn tortilla, and the empanada as well. I know people love their carne asada, but I wasn't blown away...meat was overcooked and underwhelming, unlike the...CARNITAS.
author: Celie H.

description: Had a wonderful birthday party dinner and all the food came out quickly and was delicious (we shared lots of plates among 7 of us). The only thing we weren't crazy about is standing next to our empty table while waiting for half our crew to arrive. Seemed silly but that's the way they roll. Excellent service and just a good time all around.
author: Mikey S.

description:
Decided to come here to celebrate a friend's birthday, and it was delicious and majority of the food selection are gluten-free (friend is allergic to gluten). I recommend the seasonal sangria, as it comes in a large glass. I wasn't too much a fan of the almond horchata, it was really grainy. 

We shared about 4 dishes: queso flameado con chorizo nopales (tastes like Mexican pizza at Taco Bell but with better quality products); empanadas con deshebrada de res (not my favorite but flavorful); ceviche de temporada (really tasty and fresh); and on to my ultimate favorite of the night: quesadilla con calabaza y elote tierno (basically, a vegetarian quesadilla). The selection of veggies and cheese was very well paired in this dish. You only get one too!
author: Minette C.

description: Yum - the food here is so good. I shouldn't be surprised, given how amazing NopaSF is. The margaritas are a home run. We ordered a pitcher on the back patio on a sunny Friday during an off-site for work. Everything we ordered was so tasty and the service was good too. The ambiance of Nopalito is very fitting. A very enjoyable experience and I can't wait to come back!
author: Nikki R.

description: Excellent ambiance. Attentive service. Unique and authentic Mexican dishes. The Fish Tacos were just right made with delicious Snapper. The Enchiladas de Mole are enchanting... and I normally don't like Mole!
author: Wolfgang F.

description: As good as NOPA proper is nopalito hasn't lived up. Not impressed with the food both as menu options or taste/quality. Good service, clean, good location. But way better Mexican options in the area.
author: Ryan B.

description: The BF took me here for date night.  (yay me!) We called in for a "unreservation"- so basically you call ahead and give them the "heads up" you're going to be there at 6pm for 2 people.  They write your name down and send you a text reminding you of your unreservation and you show up at 6pm.  You may have to wait a few mins, but they did get us into the standing bar and we settled in for their roasted chickpea appetizer and their signature margaritas.  We were seated at our table after about 7 mins I'd say.. so not bad being it was pretty busy.  The margie's were good but very strong so beware.  We ordered a bunch of small plates... the chips and dip, the chips that were tossed in some type of red sauce (hot).  We also got the jicama grapefruit salad which was absolutely delicious and refreshing; the gorditas (so good-so fresh) and the flan.  Everything was very good, and so fresh.  It isn't authentic mexican food, it has a great deal of american tex-mex flair but the flavor palette is no doubt unique.
author: Victoria C.

description: Came here for lunch.   My wife loved her empanada and her horchata and my friend enjoyed his carnival tacos.  I wasn't the biggest fan of my fish tacos, so I wouldn't recommend those.  Call ahead, or you'll be waiting a half hour or so for a table around lunchtime.
author: Ryan M.

description:
The food was fine, the service was downright bad. 

Our server left us at our table for 30 minutes without our drinks, water or an appetizer that we had ordered. Then, quite inappropriately, when the manager guy came over to deliver some food he tersely said the server "miscommunicated the order." Frankly, for a restaurant manager to throw a server under the bus is just downright inappropriate. We as patrons don't need to hear you complain about your staff. And he was just as responsible for our poor service as she was, as the manager. They never thought to apologize, or take anything off the bill as an act of good faith.  

 If I'm going to pay over $140 for brunch, I have much higher expectations. There are enough other places in San Francisco to get brunch without that type of poor behavior.
author: James M.

description: Food is awesome. Be careful if you don't like spice because some of their items can get spicy. It's a different type of Mexican food but very good. I love their chips and nachos. The meat is amazing as well as the drinks. A great date night spot. I'm not a fan of having the tables so close together but you gotta do what you can with limited space.
author: Jenna G.

description:
First found out about nopalito when I was watching "Munchies: Chefs night out with Gonzalo Guzman," one of the partners of nopalito. Just watching that short excerpt of Guzman making the tortillas from scratch and etc. made me want to try the food and especially because we were really close to the area. When we first walked in the ambiance was great, it was around 5pm on a Saturday night and surprisingly it was too filled up. Others said the wait usually varies from 30mim- an hour or more but when my girlfriend and I came we were sat right away, only problem was that the two person tables are very close to each other that conversations start to conflict. Ambiance was a more modern and playful set up. The bar is located in the middle of the first room connected to open kitchen. 

Service: Great, they were tentative to every thing we needed and he would come every 5-8 min asking if we needed tortillas, water etc. 

Carnitas: One of the best carnitas I ever had, reminded me of this place in LA that I hold the standard to. Try the taco with the meat before adding the pickled veggies. The meat was tender and great accompaniment to the fresh made tortillas. MUST GET

Empanada: At first I thought the meat itself was more bland in taste but the star of the empanada was the fresh made masa tortilla, everything worked well together especially the queso fresco on top 

Totopes: Probably the dish we liked the least but it packed the most spice, not to say it was really spicy. It comes with a salty cheese shredded on top and a crema or sour cream with a citrusy taste at the end. 

Overall a great place to try, and would come back again to have drinks and some tacos.
author: Jordan N.

description: Been wanting to check this place out. Location and atmosphere are great for a casual fun lunch/dinner with friends. Food was good, but nothing super delicious. Small bites with bigger prices. If I go back, it's for the mole.
author: Fatima S.

description: This place raises going out for  Mexican food up into a really nice dining experience. Good drinks, great food and very good service. I love the slow cooked Carnitas in the parchment. The cheviche is amazing and those hot little chickpeas are addictive.
author: M. O.

description:
Welp, it's as good as other say. We ordered the Huarache Salad with nopales, cotija cheese and black bean  creamy deliciousness. Fantastic, I'm salivating now just thinking about it.
Then we had the beef filled Empanada, so crispy and light with a sumptuous lush filling.
Everything looks amazing on the menu, healthy, fresh and delicious.

Beverage menu is creative, this time we opted for a sparkling wine that went perfectly with our lunch.

Staff is super friendly and chill. Can't wait to go back.
author: Natasha Z.

description: I have dined here so many times and it always surprises and never disappoints. The prices are commensurate with the quality of food, the service is good and the margaritas are astounding. Last nice we had the carnitas served with a fresh slaw and a green chile sauce, and we also had a whole grain tortilla with brussel sprouts, onions and a delicious and unusual red sauce. Highly recommended. So many SF restaurants are overpriced, all talk and no action, Nopalito is really worth its salt. Enjoy your meal.
author: Basya P.

description:
So much better than sister restaurant NOPA. Just a more casual vibe - def get a pitcher of margarita and una pelota for dessert

Best ceviche I've ever had!

Didn't need a reservation but still felt like a crowded, lively restaurant, which was great
author: Lily T.

description: Delicious not too sweet and perfectly limey margaritas. Loved the spicy  chickpeas for a free app. Had pozole for my main dish and it was also sooooo good.
author: Heather W.

description:
Our first dinner in SF on this trip and we were not disappointed.  Nice location in a shopping plaza and we sat outside - near an overhead heater which was welcome.

Starting off with Altamont IPA (Carol had tea, adjusting to the time change) we shared a great order of Guacamole. Entrees were Empanadas, Carnitas and Carne Asada - all were tasty but could have used a little more spice.

We ate dinner late, but the place was packed - always a good sign.
author: Dave W.

description:
This place is so overrated... I have eaten here about 4 times in 8 years and I live about 50 feet away. 

The few issues I see are and are not limited to:
- the menu is weak, limited offering of your standard fare Mexican food
- the servers are full of themselves
- the wait is ridiculous

I think the people who like to eat here love having coffee at The Mill and probably like getting drinks at The Page. Not my crowd.
author: Deepak K.

description: Came in Sunday Sept.17. We live close by and decided we wanted Mexican food. Made a reservation and showed up at 7:30. Ordered our drinks and got them in a timely manner. Everything after this went downhill. We waited 45 minutes for our salad while diners around us got their salads and food even though they were seated after us. Finally our salad came literally 2 minutes later our waitress comes up and says our food is ready can she bring it out. No we just started our salad. When we finished our salad she then brings out our food which is now cold. By this time we have both lost our appetites. Not the typical experience we usually have. Very disappointed.
author: Teresa M.

description: Nice ambience, good food made with organic ingredients and great service. Kinda pricey though. Oh and their guac is perfection
author: Nikhil R.

description:
2 1/2 star on food. 
4 star on cleanliness, staff and meal presentation. 

Cute place and very trendy. Decently priced at $37.00 (not including tip) for 2 of us. We ordered pork tacos, veggie quesadilla and a beef empanada to share. I wasn't impressed with the taste of my meal. It lacked a lot of flavor. I wanted salt, spices or something to add a kick, sadly, I felt it was quite bland. :(
We did receive a small bowl of complimentary dry roasted garbanzo beans, I liked those as it was spicy and had good flavors like paprika, cumin and/or chili powder.  

The check came with 2 small round complimentary cookies, similar to a Russian tea cookie. (I LOVE Russian tea cookies!) It was like a sugar and butter cookie with nuts topped with powered sugar. The texture is soft and should crumble in your mouth. I should really call this a Mexican/Spanish tea cookie, although it really wasn't bad, but it had too much nutmeg or allspice plus a lot of cinnamon. Sorry folks, I wasn't a fan!

The food lacked flavor (with the exception of the garbanzo), and  "Russian tea cookies" was overpowering with spice! 

Nopalito is nestled in a cute plaza with street parking. Oh, did I mention they have outdoor seating?! 

Will I come back? Perhaps, to try another dish.. I'll keep my fingers crossed and hope for the best, because I really want to like this place!
author: Anie L.

description: I guess I expected a lot more from this place.The totopos were nothing special, the chilaquiles and mole enchiladas were decent. The service was just bad, we finished our drink and not once did anyone come to our table to ask if we wanted something else.
author: Judy C.

description: I recently visited Nopalito and it has been one of my best picks when it comes to Mexican food. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla and a veggie quesadilla. The shrimp was very fresh as if they were bought that morning and the veggies included in the dish provided a nice healthy balance. It definitely stood out as one of the best quesadillas I have had. The veggie quesadilla wasn't bad at all either. It included a mix of fresh veggies and for this I really love the experience that I had. I will definitely visit Nopalito again in the future.
author: Chelsea J.

description: Super yummy. We tried so much stuff I forget all the names. I just know the flavors & textures were authentic & very present in every bite.
author: Carlita C.

description: I. Freaking. LOVE. this place. Specifically, the Caldo Tlalpeno con Pollo (it's a soup), the Gorditas Campechanas, and Carnitas. I also like the Totopos con Chile and Pozole Rojo though the first four I listed there are the absolute hands down winners of this show.
author: Nasrin M.

description:
I'm not sure what all the hype was about... Nopalito reminded me of a "Chipotle but slightly better" type of place (not necessarily a good thing). Super busy on a Saturday around lunch time. I appreciate their call ahead service and I would encourage anybody to use that if they were thinking of coming in for breakfast or lunch. But in all honesty, I found the food to be boring and one dimensional. 

I ordered their quesadilla with pork belly and it was more reminiscent of a large hard taco with some stuff inside. They don't add any salt to their food so they conveniently have salt in a side dish on the table. I didn't realize this until halfway through my meal when I was feeling that my quesadilla was lacking any flavor. Once I added that salt, it improved but only slightly. I think some salsa or heat would have made the dish so much better. Also paying $7 for a plain taco was kind of meh for me.

I did enjoy my horchata, the spicy chick peas, and the little cookie dessert at the end of our meal. Those were nice touches. Service was okay... nothing spectacular. Some people were super friendly while others were not so. 

If you want real Mexican food, this certainly isn't it. Drive around and you'll probably find a real taqueria with authentic Mexican food for way cheaper.
author: Melissa M.

description: Delicious!  Great staff & the outdoor dining was very pleasant.   Food was very tasty.  Will go back again soon.
author: kate l.

description:
I've been here once. My fiancee and I shared a quesadilla and torta. Both were off the he z.
I'm trying the mole now. I'll let you know how it is.
Place is pack, n crazy good, n different in a great way.
As far as appetizers and dessert.
Btw the mole is scream n good!
author: Matthew H.

description: Creative and fresh New Mexican food. Very friendly service and tasty food. Fresh salsas, attention to detail, and nice staff is what sets this place apart. Definitely don't miss the tacos or empanadas. Didn't get the car it's but it looked delicious
author: New J.

description:
I had high hopes from what I read in the reviews and what I've heard from friends. The food was well cooked with fresh ingredients. I got the Brussel sprouts quesadilla. The cheese was delicious and the dish was packed with vegetables. The food tasted pretty bland....not thoroughly impressed. I got the chocolate and cinnamon popsicle and that was pretty good! 

Don't know if I would go back again, but glad i got to try it once.
author: Akshaya V.

description:
Food is very sub-par and our bra-less waitress was a bit unprofessional. Also, were never asked if we wanted refills despite her looking directly at our empty glasses.

Very disappointed. Pretty much paid 80 bucks (for 5 people) to eat less than average food with odd people and their furry friends (yes you may bring in your dog to eat with you).

Not sure how this place is rated well.
author: John W.

description: If you are looking for the more sophisticated Mexican cuisine from Mexico City, this isn't it.  It pretends to be. But this restaurant is clearly an imposter. The only thing elevated was the bill.  If you like this place, you've never had the real thing. And that is what they're counting on.
author: Food E.

description: Such a Great place! We've been coming in for many years, never misses a beat. The food is as great as I remember from my first time here.The service is remarkable. I can't think of another place where everyone is so happy and pleasant. What an amazing environment!!
author: Trey K.

description:
A friend and I were sitting in Alamo Square when he decided that he could go for empanadas at 3pm. We took a look on Yelp and there was Nopalito. We got to the store at around 3:30pm on a Sunday and I was pretty surprised to see that the place was actually jam-packed even though it was so late! We could only get tables at the counter, but it's a chef's counter so that's not too bad! We went with some of Yelper's favorites. Since it was a pretty late lunch/early dinner/midday snack or whatever, we didn't get too much.

totopos--yum yum chips and salsa! but way fancier and way more delicious WARNING this thing is spicy!!! It's not just the sauce. It's something in the chip. Not sure how they make it, but we were both weaklings and couldn't handle it. It was absolutely delicious though but will definitely burn your mouth off! I usually am okay with spicy but I found this to be a very dry spicy which is why it was really hard to actually eat without coughing and chugging a ton of water. It is very delicious and worth trying though!

ceviche--thought this was mediocre. It wasn't awful but wasn't great. It was okay ceviche served with tortilla chips. Just a nice refreshing contrast to the burning hot totopos that we got.

empanada -- YUM. This was pretty freaking delicious. Embarrassingly, I've actually never had an empanada before, but this was goooood. Super tender pork inside, the shell was just right, and all the garnish and everything else going on with it was pretty yummy. It was just great that the meat was juicy and tender. 

Final price was less than $20... can't remember the exact bill but I thought it was pretty reasonable for a late brunch kind of thing.

tldr; yummy Mexican food at an affordable price! great service, great atmosphere
author: Jasmine X.

description: Excellent Mexican food. Portions were perfect. Great guacamole. Well seasoned meats. Was advised to come due to the great food. Not disappointed.
author: Nic M.

description:
Loved Nopalito!  We sat at the bar right next to small front of the restaurant kitchen.  Was helpful to see what they were preparing so that we could make choices - we had never been here before.  Ceviche is outstanding.  Basil oil in the marinade.  Pozole very flavorfull.  Margaritas were really good - not too sweet - more tart.  Draft beer selections really good.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Service excellent.  Make sure to watch the staff person making the corn tortillas.  Hard work and tortillas are a must have.  They do not take reservations but we did call ahead and put our name on the list.  

The only reason I gave this restaurant 4 stars is because we could not buy a gift card at the restaurant - only online.  Thought this was a bit odd.  Customer wants to spend more money - to me it is a no brainer that you take the money when offered.  Would suggest they enable gift card purchases at the restaurant.  Again odd - they sell the cookbook there but no gift cards.  Hmmmm
author: Patricia K.

description: Came here with my boyfriend cause I had heard many things and after watching the special they did with Munchies on YouTube I was sold. Sad to say that our experience here was pretty mediocre at best. The service was not existent as our server didn't sound enthused or interested at all in serving us. After he took our initial order he mumbled the special to us and walked away. And the only time he came back to check on us was when we were pretty much done with our food. Anyways, when it came to food i was pretty excited to try the ceviche and enchiladas de mole but was quickly disappointed. Although the ceviche itself was quite tasty the portion was pretty small for the price point. On top of that the chips that were served were pretty hard and stale. When it came to the enchiladas. I was surprised to only get two enchiladas with barely any sauce and nothing else to accompany it. Pretty overpriced to charge  14 dollars for two tortillas with a little sauce and chicken... otherwise they were alright... my boyfriend got the pambazo with chorizo and papa and it was good but so soggy that when he went to pick it up it fell apart. We ended up paying over 50 dollars for over glorified Mexican food, when I've had even better for a fraction of the price. Overall this place was overrated, and definitely not worth the money we paid for. Unless they address their service and or food portions I definitely won't be back.
author: Jesse C.

description: This place was incredibly disappointing after reading all the positive reviews and seeing this place show up on all top restaurant lists! Service was okay, nothing to write home about (negatively or positively).  The Honey Bee mezcal drink was actually really good, but the food left a lot to be desired.  We ordered 2 mole dishes, which might have been the problem: Chilaquiles and the Chicken Enchiladas.  Both dishes were lacking flavor and we had to add salt to the food; I never add salt to my food at restaurants, so I knew this was seriously lacking flavor.  Since both dishes were not good, I highly doubt I will return.
author: Arthi N.

description: We were Hungry. We ordered so many small things, they came out at a pace and in an order that made sense. The housemade juice was my favorite part (hibiscus orange!), and the blue corn tamale was a close second.
author: Erin D.

description: Excellent food. We had the carne asada, the carnitas, the fish tacos el pastor, and a very tasty little gem lettuce salad. All dishes were excellent, although some needed to be salted a little more heavily. The service was great, they allow dogs on the patio, and the wine was good too. My only complaint is that it's a little pricey. I will say that the entree-size portions are very large and will feed two people, especially the carnitas, so if you order that way then the prices are much more reasonable.
author: Lana B.

description: Had chicken mole enchilada and tostada.  I liked the setting and parking was fairly easy.  I thought the service was good.  The food wasn't "great".  I have had much better mole and it wasn't really an enchilada.  It was a taco smothered in sauce.  Would like to try it again with different food.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Finally had a chance to try this place with an out of town friend visiting. The food was okay, but was not wooed or wowed! We had the Tacos de Pescado al Pastor, Ceviche de Temporada, Carnitas, and guacamole. Would I dine here again? ... most likely no!
author: Amy L.

description: Awesome place! My favorite things on the menu are the posole soup and the Mexican cafe.
author: Karine P.

description:
4.5 stars rounding up to 5. Came here with a group of 4 on a Tuesday evening. We called an hour ahead (as per Yelp recommendation) and were seated in a very timely manner. 

The restaurant has two rooms, with a lively ambience and modern/rustic decor. Our server was excellent with a genuine personality and great knowledge of the menu.

The four of us shared a margarita pitcher and various dishes. The totopos de chile were essentially a classy version of nachos served along a delicious crema. The highlight for us was the empanada de pato confitado, which had tender duck with a delicious filling, served in a crisp empanada. Other excellent dishes included the huracha and the chicharron. Overall, all of the dishes were very flavorful and about 5 of the smaller plates were plenty to share among the four us. 

Overall, a high quality, authentic Mexican restaurant. The bill came out to $150, including two drinks/person and plenty of food for 4people.
author: Aaron C.

description: This place is awesome. The food is so good and the margaritas are out of this world. I've been a few times and always get the Chicken Mole, it's definitely my favorite. The Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón is also really interesting and super good. If there's a long wait you can grab a margarita at the bar which makes time go by pretty fast. ALSO you can call ahead and put your name on the waitlist. They're usually pretty accurate on quoting the timing.
author: Hayley G.

description:
The food is great here. I ordered the pork sandwich. The avocado and cheese really made it delicious. It had a kick so I had to order a lemonade to combat that! My husband ordered the carnitas tacos. The food is very authentic Mexican food. I only wish they had nachos or something for appetizers to share. The paletas (popsicles) looked good but we didn't have room for those after our meal!
I also don't like that you have to walk all the way around the restaurant to get to the bathroom and there is only one unisex stall. That is annoying.
author: Kristie L.

description: Super tasty spot, great for sharing. Waitlist is a little backed up at times but it comes with the territory.
author: Josh D.

description:
Very fun restaurant serving Mexican food! 

My friend and I came here on a Saturday for lunch. He called in an hour ahead to make a reservation, and by the time we got there, our seats were ready! The place is very cute - there is indoor seating and also patio. We picked a table in the patio, which is kind of like a green house, with windows all around so you can see the outside. Very cool! If you are worried about being cold, they got outdoor heaters! 

For food, there are two general types to pick from - small dishes (more than $10) and main dishes (more than $12). For the two of us, we got 2 small dishes and 1 main dish, which came up to be $25/person with tax and tip. For the small dishes, we got a tamale and ceviche, both of which were SO GOOD! The tamale had sweat potato filling and tasted VERY HEALTHY! The cerviche was made with a few different seafood (octopus and some other fish...), drizzled with orange juice, which gave it a very unforgettable taste. The ceriche was served with blue corn tortilla chips, and the serving size was great.

For our main dish, we ordered the pork tender carnitas with cabbage slaw. THIS IS A MUST TRY!!! It was served with 4 tortilla wraps. The pork was extremely tender and well reasoned. And you can tell they calculated the portion sizes, because we just barely finished everything with 4 wraps. Very satisfied feeling when you don't waste anything. :)

Great experience! The food is a bit on the expensive side, but not too much if you treat yourself once in a while. It is a very cute brunch place. There is a market right next door, if you choose to walk and digest after your meal. Would definitely come again with one or two friends.
author: Wendy F.

description:
My friends and I came for Sunday brunch with a reservation for 9 people. Typically a party of 8 is the maximum allowed, because that is how many the communal table seats. They were nice enough to make an exception, especially since they usually only accept call-aheads to be placed on the wait list. We arrived right when they opened at 11:30 and there was a line of people waiting to get in! The restaurant was filled in a matter of minutes. I loved the relaxed atmosphere. It felt contemporary but still a bit rustic. Our waiters and servers were always there right when we needed them. They were always refilling our waters and keeping our food and drink orders coming with an upbeat attitude. 

I don't have any complaints about what we ordered. We mostly went with small plates so that we could share them and try a lot more items. Even when we got one serving of an item, it was still able to make a round of all 9 of us so that we each had at least a bite. Some of my favorites were:

Totopos con Chile: Tortilla chips with a thick red salsa and a big mound of freshly grated cheese. These were so delicious for something seemingly so simple. A squeeze of lime just took it over the edge.

Ceviche de Pescado y Calamar: Fish and calamari ceviche. The calamari was included in large pieces so that you didn't have to dig around for it. The flavors were so fresh and this is one of my favorite ceviche dishes I have ever had.

Empanada con Deshebrada de Res: A grass-fed shredded beef empanada with a beautiful mound of cheese and sauce on top. The corn pastry shell tasted freshly made and it was a pretty large size. 

Carnitas: Pork braised in orange and beer, among other things. The flavor on these was KILLER and they were so tender. I could have eaten so much of this. Definitely a must-try.

We finished off the meal with some house-made paletas (Mexican popsicles). I chose Arroz con Leche and it wasn't just flavored with it; I came across many pieces of rice. This was my first time trying this flavor and it was just perfection. With your bill they also deliver some tiny hazelnut cookies. I could eat here again and again. The food and service both contributed to the perfect upscale-Mexican brunch experience.
author: Morgan H.

description: Wow, impressively delicious Mexican food. I love that they care about sourcing organic ingredients. This is instantly one of my favorite places to eat in SF.
author: Matt G.

description:
Great SUSTAINABLE and ORGANIC Mexican Kitchen in town!
Amazing Empanadas con Deshebrada de Res and delicious Flan!
Excellent friendly service, I'll be back!
author: Alessandro S.

description:
Organic.  Sustainable.  Mexican Food.
That's right.

THE CARNITAS.  They have me hooked so that I never order anything else.  Which is a shame, since that kept me from previously trying the Quesadilla Roja Con Chicharron.  Since a friend poignantly asked me to try it on my most recent visit, I've been kicking myself for not having done so before.  This quesadilla is beyond delicious.  That RED SAUCE...it's friggin OFF THE CHARTS!  Crispy tortilla, the most tender of pork belly, melted cheese, & all seasoned to perfection.  Easily the best quesadilla that I've ever had.  And I've had many.

So, Nopalito now houses both the best carnitas & the best quesadilla I've ever had.  Serious.  Trust.

Don't skip the totopos.  Just don't.

It was Monday, so it was an early nonalcoholic supper.  He had a hot coffee.  I had the mexican iced coffee.  Both fantastic!  Seriously!?  Who knew?  Leave it to Blue Bottle...& to Nopalito cuz that's just how they roll.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: We're from MTY Mexico, we have been living in the US for about 1 year and a half, and we can tell you this is authentic mexican food, this is the kind of restaurant you get in big cities like Mexico city, Guadalajara and Monterrey, good service, awesome food, we had Pozole Rojo, Tuna tostadas, Enchiladas de pollo con mole y micheladas. Everything was beyond expectations. Congratulations!
author: Ny H.

description: After hearing my co-workers say this is a great place to eat, my guest and I visited on 07/01/17 for lunch.  I ordered the Pozole Rojo and my guest ordered the Enchiladas De Mole Con Pollo, along with Gorditas Campechanas for an appetizer.  The portions were small for starters. The Pozole soup had absolutely no flavor. It was almost like water soup. The Mexican oregano was good but the chili-powder was not spicy or flavorful at all. I did not even finish the soup. The Gorditas were also flavorless. The presentation is good but the food does not taste good. The Enchiladas were flavorless and the Mole was watery. I would not visit this restaurant again. We could go to the Mission district and get a flavorful and delicious bowl of Pozole for $7 and chicken Mole that tasted good for $10-12.  Too bad for Nopalito, the food presentation is great but that's where it stops.
author: Everett H.

description: A trending spot with great service. Very friendly staff and nice, clean, modern decor. Interesting menu options done really well. The quesadilla roja is the absolute bomb! Seriously well made. We have been back twice strictly for it. I can't wait to try everything on their menu!
author: Amber U.

description:
Heard about this place for awhile and was interested to try it given all the hype. Glad I came for linner as it was the weekend so we were able to bypass any wait time. So glad I  didn't have to wait 2 hours, because I don't think the food is worth a 2 hour wait or even a 1 hour wait. However, I am an unabashed gluten eater, so perhaps I didn't get the most out of this restaurant as others might.

Basically it tasted what I thought a gluten free restaurant would taste like. 

We shared the ceviche. Not worth 13$. It tasted fine, but was more on the bland side, the tortillas were also so hard. The beef empanada was tasty and filling for me, but the beef was pulled and I was craving ground beef. Oh well. My favorite part of the empanada was the mexican cotija cheese on top. 

Almond horchata was good.

Ambiance was nice. Service was decent as well. I really liked the complementary Mexican cookies that came with the bill. Probably won't come back however.
author: Vivian D.

description: This place was soooooo good. We had the carne asada, fish tacos, pork tacos, and the ceviche nachos. They were all very well seasoned and the flavors were pretty unique; all of the dishes surprised us by being a bit different from the standard. The "outdoor" seating area is perfect for dining with pets, and I especially appreciated that it was fully closed off with a door, giving it an indoor atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Leila P.

description: NOT good. Don't recommend this at all.  Don't wait, go somewhere else. The food is just ok. The service is so bad. First we waited for an hour and a half to get the table. The hostess said they are completely booked, in reality there were several empty tables all the time we waited. The main course arrived after 45min of ordering, they forgot about appetizer all together.
author: Irina Z.

description:
The chilaquiles. Oh, sweet lord, the chilaquiles. Bliss.

They also have a really lovely outdoor seating area, which I loved.

But seriously though.... those chilaquiles.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
Mira! Look! Eat this food! It is excellent!

Thanx to delivery app I can eat here in my house. The menu dazzles, and porky belly and deep spices says try this.

The quesadilla knocked us out, such depth of flavor, the meat deep & rich, so satisfying. 

Venga! Come here! So good, you'll be happy!

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
3.5 Stars- SO many people have raved about this place. In my opinion, it's overpriced Mexican food. Maybe I should have ordered a bunch of tapas but I ended up only ordering a carne asada plate ($18) which included steak slices, grilled onions, cheese, cactus, jalapenos, black beans, and corn tortillas. I had to eat my meat with the tortillas otherwise it was way too salty eating it on it's own. It took 4 corn tortillas before I was satisfied.

They are very generous with the steak portion- and they should be after you pay enouh for the dish itself. The service is awesome and very friendly. I love the small almond cookies at the end.

Hate that you have to leave the restaurant to go to the restroom and re-enter to their takeout side. Also hate that there is only one restroom. I know space is expensive in the area so this in no way affected my rating.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Had such a great meal here!! Loved everything we had!
There were a lot of interesting vegetarian options. I really liked the sweet potato taquitos. They were awesome!
Ceviche was super flavorful. It was tart and just really fresh. 
The fish tacos were also great -- a really nice flavor (loved that they had orange slices in there!)
The posole had an awesome flavor. 
Everyone at the table went nuts over the carnitas. They all said the pork was super soft and delicious. 
I try not to eat too many chips, but I couldn't resist the ones we got. 
Overall, just really excellent!
author: Jen G.

description:
I dropped by Nopalito for a carb-laden lunch to recover after a serious urban hike up and down the Panhandle and through Golden Gate Park.  I needed a nourishing and refreshing meal, and I needed it fast.  

Luckily the place wasn't busy mid-afternoon on a Friday.  It was a piece of cake to cozy up to the counter and soak in the contemporary atmosphere.

A margarita was a good refreshing choice to start.  It was a bit sour for my taste, but definitely had a nice kick, and was a nice accompaniment for the complimentary bowl of fried garbanzo beans.

The real highlight of lunch at Nopalito was the ceviche verde de pescado y calamar.  The fish was super fresh and tangy, while the squid was silky-smooth and not the least bit rubbery -- and I say this as someone who normally shies away from calamari that's not of the deep-fried variety! 

I wasn't as huge of a fan of the totopos con chile -- spicy tortilla chips with cotija cheese, onions, cilantro, crema and lime.  Despite all the toppings, these glorified nachos were actually kind of bland.  I guess I expected more (and I don't mean in terms of portion size, which was quite behemoth).

Service was fast and formal, in that impersonal sort of way that feels more "Cheesecake Factory" and less "local neighborhood joint".  On the other hand, it was a wonderful surprise to receive a complimentary almond butter cookie at the end of the meal!
 
The few complaints I had are all pretty minor.  All in all, Nopalito is a solid choice for a meal.  I definitely appreciated that much-needed refuel!
author: David G.

description:
1 star for the hostess. The food is awesome but the hostess sucks. She is rude and lacks manner. We visited and she made a comment about how we just showed up when they don't take reservation. 
Also when we were waiting outside she said "ohh are you just going to wait right here". Where else do you expect us to wait then.
author: Stuti S.

description:
My friend and I came here on a Sunday at 6PM. The hostess told us that we would be seated in 45 minutes. A long wait, but to be expected at a popular restaurant. It's now 7PM and I ask the hostess when we will be seated. She replies by saying that she underestimated how long it would take other customers to finish their dinners and that it could take another 30 minutes before we were seated. 

I was really floored by this "mistake" in large part because the hostess didn't take the time to let us know that it would take MUCH LONGER for us to be seated than she'd estimated. I had to inquire about this myself and was given an attitude to top it off. It seemed like other people were being given priority seating over my group. Several times I saw that the hostess was taking in people who had just arrived. 

Finally, we decided to walk over to Green Chile Kitchen because, let's be real, no one has time to sit around waiting for a table for 1.5 hours. We got a text message from Nopalito 2 HOURS LATER saying that they had a table ready for us. Really? Who would wait for 2 hours for a table. 

Management needs to better train their hostesses, and the hostess should not be in charge of cleaning tables and setting up utensils. We noticed several times that the hostess was running around doing things that normally a busser would do. 

I'm definitely not coming back here. There are a lot of other options in the city for good Mexican food.
author: Raha G.

description: This wonderful Mexican spot has some of the best food we had on our trip.  The fish tacos were flavorful and the salsa that came with it was amazing.  Great spot to grab a quick bite.
author: Tom T.

description:
Came here for dinner with my boyfriend on New Years Eve. Called 2 hours in advance to secure our table, which was ready for us when we arrived promptly at 7pm. We enjoyed the TOTOPOS CON CHILE ($8), however, we felt that they were overly-hyped by other reviews. If not for the cheese, I feel that they lacked much flavor. Also they were too spicy (and keep in mind I like spicy foods).

We ordered a MARGARITA PITCHER ($40), which gave the two of us two drinks each. They are very generous with their alcohol- the drinks were strong but tasty! We also ordered the BIRRIA DE RES ($23) to share- and I must say we were both STUFFED. Only part of the entree I wasn't fond of was the salsa- it tasted like habanero tobasco. I asked the waiter for a side of salsa and he just brought more of the habanero tobasco.

Overall, we thought the food was great. I would definitely come back but I won't get the Totopos. Would recommend management to include more salsa options (I.e pico de gallo).
author: Karoline A.

description:
Yawn.

This is what happens when white people take on Mexican food.  It becomes an overcomplicated mess.

The $9 margarita was totally unremarkable.

The Totopos con Chile are tortilla chips rubbed with some sort of chili sauce.  This has the unfortunate effect of making them soggy, but I did enjoy the taste.

I ordered the Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón.  The tortilla was overcooked so as to be dry and crunchy.  

We also waited a loooooooooooooong time for our food to arrive.

Slow service and so-so food?  Pass.
author: Ben B.

description: Food was decent, expensive--our server, dude with with accent, was non existent. Never saw him since we placed our order. Never followed up on us. So he got no tip, and I have no problem saying that. Service left a bad taste in my mouth. Not coming back to this place
author: JG B.

description:
we wanted mexican food brunch the other day and nopalito did not disappoint. it wasnt exactly brunch but it did the trick! 
first - they were very accommodating when i said i couldnt have dairy and put all crema/queso on the side. we started with a pitcher of margs. fresh! yum. 

we got four items. 

sweet potato taquito things, they were deeeelicious! probably better with the dairy, but i still enjoyed. 

black bean stuffed tortillas with chicken on top and some other things.. ooomg i could have eaten 3 more orders. well definitely be back for these. 

for an entree i got fish tacos that were the bomb.com with whatever salsa they used, lots of jalapenos and orange slices too. my bf got this chorizo thing that looked like a fried, inside out quesadilla. he said it was to die for. 

we will be back to try more!
author: Taylor N.

description:
I ordered a $9 tostada that was the size of a small $3 taco. It was disappointing. 

Everything about this place is disappointing frankly. 

Why isn't there a checkbox for "gentrifier restaurant?"
author: Maxine Y.

description:
I'm a huge huge fan of Nopa and have seen Nopalito on the food network but never got a chance to check it out. My dad and his wife went a couple months ago and had rave reviews about the food. So I did my due diligence and yelped the best items. I'm a huge quesadilla fan so I was looking for something different. 

Get the quesadilla roja con chicharron aka pork belly quesadilla. Man. That thing is special. It was probably the best quesadilla I've ever eaten. 

We didn't have reservations so we did to go through their little to go window. Definitely a good touch for people who want to try their food but find themselves spontaneously in the neighborhood. Great spot I'm excited to try more of their food.
author: Shannon H.

description: Delicious authentic Mexican food. When in San Francisco you have to try this place, it's a must. Its not your normal hole in the wall mexican joint. This some of the best twisty mexican food I've had. The tacos de carnitas are soo good. Along with the quesadilla con chicharrón. You wont be disappointed in knowing its just another mexican spot. Its delicious and fresh. Highly recommended.
author: Scott B.

description:
This place wasn't at all what I expected. I am accustomed to having amazing Mexican food from food trucks or slightly run down but delicious mom and pop's type of establishments. Whenever I see Mexican food in more upscale places, I tend to assume the flavor would be watered down. I wouldn't even say this place is "upscale" but it definitely has a more modern and trendier feel to it.

Despite that -- the food here is divine! It's not the most traditional but I'm not really an "authenticity" purist. Some traditionally prepared foods could benefit from some culinary techniques not often used in the cuisine. This place combines traditional flavors with amazing techniques and the result is fantastic food. The mole was so delicious I debated licking the plate clean. My carnitas was so moist and instead of covering up the flavor of the pork, it highlighted the best of it.

I loved that we sat by the kitchen and could watch them put together the food. My mouth watered at almost everything that came out of the kitchen. The portions are perfectly sized. Service was understated but always available when needed. It was great for a date night dinner.

I'd make a point to come back here next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Felisa D.

description: Loved this delicious place. The ambience is fun and the service was quick. We all got an entree and the portions were huge.
author: O K.

description:
This was on my radar for quite awhile, and I'm so glad I tried this out. Serendipitous luck when I needed to find a place for dinner with my companion AND be dog friendly-and voila! Nopalito has a bit of a tapas vibe, but there's also large dinner plate options as well. Do note that this location is the doggie friendly one.

The wait wasn't that bad, and I loved how they made sure the area we sat in could accommodate our pooch. 

RECOMMEND:

*Totopos Con Chile-I sound like a broken record from all the other reviews, but this is a perfect appetizer!!!

*Chicharron Quesadilla-I know some complained about the portion, but please don't be fooled. The flavors in it are amazing to say the least.

*Pozole-Perfect bowl of comfort. All the sides that come with it, you need to add it all-it definitely heightens the flavor of the soup.

For those hoping for Tex-Mex style and portions, this IS NOT the place to go! Service and atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, and I'll definitely be back!
author: Nicole C.

description:
I felt like as my meal went on, it got progressively less impressive. But let's start from the beginning...we were actually seated pretty quickly (within 5 minutes) but we had our seats almost given away cause we weren't present at first call...why ask for a phone number if you don't even bother calling?? Luckily, my brother had a sixth sense about our status - we were just exploring the market next door though.

Started the meal off with the machaca de camaron con huevo y salsa. This was very delicious and full of flavor. I'll admit that I couldn't really taste the shrimp though. This was followed up by the quesadilla roja con chicharron. It's not your traditional quesadilla...the shell is uber crispy, but still pretty light. Flavors were fresh and paired well together but there was basically no chicharron in our quesadilla. Granted we split it 4 ways, but everyone only got a sliver of chicharron. Next we had the torta. It was basically a pulled pork sandwich. Absolutely nothing stood out to me, not the bread, not the pork...and to think this one was the recommended dish on Food Network. Lastly, we had enchiladas de mole con pollo. I was not a fan of the mole sauce....I've had way better. But the chicken was very tender and juicy...I'll give it that.

These size of the dishes here are small, but prices do vary from $6 to $13/plate. 

Would I go back, probably...

Definitely not for the value, but in terms of atmosphere and hanging out with friends, this is definitely a place to consider. It was pretty comfy sitting and idly chatting on their covered patio space on a warm SF day.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Everything about Nopalito is on point.  The service is super friendly and helpful.  The atmosphere is casual yet still has a lot of style.  And the food is really, really good.  The carnitas may be on everyone's best of lists, but the Totopos Con Chile are where my heart lies.  Also, it seems like to beat the lines, you should go at lunch when they first open.  Must haves are

-Totopos con chile $7
-Popsicles when they have it
-That almond cookie thing at the end of the meal, so good!
-Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón $11
author: Herb K.

description:
Back to Nopalito. They have the best queso fundido with nopales!! 
I order a chilaquiles rojos México City style and the waitresses look me like weirdo!!  I just request cilantro an onions on top!! México City Style.
Always my first impressions are bad in this restaurant!! 
They keep garbanzos with chile for snack.... well it is waird of you think the concept is base in the DF cuisine!!
Chilaquiles ok!! Nothing special. 
The services after the first impression is great!! Just they don't have Mexican beers options!!
author: Arturo R.

description:
Such a rip off and so bland. I've lived in the neighborhood since they opened and they've consistently gone downhill. I am not one to complain about value when ingredients are  quality, but here its laughable. 

$18 for a big bowl of chicken broth with 2 pieces of veiny chicken ... oh and they forgot the 3 tortillas which consist of 40% of the meal. A can of Campbells soup has more to it.


Please ask  your kitchen staff  if they would pay $18 for that dish - its not ok to charge these prices and give such shi**y food just becuase we are in SF

Mgt really needs to rethink menu, portions and prices becuase its a total unsatisfying rip-off
author: L V.

description:
Nopalito doesn't disappoint in terms of quality of food and feeling satisfied after the meal. I would suggest ordering a few different dishes if you are here with a group and eating family style. The Carnitas is safe choice- a good fist-size of tender meat with unlimited corn tortillas. The Ceviche appetizer is delicious but small in terms of quantity. I would highly suggest ordering whatever specials they have for the day- it's always good. The Red Snapper Tostado was amazing and I would definitely order it again. Free Mexican Wedding Cookies for each person at the end of the meal is always a plus.
It's continuously crowded here so make sure to get a reservation before coming in.
author: Grace L.

description:
My parents wanted to dine here ever since they saw Nopalito on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives (which I think is weird because I don't think Nopalito is either of those..)  Anyway, the show featured the Sunset location, but it was too far for them to travel from the East Bay, so we dined at the one off Broderick.

We ordered a lot of dishes: side of beans, totopos, tacos dorado, tostada de trucha al crudo, tacos de pescado, ensalada de pepinos, and mole.  We also got a free beef empanada because they served the wrong table (score!).  For drinks, my sister and I each got the strawberry almond horchata.

We enjoyed every single dish.  The totopos are my go-to dish whenever I eat here, and they didn't disappoint.  The fish tacos were satisfying as well.  I tried everything except for the salad.  I'm not a fan of cactus, which this salad had.  My mom and my sister enjoyed it though.

The only complaint I have is the bathroom.  You have to exit the restaurant and enter this tiny room where they place to-go orders.  The bathroom was disgusting, and I suggest using it if you really have to go.

It can get really loud and crowded here.  And I find the people dress a little more fancy here than in the Sunset location (for dinner at least).  While you wait for a table, you can do a little snacking from the grocery store next door..but don't lose your appetite!
author: Vira P.

description: I love almost everything here! I always start off with drinks as I wait for my seat and go crazy on the appetizers =) and what is next is history! Super yummy food! Love this place...
author: Jay Y.

description:
Great place for Mexican food.  Short wait, clean environment, and large portions.

Carnitas: must order! I was so surprised it wasn't dry/over cooked like most places.
Pescado al la Veracruzana: it was good but will try another dish next time
Hibiscus Orange Soda: i liked it but my mom thought it was sour.

Bill came to $42 plus tip
Parking was easy to find, considering the neighborhood.
author: Angelica C.

description: Horrible service. There's this Caucasian male waiter, 5'5'', slim built, who works in weekday afternoons that ignores people as they walk by and holler at him for help. He must be real busy. Food was nothing interesting. The lack of choices / variety is astounding for a 'upscale' Mexican place like this. Cocktails weren't bad though. We won't be coming back. Plenty of other places with better food, not worth coming if your staff carry that kind of attitude.
author: Koalie W.

description:
Their tamales are amazing. Usually I don't like tamales but these are quite different...not your typical carnitas filled  but rather butternut squash. A good vegetarian alternative. 

The only thing is it's a bit pricey for one tamale, especially given the small size. 

Definitely good to try though if you're in SF!
author: Melissa L.

description:
So this was my husband's pick for our Saturday night dinner. I consulted with Yelp before I agreed, and saw that the reviews were great so I gave him the thumbs up! And let me just preface this review by saying that if the food hadn't been so ridiculously good, this entire review would have a totally different look to it. By different I mean, ugly! 

We arrive, reservation-less on a Saturday evening at close to 8pm. We'd been out all morning, so we were fairly tired, and just wanted to get a bite to eat. We walk up to the hostess and she tells us it will be at least an hour and a half wait. AHH! Earlier that day, we'd opted against waiting 45 minutes for lunch and then realized that by the time we walked to another spot, the 45 minutes passed, and we ended up waiting longer. Needless to say, this time around we decided to wait it out. We walked back to our car and waited there instead of out in the freezing cold. 

As I'm sitting I notice that NO ONE else is waiting. Why? I saw few people ahead of us, behind us, check-in, get seated. Sure there was a bar the hostess offered up to the other 99.5% of kid-less patrons that arrived, but even still, the people that checked in immediately before us were no where to be found. Hmm. 

So 90min later, we get a text saying our table is ready. As I'm walking up, I see the hostess put the high chair next to our table. I say our table, because we were literally the ONLY people with a kid in the entire restaurant. So she walks out, and knowing full well we've been waiting for 90 minutes, she decided to check in the 2 couples that may or may not have arrived before us and had US wait!!!! She suggested the bar for them, and immediately took them inside to show them the bar area. We waited another few minutes before she came back for us, and sat us. UGH! 

I also noticed that we were the ONLY "latino" people there. Now, keep in mind, it is very rare that I feel like I've been the victim of racism. I think in my entire lifetime I've felt discriminated against, twice. I couldn't shake the feeling, when I saw how friendly the hostess was to everyone else, who happened to be white. So I actually edited my review to include this bit of information because I went back to see if anyone else had complained about this same sort of thing, and THEY HAD! TONS of people complain about the hostess and one person in particular noticed the racial stuff. If there are so many complaints about her, why isn't anyone doing anything about it?

Fortunately, our server was great! No complaints there. 

The food itself was it's ONLY redeeming factor. Absolutely AMAZING! We ordered the Tamale, the Huarache, and the Empanada ... ALL incredibly delicious. Absolutely exquisite. Just, great quality food & ingredients! I also tried their Almond Horchata which was very tasty and unique. 

I would absolutely visit here again if I could order my food to-go and not deal with the BS seating.
author: Joana F.

description: Great ambiance of a casual little spot- small seating area so quite personable feel. The plates were nice smaller dishes that I shared- seems like a good place to get a drink and a light bite. Enjoyable.
author: J K.

description:
Went back after several months. Ordered the carne asada and it was like a salt lick - the meat was a distasteful grey color as well. I cut my losses after a few bites. Took the rest to go so I could make the flavors more balanced at home. 

My wife was bitten by a rather large beetle that crawled on her from some of the restaurant's shrubbery... the management brushed her pain and discomfort aside and didn't bother to apologize. They said that that has not happened to anyone else... well what does that matter?

So the first time we went was great, really great... every time after has been more and more disappointing than the last.
author: R M.

description:
The wait for a table of four on a Monday night was about 45 minutes, which is decent for a popular restaurant like Nopalito. 

The complimentary baked garbanzo beans were perfect to munch on as we waited for our dishes. 

Totopos con chile: One of the best "chips and salsa" starter I've had. The chips were real deep fried tortillas giving each bite a satisfying thick crunch, and all the combined flavors of the toppings, especially the cojito cheese, had me reaching chip after chip.

Empanada: Stuffed with goodness and not bland at all.

Carnitas: My favorite dish of the night. The braised pork was so tender and flavorful. Highly recommend

Mole Poblano con Pollo: The chicken was not dry and the mole was rich and easily one of the best mole I've tried but...for me, it also was one of those flavors/tastes that you get tired of easily. Just a few spoonfuls was enough. 

Ending with the complimentary almond cookies was a plus.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Everyone we've taken here loved this place. The food is fresh, delicious, Home made and relatively healthy. Flavors are on point and the drinks are delicious too. Wish they had more seating but we luckily lived close enough that reservations were a big issue. Highly recommend
author: Ron M.

description:
Love coming here since it's bigger than the other location and easier to find parking.
Food is awesome and service is impeccable. Get the totopos, tacos and Carnitas. Great beer selection and they have Michelada!
author: Semuteh F.

description: Most of my friends who really like this place are vegetarians.  I got the chicken mole burrito, and all the mole was on the top, the middle was jalapeños, the bottom was dry rice and beans. Very disappointing.  Tried the carne asada, similar.  Ordered the tacos, but when I got back to my friends with her super veg burrito, it turned they left out the tacos...
author: Pul F.

description: Great food, and service, however, w prices you should be able to seriously have your bathroom inside your establisment, rather than a gas station "feel" outside the building.  Luckily weather is temperate, but wierd to put your coat on to use the restroom. Not right.
author: Peggy M.

description:
