The menu here is very different from that of its big sister, Nopa, and the vibe is pretty different. On a Friday night around 6ish it was actually a lot of families, and it's a lot less loud / crazy here.

I went with the pozole for a windy night.  I love hominy and pork, and their seasoning was really good.  It's more than just a regular soup at $13 and is definitely filling enough to be a meal.  It comes with lime, fresh onion/cabbage/radish, thick and nicely salted crunchy chips, and extra spices on the side. They package everything nicely in separate containers when you get it as take out. The polvorone was a bonus for dessert.

Things I love about Nopalito:
1. Free parking in the lot for Faletti's right in front 
2. There is a take out window
3. No reservations, but you can call ahead, which is almost the same thing - this is much better than places that are just straight no reservations
4. Open all day!
author: Marilyn H.

description:
Most people i've talked to have said the food is a hit or miss here. I'd agree with that because I wanted to love everything I ordered, but i didn't. 

So anyways, I came here for lunch, I got the tostada with ceviche. Apparently it's not on the menu. What I did like about this dish was that it was very pretty, had a good ratio of fish and salsa/avocado/cabbage. What i didn't like was that the tostado was stale..... and lacked some seasoning. 
I also got the chilaquiles. I don't think I can give a fair critique on this one as i have not tried chilaquiles from multiple places. All i know is that it tasted almost like charcoal, so i left about 75% of it and left.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Hate to write a "Nopalito used to be awesome but as they've gotten way more popular it fell off" kinda review, but here it is: Nopalito used to be awesome but now it's way overpriced and just not that good.

I've literally been to this place a few dozen times as I've lived on the same block for 3 years. I've seen the portions (and drinks) grow way smaller, the formerly awesome and accommodating regular staff get replaced with a rotating cast of so-so servers, and the prices go up significantly.

The past few times we went, the food was way salty, lukewarm, expensive, and overall just off-balance and poorly prepared. They also recently stopped serving their amazing and free almond cookies due to some babble not wanting to contribute to the drought by supporting the almond industry (rolls eyes). So we stopped going. 

Feels like one of those places where the reputation and long lines outside make people feel like all is good and it's doing better than ever but if other patrons are having the same kind of experiences we've had recently it will catch up to them.
author: Charles M.

description:
Delicious, but quite a wait. We got around the 1 hour wait at 8PM by going to the takeout line. 
The birria was full of flavor and definitely had a spicy kick. The handmade tortillas were on point as well. The quesadilla was also amazing. Would definitely get take out again!
author: Frances C.

description:
With the big brother NOPA down the street having a 1hr wait time, my friends and I decided to start off our Saturday with a trip to Nopalito. 20 min wait time for a table for 4 here in the afternoon, and a nice market next door to explore while you wait. 

If you skimp over the review highlights, everyone raves about the carnitas. How could such a simple dish leave so many people flabbergasted? To this day, I still don't understand. For $16, you get a relatively heft portion of carnitas, cabbage salad, a few grilled veggies, and sauce. That's it. I'm not a fan of cabbage, so I pretty much had no side dish. Yes, they are marinated in orange, bay leaf, milk cinnamon and beer. Yes, they're tender, aromatic, and delicious. However, they're still just carnitas and are not worth $16. 

To wash it all down, we got a pitcher of seasonal sangria. Our original choice was the exquisitely looking white wine sangria with frozen grapes, but they were out. It was very watered down and tasted too simple. I could easily make better with just a few ingredients. For $9 a glass, it's a rip off. 

Service is very slow and you have to hunt down a waiter just to get water. I realize they're very busy, but hiring some more wait staff would make a big difference. 

$30 later, I left full but not impressed. The carnitas are delectable, but this is one place that doesn't live up to its hype.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: This place was the best food I've ever tried. Everything tastes great and looks great! I got the torta and it tasted super good. The torta came with home made chips that just made the meal taste better. The restaurant itself is small but really cute and clean. I was definitely eat here again when I come back to SF.
author: Alexis N.

description:
Gluten free Mexican food. 


Great taste for me. I ordered the chilaquiles and WOW. 

I went back again and again. Top choice for non taqueria Mexican food. 

5/5. 

P.S. They serve delicious strawberry lemonade.
author: Tristan A.

description: Fantastic food, and I like the patio, which is open to dogs (I don't have, but maybe I just like to daydream that I can come to this restaurant nearby my house with my future dog). I like the they take phone reservations ahead without having to be physically present.
author: Victoria C.

description: The worst Mexican food that I have ever eaten in my life and it was pricy for the tasteless food that I got. I should've just cooked at home.
author: Danayira S.

description:
The Torta Pambazo is amazing. There's no wonder it was recently featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. I don't typically trust that Guy Fieri sellout but he wasn't wrong here.

Our waiter, Ken, was pretty awesome. Great service. Great atmosphere. I'll be back soon.
author: Wesley D.

description:
What a lovely time we had at Nopalito a couple of days ago. 

(PLUS SIDE)

- Their food is divine. I had their potato tacos (can't remember the exact name), it came with crema, queso fresco and guac and it was surprisingly very crispy but I loved it. I also had a taste of their quesadillas, which were a little bit more average, but still good. My friends loved the carnitas dish.

- Strong mojitos! 

- Nice ambiance with a cute sitting area, plus they do takeout too! 

(MINUS SIDE)

- It's not a dog friendly place, which kind of sucks. But we still managed to get our puppy in, provided he be sitting under the table.

- It's a bit over priced if you ask me. 

Overall a good experience, I will definitely come back for a late weekday lazy dinner to try their takeout. CHeers!
author: Sev G.

description:
My husband has raved about this place for two years so I had great expectations.  We happened to be in the city on a Saturday and went to lunch at one of his favorite spots, a Yelp review is born! 

With as popular as the place is, I am shocked they haven't moved to a larger location. 

The hostess was rude however; the food is really good.  This place has to be busy as a reflection of the flavor a because there is nothing else about this place that is good.

I would say the pozole is a pass.  This likely varies based on regions in Mexico however; it tasted more like an enchilada soup than a pozole. 

I don't think it's worth going to with so many other great places in San Francisco personally but,  to each their own.
author: Angela P.

description: I've been here a couple times and the food is always fantastic. The service is decently attentive despite how busy it always seems to be. I love the portions because it allows you to sample more on the menu and satisfy any particular cravings.
author: Alison M.

description:
I'm going to chalk this up to one large greasy disappointment. Guess I made the mistake of thinking "sustainable organic Mexican" eats equals healthy eats (silly me).

If you call ahead to place your name on the wait list (no reservations) they don't start the timer until you arrive there in person (someone correct me if I'm wrong). Our wait time on a Friday night was over a hour (to be expected). We took this in stride and decided to sooth our hungry bellies with alcohol at a local bar. Thankfully they call/text you when your table is ready. Cute restaurant, friendly service, delicious margaritas- what's not to love?  

My entree- just awful (a three is being generous). I had the carnitas and thought it was a pretty piss poor rendition of carnitas. Flavorless and greasy with a cabbage salad that was equally as distasteful. The wrapper was actually dripping in grease- nasty... I took the leftover carnitas and used it to make a Chinese pork stir fry at home the next day, which tasted better than the original creation. Now that's sad. Wont be returning- bummer...I do love me a good margarita..
author: Ritu K.

description:
Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón. Order many, many, many of these. Incredible!

Totopos con Chile - very fancy Doritos, not bad.

Tacos de Pescado - fish was just okay, remaining taco was delicious. With a different fish, could have been wonderful.

Pozole - ok, too oily. Pork shoulder therein was delicious
author: Jacob L.

description:
Came here with 3 coworkers. We had reservations, but still had to wait a while and it was really cold outside. 

The guac came with good, thick crunchy chips. And the roasted chickpeas were spicy and good too.

Carne Asada con Chorizo y Nopales 19.00 -- This was good, but the dish was probably 90% meat. I kind of wish they gave me more than just the spoonful of refried beans. And some rice probably would've helped balance it. I ended up getting a tortilla from my friend to help.

Dark Chocolate popsicle 3.50 -- this was good and dairy-free. Other than that, nothing too special.

All in all I've heard a lot about this place but it wasn't as good as I thought it would be. The service was okay (had to wait a while for refills). If I came back I would try the fish tacos.
author: Cynthia W.

description: Wonderful food and service; I had the Mole Poblano con Pollo and the mole sauce was amazing and the chicken was very juicy and flavorful.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes as I was torn when deciding what to order.  Just wish I could put that mole on everything!
author: Pam B.

description:
Herro!

Fresh, spicy and delicious. 

I could've used more of the crunchy chickpeas. The Pozole was amazing.
author: MüsTard C.

description:
A more accurate name would be Nope-a-lito.

I want a zero star option. I'm no joke upset about being forced to give even a single star to this restaurant. (And I give VERY few 1 star reviews - 0.8% of all reviews)

Atmosphere? Children yelling and throwing things. 

Worst $40 I've spent on food in San Francisco.  Don't do it!!! It's too late for me, but for God's sake, please spare yourself the disappointment. I could name 10 other Mexican places that offer better tasting (and more) food with faster service that isn't rude for a lot less money. Don't get suckered in by the decor or bafflingly generous reviews.  

Worst service I've had in San Francisco. The people at the bus stop were more engaging and helpful than the server by full measure. 

Not only did I not like this restaurant, it caused me to boil with an anger that even tequila couldn't quench.

We were the only people without children. And normally I like children, but something in this place must bring the worst out in them, much like our server.

$40 for essentially 4 tacos. The dishes are tasteless and uninspired. The portions are TINY. The service is HORRENDOUS. The wait is too long.  

Server literally didn't care if we were happy. Made no effort to answer questions or accommodate us at all. 

I don't know what vegetarians would eat here unless all they like to eat is flavorless zucchini mush.

This is the only Mexican restaurant in the city that thinks vegetarians eat only corn, potato, zucchini and squash.

I asked for black beans but the server refused. After pushing three times he went to ask and said he could only offer "regular beans." I asked what they were and he couldn't tell me. I said 3 times they needed to be vegetarian. They came out in a broth that must have had meat, because I spent the rest of my night sick in my hotel room.

$3.50 for a few spoonfuls of beans in water with no seasoning. Refused to provide black beans even though they are on the menu. I had to badger the server to ask if I could have some beans. No substitutions, just upcharge. 

It took everything I had not to just stand up and walk out. I felt robbed of my time, my money, and the basic dignity one should expect as a paying customer. Restaurants are supposed to be part of the service industry!

I promise you I waited to post this review. I waited to calm down. I waited to "gain perspective." But I'm just as indignant now remembering that experience as I was at the time. So, I feel completely justified and at peace posting this review. I am the opposite of high maintenance as I've spent years as a server and bartender. But there is no excuse for this place. None at all.
author: Zack F.

description:
Sometimes lacking customer. The hostess abviously don't have any idea how to sit people in order.  Be ready to stay there untill you complain to the manager. But she is not much help either. 

Hate the way this place run. Always overbooked for no good reason. Food is just Ok. They have been running the same menu forever. 

Community tables are just beyond ridiculous. One disgusting bathroom is not adequate for the space. 

 A bigger nonsense then NOPA. Would not recommend this place.
author: Xela H.

description: 5 STARZ! I saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. I hope you know what that show is. Anyways...the food is grand and the service is attentive. Their corkage fee is only $10. Go for an ensalada or a signature taco dish!
author: Rashad W.

description:
Tasty tacos, mole, and cocktails. Try the carnitas, mole poblano, and the gordita.
 
A little too popular so put your name in ahead or be prepared for a wait. Window shopping at Falletti the upscale grocery store next door will only kill so much time.....

Outdoor seating score: 3
There's a cute enclosed patio. Outdoor vibes without the chills.
author: E F.

description:
I recommend Nopalito to those who are craving tasty American-Mexican food.

If you're craving a quick Mexican burrito or set of tacos- this is NOT your spot. 
I'll say this...I've been numerous times and I always leave happy and full. 
It's awesome too because the plates I always go with are the small ones (perfect for sharing and have that tapas feel). 

Let's start with drinks:
Margarita: tasty would recommend it
Bloody Maria: a classic spin on the Bloody Mary with quality tequila- would recommend it
Michelada: not your traditional michelada as it has orange in there, but it's still weirdly good. Their michelada is the perfect example of nopalito and how they spin Mexican dishes to elevate them and make them a little more gourmet(and American/white)

Must haves: 

Totopos con chile:
a must to start-off, a big bowl of saucey chips topped with crema and a light & salty cheese. 
*It's really pretty, the cheese and crema are perfect (I just wish there was more) 

Empanada con Deshebrada de Res:
a great beef empanada with a lot of flavors crossing paths harmoniously. get this one regularly

Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón:
Saw this one on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives with Guy Fieri. 
Lots of love goes into this bad boy, and the chicharrones(sp?) adds some depth and a great crunchy texture to this dish 


Nopalito is a clutch non-Mexican Mexican joint that has great service, solid food, and a nice atmosphere.
author: Naveed B.

description: Five stars for Nopolito! Excellent cuisine, everything wonderfully prepared and thoughtfully spiced. Superb presentation. Their cervichie is delicious. I had the fish tacos, they were light and flavorful. Service is fast and the waiter was knowledgeable about the menu. Special orders were no problem. Very highly recommend.
author: Jerry M.

description:
Finally! A place that reminds me of home!

Torta pambazo: a must have!!
The sauce on the bread has just the right taste that is so hard to find!

Enchiladas the mole con pollo:
My friend had them and she really liked them. Ask for a side of cream to make them even tastier. 

Tip: 
Ask for some of their green salsa to put in your pambazo! It's the best!
author: Diana R.

description: Came here with a group of 6 and the service and food were fabulous! I especially loved their margaritas as they weren't too sweet. The place was very busy but that didn't slow the staff down at all. The hostess showed us to a little bar area to have drinks while our table was being prepared, someone quickly came and got our order, and they sat us shortly after we got our drinks. Everything we ordered from apps to entrees were wonderful. Definitely want to come here again and would highly recommend!
author: Siri A.

description: Service was good and the food is pretty awesome.  Smaller portions with good value on price.  The pork belly quesadilla, ceviche and fish tacos were really good.  The ceviche was my favorite.  The hostess and waiters were awesome.  There's a parking lot and parking was easy on Saturday night.  I would definitely come back.
author: Chris L.

description:
Lost 2 stars for the initial stuff.....no bueno when dealing with drinks...Drink menu not very large, we ordered two drinks & both were like straight alcohol & hard to enjoy... & I enjoy my cocktales... My friend sent hers back & it came back just as bad...I decided to just pretend it was NyQuil & sip away, but alas I Left most of the drink at the end of the meal....this has never happened ...the drink was that bad.

The service was odd...they were nice but just odd & it took a million years to bring us soup & a salad...even after we kept staring at the dude & Then I had had him pack stuff up some of our appetizers to see if he would say anything. & he never said oh let me get these out of the way & bring out your other dishes nada....odd......& it would be nice to see at least one Latino staff person on the floor of a Mexican restaurant or does fusion mean they fuse all the Latinos into the back of the restaurant ? 

The food was delicious though (minus the hella hot nuts...give me some chips please) .  The salad was one of the best I have ever had in my life!  We also got the totopos yummie & the flautas with sweet potato? Double yum .  My friend had Pozole and loved it. The deserts were whatever....I personally am over flan & don't really like it....& then they had a bunch of over priced paletas....dude put a cake or chocolate dish or churro on there! 

I would definitely go back cuz the food was great...will drink before I get there & will plan to go somewhere else for desert after.
author: laura D.

description: Great ambience and service, but I'm someone who just wants really good food at a reasonable price. It was pretty pricey for the portions. I'd say the best dish were the fish tacos
author: Ben S.

description:
People have complained about long lines but I have never seen a line here but have always come on a weekday. Food is the best and I love their chip dish: Totopos- the best! Great tequila selection. Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. If you think $10 a plate is pricey then- I'm sorry - you need to stop eating in restaurants, go back to school and get a real job....

 Just wanted to update this and say that I did come here on a Sunday and there was a short line. But I felt it was managed quite well. Came with 3 chefs and former waiter and they all agreed it was some of the best Mexican food they'd ever had in the city. So bring your words with friends app - it's well worth the wait.
author: Jane F.

description:
Love Nopalito for lunch. The food is great and service is usually fantastic. Roy or Ray served us last time and he was wonderful. Also, the blond manager is very sweet. Had one complaint for the hostess. Alissa was incredibly rude and not friendly. Probably the worst hostess I have ever encountered. There was a wait and everyone waiting outside was commenting on her horrible attitude. It was almost comical. A few people left due to her not hospitable attitude. She was hosting the day of Bay to Breakers and I understand that it was a difficult day due to the insane amount of people but still no excuse to treat people so horribly. 

Would definitely come back because everything else was fantastic.
author: Lizaveta S.

description: I normally don't like Mexican food, but this place I liked! They have more authentic Mexican food, not like the typical taqueria. I had the ceviche (delicious fish and tortilla chips), empanada (fried and with beef) and chicken soup. Everything tasted very delicious.
author: Christina J.

description:
Good meat, good flavor, decent prices.  I've never had a bad dish here, and i really like the pozole, carne asada, carnitas, trout, ceviche, mole, totopos (from someone who doesn't like tortilla chips!) and salads.. The tortillas are thick and hearty, which I like.  Not much dessert variety though :/
Also, the service and space is nice, but one of the waitstaff had a bit of an attitude (it happens).
author: Andrew D.

description:
Went with a party of 3, ordered the Carnitas, the Trout, and the Beef.

The trout and beef were phenomenal. Everything is very spicy, and the server didn't mention it, so if you go be prepared for it or ask for yours to be mild.

Had to wait 2 hours, but they let you know that ahead of time, so can't complain about it.

Service was great.
author: B G.

description: Never disappoints! Been going monthly+ for two years and they are consistently FANTASTIC. Fresh veggies. Quality meat. Nearly everything is gluten free because it's just clean and whole and house made not processed. Do not leave without trying the Totopos. And the carnitas. And a pop-cycle! Worth the wait for a table, have a margarita at the bar.
author: Jen W.

description:
Tried this place after hearing some good things.  Food was presented well but mostly bland and nothing too inspiring. 
The thing that bothered me the most was horrible attitudes of the staff that started with the rude hostess.  Our waitress never once asked how we were doing and if we needed anything and almost appeared to go out of her way to avoid looking at us.  We had to finally get up and get extra plates and silverware for ourselves.  This restaurant appears to have the market cornered on hiring rude, snotty, miserable waitstaff.  Bad. Bad. Service. Won't return...
author: Michele S.

description:
Food was so-so. Didn't taste great but it didn't taste bad either... I ordered the fish tacos (2 for $13-15 I believe), ceviche, and some kind of baked spicy chips that they had, and it all was so-so. Don't come here expecting authentic Mexican food: the fish tacos have oranges inside. Yup, *that* kind of Mexican place. 

Our waitress was attentive but didn't really go out of her way to be friendly or approachable. I had to go to the grocery next door to use the restroom as there  was a long line for the only a single unisex bathroom in the whole restaurant, which was a little ridiculous. With mediocre food at these prices and a lackluster experience, and a million other places to try in the city, I probably won't be back.
author: Emily A.

description: Nopalito happened to be close to our Airbnb in SF and boy are we glad! I had the fish tacos and my sister had the pork belly quesadilla. We also ordered the esquite, a roasted corn salad. Service was attentive, and as it was Tuesday night - early since my sister is still on Atlanta time - we didn't have to wait. Nice space, light and clean. Good draft beer selection and drinks.
author: Eileen N.

description: My friend and I decided to check out this place for lunch because of the great reviews and since we were already in the area. I ordered the strawberry horchata and the cucumber and cactus salad. My friend had the nachos and Hibiscus and Valencia orange drink. The food was pretty good definitely a different take on your traditional Mexican food. They weren't very flexible with adding chicken to the dishes and the chicken we got on the side was heavily salted and seemed like it was just boiled, We both loved our drinks, the strawberry horchata was life changing and the hibiscus drink was really refreshing. The service was definitely lacking, the food took quite a while to come out and it took our waitress forever to bring out our check after we had finished our food. Overall a decent experience, would definitely not go out of my way to return.
author: Mitra S.

description: Salad was good but portion was small. Veggie enchiladas that aren't on the menu, but are available and taste great.
author: Chet M.

description: Good job Nopalito. They accommodated for our baby and I didn't expect that from such a semi fancy place. The food was delicious and drinks were great too. We highly recommend it. Didn't get to try the totopos but when we return we will.
author: Cassy A.

description: Meh, Ordered one of their salads through Uber eats and the salad was so small, I had to shake the box to see if anything was inside it. Quality was eh, ok, but the for the money, very bad value.
author: Steven B.

description:
Nopalito is a wonderful brunch spot with PARKING.  In the City.  seriously.

The torta is to die for.  The meat was so flavorful and tasted like heaven.  The ceviche was light and tasty, and the nachos were the BOMB.

We got lucky - we got the Nopalito right when it opened and didn't have to wait long for a seat.  A must try when in the area!
author: Meg T.

description:
If the rates were just for the food I will give Nopalito 6 stars!! But I want to rate my overall experience in the restaurant.
I wanted to visit this restaurant since I saw it on DDD, the quesadilla looked delicious on TV (it was better than I expected)
When I arrive to San Francisco I knew i was going to eat at NOPALITO.
 I was traveling with my mom, my husband and my little dog (9lb maltesse). I know how hard is to hard dog friedly places so we called ahead and they told us they have a patio so we head over and when we got there the hostess told us it was a 40minuts to 1 hour wait, I really wanted to try the food so we stayed and waited.
I dont regret waiting because the food was great, I had the pork quesadilla, my husband got the carnitas and my mom a queso con chorizo...everything was great, the servers very friendly and they didnt mind my dog , that was imperceptible under the table on her blanket.
The food was so good that we decided to come back the next day... We were not dressed fancy , we were in cold weather and we were just coming back from an entire day of sightseeing, so neither to say we didnt looked our best.
We encounter a very judgy hostess that gaves the stinkin eye and again told us to wait 40 minutes to 1 hours, even though there were 2 empty tables, we understood because maybe those reserved , but on the 1 hour we waited, bu the door, nobody was sitted there.
Thats when I started putting attntion  on the hostess behavior, to the white people ( i dont want to sound racist , just stating the facts) dress in fancy clothes , she was treating them so nicely and inviting them to wait in the bar, I understand we needed to wait ouside because of my little dog, but then 2 ladies arrived  one was an african american, the hostess blocked the entrance and told them that they had to wait 45minutes to an hour, she didnt invite them to wait in the bar (they didnt have a dog like us) and she didnt let the african american lady to even open the door! When she tried to!! 5 minute later another couple shows up, white young and well dress and she opens the door for them without asking about reservation or calling ahead... What was that???
The ladies endend leaving , who wants to wait one hour ( only me because, i have to confessed, love the food)
Then she did the same to a hispanic couple ...coincidence? dont think so!
I noticed the trick, she was discouraging the "bad looking people" to enter the restaurant making them wait . Too bad for her I very persistent and  I loved the food so after 1 hour she had no choice but give us a table ( woohooo )
I got the pozole, my mom the sea food soup and my husband the carne asada , and we tried the totopos... Everything delicious just like the night before.
 Related to the waiters and the food ...everything excelent, but that hostess put the bad note and make the restaurant look snobby and judgy.

My tips to visit NOpalito are
 Try whatever on the menu because everything is great
Call ahead or make reservations
Dress in pretty clothes 
Or just order take out.
author: Nancy E.

description:
Okay, the food was worth 5 stars, but the service was less than desirable, so I had to dock a couple stars. 

There were 6 of us grabbing an early dinner. We didn't have to wait long for a table. Split a bottle of sangria which was standard. Probably better split amongst a party of 4. The table split an order of the queso which was legitimate melted cheese (not the plasticy sauce you get on your nachos at Taco Bell). It's rather embarrassing to admit, but I think I actually prefer the chemical-y queso. 

I ordered the fish tacos, what was basically a chicken tostada but had a fancier name, and a side of rice. I usually like my fish tacos fried, but these were grilled and still very flavorful. The chicken tostada was super well seasoned. And I'm incredibly picky about my Mexican rice, and I had zero complaints about Nopalito's. So good. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. 

As for the servers, some were fine, but others seemed to have a negative attitude I didn't really appreciate. When we asked for something, we were met with a look of irritation. The service itself was spotty. They always dropped by the table when we didn't need them, and then never seemed to be around when we were looking for them. The thing that irritated me most was we were getting ready to leave, and the hostess rather rudely came over and asked us to move to the bar. Our dinner was rather extended by the 10 minutes it took for someone to come back for our bill (we eventually had to flag someone down). There were not masses of people waiting for a table outside the restaurant. And we were clearly preparing to leave. The encounter seemed unnecessary and rubbed me the wrong way. 

The food is excellent though, and for that I'll be back. But maybe I'll try their other location.
author: Jon S.

description:
Overall, if you come in with the right mind set (that this place isn't cheap), then you will be able to enjoy the food more : ).

One dish I would definitely recommend is the 
Machaca de Camaron con Huevo y Salsa (4/5) - the shrimp + egg in a tomato salsa sauce surprisingly worked. I love the consistency of the eggs - reminds me of the eggs that I make when I eat packaged ramen - soft scrambled from the heat of the broth.

I also liked the Carnitas (4/5) - visiting from Texas, I am impressed by the authenticity. (As authentic as bougie mexican food can be).

Totopos con Chile (3/5) - nice kick. They were soggy. Shame on me for ordering chips to go or shame on Nopalito for preparing this dish first and letting it sit covered for 20 minutes instead of last.
author: Leslie K.

description:
I've heard good things about nopalio, but hmm...high end mexican food?  I'm not sure how I feel about that.  However everything on the menu sounded amazing, so once again we went overboard and ordered enough food for 5 people when there were only two of us.  I guess once sign was when the waiter was like, are you sure you want to order off of this?

Ordered the totopos con chile, a quesadilla, ceviche, mole, carnitas, and drinks.  My favorite out of all of them was the carnitas. Also a fan of the quesadilla...though I'm sure that went straight to the love handles.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Great lunch spot. Nice decor, with great and fast service. 
I got their beet salad, which had pomogranate...so amazing!
Their Pescado Asado, which is a seared trout was cooked perfectly. It had a nice and crispy sear on the outside, but still juicy inside. 
Would def. come back!
author: Nancy Z.

description:
Overrated. 2 stars for effort. This place has good intentions, but I felt like the food was lacking. 
First off, this place is always packed! This was my second attempt at eating here and the only reason why we ended up getting a table was because we called ahead. Because of the demand to eat here I believe our waitress got a little annoyed with us. We came in between lunch and dinner and the person who sat us gave us both menus. Naturally, we had to look over both menus (they gave a party of 4, 2 lunch and 2 dinner menus) and couldn't decide what we wanted. She came to the table 3 times and, we believe, since we still hadn't decided her attitude changed with us. I knew it wasn't just me that felt this change since someone in my party mentioned it just as I was thinking it. In addition, this place is soo small, you're constantly seeing the greeter walk up and down the aisle to see who is getting their check(s) so they can tell people in line how much longer of a wait. It makes you feel like you're not welcome because in you're head you know they want you to leave so they can seat someone else.  
  
Now to the food. 3 different dishes; fish tacos, carne asada, & huarache w/chorizo all tasted like Al Pastor when the only one that should have were the tacos. The ceviche was lacking flavor and a bit on the fishy side. We tried 3 different alcoholic drinks and they were not good, the flavors didn't mix well and my Bloody Maria tasted like liquid smoke. My favorite dishes were the Topos, (crispy tortillas in a spicy sauce with fresh grated cheese and sour cream for dip) and the hurache (the tortilla was filled with beans) the chorizo and beef went really well together. The flan was authentic and good as well. 

Now I don't think it's always like this but worth mentioning, the plates ordered that were more 'dinner plates', not sharing plates, took about an hour to come out. We had to ask our waitress what the hold up was to which the answer was that the take out window was slammed. She made up for it by giving us complimentary flan which was appreciated, but a simple update would have been cool.
author: Selina K.

description: Nopalito was great! The server and staff were attentive and quick. The food was delicious.The environment was really warm and welcoming. The parking is great for the area, they have a garage that is free. I would highly suggest this place for a date night.
author: Bernard E.

description:
Nopalito serves the white hipster man's version of Mexican food and it's still unexciting if you accept it for what it is. The restaurant itself is cute but, then again, it looks like you're dining in at a Whole Foods. They don't take reservations, but you can call ahead two hours in advance to put your name on the waiting list. Still, I'm not sure this actually does you any good. We called ahead and still had to wait for roughly thirty minutes once we arrived for a table, which would have been fine if there was anywhere suitable to wait. We basically shuffled around the bar area for thirty minutes trying to get out of the way of the wait staff while inadvertently getting in the way of other members of the wait staff. It was the least fun game of Frogger I've ever played.

The food was fine, but I can't envision myself ever getting a random hankering for the grub at Nopalito. I got the Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón. It was interesting. I liked that the tortilla was crispy. The "crispy pork belly" inside the quesadilla is just their way of describing what are effectively pork rinds, which were a little bit too hard for me; there were a few moments when I thought I had bitten down onto bones. No bueno for Estephania. For drinks, I ordered a Margarita and a Killer Bee. The Margarita was just your standard margarita; nothing special to report. The Killer Bee tasted like gasoline. BUT, two of my friends also ordered the Killer Bee and seemed to enjoy it, so perhaps I am the anomaly here. Yet they both chose a different beverage for their second drink, so I'm inclined to believe that they were too shy to admit that it just was not very tasty.

Our server was nice, but I'm pretty sure he was as high as you can rightfully expect a San Franciscan to be. He fudged our bill a tad, but he was quick to right his wrong, so no complaints about that tiny snafu.

Overall, Nopalito wasn't special. I can't imagine that I will ever recommend it to others but I also wouldn't say no if I was with people who wanted to try it out.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
One of my local friends was taking me around a few spots around the city, and we stopped in here for a quick bite.  

The carnitas are awesome.  It's full of flavor and saltiness, and dressed up nicely with a spicy green chile lime sauce on the side, without all the grease and fat of some of the dives that I enjoy and frequent.  

This place has a great selection of mezcal and tequila.  I will need to come back to try a flight or 10.
author: Alex K.

description: Good service and great food. I like how they have actual Mexican dishes and how their food is organic. Not much places like this one!
author: Douglas R.

description:
I never knew where Nopalito was until we actually ate here and realized that we've driven past it hundreds of times.  I'm not a fan of places that don't take reservations but if you come for an early dinner you should be able to get in no problem.  

I started off with a margarita (how could you not) and it was really tasty.  We shared the ceviche to start and I'm a big ceviche fan and this was excellent.  The chips were awesome too but we did need to ask for more so we could finish all of the ceviche.  For the main meal I got the carnitas.  I usually get heartburn from carnitas but I love the flavor so I always get it and I didn't this time which probably spoke to how good this was.  Plus there was so much carnitas that I had to take half of it home.  It was delicious though.

A little pricey but a good spot for solid food especially the ceviche and carnitas.
author: Blake B.

description:
I tried their pulled pork torta for my first visit there a while back only because I was in a hurry and had just gotten out of the DMV. I must say, their ingredients are excellent, but this torta is not. It's a weird combo of an american sweet bbq pulled pork sandwich mixed with a mexican torta. Eh. Spice it up at least I say. It's like having a taco with bbq sauce or ketchup. smh... I will be back again, the place smells great and they actually have things on the menu that are not available at every other Mexican joint. Have you every heard of a huarache? Yeeaaahhh, eat that! 

Staff was excellent.

5 stars TBD
author: Fredo L.

description:
I heard that this place had the best horchata in the city so I made my friend go with me to get dinner there hah.

When we got there, it was pretty late in the evening. There was a long wait so we walked around a bit (maybe 30 mins). The staff was quite friendly though and very attentive when we were finally seated.

The atmosphere is very cozy and intimate although it's really crowded and easy to get overwhelmed by the people around you. It's really not that bad though.

We ordered horchatas (of course), Empanada con Deshebrada de Res, Totopos con Chile, and Tamal Oaxaqueño de pollo. My favorite was the totopos con chile which is basically chips doused with a mildly spicy salsa de arbol and other stuff. It got pretty soggy pretty quickly though. My least favorite was the tamal which was disappointing. It had chocolate in it which sounds strange, but sounded interesting at the same time. I made my friend eat it after I took a few bites. Oh and the horchata was not the best in the world. I make better horchata at home.

Overall, I'm probably not going to go to this place again but I'd go if friends asked to go there.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Went there recently on a Friday night with some girlfriends for a much needed girlfriend night. I love the call-in ahead to add name to waitlist. Great idea, guys!

Food - very good, fresh, healthy. 2 of us ordered the brussel sprout burrito and the other 2 ordered fish tacos. The chips n salsa/guac was *really* good! Hibiscus drink was fun, too.

Ambiance - it was a little tight and dark and the menus were very hard to read because of that (and probably due to small font). Was very loud too, but we contributed to that :)

Staff - decent. It was very crowded and our waitress was good - very good service to me means staff is smiling, happy to be there, personable and attentive but not overly catering.

I recommend this spot if you have a small group, need something fresh, healthy, tasty and in transit. I don't think this highlights the best of SF but I think it's very good and good for locals.

Cheers!
author: Karen M.

description:
Now officially my favorite restaurant. The menu options are just so different-things you  don't find very often.  Portions are well sized and the atmosphere is great at both locations. My 18 year old daughter requests to go there whenever we are in the area. 

Service was a little too slow for my preference, during our last visit, but defiantly will not deter my return.
author: Lesa L.

description: Great spot that is guaranteed to be jam packed on a Friday or Saturday night. You can't make reservations but you can call ahead up to 2 hours before, which I recommend doing on a busy night. Try the Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón, es muy deliciosa! Don't feel pressured to get the most expensive thing on the menu, most things are quite good.
author: Alex C.

description:
Came here on a busy Saturday night. We didn't have reservations, but we were able to grab a spot at the standing bar while we waited for our table.

We enjoyed sangria and totopos con chile while we observed the busy restaurant. The sangria was light and refreshing, and the appetizer was full of flavor and crunch (and unfortunately quite filling).

When we got our table about an hour later, I was stuffed, but I could not bear to order just a salad. Instead, I ordered the panucho de pollo al pibil- DELICIOUS!! The chicken had amazing flavor and paired with the crispy, corn tortilla, it was the perfect choice for my stuffed belly.

I hope to return soon and try some other dishes.
author: Roma R.

description:
I'm from Texas, and I know my Mexican food. This wasn't Tex-Mex. This wasn't your typical Mexican food. This is Mexican food straight from the interior of Mexico, with a bit of a creative spin on it. They have these nachos that are covered in a two chili sauce, covered with white cheese, served with a side of crema that was absolutely incredible. You get a small dish of roasted beans that are like peanuts, with a hint of spiciness. 
I got the pulled pork torta, a Mexican sandwich served on a french loaf. It was spicy, but was countered with cole slaw, which was beyond amazing. I scarfed it down. 
Our server was from Texas, and was quite nice, helpful and friendly. She made recommendations that everyone loved. My dining companions both opted for the ceviche, which looked simply amazing. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't serve the ceviche in the tall glass like I'm used to. They serve it in a bowl, which is not very traditional. 
Apparently, this place was featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. It wasn't any of those places. I wouldn't call it a dive or a diner. It was a really nice restaurant. 
They serve up palettas, the Mexican version of a popsicle. I had the Mexican chocolate one, that took me back to my time Oaxaca. Amazing. 
The restaurant had a cool vibe, was very well lit, plenty of seating, and quite clean. I was a bit disappointed in the restroom situation. You have to leave the building walk all the way around it to get to the restroom.
author: Curt C.

description:
Seen'm in 7x7 magazine and been wantinta try the food. 

Friendly folks here. Thank y'all Heather, Twee, and Edgar for bein so awesome!

Delicious grubalicious carnitas w handmade tortillas and totopos con chile!  

Michelada was refreshing and Mezcals are served w palate cleansers so ya can enjoy the next on the list. 

And gotta have their Blue Bottle cafe con leche paleta dipped in a lil coffee grounds. It's decaf so it's kid friendly.  

Easy parking across the street at the DMV for 5$/hr. 
 
We chopped't up w a family sittin next to us whom, like us, made the commute to be there so that says a lot. 

Heaters'll keepya warm whileya munch. 

And ifya don't have time ta sit there's a take out window. 

A must!!!
author: Aureliano C.

description: Great service and amazing food, what more do you need? Highly recommend for date night or a fun group dinner. The servings aren't too big, but it's probably better this way... I've been a few times and have loved everything that I tried. I recommend getting a few dishes and sharing so you get a taste of everything. I don't think they take reservations, but you can call ahead and put your name on their wait list so you can *hopefully* be seated as soon as you arrive. Enjoy!
author: Helen Z.

description:
We have been to the one on 9th but tried the one on Broderick recently. The menu was different from the other one but equally delicious!!  We had the Taco with pok, the carnitas taco, the fish taco and the chicken mole. We also tried the empanadas and chicken enchiladas.

We will definitely be back!
author: P M.

description:
Came here craving mole and got exactly that: a good mole dish.  Solid place if you don't want any surprises.  The tortillas were amazing, the service was good, and the cocktail menu is expansive.  

Why only three stars?  Because it was pricey and when it comes to Mexican, I generally prefer hole in the wall places where you need to speak Spanish and the kitchen looks like it wouldn't pass a health dept inspection.
author: Natalie V.

description: Really nice, out of the box Mexican restaurant with interesting and vibrant variations that do work most of the time. Portions a bit small, but still decent. Great drink selection, and clean neat place. I'm actually due for a visit, so off I go.
author: Daniel A.

description: A dinner menu that takes risks. A tequila menu that flies. Missing mouth watering savory flavor.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Great food... I really liked the torta... not the best but most certainly very different... 

I do have to say though guy from triple d kinda puts anyone on that show now....
author: Jason T.

description: Excellent food. We attended on a fairly nice evening so we were comfortable.  I suspect on cold or less than ideal conditions you may not be so lucky.  Only small amount of seating is actually inside. You half to go out and around and back in to the bathroom. But don't let this deter you. Food alone is 5 stars.
author: Jim E.

description: If you like to eat lots of chips with every meal you get it's a place for you. The fish taco was good but dry. Overall the food is expensive and full of dry ingredients. 2 stars for the stuff.
author: emukka y.

description: I said I wouldn't come back but I did and to this other location. Like other place very tasteful. I noticed the menu was different I guess they change it often. Brought 2 other friends they liked the food as well. Very unique place different from other restaurants. One of my friends was disappointed that they didn't offer soda. Oh well he got an almond orchata. I didnt tell him it was almond or he wouldn't of drank it lol. The flan was amazing!
author: Ivette A.

description: I was in San Francisco over the weekend and my best friend and I were looking for GF restaurants near Dolores Park. When I read off Nopalito to my friend, he said we are going there, so we did. It's a very intimate restaurant. Our waitress was very helpful with the menu. Everything we ordered was superb. I had the huarache con suadero y chorizo and my friend had the chilaquiles and a carnitas taco a la carte. The huarache was perfectly seasoned and a good portion size. The chips in the chilaquiles were still crispy and had great flavor. I especially loved their house margarita. It was not overly sweet and you could taste and appreciate the tequila. If you are going to have a margarita, I suggest ordering a pitcher. It's a better deal for two people who would like two drinks each. The restaurant is also kid friendly. The only down side is the restroom location. To get there you have to leave the main restaurant and go to where their to-go ordering area is. Other than that, I highly suggest this restaurant.
author: Suzanne T.

description:
Nice food presentation, no taste.

Very long wait to get a table, definitely not worth it. Our goal was to try the birria but it is only served for dinner. Of everything that we tried the carnitas were the best, just needed a little salt on the meat and the salsa.

I prefer so much more the seasoning at tacolicious. 

Parking was not difficult, there is a small shopping center next door. 

Not coming back.
author: AF G.

description: I like Nopalito. It's definitely on the "upscale" side for Mexican food and it's a little pricey. Meals are in the $15-20 range per plate and cocktails are $11. I recommend the quesadilla roja.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
Bf and I came here for a super early dinner so there was no wait.  We sat on the heated patio - it was such a cute place!

We were given complimentary fried garbanzo beans (yum!) and I ordered the strawberry ginger drink while the bf and I shared the ceviche and carnitas.

The four stars is for the carnitas.  Carnitas is on the 7x7 at least twice, I believe, and the carnitas at Nopalito is nothing like any carnitas taco I've ever had.  There was no description on the menu so I actually expected a $15 taco.  The plate actually comes with a cut of fatty pork about 9 square inches big, pickled veggies, five soft tortillas, and salsa verde.  The meat was SO tender and juicy and fell apart extremely easily.  I really wanted to eat it by itself.

The ceviche was OK.  Marinated rock cod and squid sat in what seemed like the same salsa verde that came with the carnitas.  Half of an avocado sat on top.  I love squid, but the slimy legs eventually got to me and I had to make the BF eat all the legs.

I tried their white peach/blueberry organic and house made popsicle.  It was mostly blueberry and very tasty.  We were given complimentary almond cookies that fell apart like a ball of powder in our mouth.  Mmm.

I would definitely come back for the carnitas.. it was amazing.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Driving down Divisadero on my way to a 2pm hair appointment at Madu Salon looking for something quick, delicious and maybe a little bit nutritious to eat. With only 15 minutes to spare before my hair appointment, I refused to subject myself to some fast food concoction and decided to try my luck at Fallettis. After waisting 5 minutes of precious time forging for food, I decided to check out Nopalito. 

I ordered the gordita campechana. I have two words to describe my meal--hella good! The meat was tender and well seasoned. Chorizo and beef  stuffed in a rustic style corn tortilla, what a treat. My only suggestion to make it a 5 star meal would be to add some salt to the tortilla shell when it comes out the fryer. 

I will definitely be back.
author: Aja B.

description:
Disappointed!!!! It was only ok .... But I tried it and can cross it off the list....
The joke of the night was No Nopolitios .... It was not very good service and all three of us was StArving .... All three of us where disappointed and felt the food was bland and tiny portions ....
author: Misty R.

description:
We came here on MLK day for a late lunch.  There was a bit of a wait, so we walked to Haight-Ashbury then came back.  We ordered: 
a pitcher of Margarita- exactly to my liking, citrusy, tart, homemade, not too sweet and just enough booze.  
Ceviche- all very fresh, nothing was chewy and had just enough jalapeño, but not so much as too overpower the seafood.
Tamale- I got this as my main.  Was SO good, not too heavy, but also not that big.  Normally I would say this was better as an app.
Carnitas- lots of tender pork, fresh tortillas, cooked cabbage, carrots and jalapeños with a green salsa.  
All in all, the perfect amount of food for two reasonably hungry people.  Fresh, bright flavors.
author: Vanessa N.

description: How this place can have 5 stars is beyond me. Waited 2 hours on Saturday for a table for two...so I expected the food & drinks to be beyond amazing. Oh how mistaken I was. Got the Carne asda let me do you a favor, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. No flavor, 4 pieces of meat and three dry tortillas. This was a birthday dinner for me that I will never forget. O might I add got some drink called el Diablo that tasted like juice. Save your money and go to the mission for some real Mexican food with some money left in your wallet. I hope this place does not last and waste SF time.
author: Max C.

description: Been here at least 8x! If you haven't been here stop reading this and try your best to get a table today! Their food is the best Mexican food in the city and by best I mean best in taste, quality and authenticity. Everything is made with the highest quality ingredients including grass fed beef, can't get better than that! Some of their best options are the empanada de res, quesadilla de chicharron, birria, carnitas and their totopos appetizer is a must! Save one bite of room after your meal for the traditional Mexican wedding cookies, free at the end of your meal! If you have extra room try the coffee paleta (ice cream) they are delicioso. If you're really awesome go for the flan it's fantastic!
author: Cindy G.

description:
So, honestly, it wasn't good. Wouldn't go back and can't really understand all the positive reviews, nor could I recommend it.

The first thing is that the menu specifically says 'traditional' mexican cuisine. It was definitely NOT traditional. Maybe fusion, or modern, but there was nothing traditional about it. So much false advertising. 

Honestly though, the biggest issue i had was that it just wasn't good food.

First of all we got Micheladas, which I love and could drink daily, and Nopalito managed to serve me a michelada that was nearly undrinkable. When we ordered it we were told/warned by the waitress that they make it 'hot and smoky', and when I tried to order my beer to go with the michelada I was told that it is 'specially formulated for Tecate'. Hmm. I feel like at that point we should have just left and gone to look for food elsewhere... Anyway, back to the Michelada. 1. A michelada is a mixture that you add beer to, I have NEVER seen it anywhere with a prescribed beer, and 2. Tecate?? That's a bit like saying 'we've specially formulated this drink for PBR.' It's something so pretentiously hipsterish that I was a bit dumbfounded.

The drinks came and they were clear, orange colored cocktails-like drinks. I kid you not. I wish I had taken photos. Basically it was watered beer with smoked-peanut flavor. No hint of lime, no hint of salt or pepper, no hint of spice or tabasco, of clamato, tamarind - anything. Just bitter smoke flavour. I then asked for some more tomato juice, hoping to 'michelada-up' my drink a bit. The server said she 'didn't know if they had any' - which made me feel like a 'gotcha moment; it must in fact be a pre-made mixture if they don't even have the tomato juice... I was actually pretty embarrased to have a friend there who hadn't had a michelada before and tried it on our recommendation - I kept wanting to insist that 'that's not what it's supposed to taste like!!!'

Anyway, off on such a great start and sadly that's the level it stayed at. We had the ceviche,nthe panucho de pollo, and the enchiladas de mole con pollo. The ceviche was ok but somehow lacked all acidity (I have no idea how ceviche could be bland, but they sure managed!). The panucho was the best of the lot, with nicely crunchy slaw and onions. The mole, again, was really not great. It was kind of bland/bitter at the same time, like it lacked salt and then something else, and had the same peanut-smoky flavour as the micheladas. 

This restaurant came so highly recommended that i'm really surprised, both by the yelp reviews as well as by the bride of the wedding we were attending. I was having a 'maybe I don't get it moment' but then I remembered the micheladas and yeah, I get it, and no, it wasn't good.

Oh - and I nearly managed to forget - the bathroom situation. I just wanted to write the words 'to add insult to injury' about this but then I remembered - in my case, since I'm on crutches and have trouble walking, that's EXACTLY what it was. They have one (1!!) bathroom for the whole restaurant and takeout customers, that you actually have to go outside the restaurant and walk all around on the sidewalk and then in another door to the take-out foyer to go. I also had to wait on the sidewalk, so awkward.
author: Marie Q.

description: The man who served me (damn, I wish I got his name), was the bomb.  The carnitas is so good, I can't stop.  Thank you nopalito for serving up such deliciousness even though I wrote a kind of bratty review before.  Your food is truly spectacular.
author: Rebecca J.

description: I just want to say , this place is Authentic Mexican food! Yummylicious! Everything was so good!
author: Bianca G.

description: Pretty disappointed in our experience at this much hyped restaurant.  The well reviewed totopos con Chile  were a big let down, unless you want to stuff yourself with stale bland chips.  Overall this is one of those overrated San Francisco spots where people wait for an hour and a half without exactly knowing why.  They must be making a killing though given that most of their menu has tortillas or fried tortilla chips as a foundation of their dishes.  Someone interesting but definitely not worth the wait or the hype.  And by the way there are no Mexican wedding cookies as a complimentary dessert as mentioned in some reviews.
author: Mana B.

description:
Decided to have a lovely Friday night with some of my girlfriends. One of them suggested coming here and I'm usually not a huge fan of Mexican food, however this place totally changed my mind! I left the ordering to her since she knew what to order and I was totally going to butcher all the names of every single item on the menu. She ordered 4 items, but out of the 4, I really enjoyed the Totopos con chile and the Carnitas (pork belly).

The totopos con chile - So simple, yet so addicting. Just go ahead and take a chip flavored in a delicious tomato sauce (I could be wrong but that was what my tastebuds were telling me) and dip it into the sour cream! Phenomenal! I could eat it for days.

Carnitas - THAT DELICIOUS, SOFT, FATTY PORK BELLY was soooooo good. The pork belly was moist and tender and it went great with my White Sangria. Definitely could've just had this all night with the tortillas.

What a great place to enjoy gluten-free (HOW MANY AFFORDABLE RESTAURANTS HAVE GLUTEN-FREE FOODS?!) "authentic" mexican food. Just wish the server would at least smile when she talks to us. It sounds like she hates her life...
author: Betty P.

description:
FANTASTIC. Saw the restaurant on diners, drive ins, and dives, we were in the area so I wanted to check it out. Completely lived up to expectations. Even though the place was packed on a Saturday, holiday weekend, we walked right in and were seated right away. 

They had delicious spiced chick peas or something on the table that were great. We ordered the torta and the quesadilla with the chicharrones in it, it was amazing!! Very accommodating for food allergies too, they had a lot of gluten free items to pick from.

I could seriously curl up and die in that quesadilla...I never want to be without it. Love love love Mexican food and this place just had it going on. The menu was original and delicious, I don't agree with the other comments about price I thought it was totally reasonable for a meal out, especially in one of the most expensive cities in America, of course it's not Taco Bell!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Great place for lunch, never lets your down. I ended up here again recently when I found that Nopa was closed for lunch that day, but this is by no means a letdown. It's upscale Mexican cuisine at reasonable prices, with great service too, and often no wait because of its random location.

First suggestion - get some Sangria to enjoy, it's rather good. 
2 - Always get the Totopos con Chile to share.
3 - I always enjoy the Carnitas, the pork is cooked wonderfully and it's filling. 

There really isn't anything bad on the menu, so go ahead and explore.
author: Chris T.

description:
I am picky with Mexican food being that I grew up with a great cook at home (my Mexican Mother)...BUT this place is truly authentic and delicious. I fell in love with the environment, authentic, service and of course the food. 

I ordered the Persimmon Horchata and the quesadilla roja con chicharon. Both great choices and I highly recommend them. Also their tortillas are hand made! 

Can't go wrong with Nopalitio!
author: Melly R.

description: Delicious food!!! We got the carne asada plate which we devoured in about 5 minutes. Also, totopos con chile were amazing- perfect blend of spicy and cooled down with the cheese on top. Perfect ambiance, great service.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I don't think I've ever given 5 stars to a restaurant before this one. Great food, excellent service, and inexpensive!
I've never had a bad meal and they're micheladas are awesome too.
author: Erin L.

description:
In a word: overrated.  

I came to Nopalito with high expectations based on positive reviews, my love of Mexican food, and the usual 1-2 hour wait list they put you on, but left quite disappointed.

To start, the drinks were super underwhelming.  I ordered two different tequila drinks (El Diablo and Blanco Rojo) and both could have passed for alcoholic pink lemonade.  

The appetizer (Black bean stuffed tortilla, citrus-achiote chicken, cabbage, 
pickled red onion and salsa habanera) was pretty meh as the chicken was dry and lacked any real flavor.  My girlfriend actually questioned if they used any salt in preparing it.

For the entrees, mine came out first and it took another 25 minutes for my girlfriend's to arrive - not exaggerating.  They assumed we were sharing because I had ordered them both for us, but I did not specify that.  Even if I did, no excuse for the second dish to come out a day later.  When her Carne Asada finally arrived, half of it was cold. 

I'm not a hard guy to please when it comes to food, especially Mexican, but this place is simply not worth the long wait.  You're better off trying Padrecito in Cole Valley for much better drinks, food, service, and atmosphere.
author: Matthew R.

description: I've always avoided this place because I'm a vegetarian AND I can't handle a lot of piquancy. I was embarrassed while placing my wussy order, but our waiter was cool and even encouraging. We got in within 20 mins at brunch on a weekend, so that wasn't too bad. The place was packed, but we were able to talk at a reasonable volume. I wish there were more options for people like me, but at the same time, that's not their deal and I can respect that. I would definitely recommend it, but I'm going to stick to Nopa yummmmm
author: Ljótur H.

description:
Empanada: 3.5
Pastry was delicious filling was good and it was a decent size. All around pretty good but nothing about it was special. 

Ceviche: 3.0
Good flavor, decent amount of seafood, again all around a good dish but nothing I could not have gotten anywhere else. 

Fish: 1.5
Rice was good, fish was average the salsa was terrible. The salsa tasted like it was out of a Pace jar which is fine if I am throwing a huge party and I bought salsa to feed a few dozen people but not when I am at a so called authentic Mexican restaurant.  This "salsa" filled the bottom of the dish and permeated through everything and effectively ruined the dish. 

Carnitas: 2.5
Was it good? Yes, was it anything special? No.  Carnitas is very hard to mess up and they managed not to ruin it but I have had better carnitas all around the Bay area. 

All around this place serves decent Mexican food, which is very disappointing as I have heard rave reviews. You can get more authentic Mexican food for 1/4 the price pretty much anywhere on Mission.  I would not go here again because the food is simply not worth it.
author: Charles W.

description: Food was tasty, hot, and came out quickly. We liked everything we ordered. Server was efficient and knowledgeable. Place is loud and lively and trendy. Call ahead to get on the waitlist before you go!
author: Namita D.

description:
Met up a few friends here for dinner on a Sunday evening around 7 and it was about a 30 minute wait.  So this place definitely gets pretty packed.

The dishes are actually a decent size, I thought they were going to be tiny since thats how tapas usually are.  We got 4 dishes between the 3 of us, i think about 4-5 for 3 people is a good number.
We ordered:
1. Quesadilla Roja Con Chicharron- It was good from what I remember probably a 3/5.
2. Ceviche Verde De Pescado- i love ceviche in genral and this one was really delicious tasting and fresh.  5/5!
3. Carne Asada Con chorizo y papas- I liked this dish as well, its kinda plated like fajitas and they give you 2 tortilllas, but our waiter told us we coudl get more and we did get an extra 2 to finish off the place.  I like this one a lot too 4/5.

Service was really nice and the atmosphere is kinda a darkly dim lit place, we were seated in the covered outdoor space I guess you could call it that is heated by space heaters.  can kinda get hot if you are sitting too close.

A great place to eat for some fancy upscale mexican.  I'd definitely come again!
author: Alan W.

description:
DO order their drinks (either alcoholic or not). The Meyer Lemonade must have club soda mixed in that made it taste like a sparkling lemonade drink! It was sweet and helped balance the saltiness of the dishes. The Chile Chocolate Milk is very thick and very chocolately. It's almost a bit grainy. It gets better with every sip though!

Ceviche Verde de Pescado y Calamari 10.00
-Squid and rock cod marinated in lime and so good on their crunchy homemade tortilla chips with a bit of avocado on top!

Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón 9.00
"Chile ancho corn tortilla, crispy pork belly, salsa guajillo, jack cheese, onions and cilantro." From first glance, the portion LOOKS small, especially for guys! But the pork belly and all the cheese in the quesadilla will fill anyone up. A good dish as well.

Carnitas 15.00
It's a good portion of carnitas! Delicious when wrapped in their hot corn tortillas. It came with a side of cabbage, carrots, pickled jalapeños and salsa de tomatillo. I believe it's a very popular dish at Nopalito.

Pescado a la Talla 15.00
I didn't get the chance to try the lingcod but it was eaten all up so I can only assume it was an enjoyable dish.

They don't take reservations. Just first come, first serve. They do, however, let you know the wait time if you call in!
author: Samantha L.

description:
WOW! This place definitely did not disappoint. I knew it was going to be exceptional but it exceeded all expectations. We definitely over ordered on food for two people, and I have to embarrassingly admit that we killed every. single. bite. (definitely headed to the gym in a bit)

***Appetizers: 

Quesadilla con Flor de Calabaza: This is a pretty dense quesadilla. However, it is amazing!! Ask for their homemade hot sauce to dip it in!

Panucho de Pollo al Pibil: Crunchy, tasty, and just the right mix of spicy!.

Oh, we also ordered 2 Sangrias. This isn't your typical Sangria. It tastes like they put a bit of tequila in our drinks? Anyway, it was YUM! 

***Entrees: 

Carne Asada con Ejotes Tiernos: YUM!!! The beef is cooked perfectly. They give you a side of 2 tortillas to place the meat into and eat. It also comes with a side of beans as well. There is a LOT of meat on this plate. 

Enchiladas Mineras: This dish was fantastic. I almost wish I got this instead of mine..but then I took another bite of my carne asada and was conflicted. The enchilada sauce is FANTASTIC. The interesting thing about this dish is that the chicken is on the side. It's not mixed in with the enchiladas. Interesting presentation, eh? 

***Dessert

Sadly, they don't have a variety of desserts here. They actually only offer popsicles! We opted for the Chocolate/Cinnamon popsicle as it sounded the most appealing. It's literally a popsicle shoved into a plastic casing. It looks like something you could buy at the grocery store. The first bite of this was interesting. It doesn't taste like any ordinary chocolate flavored popsicle i've had before. After a few more bites, I was hooked and then proceeded to devour the entire thing. 


Damn, that was a good meal. I'll be back Nopalito!
author: Tina J.

description: Was excited to take my friends here to celebrate a birthday... There were four of us, and we called ahead to be on the list. When we got there around 6 on a Monday, it wasn't super busy-- no line, no wait. Yet they put us at the weirdest seating despite better tables being available. They sat us right next to the kitchen, and if two of us had sat straight across from the other two, we would be blocking the walkway, so we had to do awkward seating where we basically sat in a line of four-- this made it very hard to have conversation with anyone but the person sitting right next to us... Just didn't understand the logic there. Other than that, the food was *good* and the service was fine. Nothing remarkable, but I'm glad I tried it.
author: Jen W.

description: Place is small and was packed late on a Monday night.  They took our cell number and would be texting us when a table was available (estimated 1 hour wait.)  Everything was good to great...the guacamole and chips was good, the nachos (I forgot the name) were really, really good (spicy!), the carnitas were good, the fish tacos were great, and the quesadilla with the chicharones was awesome.  Also, the flan was awesome.  Probably would have given them a 5 if they hadn't messed up the texting me when a table was available (never ever got a text though they said they texted me 2-3 times) and service had been a little more responsive (they were friendly and helpful but, probably based on the crazy crowd, there were some slips with the service).  Anyway, great place and I would recommend Nopalito to everyone and I can't wait to go back.
author: Chuy G.

description:
Nopalito has a ridiculous amount of cache amongst people who don't like Mexican food.

I'm sure some of their guests have had great Mexican food, but there's too many excellent taquerias in this town, to spend time at Nopalito, where the portions are twice as small and twice as expensive, unless you're taking people out who don't really like Mexican food. Your parents will love it.

First off, in fairness, they were very pleasant and the service was quite friendly, and their drink options were creative. I had never had hibiscus juice with my tacos and it did pair quite well. Point for Nopalito. Though the food was trying too hard to be creative and not hard enough to be tasty. 

For $20/person, I expect more than two small fish tacos and a cup of juice. If you want that 'we've outgrown Tacolicious' ambiance, and the food isn't all that important, Nopalito is fine. If you love your tacos like I love my tacos (and you're on Yelp, so you do), you won't have to look far to find better.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Been here many times and it's reliably good.

My favorites: beef empanada, pork quesadilla, ginger limeaid and persimmon horchata. 

You can call in an hour early to put in your name, which is a plus in this crazy town.
author: Jeff M.

description: Not sure when they raised prices recently, the Taco Arabe estilo Pueble used to be $11 and is now $12.  The quality has definitely gone downhill since the raise. A cheap cut of pork used and the Arabe was so grisly that I just gagged on the pork. Never used to be that way. The pork is so tough, that they did not slice up in the fine little pieces like they normally do. Huge thick pieces now.  Yuk
author: Teal M.

description:
God the almond horchata.
Nachos? Yeah theyre coated in some type of spicy tomato-y sauce. Dip into that delectable sour cream.
Alaskan cod tacos. Fresh. Light. Flavorful.
Toasted little chickpeas as finger food - how cute & tasty!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Not good at all!!! They try waaaaay too hard to be "cool" and fancy? It's just Mexican food people! Calm down! 
Was in San Fran visiting from Los Angeles and was super excited to go (after seeing it in the food network ch) I dragged my whole family there and boy was it a big let down! Wamp wamp wamp! Everything so damn expensive. I got the mole chicken served with rice and let me tell you NOT good at all! Didn't taste Mexican at all! Worst mole I've even had! And what kind of "Mexican" place doesn't serve soda! Come on! Not to mention the menu doesn't have a big selection of meals. 
They changed their menu since being on the food network channel! BIG MISTAKE! 
Will never be returning!
author: Lorena S.

description: The quesadilla is much like a hard shell taco and it is delicious and unique - get some.
author: Nathan M.

description:
This is our go-to restaurant in the city whenever we have guests from out of town...or want to go on a date night...or want amazing, authentic Mexican food...or want to get drunk off the best margaritas in the city. Great service (once you get in...call ahead!), amazing food, and reasonably priced. 

One demerit? You have to briefly leave the restaurant to access the bathroom. It's always annoying, but doesn't deter from an otherwise awesome restaurant experience.
author: Danny M.

description: This place is never not good! Ask for the "Fancy DOritos!" That's not what theyre called on the menu, but man oh man.... they're the best!
author: Aaron S.

description:
Oh my goodness is this place delicious!! I have been wanting to go forever but the wait has always been an hour plus. That being said when I finally went it was well worth the wait! To start off, both their margaritas and sangria are delicious. The margaritas are so good it's almost dangerous, they're way too easy to drink!

The food, you honestly can't go wrong. The quesedilla, empanadas and toquitos were my favorites. I was with two guys and one other girl (four in total) we split about six dishes including two entrees and this was plenty for all of us. Spiting everything between the four of us was very reasonable, not too pricey at all. It's one of those meals you walk away from and continue to think about.

I cannot wait to go back soon!
author: Lizzy U.

description:
The Bottom Line: Nopalito serves tasty modern Mexican tapas at fairly reasonable prices.  Their reservation/call-ahead system is a disaster and the over-whelmed hosts suck at providing information on the length of your wait.  Caveat diner.

The FOOD:  The totopos are always lovely.  The ceviche is also quite good quality. There never seems to be a shortage of chips as i have experienced in some other places.  Generally, I've had very issues with the quality or pricing of the food.  Portions are pretty generous for a tapas place.  I do find that making a full meal out of it ends up with a lot of heavy/fried items.

The ATMOSPHERE:  This Nopalito I don't like as much as the other one.  It feels more cramped and the noise level is getting a little tough for conversation.  The patio at the other location is much more pleasant.

The SERVICE: Generally good, but never outstanding.  My last visit definitely had some awkwardness with drink orders not being taken promptly and some rather long waits to order.  Once the food started flowing though, it was all smooth sailing.

The HOSTS & RESERVATIONS:  Disaster.  This place has made me angry more than once.  The call-ahead system has failed me by the order of 2-3 hours longer than the expected wait time quoted (1.5-2 hours).  The hosts can be over-whelmed and unhelpful.  Either the people that designed their systems or the ones executing it have really messed this up, and more than anything it puts me off coming here.  So be warned.
author: Ian P.

description:
O.M.G.  We just kind of happened on this place, and it was the best food we had on this particular trip to SF.  Great environment, too - cool place, good service.

We had the Tacos Dorados de Papa (like mashed potato taquitos, but way better than that sounds); Panucho de Pollo al Pibil (a masa/black bean cake, kind of like a thick tortilla, with this amazingly tender and flavorful chicken on top); and theTorta de Chilorio  (Mexican version of a pulled pork sandwich).  All three dishes were delicious, and we'd order any one of them again, although the Panucho was my favorite.

We also had margaritas (awesome, not overly sweet like some) and one of the BEST flans we've ever had--and we've had a lot!

Highly recommend this place - we'll definitely be back next time we're in town.
author: Sheila C.

description: authentic mexican, fresh made horchata, always busy, very fresh food, lovely staff
author: Carmin W.

description: Good authentic flavours, buzzy atmosphere, helpful service
author: Sudi C.

description: Really cute fun place! Great service as well. I had the fish tacos that was recommended and had chips and salsa sampler... Amazing salsas! Really fun vibe. My friend got the almond milk horchata so yum!
author: Sarah W.

description: I'm sorry, huge mosquito in my food!! Wasn't very hard to miss. There seems to be a disconnect with the kitchen and service.
author: Rene C.

description:
We tried the empanadas, quesadilla, tacos, and chicken mole. Oh, and the Mexican rice.  The food was excellent.  The ingredients were very fresh.  The service was pleasant but god awfully slow that it made you twitch. I go out to eat for the taste and ingredients and both were very good... so I rate it well.  If you are big on demeanor, or attentiveness of servers then this may not be that great of a place for you.   Also, you should call ahead and reserve a time, it's not a reservation exactly but pretty good.

Oh, the Mexican rice was extremely bland.  Only "eh" tasting thing.  Empanadas were probably my favorite... very tasty and the crust was perfect
author: Robert F.

description:
Nopalito is a nicer Mexican restaurant, where prices are a bit higher, ingredients are fresher and should not to be confused with a taqueria with super burritos and refried beans.

For a party of 2 shared: 

Spicy chickpeas - complimentary - 5/5 - What a nice and smart table item. They are spicy and make your mouth dry, leaving you to require more and more drinks. Tasty and well played! 

Totopos con Chile - $6 - 3/5 - Homemade chips tossed in a red sauce with cheese, onions and creama. These were similar to chilaquiles chips. The presentation is nice and a great dish to share.

Quesadilla con Repollitos de Bruselas - $9.50 - 3/5 - This was good but so small. Two of us shared this and the diameter of the tortilla is about 6".
