I like the twist of the brussel sprouts but it's not enough to eat this alone. Although tasted good, I am not sure I would recommend this as a must-have amongst the other menu items.

Carnitas - $17.00 - 4/5 - I had my doubts but the carnitas was soft and moist. It came with some corn tortillas and cabbage slaw which when made into a taco was awesome! 

Location - Surprisingly easy to park despite the business of the area. The restaurant itself is small but extended with an enclosed patio area that is basically like a non-permanent extension. Most tables are for larger parties, so be prepared to share a table if you are a party of two. 

Although I liked the food, I don't see Nopalito as being one of my repeat restaurants in the city, unless a friend suggested going here. I wasn't as amazed with the food for the value as I am at other places in the city.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Big picture: I wouldn't recommend going here. I won't argue against the atmosphere - it's warm and inviting with nice sunlight - but I will argue against the food. The portions are small and the food is not appetizing.

Read on for context and additional details...

(+) Ambience: Since the restaurant is always busy and enclosed by windows peering into the Panhandle, it could be perceived as a warm, romantic environment.

(-) Food: The food is very, very small in portion size, less spicy and flavorful than you would expect at a Mexican restaurant. For those reasons, it seems overpriced. 

For instance, I've tried many things on the menu - Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo (enchiladas with chocolate) and Tacos de Pescado al Pastor (fish tacos) to name a few - and had the same disappointing experience. 

The fish tacos, as an example, consisted of the tortilla, a block of fish, and light sauce. In a side cup were a couple slices of pickled carrot and pepper. It was very plain. I had to ask the waitress to create a sauce - I wanted a sort of aioli, which they didn't have - and she mixed sour cream with hot sauce. It didn't help much.
author: Aj P.

description:
I don't care if the food is great when this place allows to have a careless, unorganized hostess on a busy Saturday night.  We waited for one hour and a half on site without getting seated when tables were available.  I am writing this review almost two hours since we wrote our name down and i still have to get seated. She came and ask us " did i text you?"  Hello? We are here, standing in front of you!  People walking from the street were offered tables right In front of us!
This happened on 4/12/14 starting at 7:50pm. 

JEFF, saw you tonight at NOPA, hope you read this!



What a disappointment
author: Ricardo A.

description:
I've always wanted to try Nopalito because I've heard so many good things about this place especially about their torta so I had to try it out for myself 
The restaurant has trendy modern look to it. The entrance was a bit confusing with the take out entrance where I think the real entrance of the restaurant should be. Once I walked in there was no hostess to greet us and I had to walk further into the restaurant which was a very awkward spot to have someone finally greet us and had us wait for a bit. 
We came here for a late lunch at around 4:30PM and got seated right away. The hostess who had seated us and gave each of us a menu. I knew what I wanted right away-the torta which was on the lunch menu that the hostess had provided me with. At 4:50pm not the server, but the hostess came by our table and literally took the menu out of my hand saying, "Let me just switch that for you." It took me a moment to realize that he had switched the menu from the lunch menu to the dinner menu because he didn't mention it as he took it away. At 4:55pm our server finally appeared and when I told her I wanted the torta she said they stop serving it at 5pm because that's when they switch over to the dinner menu. It was obviously not 5:00PM and even so I was very disappointed with their service in how they first gave me the lunch menu and didn't take my order for another 15 minutes or so and when the server finally came I wasn't even able to order it. I was pretty upset at the service but I wasn't rude to the server however she purposely took her time serving us because the table next to us who got seated at least half an hour after us ordered the same thing as us but got their food and devoured them even before we got our appetizer. We also sat near the bar where theres a giant curtain for the lighting above the kitchen and I almost threw up looking at it because there was a whole colony of flies flying around in it. 
Sometimes even if the service sucks if the food is good they are sometimes forgivable but the food wasn't even that great and lacks a wow factor. All in all they do have a more refined taste compared to traditional Mexican food places I've tried however I don't think its worth the price (I got the pozole which was $14 and the tacos de pescado al pastor were $11).
author: J K.

description: Excellent food. The tortillas are made fresh that gave it this really home made authentic taste to it. We tried the empanadas which were amazing and the carnitas which is their signature dish was out of the world! Overall great taste. I need to go back to try the other dishes.
author: Edmond N.

description:
I usually eat at the 9th Street Nopalito. I love the food here. This experience was certainly different.

Since they do not take reservations we (a party of 5) called in at 6:30 to let them know we wanted seating. They told us that they would page us but to be there around 8:30. We were paged at 8:20 that our seating was available. 

We waited outside until 9:15 and were finally seated. Unfortunately we were seated in the bar area at a high table and were asked to share with 4 other people. It was hot, and loud, and cramped and was not ok with a particular member of my group. 

He asked the hostesses if we could have a different table, and they said no, that they are sorry but this is how their system works. 

Meanwhile 2 low tables at the windows are clear and set and empty. Luckily our very attentive waiter Troy observed this and kindly seated us at one of these open tables. Troy was very professional and diffused a tense situation with grace. 

The food as always was good. This location is a bit crowded and stuffy. That is a good sign for their success.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I was introduced to this restaurant by my siblings. We came here one weekend to catch up over delicious foods & drinks. My sister has a lot of food allergies, so this place was perfect because they catered to her gluten and dairy allergies. She was able to enjoy the food as much as we did.

Upon arrival, the place looked very busy. Luckily, they were able to seat a part of 9 of us within 15 minutes. The service was excellent. The servers were swift and the food came out at a good pace. Some of my favorites include the carnitas & quesadilla. Can't wait to come back here & try more of their dishes!
author: LilyAnn N.

description:
Hypetastic.
Nopalito is to Mexican as PF Chang's is to Chinese - it's not bad, just not exactly Mexican.

Atmosphere: Cozy, low key, takeout area in the back (catch them at Off-The Grid Presidio on Sundays too). And dedicated parking lot - plus!

Service: Wee bit slow but OK

Food: Everything in or with their corn tortilla, which is rather thick and a bit dry
Totopos con chile - Coated chips, their riff on nachos, different but quite salty 
Quesadilla roja con chicharron - Not really a quesadilla, more like a taco, best item we had 
Pozole rojo - Bland soup
Carnitas taco - Solid and actually tasted authentic
Birrias de res - Too salty yet bland at the same time
Hibiscus orange drink - Refreshing
Strawberry Horchata - Its Horchata, its going to taste good

For more upscale Mexican-esque fare, there are better shows in town.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Carnitas, great!! Popsicle, aiight. Enchiladas? Not bad.... 2 hour wait? I think there are more authentic Mexican places out there. My love for Nopa remains unabated though!

oh yeah, there's an unreal wait (first come first serve basis = 2 hour wait) and their bathroom is outside -- slightly awkward when you're rocking heels and wandering confusedly around the restaurant
author: Sam W.

description:
This review is for the takeout counter in the back of Nopalito restaurant - which is across the street from the DMV office's parking lot. The original passage to the bathroom was blocked to create this takeout counter. The funny thing is that while we (to go order customers) get easy bathroom access, regular patrons have to leave the restaurant, go outside and walk around into the takeout area (and get wet, when it rains) to use that bathroom.

I was in the neighborhood on Friday, so I parked at this plaza building to buy drinks and something to eat from Falletti/Delessio. I soon changed my plans when I saw the takeout counter and placed my order.

Also, if u have a long wait at the DMV, or if the waiting list for the restaurant is too long, perhaps consider ordering takeout here. It's a quick alternative and u probably will get food faster than dining inside. The menu is identical so u won't miss much other than the waiter service.

Service at the takeout counter was fast and VERY friendly, most orders are ready within 10-15 minutes. Having a restroom is a nice bonus (note that there's no paper towels inside. They use a "jet powered" hand dryer instead, same as the one at Dosa Fillmore).

Nopalito's menu is more expensive ($4.50-$15) than most Mexican restaurants and yes, u could find a few similar menu items elsewhere for less. But the food quality (organic) and preparation are top notch, and it saves u the trouble of going to multiple hole-in-the-wall places to find what u can get here in one place.

Some of my food pics:
- Taquitos with guacamole and crema dipping sauces (it's really just 2 flautas cut in half) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nopalito-san-francisco?select=A-lTHcVFMO7eyZ43sGuPHg#A-lTHcVFMO7eyZ43sGuPHg
- Lengua taco - u need a fork and knife to eat this version (my favorite item) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nopalito-san-francisco?select=JxmtM02RVIn6P6z5HvUMsQ#JxmtM02RVIn6P6z5HvUMsQ
- Tamal filled with stewed pork (it's okay) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nopalito-san-francisco?select=hE_CozglOewccPw-UaavOQ#hE_CozglOewccPw-UaavOQ
- Complimentary Mexican wedding cookies http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nopalito-san-francisco?select=Mu7zfBIADxTectc9xzWcXA#nITyr1hFdTV-wH_QPztnHA
author: Luis C.

description: I LOVE this restaurant. Perfect service and perfect food. I would eat there everyday if my budget would allow me to. It is expensive but it is worth the price!
author: Michèle B.

description: Tiny portions. So over expensive! I paid 24 dollars for 2 eggs and a shared dish, and left feeling hungry! The staff are nice, but the food is over priced, i wouldnt go there again
author: Aparna S.

description:
Both this and the inner sunset location consistently serve up some seriously tasty Mexican food with a modern twist.  I prefer the inner sunset location because it's not as hard to get into.  

The food is always fresh and clean with bright flavors.  The portions are a perfect size (as opposed to tex-mex style portions) where you won't leave feeling too hungry or too stuffed.  I've had nearly everything on the menu and my favorites are the fish tacos and the trout.  As someone who doesn't particularly care for mole, Nopalito's mole is delicious (it almost tastes like a barbecue sauce).  The tamales are also very light and fluffy.  The blue bottle coffee is at it's best here, although they don't offer non-dairy alternatives.  At the end of every meal, they serve these complimentary tasty little alfajores (nut flour cookies).  

Service is always great.  They must treat their employees well because the staff always seems unusually happy.  The atmosphere is welcoming and the prices are good, particularly for the caliber of the food.  I always take out of town guests here so that they can get a taste for some great Mexican food outside of the taqueria.
author: Allegra H.

description:
Definitely go for their nachos and carnitas! Super yummy. Their organic almond horchata is flavorful too. And if you have room for dessert, they have house-made paletas (popsicles). There are usually 3 flavors but chocolate-cinnamon is my favorite. It's has a good rich chocolate flavor. 

I haven't been able to make it to the new location on 9th in the inner sunset. I'm sure it's just as good, although, the original location has had fair-good weather all the times that I've been there which make the covered patio seating so much more pleasant!

TIP: They don't take reservations although you can call in and put your name of a waiting if there is one. If you're on your way, you might as well put your name down to have a shorter wait :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Solid fancy mexican food. The gorditas (fried tacos with chorizo and brisket) were my favorite. The citrus'y salad was very good. The quesadilla with veggies was eh. The fish tacos were pretty good, and the potato brocolli wraps were ok as well. Overall I'd give this a 3.7/3.8. The wine was also solid.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday December 27, 2009 @ 3:30pm
Location:  In Between Nopalito & Delessio's
Crowd:  Well-Heeled Foodies w/ Ladies in Cashmere Coats, Scarves, Hudson Jeans & Tory Burch Boots Accompanied by Husbands Toting Nopalito Take-Away Shopping Bags
Atmosphere:  Cheery
Decor:  Charming Take-Out Stand w/ Seasonal Decorations
Service:  Cute & Friendly Will Call Cell When Order is Ready
Imbibe:  Huckleberry Lemonade.  Wine & Beer Available
Devour:  Tamal Enchilado w/ Stewed Pork & Green Chile Torta & Complimentary Mini Wedding Cake Cookies
Total:  $18.07
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Mailbox is full and takes no messages.  2:30pm Wednesday.  Phone is not answered.
author: Geri S.

description:
Quality at nopalito has gone down. The first mole I had almost 2 years ago tasted amazing, intense notes of cacao and spices, tender chicken and delicious rice. Yesterday the mole tasted very bland, we also had the Carne, which was very dry and tasteless... 
4 of us having dinner there on a busy Fri night and all unanimous about the mediocrity of the food.
author: Olivier L.

description: Always have a great time and food experience here. Been here about 5 times now and have not been let down once. Came for a Thursday night dinner and was quickly seated (usually there will be a pretty long wait if you don't call in ahead). Decided to get the queso fundido and fish tacos as appetizers and both were phenomenal! Small portions but just enough to prepare you for your entree. I usually get the carne asada or carnitas which I both highly recommend, but this time decided to go with the pozole since it was a cold night. Large portion bowl, really savory meat and just the perfect level of spice, once again I left nopalito content and full. Would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys some quality Mexican food.
author: Josue V.

description:
Haha, wow!!!
Another amazingly pathetic hipster restaurant in a city becoming ruined by hipsters and wanna be food snobs!

1:00 on a Saturday and, being hipster San Fran, there is a line outside the door.
 The hostess is standing there looking cluelessly at the line, not taking down names and numbers of people in the various parties.
Then her phone rings, she answers and writes the name of the person down on the list and says "Ok check in with the hostess when you arrive and you'll be seated."

Really?  Meanwhile we've been standing there for 10 minutes and you don't take our names down, but someone who calls on the phone gets priority.  
And the kicker, she answers the phone AGAIN and adds another name to the list!!!!

Needless to say, this establishment nor it's other locations will ever see a dime of mine!!
Too bad you can't give zero stars.
author: JimJim M.

description: I've written a lot of reviews for Mexican restaurants and I don't give a lot of 5 stars for them. It is hard to come close to Mexico but Nopalito has. They take the time to do it right- fresh Masa from corn makes all the difference. The totopos are the best way to start, followed by the pork quesadilla with chicharron. So much flavor reminding me of Old Mexico. A far cry from ANYTHING else I have found in the Bay
author: Joseph U.

description: Fast service good food. We were sitting in the outside area and they had heaters on but it was still pretty cold. Definitely a different kind of Mexican food but worth it.
author: Angelique C.

description:
I've been here about a handful of times, I always end up getting more than just enough here, a quick bite can easily turn on to a decadent meal with all the lovely tapas options.  This is definitely a great place to bring some good company, which is always perfect for ordering a few items to share, and in order to get a taste of everything. Lovely indoor/outdoor ambiance, sometimes there's a wait but it is well worth it.

Some favorites:
Ceviche -always fresh (including the chips), with the right amount of acidity, and generous portions. 

Enchiladas de mole con pollo -the sauce is very savory, cooked down, and makes this dish.

Empanadas -hit the spot for when you're craving a little bite of that fried perfection.

Mezcal Paloma -great quality tequila, grapefruit, and the little kick of spice pulls out really nice earthy/smokey notes..  Highly recommended to offset any of the fried dishes. Yum!

Ginger lemonade -ginger in my lemonade? yes please, and always. quite refreshing, I wish I could stow this in a sippy cup on-hand for every where I go.

Can't wait to back my snaxx up here again.
author: Ty T.

description: Good quality mexican food for an affordable price. Not as creative (more traditional) and did not blow me away, but overall a solid place and fun atmosphere.
author: Benjamin Y.

description:
First of all, solely by having free and ample parking right in front of the restaurant, my dining experience was off to a great start.  I like its casual atmosphere, but with high-quality food and elements of trendiness. The big windows bring in tons of sun light, and makes it great for people-watching while enjoying your meal.  Ignore the weirdos at the DMV across the street.

The food is fantastic.  My friend and I ordered the Machaca de Camaron con Huevo y Salsa (shrimp and egg scramble with refried black beans) and Arroz a la Tumbada (seafood stew); both are delicious.  Their cornmeal tortillas are even better than many ones I have had at more authentic Mexican restaurants.  The portion sizes are just right; I did not leave feeling like I consumed a bucket load of lard.

Did I mention there is free and ample parking?! That is so rare for S.F.  Like Republicans or something.
author: Ally W.

description:
Well, they must be good because our group arrived for dinner for my dear friends birthday, and were told it would be a 2-hour wait. TWO HOURS?!

 We weren't able to wait that long, so we left for greener pastures and shorter wait times. I'm sad so many appealing restaurants don't offer reservations, especially for large parties.
author: Cristina B.

description:
Food is delicious. Seriously finger licking good. I like the quesadilla Rojas and tamales. This place is such a nice change from my usual Gordos fast food runs.

 I would come here more often if the dining room wasn't so chaotic and annoying. One time I ordered food but couldn't find a table. My meal was waiting with the server with no table to go to. I was lightweight P'd off. The food itself was delicious of course
author: Andrew V.

description:
We had am amazing dinner here.  Let's start with the waitlist that you can call ahead to. ..it's probably the best system out there and really worked out well for us. 

As a group of four vegetarians,  we had about 6 or 7 dishes to choose from.  We went with the totones, tamale, brussel sprout quesadilla, squash taquitos, and the huitlacoche flatbread. 

Wow. I mean wow.  Every dish deserved an applaud. My personal favorite was the huitlacoche, which was so earthy, flavorful, and unique.  

The server was also such a sweetheart. She recommended really great things and chose this really fantastic tequila for us to try.  

An unforgettable meal.  Totally worth it!
author: Sruti G.

description:
Really quite unfortunate. Brought some extended family (all of us are vegetarian) here for a visit and was quite unsatisfied at the end our meal. 

Waiters usually give off the first impression of a restaurant. Unfortunately, we somehow ended up getting rather unhappy, forgetful, and impatient employees. We were told in a curt manner to put our bags under the table (even though we had a corner table and the bag was on the side that nobody would be walking through). We had to ask for guacamole three times (which resulted in a double serving that I'm not going to complain about). And our server didn't really know how to advise us appropriately for a vegetarian tapas-style dinner. Our order ended up being too small - we ordered three times in total. 

Food was decent - in fact I enjoyed how creative they got with their ingredients. But like I said, the portions were just awkwardly small. At least for a (hungry) group. Almond horchata was interesting, but a little too sweet/gritty. 

It's your typical crowded (but energetic), cramped (but intimate) San Francisco fare. Might actually be a lot better for a date or a smaller group. Wasn't terrible. Just not my favorite experience.
author: Anupama T.

description: Got the Torta de Chilorio and Quesadilla Roja con Chicharron, based on the servers recommendation, and feature on Diners, Drive one and Dives. I don't usually eat chicharrons, but these were very light and crunchy. Great vibe!
author: Mary C.

description:
Since everyone has been telling us to go there, finally we found a weekend that worked. Didn't have to wait to get seated, which was good, but ai guess Sunday at 4pm nobody is eating lunch anymore.
Thankfully didn't order the Margarita, they look unimpressive and just full of ice. 
I ordered the pork quesadilla and my husband the enchiladas. 
That was one of the worst Mexican food we've ever tasted (taste??). No taste whatsoever, no salt, no spices. They try to make Mexican gourmet but with no gourmet tastes. Very bland and expensive, would've been better to spend half of the money going to Papalote (which is in the same area) or to a Chipotle. Would not recommend. Service was good, but they need to serve better and tastier food. 0.5 stars out of 5 if I could give half stars.
author: Logia G.

description: Is more of a Tapas place. 1 item (Empanadas) that had beef - which was quite expensive for what it was but it was good. Should go in a group to be able to share the food.
author: Ayaz L.

description: Realliy like Nopalito. free parking its great. The Horchata and great selection of tequilas and mescal are second to none. Try the fish tacos al pastor, huaraches and quesadillas. Everything is so good. Im from Mexico and the food here is truly close to the real thing back home. A most for Mexican lovers!
author: Agustin F.

description:
Pretty nice place, food NOT Worthy, expensive( two tiny pieces of fish, a lot of unflavor cabbage, wraped in tortillas..... 10$$) a glass of wine 9 dollars..... Not getting back( come on... Is mexican food rice, beans, tortillas, cabbage... Whats your cost in that??
Service was very good.
author: Larry L.

description:
Mexican food can be a little tricky because all I can think about is "hole-in-the-wall & quantity."   I have to say that I am pleasantly surprised by the outcome and taste of the food from this restaurant because of their take on fresh and organic ingredients.  Very well done and executed! 

A group of 4 of us came here for the first time on New Years Day for lunch.  We waited about a little over an hour.  (I played the Hangry Games.) 

Each of us got something different, so try the following:  
-Shared chips and guacamole ($8)
-Pitcher of margarita ($33)
-Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón ($10) 
-Carnitas ($16)
-Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo ($11)
-Panucho de Pollo al Pibil = Great appetizer  for one person ($5)
-Huarache con Pato Confitado y Chorizo  = Good portion for a small plate ($10)

Service was a little slow and the waiter didn't really come by our table to check on us often, but at least he was upbeat and funny.  

Ambiance has a nice outdoorsy-patio feeling.  The decor was rustic and had snippets of Mexican design to it. 

I would come here again if I ever feel like splurging on good quality Mexican food and try their Pozole Rojo soup. 

Happy 2014 and Yelping!
author: Deborah C.

description:
I had take out. There's never an empty chair in the place so I walked up to the little counter and took in the menu. Fools rush in but there was nothing foolish about the menu. Some unseen divine hands were clearly at work here. I tried four different items and devoured all four before the sun had receded behind the horizon. My senses were instantly overcome by the smooth intertwining of texture and taste that inundated me (and my dining room). It forced me to slow down and take in every bite. I savored every moment. I had a late lunch and an early dinner so I could eat it all up. I was worried it would go straight to heaven (without me!) before I could get to it again. 

If I had a guitar or piano I would compose a song of love. Like the crazy, intoxicating love one feels in the first six months of a relationship. Except I would expect this love to remain sizzling hot long after six months. Or seven years. The only itch to scratch is a desire to go back here. This place is for all time.

I will addend this gushing, mushy love note into a formal review after I have regained composure and control of my critical faculties.

It's not to be or not to be. It's to be here and not elsewhere. I eat therefore I am. What did Shakespeare and Descartes know? Cogito, ergo sum you say (in your rusty, barnacle encrusted Latin)? That doesn't mean squat anymore. This place has conquered me. I am in love.
author: Jahan T.

description:
The Queso dip with the chorizo and Nopales - OMG. So good!  Wish we cld pack this up and bring it back with us to DC :)

The fish tacos were good but a little too spicy for us.
author: Kitty M.

description:
I absolutely love coming here to have the topotos and chilaquiles, everthing I have had here is absolutely delicious! I have also had the enchiladas and they were good too. Portions are small, but good food overall. 

Minus one star for the rude Latina hostess lady with brown short hair. I  do not know her name but its the second time I came across her and I seriously don't know why she is working there. Will update when I get her name. The other servers were all friendly and welcoming providing great service except for that women.
author: Ella P.

description:
Came here for the Carnitas featured on the 7x7 Big Eat. http://www.7x7.com/big-eat-2012-photos#/50

The carnitas were pretty good but nothing amazing. They were really tender but needed a little extra salt. They were pretty oily on the bottom that the paper around it attempted to soak up.

Overall, I wouldn't say this was something you absolutely HAD to try. It's a little pricey for what it is; I don't think it was worth the $15.50 that we paid for it.
author: Ava S.

description:
Came again. Loved it again. Deserves 5 stars for consistent deliciousness!

This time around, my friend called at 7:30 to place our names on the wait list. We arrived at 8:30 and had a 10 minute wait to be seated. So for all those who don't like to wait - call at least an hour in advance!!

We split:
+ Panucho de Pollo al Pibil ($4.50). This is a crunchy, thin black bean stuffed tortilla topped with flavorful chicken, cabbage, pickled red onion, and salsa. Difficult to eat, but delicious!

+ Taco de Pescado al Pastor ($4.75). This is one seared fish soft taco in some spices. Definitely the lowest point of our dishes. I wouldn't order it again, though I wouldn't call it 'bad'.

+ Tamal Empipianado Rojo con Puerco ($6.00). A tamale with pork and soaked in red sauce. SO FREAKING GOOD. YUM. 

We also received a complementary order of Totopos con Chile (Normally $6.00
) because I was lucky enough to be dining with a friend of the employees. These were tortilla chips, covered in salsa, cotija cheese, and served with sour cream and lime. Nice little chip dish for those of you who love cheese and tortilla chips.

And finally, we had the Carnitas. They were so delicious last time, I had to order them again! Ask for a little extra fry to get the ultimate wonderful crunchiness. Apparently some of the chefs give it the extra fry, others don't.

Overall, delicious night :-) Only thing I regret is not getting the Mexican Chocolate Popsicle!
author: Talia G.

description:
Gotta second other reviewers - staff here have a bad attitude. And the food has gone downhill enough in the past three years that it's not worth it anymore

Walked into 3/4 empty place tonight and were told "sit anywhere".  Walked into back area to avoid some kids (no offense, parents). Tried to sit at the empty bar and were asked by a condescending server to move down a seat next to the raw onions to maximize the open seats. In an empty restaurant. 

And she didn't even offer us a drink. 

So we left. 

Because the food is meh and we were really there to have margaritas. And her Mission hipster attitude is even worse than loud toddlers. I won't be picking up takeout anymore either. Thanksssss
author: T T.

description: Mexican food at its gourmet finest. Not one negative thing I can say. Food and service the best. Don't miss their homemade chips dipped in a spicy sauce. To die for. Also had duck taquitos which were delicious as well as chicken enchiladas in a homemade mole sauce. The carnitas were crisp on the outside and tender on the inside with a green chile sauce the was again homemade and very good.
author: Beth L.

description:
I love love love this place! Apart from being gluten free pretty much every dish except 1 or 2, their salsa dip/chip appetizer is to die for! 
Pretty much everything on the menu is delicious and they have an extensive cocktail/tequila menu too! 
It gets crazy busy for both lunch and dinner. First time I arrived at 11:25am and there was already a queue out the door. 
Late dinners are definitely better.
author: Van-Anh N.

description: Nom nom nom! A colleague and I decided to do a late lunch/early dinner (4pm) after teaching on a Monday. So we mosied down the street to Nopalito. Mind you, this place has been on my "to eat" list for a while, so we walked on in. No wait. No line! I had the Frijoles Puercos Con Huevo and it was heavenly! Also drank a really yummy ginger-limeade!!! Made my night. Great eats, ambiance and staff!
author: J. G.

description:
First discovered on DDD and had to try it. Ordered Civeche and carnitas 

The atmosphere at this location is new and very friendly. Service was prompt attentive and caring

The Civeche dish was in a sauce that I had never eaten before. There was half of sliced avocado on top adding to the creaminess and tart flavor of the dish. And of course the fish was very fresh

The Carnitas were cooked to moist perfection. Instead of serving traditional beans or rice   there was a cabbage carrot dish that complimented the pork beautifully. A green sauce on the side added tart and clean flavor
I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a fresh twist on traditional Mexican Spanish cuisine

Pricing was in line for what you'd expect in a major metropolitan city approximately $35 for dinner
author: Tim M.

description:
Great location. Large restaurant with plenty of seating. Good Mexican fusion food. We had the ceviche and steak empanada.
Im brown and can make better at home, but for a night out it was good.
author: Daniel M.

description:
On a trip up to San Francisco, my friend and I made the long trek to Nopalito from the Presidio to Golden Gate Park Panhandle. We've heard about this place and was dying to try it. I had the Birria de Res: beef stewed in ancho chiles, tomatoes, and plenty of spices. It was like a great Mexican pot roast: the meat melted in my mouth. The broth rich and spicy but not overwhelmingly spicy. My friend had the fish tacos: fresh fish marinated in ancho chiles adobo and grilled to perfection, and served with fresh tomatillo salsa. The place was packed, and we were lucky to be seated quickly. (Though we got there at 5:30 pm). 
This was traditional Mexican cuisine (more like Yucatan). Not Tex-Mex junk smothered with cheese and beans. 
The service was good. The food came in timely manner. And the margarita was nicely dry, not cloyingly sweet. I could taste the tequila.
author: David T.

description:
Return? Definitely. 
Atmosphere (3) Not too memorable, Plenty of elbow room, easy to carry on a conversation. More of a friend/family vibe than date. Its about the food    
Food (4) - We had the ensalada de lechuga (4 - great blend of flavors), tocaos pescados (4), Birria de Res (3+ - basically pot roast, side hot sauce great, sauce/broth ok), rice (5), maragrita (4 - sour, not sweet).
Service (3) friendly but not very attentive (forgot reorder of margaritas)
Cost = Total tab before tax/tip was $69 w/ two maragaritas
author: Will S.

description:
Boring, mediocre food. 
Some people like bland food, and this would be a good place for them.

Ohioans should not do the restaurant-picking.
I'm taking it out of his hands right now.

This is the second 'never again' restaurant chosen by an Ohio friend during the last few months.
The other was an 'Italian' (apologies to Italy) place on Columbus. 
How long does he have to live here before his standards improve?

I got two things, a bland thing and a thing that had some taste, barely.
Anything with flavor became heightened and appreciated
so that's a good thing, I guess.

My friend got a big bowl of liquid nothing ('soup').
He said there was one thing in it with taste, so when he got one of those he was grateful.

Nopalate-o Willhelp-o is open to the outside (no door, on our end, at least) and someone left their dog while they went into the adjacent grocery store and it barked constantly...

barking and bland food 
Check!? 
Please?!

Lots of families with kids-I'm thinking this is a neighborhood place 'cause it's often packed. I can't imagine bothering to eat here otherwise.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description:
How do I love Nopalito?  Let me count the ways.

No, let's not. Screw that.

It's tasty  healthy Mexican food in large portions at an affordable price.  

* Free parking, always a spot available.  In San Francisco that's rare.

* It's all homemade from scratch.   They make their own salsas.  If it's on a bun, they baked the bun.  If there's corn in a dish they shucked the kernels.

* Professionalism.  The servers here know the menu, they treat you right, and they seriously know what they're doing.  They can help you deal with a difficult child or recite the philosophy, ingredients, and sources behind a dish.  That's a level you might expect at $25-50 a plate, but a complete surprise under $10.

* Dog friendly.  Many places say it, but Nopalito is one of the only places you can bring a dog, dine under the awning, get some respect, and all that.

* Quality.  The food here is very tasty, clever, and all around amazing if traditional in conception, execution, etc.

It's delicious food to be sure. But the only reason I'm taking it down to 4 stars instead of 5 is that it's, well, it holds back a little. It doesn't give and give. There's a seriousness about it. That's just me I guess.

The homemade chilada (beer + chile fruit and spices) almost makes it all worth it.
author: Gil S.

description:
Fresh out of Germany's triumph over Argentina the hunger began to take hold. I staggered out of the cafe like a three legged turtle into the savagely benevolent streets of San Francisco. I stopped a man whom sported a beard of which I'm fairly certain was grown intentionally, and question him on the whereabouts of his favorite restaurant. Unindignantly he didn't shout, "Nopalito". Before I could react he draws his fist, jabs a finger at what I only assumed to be a drug dispensary, and unimpolitely delivers, "That's Nopalito.". I told him thanks and slid him a business card I had received earlier from a tax attorney.

When I arrived at Nopalito's I was set upon by the maitre d. Recalling the training I received in yoga class I found my intention and was able to communicate it. The place was jumping and I got the sense that I should stop talking to myself. To slip into something a little more destructive I'd been eyeing mezcals when the man whom I knew knew I knew nothing approached. I asked the man who the prime suspects were in a good experience. With the confidence of an avocado in a CA market he replied "The fish tacos are great and the Totopos Con Chile is an experience.". I told him what he could do with his suggestions and shortly after the fish tacos and totopos con chile were in route to my table. 

I approached the totopos con chile as a cockeyed optimist; snatched up a chip and gave it what for. It responded in kind with a bland yet substantial sock in the mouth. What it lacked in personality it made up for in character. I generally observe the principle "never leave your enemies alive" but the chips in this dish are forged and folded. I offered a truths with the totopos and diverted my attention to the fish tacos which were descended upon as if they were cats in an Alf orgy. I'd never before had swordfish in a taco, and I will kill the next man who serves me a taco without it! 

Final thoughts: the food here is only slightly beat out by it's value and service staff. If you find yourself in the area this is well worth checking out, and don't allow them forget the complimentary almond butter cookie at the end....

-Final Boss.
author: Erik G.

description: Came in on a Sunday at around 2:30pm. The wait for our table of 2 adults and 2 kids was about 20 minutes. We ordered a strawberry lemonade, It tasted like fresh strawberries were used delicious! An almond horchata, which was good as well and a sangria which was not bad.For our entrees we ordered the quesadilla with chicharron, carnitas and torta.  I loved the quesadilla, the tortilla is crispy and the meat, cheese,and sauces inside the crispy tortilla meld together well, The torta was tasty with a perfect amount of spicy, and the bread was nice and soft! The carnitas were my least favorite, but they were still fairly good.The service was great, the servers were friendly and fast! Highly recommend a visit to this place!
author: Rosalyn S.

description:
This deserves a nomnomnomnom. My boyfriend and I stopped in here on a whim a couple weeks ago after a stop at Ocean Beach. Despite the line we were seated almost immediately (we got lucky, as it seems that most people were waiting for four-tops). 

I can't remember the exact names of the dishes now, but we ordered the avocado + citrus salad, the poached eggs over black beans and the carnitas tacos. This place does it RIGHT. 

My only gripe? I ordered a coffee right away (was happy to see Blue Bottle on the menu) and it took around 10 minutes just to get a coffee. When I asked for more sugar, that took several minutes, too. 

But on the way out the server was nice enough to give us these little cookie dough balls as a parting gift, and extra, too, so that made up for it.
author: Lau G.

description: Seriously how can you beat this place? The lines can be long so call in advance or get there early. The Oaxaca flameado will smooth over your hangover and the coffee is great. Don't miss the ceviche as well..real Mexican food like you would find in a nicer restaurant in Mexico City.
author: Max G.

description: Food is awesome! Me and my GF went for lunch, she had the panuchos de pollo al pibil and i had the quesadilla roja con chicharrón. Everything was great other than the micheladas ; Do NOT try the michelada. Its is in no way a traditional michelada. It is smoky; definitely an acquired taste.
author: Ramon Z.

description: Great food and service.  It was our first experience and the server gladly answered our questions and explained our entrees as they arrived and package our leftovers very nicely.  The food is excellent.  The only con is the tables are spaced too close to each other.  We could not help but hear the next tables conversation and I know they heard ours because they commented.  However, I do understand more tables more customers.
author: Susan J.

description:
Two coworkers and I went on an adventure to the Lower Haight from FiDi for lunch because my coworkers' friend works as a prep cook there. 

I like the whole sustainable kitchen idea and that everything is sourced locally and is organic.  The dishes were pretty hit or miss. The 3 of us ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees to share. My favorites were the Ceviche Verde which came with cod and calamari and the Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo. The best part of the enchilada was the mole sauce that it was served with. Totopos con Chile were given to us on the house. They were like glorified tortilla chips. Glad there were for free because I wouldn't have paid money for them.  I was also a bit disappointed with the Panucho de Pollo al Pibel which was a tortilla stuffed with black beans served with chicken and cabbage on top.  The chicken was dry and the tortilla was too crispy and fried.  The Carnitas was also just okay. The 6 oz chunk of pork was super fatty and was braised a little too long. 

The drinks were super exciting. The table across from ours ordered a few white wine sangrias. They looked so delicious I hunted our waiter down to order one. The sangrias came with persimmon and pomegranate and tasted like juice. DANGEROUS!  

Overall the meal was pleasant. The service was friendly and the food was pretty good. One minus of the place was that you had to leave the restaurant to use the bathroom which was over on the other side of the take-out counter. I thought about hopping over the take-out counter so I could avoid walking outside.

4 plates (2 entrees + 2 apps), 2 beers and 1 sangria turned out to be about $70 for three people.  A $25 lunch was more than I was looking to spend but it wouldn't be a bad dinner.
author: Debbie C.

description: Margaritas are good but portions are pretty small for what you pay. The patio is nice on a pretty night. Good place to meet a couple friends for dinner.
author: Ashley M.

description:
While the totopos is a nice little treat and the mole was good, nothing else about this place really stands out. It's essentially over-thought, under-loved Mexican food, served by aloof waitstaff that don't seem to realize they work in a restaurant adjoined to a supermarket. 

P.S. If you go, stick to the above mentioned items or torta. The pozole was remarkably bland.
author: Baron C.

description: Was tuned into this place from Drivers Diners &  Dives, and finally got to check it out for myself. The carnitas were amazing. Best I've had yet, and I try carnitas everywhere I go. So flavorful, and tender. The meat falls apart when you go to serve it. Served with a delicious pickled cabbage mixture and mild salsa verde which only compliments the pork and does not overpower. I will be back for sure.
author: Prime O.

description:
Had the tamal, quesadilla, empanada, chicken mole and carnitas...Holy sh!* Everything was incredible. Not one thing I wouldn't order again. All items were seasoned perfectly and beautifully presented; nice balance of spice/sweet/savory without any overpowering the other. 

Make sure to hit up the cocktail menu as well, you can't go wrong when you have that many tequilas and mezcals. 

Only downfall (and it's not enough to take anything away from the overall meal) was the only dessert option was their homemade popsicles and we were in the mood for something not-frozen. Had the house-made horchata instead, also delicious!
author: Robb M.

description:
Wanted to check this place out because I saw it on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives! 

TIP: YOU CAN CALL IN TO PUT YOUR NAME ON THE WAITING LIST unlike other restaurants where you have to go in person and wait aimlessly until your table is called. Wait is usually 1-2 hours around popular times.

Tried 3 things from the menu:

1. Totopos: basically their version of nachos. not sure what everyone else is tasting but this was the least favorite for me and NOT worth ordering. Pretty bland nacho dish... I had to ask the waitress for some salsa which I didn't know cost money - would've rather tried their ceviche instead!

2. Quesadilla with pork belly: SO GOOD. one bite of this baby puts so much flavor into your mouth and this was definitely my favorite!! I would order this again and again instead of the totopos

3. Carnitas: a must have here! the first few bites are extremely tender and juicy. the larger pieces of meat seemed to be more dry for me, but still pretty good

PAY 50 CENTS FOR THE SALSAS! I looooved the habanero salsa and their hot sauce :)
author: Sophia L.

description:
Best food items: carne asada and totopos. 

Nopalito is a fantastic upscale Mexican food restaurant in the NOPA neighborhood. They have great margaritas (on the rocks only) and sangria too. My husband and I go as just the two of us and with medium sizes groups. Usually there's a long wait, but if you call ahead they'll add you to the wait list. You should call ahead.

Overall, it's one of the best places in the hood!
author: Jeff L.

description:
Going to Nopalito with a group larger than 4 can be a stressful process, even at lunch time. The no reservations and the first come first serve policy, makes a trip here with large groups a luck of the draw. If you catch the hostess in a good mood and on a good night, things will go well. However, it is clear they get stressed out, so the hostess can be snippy and a bit saucy when things are crowded and you walk in with more than 4.

With all that said up front, Nopalito is a classic San Francisco favorite and for good reason. The food and drinks are well prepared, flavorful and interesting.

At space is well lit and can fit a lot more people than what you first think. The spaces can be tight between tables, but they manage to make it all work.

The carnitas is easily my favorite menu item. The meat is perfectly slow cooked and is so tender it falls apart with just a touch.
author: Justin O.

description:
Great food!!!!! Our server was wonderful!!! 
The rest of the staff could use a lesson in shaving, smiling and patience but over all it was great! I will most defiantly go back!
author: Tim F.

description:
Love this place -- have been there 3 times in 6 months, which is quite a bit for San Francisco given how many fantastic places there are.

Everything is delicious, the drinks, the food. Simple but elegant minimalist setup.

I mistakenly took my Croatian friend who can't eat spicy food there. Even though most of the dishes are quite mild (with a bit of spice), he started tearing within 10 minutes and had to resort to the Carnitas dish, which is tender and delicious, and probably one of the most well known dishes at Nopalita.

If my memory serves me correctly, the carne asada and mole pablano con pollo are excellent.

I'm a convert for Nopalito even though Mexican food in general is not my favorites with my delicate asian food - trained stomach.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
The carnitas here are amazingg.

And I don't even like Mexican food!
author: Stacey H.

description:
Pros : Totopos con Chile are bomb and Esquite Tostado makes my mouth melt.

Cons : Really, really terrible service.

We were a party of 8 on a Saturday night. Called at 6:00 to put our name on the list and were told it would be a 3 hour wait (makes sense, it's a top restaurant on a Saturday night).

1. The hostess was terribly standoffish. If you're going to fuss at customers being in your way, perhaps you could stand somewhere a little more accessible?

2. Our server managed to miss an order, bring the wrong dish out, offer said dish to one of the couples at the table...and then take it away. The same server was absent for most of our meal.

Food is consistently tasty but service is seriously lacking. If I go back, it will be for the takeout window.
author: Caroline M.

description: Love their place, but the food is just OK. Good for a Saturday night date!
author: Vitalie S.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night with the BF. For me the food was A-OK, nothing spectacular that really stood out, but my BF really liked it. I had the carnitas and ordered a side of corn tortilla to go with it. Carnitas were prepared in beer, cinnamon, milk, etc that sounded great! It was pretty good but it tasted average. I did like the chips appetizer that we ordered with creme and salsa. Housemade soda tasted okay too. 

Overall, I'm not sure what the hype is about. But I wouldn't mind going back and trying it again
author: Zara H.

description: The food was alright. I wouldn't say it was amazing given the high prices and wait times on a Thursday evening. I got a carnitas dinner plate that came with refried beans and some peppers. Service was a tad on the slow side. I'm really not sure why it took 20 minutes for me to get a sangria. It took so long that I canceled it and the server kept asking me if I didn't want to wait for it since it's "almost done." Again, not sure the food quality is worth the wait when there are some highly authentic places in the Mission that provide solid service for a fraction of the price.
author: Gonzalo C.

description:
This evening we had a group of 6 very excited for this meal as I have raved about Nopalito to my friends before this dinner.  We called in and the wait was between 2-3 hours. This is to be expected with a large party at a top spot. 

Unfortunately it was quite disappointing as after 3 hours we showed up and went to ask the hostess if our table happened to be ready but she was incredibly standoffish and even decided to add that we were in her way and needed to go outside and she would come talk to us then. I know this review comes off as another frustrated Yelper but the truth is it was pretty disappointing. 

The food here is good and so are the drinks. But it's definitely not worth three hours, or two hours. I'd skip Nopalito next time based off of the service and the wait. But feel free to try on your own. After all it has excellent ratings.
author: Adam W.

description:
I'm a fan of Nopa and wanted to check out Nopalito after seeing it feature on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.  Though I never had the opportunity to dine in, I did get takeout on several occasions.  

Both the carnitas and carne asada are top items and always seem to make it onto my plate.  Eventually I'll sit down and be able to rate the service.  For now, I'm please with the takeout.
author: Jason S.

description: Awesome, so good, I can't eat americanized mexican food anymore after eating here.
author: Marley W.

description: Emily is the best here!! They always take care of us even tho they confuse me for my cousin when I go here. Haha but overall the food is fantastic and thee best Mexican I've had. Super clean and amazing service.
author: Wahajj S.

description: I took a friend here on a Friday night for his birthday dinner because his favorite cuisine is Mexican.  Definitely on the nicer modern side than a typical Mexican taqueria.  He really liked the mole but I felt like my carnitas was not much to write home about. Same can be said for the empanada.  The meats just need more flavor.  I liked the totopos con chile but not as insanely delicious as everyone says.  However, worth the order (over empanada).  Nice change from the typical chips and salsa.  They have some interesting tequilas we enjoyed sipping and found a decent wine.  With all of that said, it was nice to walk away from a Mexican meal not feeling bloated haha  Their ingredients are higher quality and fresh.  Although it can get loud, I'd still recommend this place for a date.  Also, parking across the street made that issue easy and convenient.
author: Bee B.

description: Wonderful working with the Nopalito team to cater my wedding. Their food is delicious and added to the local, San Francisco flair I wanted at my wedding. My husband and I really wanted an interactive experience among guests at their table so we opted for their carnitas and tamales dinner - family style. The food was amazing. Many wedding guests have already told me that this was one of the first weddings they attended where they actually loved the food!The icing on the cake were their paletas (popsicles), which were served out of a cute, retro popsicle cart. The dark chocolate and cinnamon flavor is by far my favorite! Aside from the food, I had a wonderful time working with the Nopalito catering staff. They understood what I wanted for my wedding, worked with my budget, and were flexible with line items in my contract to ensure I was happy with the proposal ... and I was! I'm thrilled I was able to have them cater my wedding. I highly recommend working with the Nopalito catering team for your event or wedding.  I've posted pictures of the family-style dinner, passed appetizers, and popsicle cart.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
I know everyone experiences restaurants in their own, mostly subjective ways. Having started with that, I have to declare that anyone who doesn't think this is a five star Mexican restaurant has NO idea what they're talking about. This place was incredible! I have eaten at some pretty next- level restaurants through 7 different States in Mexico from Sinaloa to Guerrero and Quintana Roo to D.F. 

My friends and I loved the bar snacks that came with the cocktails, which were both refreshing and inventive. The Carnitas were some of the best I've had. Estilo Michoacan. Just the best. Tortillas were made to order. Incredibly delicious and original, alongside the traditional. Can't wait to go back.
author: Chris S.

description:
We ate at their tent at the Presidio Picnic Off the Grid. Their menu was obviously small due to the location, but boy was it yummy. 

We had the Torta de Chilorio: Sandwich of shredded pork in adobo, refried pinquito beans, onion, jack cheese, crema, avocado and salsa jalapeño. The juices were dripping down my fingers and I licked them clean, and then licked my wrapper clean--that's how good it was. My lips were burning from the jalapenos when I finished and I didn't even care.
author: Ashley E.

description:
I stopped by the other day to try Nopalito namely because of yelp reviews and that we love nopa. I must report that my first experience was meh. I tried only 5 of the apps...all of them just okay not great. The chips and cojia cheese were pretty good..nice and spicy but the other 4 apps were just pretty greasy and not really flavorful. I also did not really like the mezcal cocktail the queen bee. Service was pretty good but somewhat indifferent....very industrial ....get em in and get em out....next.

I will try this restaurant once again with entrees and see how that works. 

I still like better green chile kitchen and the little Chihuahua better
author: David G.

description: Great service and food is modern comfort food. Pretty good for Latin or Mexican upscale dinning. There prices aren't too bad either.
author: Queta Q.

description:
My boyfriend had a harrowing morning at the DMV and wanted to make it all better with a good meal. A couple of screen taps later, Yelp tells us that Nopalito is ready and waiting. 

Situated next to a small grocery and coffee shop, Nopalito seems like a great place to stop in on a busy day of doing errands. The place had a hurried atmosphere, but wasn't too full, with mostly small groups of people having a quick bite alone, ready to dash off to complete the next item on the to-do list. 

It's a slightly upscale Mexican place, so I was mentally prepared for it to be different from my beloved Mission haunts. If you're looking for authentic Mexican fare, this isn't it. Regardless, the food was great and the service was friendly. 

Caldo Tlalpeño - chicken consommé with carrots, cauliflower, garbanzos, avocado, queso fresco and a giant dried chipotle floating in your soup. Not the most appetizing thing I've seen, but okay. This soup was really mild and had that smoky chipotle taste. It was interesting, but not on my favorite list.

Carnitas - pork braised in a ton of tasty stuff, accompanied by cabbage slaw, corn tortillas and salsa verde - now we're talking! Chunks of the softest pork ever packing some serious flavor without excess grease. Again, not how the taquerias make it, but still...YUM.

Mezcal margarita - delicious and not overly sweet, just the way I like it. 

While I can't say they had anything I would be craving in the near future, it was still pretty good for an impromptu lunch. Plus those carnitas earned an extra star on their own.
author: Racquel N.

description: Awesome place for Mexican food. The food is very simple but great! The lemonade is home made and the pricing in more than ok. It was a great experience! If I would ever go back to San Fran, Nopa/Nopalito is in my list for sure! Thanks for that experience!
author: Rainer S.

description:
I needed some desperate cheering up after a more than cut throat search for a place to rent in the area.  A spontaneous early dinner, late lunch at Nopalito was a quick cure for the renter blues. 

Unique items coupled with exciting flavors was my overall takeaway from this place

I will be returning soon for their amazing version of "chips and salsa".  My husband ordered it and I was expecting the traditional items, but was so surprised by what arrived.  They are very crispy chips coated in some kind of heavenly seasoned salsa.  I would liken them to eating buffalo wings.....messy, spicy, crispy and saucy.  I am a FAN!  

The server was sweet and knowledgeable about the food.  I asked her a question about the mole enchiladas I ordered (fantastic btw, once again a unique spin with a hint of anise) and she was spot on and friendly.   

-1 star for the rice, lacked flavor and tasted oily.


Go early, leave happy
author: Veronica D.

description:
Oooooooooomg, after a mixer on  a Friday night a girlfriend and I decided to try a new spot. We foi nd it in yelp and away we went. When we first arrived we were looked over to put our name on the list. The hosted passed us right by and when to the group behind us. While we didn't want to pull the race card, we both couldn't understand when she passed us up although we were clearly in front of them.

At any rate, the food was awesome. Such a new twist on mexican food. We started with the special which was a ceviche to start. It was fresh and light along with cool presentation.  Next to the empanadas that had chunky flavorful beef topped with goodness. The surprise of the night was the chicken enchiladas that had no chicken inside but on the side. We loved the potatoes and the chicken was moist and crispy on the outside. Good job just tell your hostess to be cautious of who's in line. Xoxo
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Didnt dine in because it was 2 hr wait on a Saturday night even when it was pouring rain!

But my girlfriends and i took take out.

pretty good i must say.

but its definitely on a higher price pt for mexican food especially if you are use to eating at Mission. 

we ordered:

1. Quesadilla de Primavera
2. Carne Asada con Chorizo y Papas
3. Birria de Borrego
4. Ceviche Verde de Pescado

everything was really good especially the Birria de Borrego (lamb). The ceviche was the BOMB but i wish the portions was slight bigger. 

all the plates were small portions or maybe its just smaller cause we got take out?

for those who want to dine in -- the restaurant is very small and you have to walk outside by the takeout menu to go to the bathroom which i think its SUPER weird because the waiting space is very SMALL. its like a small box especially if you are waiting in for the bathroom and there are two people waiting for their take out. :P 

i will definitely try to come back again. or maybe order takeout. would love to try their soup. i cant wait for their 9th ave location!
author: Carol Y.

description:
I had to move my full sized bed, apparently on a rainy day, using a zip truck which was 2" too short for my load!

Nopalito to rescue me from wrinkles and a frowny face!

Had that snapper ceviche, served with avocado. Wow. Just wow. I was craving something fresh tasting, nothing rich, and got this. May very well be my best decisions on a Sunday morning. Ceviche verde con pescado if my Spanish and memory serve me right.

Also got the taquitos with pumpkin/squash. It was okay.

 I don't remember what my date ordered... Not really to say it was not memorable, my memory's not to be trusted, that's all.

Loved the atmosphere here. Really nice for brunch/lunch.

Will try it for dinner.
author: Paulyne R.

description:
Great meals, great quality vegetarian friendly (and fish friendly) place with outdoor heated seating that allows 4 legged kids to come along for the fun. My husband, his friend and our two dogs joined us last week for a brunch here and the food was delicious. They will work around your requests (spicy/not spicy) and they have great drinks. My fav was their hibiscus/orange drink and their version of a Mexican (spicy) bloody mary. Their ceviche is one of the best that I've had- must try, so are the carnets that my husband swears by. He also loved the mescal with honey drink and their margarita. 

It does however get quite busy during the weekends, so come prepared to wait a little while for your table.
author: Carolina S.

description:
I really love some of the food at this place, but it can be a little process over passion for the staff here. 

On our second time coming here, we were informed of a 3.5 hour wait for dinner when we arrived (they were too busy to answer the phone). That is like a whole other meal cycle for me and my 'hanger' would have spilled over by that stage.

I just think so many problems could be solved by taking reservations for at least part of the restaurant. I guess they have no problems filling tables, but it just shouldnt be such an effort to eat here. 

The food is good - the highlight is definitely the first item on the menu, the chips and salsa. Seriously, its good enough to get me back there. I am picky with food (not overly qualified, just picky) and I find the rest to be a bit hit and miss. We had an item not delivered but charged (they did fix when we asked). The first time we came here the server was memorable and fun, this time the server didnt really care for eye contact or conversation. 

I'll likely be back, but some of the shine has fallen from my first visit here.
author: Mitchell S.

description: Great food. Love the Empanadas and the Totopos. It is a must!
author: Andrea S.

description: I thought the food was good and the service was great.  Thought it was easy and the food was yummy.... I would go back
author: Lanee B.

description: Had quesadilla on blue corn tortilla, side of rice, carnitas plate, and the huaraches plate.  All three were really good.  The carnitas were great, the serving of carnitas was very generous and I had enough to take home.  The huarache was unique because it was layered with sour cream, meats and sauce.  The huarache is a thick corn tortilla.  The combination of sauces and meat was amazing.  One thing that I'm not sure of was why the carnitas plate was over $20... it was good, but served with only two tortillas seemed like a steep price...  Overall I liked the food a lot.
author: Neli M.

description:
Never in my life did I wake up in my bed and think to myself, 'self, today you're going to eat taquitos cooked with duck confit'. Luckily though Nopalito had my back.

The service was excellent. My waiter schooled me up on a number of the available tequilas and mescals which helped me cruise right into my Friday afternoon no problema.

I recommend the pozole soup. Aside from being spicy and delicious, you get a plate of extra bits the mix and add as you please. Which is fun because playing with food.
author: Stephen C.

description:
I love large windows in restaurants. So when I approach this restaurant I immediately fell in love of the setting. I was greeted with a smile and kindness by a lady that was standing in the front.

The light was low which created a romantic setting. Everyone spoke with a low voice which made me feel I had to be cautious of my voice (I'm a loud talker. hehee).

Our waiter was even worse! His voice was very low and he was very tall. I got tired of trying to hear what he was saying so I just guessed and did my best to read his lips when he asked us questions.

He came out with these tiny (but cute) folded menus. When I opened it up I realize it was all in spanish. Traditional spanish I think (or was it italian). So I ended up reading the fine print under the name of the entrees. I tried ordering my usual drink, but they didn't have it. Our waiter tells us that the only alcoholic drink (beside beer) are the ones they have on the menu. I looked, chuckled and said, "I can't read anything." (LOL) I spotted the word "bloody maria" which I assume it was a bloody mary so I ordered that instead.

As for my entree I ordered the "mole poblano con pollo". Soon after we placed our order our food came out. When my dish came out, half of the dish was filled with red rice and the other chicken topped by some sort of chocolate sauce. It was deceiving to be honest. It didn't look delicious at all. But luckily that I love food so I ate it anyways.

I had a fork full of rice, it tasted like any red mexican rice would taste. Then I cut a slice of chicken. It was tender but a dry. The sauce however, was surprisingly good. So the next half our all I did was listen to my friend talk while I chow down on my chicken.

The service was excellent and prompt. The company was pleasant. The location was quiet. I say its a spot that you should try if you're in the area.

I think it is a good spot for a date.
author: Cathy N.

description:
We had carne asada and cartinas and both of them were really "horrorosos". The firs one taste of nothing and the carnitas were dry..you need two bottles of wind.. 
Nachos were too spicy and withouth guacamole (they wait you to ask for it and then you'll pay). And the tortillas were always too dry.
I don't think I'll be back
author: Gori V.

description:
We've been back and are more happy than ever with the experience. This time we went for lunch on a Saturday and didn't have to call in at all. We were seated promptly and the food was delicious again!

 In fact, our last visit left us confident about their ability to consistently deliver good food and so satisfied with every dish that we didn't order what we had previously tried. Usually, my husband will go with a safe choice and I will order something new to try. This way we know that we can discover something new without too much risk since we share both dishes. This strategy is not necessary at Nopalito!

The two new dishes for us this time were no disappointment at all. Indeed, one of them, the Chilaquiles Rojos en Cazuela, are now our new favorite! It's really flavorful and the spiciest we have tasted so far. I ordered the Caldo Tlalpeño con Pollo which was a good chicken soup. I probably wouldn't order it again here since they have so many other delicious things, but I wouldn't advise anyone against ordering it either. Since it was warm outside we decided to give their popsicles a try. I had the dark chocolate and cinnamon and my husband had the milk and rice flavor. Both were delicious. 

I also want to mention that the prices this restaurant charges are very reasonable. I am so happy that they use organic ingredients. We ourselves cook mostly with organic ingredients and don't like eating out too much because there are hardly any restaurants that provide an organic alternative. So, Napolito is a rarity and welcome addition to our routine. The result has been our thinking about picking up take-out often and I am sure one of these days we will be in line at their take-out counter.
author: Emma E.

description:
I managed to find a few mostly Paleo things on the menu, deemed my brunch a 'cheat meal' and went on with ordering. 
First came the citrus salad which was light and fresh. Two kinds of oranges, avocado, pickled onions and queso fresco. Never thought cheese would go with citrus but it was delicious! Next up was the ceviche. The fish was delicious, resting in a slightly spicy slightly tangy lime and jalapeno sauce. But, calamari isn't totally my thing and there were a  bit too many tentacles for me.
I really wanted Mexican hot chocolate but they don't offer it. Or hot tea either. 
The space itself is cute. The outdoor area is modern and decorated with little potted succulents. It got chilly sitting on the covered patio after a while but they gladly turned on the heat lamps. Staff was friendly and attentive.  The adjacent parking lot is a huge plus!
author: andrea l.

description: I absolutely loveeeeeeeeee this place, the totopos con chile are my favorite and I make sure to get them every time I go. The carnitas are also really good. Like really the totopos are life like words can't express how good they are. If you happen to be leaving the DMV and want to grab a bite to eat I seriously would recommend you to walk across the street and taste for yourself!
author: Vanessa D.

description: I'm so glad my roommate introduced me to this place. Their menu is constantly changing so some of my reviews might be a little outdated. First of all, the Killer Bee is a must have. If you like mezcal, this is their only mezcal drink I think. The salads are always changing as well too but the one that I had blood orange on it. The second time I went, they were no longer in season. Boo! We had the guac and chips. The guac can be a little better and I wish they were a little more generous on the amount of guac that we got as well. The quesadilla was tasty but too greasy. The quesadilla is deep fried y'all so be careful. The totopos was amazing. It's very basic but the flavors are on point. Mucho sabor! We also got the empanada which was also deep fried. -_- I wish my food would stop taking a bath in oil. It's not very healthy. Haha. With all that said, despite it being deep fried, the food is very tasty and the flavors are bold and traditional with some cool fusion twists. I definitely would return again.
author: Gary I.

description: Great food, but hoops to jump through to get a table and the hostess is aloof, unattentive and borderline rude.  First you have to call a phone number to call another number to hold for 15 minutes to have your name put on a wait list.  Our time was at 8.  We arrived promptly but did not get seated until 9 pm.  This was after prodding the hostess twice.  Then she sits my friend and I at the bar.  After that things seem to roll.  Out waitress was great all food was phenomenal excluding the ceviche.  The double chocolate Popsicle was a great finishing touch.
author: Brian O.

description:
Despite what others have said, I had no trouble getting a table at Nopalito, and the hostess was in a good mood when I arrived. There were only two of us on a Sunday evening, so perhaps that's the difference from what others have experienced on busier nights. We sat at the communal table and it was quick and enjoyable all-around.

The BF and I shared a bunch of small plates. We loved the tomales most of all. The taquitos were also delicious and there's a brussel sprouts quesadilla. Yum. All the food was very flavorful and a little spicy (flavorful spicy, not hot spicy for no reason). Four small plates between us was enough for a good dinner. 

We also had the ginger limeade, which is officially my new favorite drink. So good!
author: Gretchen S.

description:
I went yesterday and I'm craving for some more today. Delicious! Starting with the chips and salsa. 
Great bar menu with different types of tequilas house margaritas is the bomb.
author: Lupe A.

description:
I would give Nopalito 3.5 stars but I'm rounding up.

We came here on a Saturday night around 6, but luckily it wasn't too crowded since there was a 49ers game going on. Our group of 5 opted to share a bunch of plates since nobody was starving. 

totopas con chile - chips with a salsa and cream concoction. It was surprisingly spicy but really good. The chips were especially crispy, just how I like. 

ceviche - this also came with even more chips. The ceviche was made with fish and it was good, but nothing special.

panucho de pollo - tortilla with beans and chicken. If I recall correctly, this dish came with the chicken on the side of the stuffed tortilla, which was a big odd. Definitely one of my fave dishes in terms of flavor nonetheless. 
 
chicken enchiladas- also really good! Excellent flavor mix and not your traditional enchiladas 

Overall the food here was pretty good. The plates are on the smaller side so splitting is a good way to get a sampling. Great ambiance as well! Definitely recommend for someone visiting the bay
author: Sally E.

description:
Nopalito has really grown on me.  I think the secret is to explore the menu and order outside of your comfort zone.  Though the carnitas are a standby favorite. The menu is pretty diverse and the brief explanations of the entrees don't always do them justice. The ambiance is lively and the drinks are great.

I would give Nopalito 5 stars, it's just that the hosts tend to be a little flakey.  I've been told things like, "The wait is 45 minutes, but the kitchen might be closed." I've also received texts saying my table is ready, only to find out when I arrive that it is a shared table.  They seem to get pretty overwhelmed when there a few people trying to get on the waiting list. 

After my friend and I went to different Nopalito locations to meet for dinner, I learned the Sunset location is significantly less busy.  The dining area isn't quite as nice as the Broderick location, but the food is just as good and I think the service is actually a little better.
author: M R.

description:
I'm not sure why I never re-reviewed this place. Pricey, yes, but that's SF! I don't know what I was thinking.

Now that I don't live in that big beautiful city anymore, this is the one restaurant I find myself craving. I loved everything about it...the location, the parking, the freakin' totopos, the enchiladas with mole...hell, even their popsicles are fanastic! I could bring my dog and not have to sit out in the cold and their margaritas were heavy on the booze and extremely delicious.
author: Jasmyn M.

description: Great food, ideal for brunch. Good service. A bit crowded on the weekends but more manageable than a lot of SF brunch places.
author: Kevin K.

description: it should be illegal for chilaquiles to be this good. tip: get a double shot of espresso from Peet's and dump it into their amazing horchata for a dirty horchata. You're welcome.
author: Kari Jo M.

description: Fun little place to try out that's not too expensive for San Francisco. Lots of flavor in every dish and well thought-out combinations. Perfect place to stop by after a walk in nearby Golden Gate Park.
author: Philip L.

description:
I had a spicy jalapeno beer and she had death and taxes, a dark beer. The carnitas was tender and melted in your mouth. It came with tangy yummy coleslaw and green salsa. The carne asada was thinly sliced but the sauce was nice. 

Small and nice atmosphere. No reservations but I called an hour ahead and they seated us quickly. I would come again. The patio on the way in was super toasty.
author: Marty J.

description: I love the food here, tried the vegetarian quesadilla with Brussels sprouts and the chips. The guac tastes super fresh. The desserts here are really great too, give the dark chocolate and lemon Popsicle a shot!
author: Manasvi S.

description:
Great ambiance, friendly staff, delicious food.  The servers could be a little quicker to attend and take orders.  The brussel sprout quesadilla is killer and the carnitas are so so so good - a reason why they were on the list for the 100 things to eat in SF.

Call ahead and get on the wait list so your table is ready when you arrive as the place is popular.
author: Chad S.

description:
Fancy Mexican food is like.. Chevy's, right? No? Oh, well then...

I haven't been wow'ed by a restaurant in quite some time now. Well.. WOW.

First off, the cocktails were delicious. The smokiness in their mezcal made for one of the best cocktails, ever.

Every dish we had was awesome. The sauced up chips (Totopos con chile) reminded me of the chilaquiles from the Ferry Bldg Farmers Market; the fish taco had a light, flaky batter on the fish and the tasted very fresh; the carnitas were juicy on the inside and also had some nice crispy charred pieces on the outside and had tons of flavor; everything was just super good. My favorite dish? The quesadilla con rojo chicharron. It was more like a giant taco or something than your standard quesadilla.. but wow. Imagine juicy, well-marinated, melt-in-your-mouth pork belly inside your quesadilla... yes, I'm drooling as I type this.

Definitely going back!
author: Kazu O.

description:
It's difficult to judge a place off of only one dish, but I'm doing it anyway. I had the Tamal de Rajas con Queso (i.e. a vegetarian tamale). It was fine but nothing super special. I thought it could have used more "stuff" either on the inside or more salsa on the top. 

My dining companion and I arrived at 5:30 and it was nice and empty, but the place was packed by 6:15 or 6:30

Service and ambiance were both good.
author: Sydney L.

description:
Jesus. The food is delicious. I could have drown myself in the Totopos con Chile (Tortilla chips, salsa de arbol, cotija cheese, onions, cilantro, crema and lime). 

I actually thought - How come I never have made chips like this? It seems so simple but it's SO DAMN GOOD. 

We also had the potato taquitos, fish tacos and almond milk horchata. Outstanding, all of it. Simple, fresh and bursting with flavor. Our server was alright, seemed a little antsy and preoccupied, but regardless it was well worth the visit.
author: Dana W.

description: Went on a Tuesday night and was surprised to find it packed with a 30 minute wait. We sat in the atrium, good service and really killer, Nuevo-Mexicano fusion food that is close to the original but with slight tweaks that make it even better. Better for couples and small groups. I love authentic Mexican food in Mexico and this is the next stage as far as I am concerned. Will certainly be back!
author: Prescott B.

description: This is a great brunch spot. I love sitting at the chef's counter and watching the action in the kitchen. They also serve yummy boquerones (small cookie bites) at the end of every meal. A fun SF experience!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Friendly, prompt service. Had a mole chicken and rice that was very tasty. Even better were the chicken enchiladas.
Love that they use real ingredients and preparations that are not what you'd find in your run if the mill Mexican restaurant. 
Do yourself a favor and get a pitcher of margaritas while you're there too!
author: R M.

description:
Hola Nopalito's bathroom!!

You son of a bitch, how has no one dedicated a yelp review just to you and your eccentricity yet?
