Sure, some (read: a shit ton of bitches) have been all, "Oh Nopalito, minus a star bc your bathroom is outside."  And yeah... hey, thanks friends for stating the obvious.  You should yelp more often.  People could really benefit from a dozen of you regurgitating the same fact and hitting them with some architect knowledge.  Cool.

NO THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE LOVERS LISTENING IN.  Nopalito, my little chiquita banana, I know what happened here.  Your owner is the owner a lonely heartito.  He scans craigslist missed connections in the wee hours of the morning, living vicariously through "red-haired girl on the N-Judah" and "we made out at Public Works."  He fucking lives for that shit.  It's damn near the lifeblood of his juju in the service industry.

Then one night, he's all, "But soft! I have an idea!"  He decides to create the quirkiest setting for a constant stream (GETIT) of missed connections - never to be posted, but always to be pondered in retrospect.  He decides to tear his restaurant up.  Hallway to the loo?  DON'T NEED ONE.  Randomly placed to-go counterita?  GOTTA HAVE IT.  Make customers get up and exit, in all their buzzed glory, to go stand inside/outside waiting for one bathroom?  YUP.  GONNA DO THAT.

"What will they say to each other?"  They asked him as he decided not two, but one bathroom was the magic number for his equation.  Why, morons, do you even have to ask:

THEY'RE ALL GONNA TALK ABOUT HOW WEIRD THE BATHROOM IS!!

And they do.  They stand there in the line, holding "it" and the door open (or keeping it closed (depending on which side of THAT political spectrum you fall on)), and just talk their fucking asses off about the sitch they find their asses in, moments before said asses mount porcelain. And sometimes they think they're kinda cute and it's borderline all she wrote in a craigslist post.  But then the romance dies immediately because they share a pee pee place and, come on... might as well put the NOP(e) in  any Nopalito missed connection at that point.  Really flushing the hubba hubba factor out on that one.

But it's cool.  I see you you little baño.  This one is dedicated to you.
author: Keeks K.

description:
States they are authentic Mexican food.  Relaxed Environment, comfortable lots of windows to watch the world around you and clean.
Reasonable price and friendly staff.
Portions smaller than expected - more like a tapas menu.
Next to Peets coffee
author: Nick W.

description:
Featuring local, organic, and sustainable ingredients, Nopalito is not your typical hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant.  While staying true to the traditional Mexican flavors, Nopalito uses imagination and interesting ingredients to endow its dishes with a contemporary California flair.  

Nopalito is popular, and the place can be super-crowded, so patrons should be prepared for a wait at peak dinner hours.  The host maintains a list of names and will even ring you on your cell phone when your turn comes, should you decide to wait in a nearby bar.  

Upon entering, diners can choose between a covered "outdoor" area (like a sun room with heat lamps), a few indoor tables, or a bar overlooking the prep area/kitchen.  The bar is where the action is:  you will be treated to watching the fresh tortillas being made by hand, the organic vegetables being skillfully chopped, and the components of each dish being arranged just so.

Once seated, diners are treated to complimentary dried spiced garbanzo beans, which cry out for a margarita to wash them down.  The menu is divided into small plates sized for one person and larger paltes perfect for sharing.

Piquant and tasty, the panucho de pollo al pibil ($4.50) features citrus-achiote chicken on tortilla stuffed with black beans, cabbage, pickled red onion, and salsa habanera.  With fresh rock cod and calamari, the ceviche verde de pescado y calamare ($10.00) combines lime, tomatillo, jalapeño, cilantro, and avocado into a light, citrusy treat.  While the sesame seeds were a little our of place, the mole poblano con pollo ($14.00) was still quite delicious with a rich, dark sauce of toasted chiles, chocolate, cinnamon, nuts, and onions served over a seared chicken breast on a bed of rice.

Mostly attentive and friendly, the waitstaff was also very knowledgeable about the dishes and ingredients.  The wine list is minimal, so it is advisable to stick with cerveza or margaritas.

A true gem in NOPA, Nopalito offers a down to earth take on traditional Mexican cooking.
author: CJ G.

description: That's it. I'm done trying. This place doesn't take reservations. For the third time, we tried to eat here. We were braced for a wait, each time but a two hour wait? That's not a wait, that's a raised middle finger in the direction of their customers. Nestled in a parking lot of a largely residential area, you can't talk a walk and hang elsewhere while waiting. I mean, I guess you could, but you need to walk a mile or so before getting to other businesses. Most people sit huddled in front of the grocery store, hoping they will be lucky enough to eat their food. I've had the take out, and it is tasty. This is the only reason I've come back three times. But I've never seen a place with such a disregard for customers. I'd just skip it.
author: Bob R.

description:
Really cute place and always busy! They pay attention to the little things here - cute little book menus, munchies before you order, water in individual jugs and lighting/decor - everything built up to a really nice dining experience.

Starting with drinks - the sangria is yummy here. Wish it had some fruit bits in it though! Those make sangria for me. Next time, I'd like to try one of the cocktails because they sounded really good.

I had the quesadilla rojas con chicharron - mostly because I was really excited at the idea of being able to have a GOOD quesadilla on a corn tortilla (I can't eat gluten so big flour tortilla quesadillas are off limits to me). It was a bit small for an entree but really delicious so I'd definitely recommend it. These are tapas after all! Just order as a small dish or with a taco on the side. For those that are gluten-free I have no adverse reactions to report! :)

My boyfriend had the carne asada. It was delicious and the portions were a bit larger. I recommend this one as well.

Looking forward to trying other things on the menu!
author: Alli Q.

description:
Really good Mexican food with a twist. Ended up making a meal out of 5 appetizers (shared with 1 other person) and really enjoyed the experience. Each dish was brought individually, with the next not arriving until completing the first. The pitcher of margarita was pretty tasty, and a great deal. 

Took advantage of calling ahead and there was a table ready within 5 minutes of arriving. Service was friendly, but the noise level was high. Nothing intimate about this place, but not a big deal if that isn't what you're looking for. Looking forward to going back and trying some main dishes.
author: Jacobus B.

description:
You people are high as a kite in your continued raving about this place.

PROS:  Interior decor, atmosphere, clean
CONS:  Overpriced compared to portions served, long wait, servers are inexperienced with dishes being served.

I think it's the last part of the CONS that really turns me off about the place.  The second time that I had come here for a dinner of party of 7, the restaurant had initially refused to take reservation over the phone (don't know if it was because of the Saturday night factor, or that it was a party of 7?)  but when we showed up the waitress was taking reservation... eh?  Whatever, we're okay with waiting for 45 minutes.  No reason to depress the mood.

The waitress surely was nice, but she could not portion out the meals for our table when we suggested that we'd like to order many different dishes for share.  Needless to say, we ordered maybe 9 dishes and they were just not enough... we ended up ordering 3 more plates afterwards and there was a pause between the meal, which was an addition to the long serving time we were enduring to begin with.
It really highlighted the fact that they don't know how to portion out the meals here, or that they haven't found a good way to group it up on the menu (shouldn't be presented as a la carte)

*Just as a side note, I probably the biggest person at the table weighing in at 180 lbs, and everyone else were petite Asians weighing in at an average 130 lbs.
**Other than the portion-related lag, service was just fine.

EDIT:  Bumped to 2 stars on the basis that 1.5 stars should round up...
author: Eugene L.

description:
Lately my friends and I've been dining family style.  We did the same today at lunch.  This provides the advantage of trying more items.  

Portion sizes are small so this may not work if you're the hungry type.

We shared:
*fish taco - cut into three little pieces, very good.
*empanada - cut into three pieces, also good.
*carnitas - ample portion size to share.  Hearty.  Came with corn tortillas.
*mole enchilada - two of them so able to share.  Little on the sweet side.

We enjoyed everything we tried.

Sparkling water is on the house if you're interested.  I had the berry valencia orange beverage instead.  O.K. but wouldn't order again.

Total tax&tip $55.00.
author: Shirley N.

description: Food was definitely 5/5 the carnitas are a must. Should call and make a reservation about an hour ahead, we didn't and had to wait until about the 45 minute mark until the hostess told us there was seating at the bar if we wanted to go sit there? Would have been nice to know beforehand that's all. The wait staff were also a bit sluggish, but maybe I'm just being over critical. The food lives up to all the reviews though!!
author: Gage B.

description:
Amazing Mexican food! Had a dinner at Nopalito a couple weeks ago when a friend had come to visit. Originally I wanted to go to Nopa, but we had a late reservation so we decided to check out Nopalito.

Food:
The food was delicious! We ordered:

Carne Asada Con Chorizo Y Papas - Tender and flavorful!
Quesadilla Roja Con Chicharrón - Crispy and tasty!
Civiche - Super fresh!

Service: 
Servers were great, friendly and attentive. No complaints.

Ambiance:
Intimiate and quiet. A good place for a date of to catch up with friends.

I will definitely be back!
author: Richard P.

description:
I have this thing where I resist enjoying mexican food when it looks to bourgeois but my friend Dan is way in to their carnitas and i have to admit it's some damn good carnitas. 

The chilaquiles and totopo are ok but really you should just be getting the carnitas and nothing else.
author: Misha T.

description:
I really like Nopalito.  My girlfriend and I had an excellent meal here.  They don't take reservations, but they do accept call-ins to the waiting list.  I'd recommend doing that, as it gets really busy most nights.  That's what I did, and we were seated in less than 5 minutes on a weekend night.

It's a pretty cool spot- we got bar seats with a front seat view of the kitchen...and the bar.  I can see how some might be turned off slightly as it's a bit different and kind of combines two different areas into one.  But I think it's fine, and ambiance is lively.

We started with a couple margaritas which were great. They have a nice selection of cocktails.  We ate totopos to start, which were memory-worthy.  Basically they're like thick homemade doritos with crema, cheese, salsa, etc. on top.  Unbelievable.  We also got the tamale which was very good.  For mains, we got the carnitas and the shrimp enchiladas, both of which get two thumbs up.

I'm a big fan of Nopalito, and am eagerly awaiting my next visit.
author: Will A.

description:
This place is busy busy busy. On a Friday or Saturday night you better get there early or put your name on the list because by 6 pm, you may not get a chance to dine here.

The food is pretty authentic Mexican (take that with a grain of salt since I'm not expert on Mexican food) and less so Tex-Mex. It's delicious though. The carnitas are well cooked and like everyone has said already, the pork is tender and well seasoned.

Parking is easy - they have a parking garage underneath or above ground and it's free...something that's rare in this city.
author: Julia P.

description:
Yummy, yummy, yummy! This is little expensive for Mexican food but great of you're craving authentic food. The portions are perfect if you can't make up your mind on what you want to get. I usually get to times and a yummy agua fresca. 

I love that they have a separate to go area. They are busy with a bit of a wait and the parking lot is tiny. Parking is hard to find as it's a busy area in the city.
author: Liliana C.

description: Sorry so disappointed not Mexican food I'm use to eating no flavor and the service was terrible
author: Marla B.

description:
It's been awhile since I've gone back to Nopalito and their menu hasn't changed. Some of my favorites were still good - Totopos con Chile mind you the sauce is quite spicy but good, tacos with marinated pork very tender meat, tamal asado de rajas wasn't too dry or had too much masa but not the best I've had. 
We did explore the menu to cover all meats available and tried the ceviche but was unimpressed as it didn't taste fresh, there wasn't much fish, had too much onions. We also tried the Mole Poblano con pollo and that dish was good. You could taste the chocolate essence in the sauce and the Chicken was very tender, a good dish. Unfortunately we couldn't appreciate this dish as we were quite full from the remaining menu. 
Overall the service is good, call in before to reserve a table so you don't have to wait in the cold as there isn't a bar area. This is place you go once in a blue moon not a frequent repeat for me.
author: Harshal V.

description:
my friend and i came here and tried the ceviche, fish tacos and carnitas.  i must say that the chips here are very good, and i can only imagine how good the nachos are.  

the carnitas was a big portion of meat and quite delicious as well.
author: Helen T.

description: Funky, chic, cool!  And good food too!  Tried both locations.  Totopos are delicious.  The carnitas were so good.  Pickled slaw with jalapeños, cabbage and carrots was ummmm ummmm good.  $21 for carnitas!  Pricey but hey, we're in SF. Service is excellent.  Carne  asada was done just right.  Lots of eye candy for all inclinations.
author: Paul M.

description: Hands down the best Mexican food I've ever had! Got lucky and there were open seats at the bar so we didn't have to wait an hour and a half to be seated, from there we were able to see a lady making fresh corn tortillas which were to die for by the way! Ordered chips and salsa for an appetizer that are coated in a red sauce and then smothered in cheese, so good! For dinner I ordered some carne asada tacos that were served with cactus and the freshly made tortillas... The meat was so flavorful and tender, best carne I've ever had! Can't wait to come back, best dining experience I had while in SF!
author: Alisha W.

description: I'm so mad because we spent a lot of money here (we had a party of 9 people), unanimously voted that the food wasn't good. The drinks were awful. Was it just us who got the bad batch of food or was the sous chef on vacation or called in sick??? Then I think the people who rated this place highly must be crazy. I'm sorry. I'm just saying.
author: J C.

description: I would not go back. Who runs out of guacamole at 7:30? Our waiter was rude and we paid for $38 for a small pitcher of margaritas that had a lot of ice. I was not impressed and disappointed. I wanted to like the place given all the hype. Go other places it is not worth it.
author: Jill H.

description:
We got really lucky with a parking spot right in front and no wait inside. 
Our server was very attentive and was able to make interesting recommendations from the menu. We ordered the taquitos to start and I just wish they gave us more! They were delicious and had all the right toppings. 
I also highly recommend the quesidilla and carnitas (we split both). Quesidilla had a great twist to it and was packed with ingredients. Carnitas was cooked to perfection.
I want to come back to try their fancy cocktails!
author: Alisha K.

description:
I've been wanting to try Nopalito (NOPA's Mexican Cousin down the street) again for awhile, so when GF asked "so what are we doing tonight".... I immediately asked her to meet me here.   

She and I had what amounted to a perfect evening of Sangria, (punctuated with Smoky Mescal), Ceviche and Mole Poblano al Pollo.     The Sangria is worthy of mention by itself.    They make it with Absinthe and it's wonderfully smooth and tart...perfect with gourmet Mexican. 

The Ceviche was excellent, but a tad on the bland side.   I found the Mole Sauce to be  great, but could have been a tad more chocolatey.   

But all in all GF and I had a wonderful, intimate evening of great food and terrific service at Nopalito.

Get there early....it gets packed quickly on weekends and they don't take reservations.   I had the Lady get there at 6:00 and She and I were seated quickly, but we missed the big rush only by the skin of our teeth.
author: Max K.

description: Our experience was just okay. Our total for 2 people was 100.00 and the food was just okay. My husband ordered the pork, while it was very tender it had zero flavor. The flow of the resteraunt is also confusing.
author: Erica H.

description: Coming to nopalito for lunch was a good experience, a lot of their dishes are very traditional and the flavors are definitely authentic, me and my partner shared the empanada, mole enchiladas and huarache, my favorite was the huarache I thought the meat they used was very good and I loved the fact that they used blue corn masa. Mole enchiladas were also good, mole had a nice balance of sweet and spicy., and the empanada was also good but not my favorite, to drink I had a Michelada, I appreciate the fact that they were trying to create something different, however I felt there was something missing. I would definitely come back to try some more items.
author: Mario T.

description: This is me and my fiancé's favorite Mexican food restaurant when we visit from Monterey Bay! With every visit, we have been met with nothing but the best service. After recently visiting Mexico City, this restaurant really takes our taste buds back to the authentic Mexican food flavor. With an extensive range of Mezcal and Tequila, you can never go wrong with anything you choose.
author: Mariano M.

description:
Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city because of the almost completely gluten-free menu and affordable eats. Only two or three items were off limits because of added beer or just flour.  Being pretty gluten sensitive and out of about 5 visits here, I've still had not one issue.  

Now the food, amaaazingly refreshing! I love the fish ceviche to start and it's some of the best I've had. The quesadillas were tasty and the "Huevos de Caja" was my favorite on the menu. Everything was fresh, didn't drown in grease, wasn't too heavy, and the service was snappy. I'll definitely be back.
author: Ej S.

description:
Nopalito is another restaurant recommendation check marked off SF's 7x7 list. Yessss!

This time around it calls for the carnitas as a "serious" must try. It's so serious that it made it on their list of 100-places-to-try-before-you-die type of serious.  

Blame the seriousness on the Triple T's:

*Tender: The carnitas were delicately and deliciously tender. You can tell that it's been slow roasted and marinated in its own juices. Cutting through it w/ a knife was effortless & the meat just fell right through. Each bite was perfect, juicy, and had that right amount of fat to it. Certainly not a dish to indulge in on the daily, but something you can easily reward yourself w/ after a great workout or heck, just to have. (Thanks for the recommendation, 7x7!)

*Tequila- Ohhhhhh, the tequila. I tried the mezcal de oaxaca, which is basically an unfiltered tequila. I opted for the del maguey tobala- which is the most fruitful & luscious of their list. It sounded like a mouthful so I just had to try it. Unlike other tequila, you had to "sip" it rather than "shoot it". Really, sip tequila? 

*Terrific- terrific food, terrific service, terrific ambiance, and just plain terrific.

Bottom line: I was very impressed with the carnitas. They were delicious and I will definitely come back here for it.

An additional T, for Tips:
*The restaurant tends to get crowded. You can call ahead to put your name on the wait list.
*There is both indoor/outdoor seating available.
*Use the bathroom inside the grocery store next door, in case the restaurant's single bathroom is occupied. (You have to ask one of the grocery workers for a pass code.)
author: Joy A.

description: Big fan of their take out window! Super prompt and courteous service. Loved that they threw in a little tea cookie for dessert, too. Will have to be back to try the restaurant!
author: Tasha D.

description: I like this place. Prefer brunch but dinner also tickles my fancy. I'm coming here tonight again. See you there. I like to finish the night off by going next door to the gourmet grocery store and getting a molasses cookie. They're right in front by the registers. If they're all gone it's because I ate them all. Cookie Monster.
author: Kevin R.

description: If you have doubts about the 'Mexican-for-gabachos' formula, this place will do very little to dispel them. The food is fine, but not exciting, and not worth the cost. Pro tip: try the Michelada--if you hate yourself, and want something disgusting in your mouth.
author: sellMyFing n.

description:
I must admit, I am a pretty anal person when it comes to food. I am a sucker for good taste, but I also prefer to eat healthy whenever possible. Is that too much to ask? So when it comes to something super savory like carnitas, I'm aware that the pork shoulder is one of the fattiest cuts of meat you can eat, and that the typical preparation of carnitas is to fry it before it is served, which adds flavor but more oil and fat as well. I've gone so far as to call all of my favorite Mexican restaurants ahead of time to ask them how they prepare their carnitas before deciding whether or not to order it or the grilled chicken there. So when I called Nopalito to ask them how they prepare their carnitas I was pleasantly surprised to learn that they braise it a citrus marinade for 8 hours which slowly tenderizes the meat and locks the flavors in. The pork they serve is not organic, but it's all natural and hormone and antibiotic free. Once the dish was in front of me, it also helps to notice that they wrap the serving in paper which further absorbs the grease. The carnitas goes super well with the green tomatillo sauce, I ended up doubling up on the sauce as it's fresh tasting and not overly spicy. One thing I think would be nice if it you could order a side of guacamole or avocado with the dish that would also be another nice complement, otherwise the corn tortillas are served nice and warm. 

One note: This place gets super busy at dinner time and it's highly recommended to call beforehand and put your name on the list since they don't take reservations. It helps a lot that they have parking because the Nopa area is notorious for not having any street parking. I've also come back for lunch before when it's not as busy and fun to sit in the sun room, and also have called ahead for take out when I just want a simple meal to bring back home.
author: Mark Y.

description:
A gem in our neighborhood!  Excellent flavors, we love the small plates to share, so you get a lot of variety. 
It is hard to get in as they don't take reservations but nice that you can call ahead to put your name on the waiting list.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Very unique Mexican food.  Very delicious!!!  We got the carnitas as the main dish and they were excellent....lots of meat and lots of flavor.  Appetizers were all great as well.
author: Eddie K.

description:
I could just have nachos for dinner. Screw it, I'm getting the nachos for dinner!

The blue bottle coffee + shortbread cookies are laced with awesomeness. Perfection.
author: Tejal D.

description: Try the carnitas and the smashed shrimp. You'll be glad you did!
author: Cat M.

description:
Definitely a fan.  I was introduced to this spot by my aunt, who is a gourmand and has an exceptional nose for good places to eat.  I live on the other side of town, so getting here is a slight hassle, but I dont hold that against them because there is a parking lot right next door, very convenient.  

We got a few different dishes and shared, I liked the chilaquiles and the empanada.  My dad got the torta and loved it.  

Great service and I really like the atmosphere.  

Would def recommend.
author: Miss F.

description:
I love Nopalito! 
Healthy fresh, locally sourced & fantastically flavorful authentic dishes!
Bring back the Panucho de Pollo PLEASE!!!
My favorite gluten free & healthy (love the cabbage) dish is gone!!

SAY IT ISNT SO!!!
Please stop me from gathering up a petition to bring the Panucho back!
It may also be a bit embarrassing to stand out front with a big "Bring Panucho Back" sign, so please don't let it come to that!
Love you guys!!
PANUCHO DE POLLO or bust!!
author: Danielle B.
Tina F.

description:
Not your standard beans and rice Mexican fare.  Wonderful, fresh and seasonal ingredients make up their always flavorful dishes.  (Thank goodness the carnitas and tototpos are always in season!) 

It can be tough to get in for dinner, but the wait is worth it.  Or opt for take out, they do a great job packing it up hot and quick.

My only complaint is that the service can be hit or miss.  Sometimes they're downright surly or just forget to check back.  I know they're a busy group, but you can be busy with a smile.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I like that this place has a parking and a really nice wait staff.

My friend reserved two tables that sit 6 ppl each. The hostess went out of her way to make it so that we could sit 12 people at  once. However, we had to wait an extra 30 min for this happen. 

The waitress was nice. I liked her recommendation of the lingcod stew (bacalao). It was quite delicious. The fish was nicely cooked and the stew didn't have a strong seafood taste. Some people remarked that it tasted like salsa, but I don't agree.

The totopos con chile was alright. The dish tasted like the complimentary corn nuts they give out.

I didn't like the carnitas. I found the meat really dry. 

The ceviche was okay. 

The margaritas were strong. 

FYI, the caldo tlalpeño is a SOUP. someone ordered it without knowing and was thoroughly disappointed. The dish is described as chicken consommé, and not everyone knows that consommé is a soup.
author: Margaret R.

description:
My first attempt to eat at Nopalito was a few months ago. We showed up and the wait was 1.5 hours. Nope! We decided to chance it on a Sunday evening, and this time we were only given a 30 minute estimated wait time... which is a vast improvement! Also, it ended up only being around 10 minutes since we got to scoop up 2 seats at one of the larger family-style tables. 

My drink was incredible. It was a sparkling white wine with mint and lemonade. Oh man. One of the best drinks I've had in this fab city. 

For dinner, I ordered the mole poblano con pollo. Now, I don't know about other Mexicans (or, half-Mexicans), but in my family the mole is always spicy. At least a little bit. And that's what I was looking forward to. Instead, nothing. It was really bland. The thing that saved this dish for me was the amazingly tender chicken. Two thumbs up there. My partner-in-crime had the pozole and it was amazing. I'm totally ordering that next time.

All in all, I really liked Nopalito. The atmosphere was really friendly and fun, and I got really good vibes from all of our servers and the bartender. I will definitely be back.
author: Tatiana J.

description:
Met up with some old homies here for dinner a week ago... pretty busy when we got there, couldn't make reservations, but my friend was able to call ahead and put us on the list.

The service was great... the drinks were priced right... but the food.

I got the mole something or other... and quite frankly, I wasn't too excited about it. I cleaned my plate, as a good boy should, and even polished off the gf's carnita place as well.

But, I wasn't impressed.

And maybe it's because I grew up in the Bay, went to school in San Diego, and worked for almost three years in the taqueria capital of the (my) world -- Redwood City, but I can't rationalized paying $20/head for mexican food... no matter how happy the grass-fed cows are or how happy the organic stalks of corn were swaying in the wind... it's the same reason why I will never suggest going to PF Chang's.
author: Victor C.

description: After being rejected from NOPA and recommended to go here instead, we had a good meeting over lunch. Smaller portions than usual in America, a decent price and very good service rounded out the experience.
author: Hasan D.

description:
"Did I just order another fish taco?"-me 

For only being in SF for 9 months I can honestly say that Nopalito is my go-to, scream from the rafters, favorite spot in the city. I havent had everything on the menu but I feel pretty confident that its all damn good! 

Some standouts-The fish taco, shrimp enchiladas, the short ribs and the mighty tasty Diablo. Ohh and Totopos con Chile :) my lips are burning already just thinking of those yummy chips.
author: Antonia L.

description:
It's like a Mexican tapas restaurant. 

The food is prepared and presented very well, very appetizing to the eyes.

The drinks were spot on. It's a mostly tequila place and the concoctions are very creative.

My friend and I were fortunate to get a table in relative short order, I hear the wait time can be long. But, once you're inside, you'll have a pleasant experience.
author: John M.

description:
Sweet Potato tamale was really good! I've tried many types and this version was good take on tamale. 

Carnitas was very meaty and soft. Good flavor.
author: Yude S.

description:
This place is awesome.  I have now been 4 times, for lunch and dinner, alone and with others, and each time was consistently great.  I had lunch at a communal table once when in the area and the service was quick and the food was great, so it didn't feel strange at all to be eating alone.  

For dinner, I love sharing their dishes since its so hard to choose (hard to list the best dishes since honestly everything we have had has been good).  The margaritas are also delicious.  If you like ginger, ask the bartender to give you a shot of the ginger concoction to add to yours, really adds a nice kick/sweetness.

I also love that they give you the little dessert bite with your check.  Also impressive that they let you call ahead to put your name on the list (take advantage of this, even if you are having an early dinner - they get busy quick).  Parking is also easy since there's a nice market next door with a parking garage behind.

All in all, they have got it down.  We will come back again and again!
author: Nicole D H.

description: Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had. The Seviche is amazing. I would also recommend the Flan.
author: Jaime A.

description:
We went to Nopalito yesterday (a Saturday) evening before 7 pm:

- Food was 8/10. 
- Service was 8/10.
- The hostess was 1/10. And this is very important when a restaurant does not take reservations, because you have no choice than to go through her to get seated. 

She completely miscalculated our wait-time, told us the wait will be 45 minutes but it took one and a half hours. Eventually offered us a small communal table, and said we would have to wait another hour to get our own table. 

She was also very unprofessional, kept looking at her ipad when people spoke with her, did not apologize about the wrong estimation of our wait-time, put people on hold on the phone indefinitely, gave fake smiles and robotic answers instead of communicating respectfully.

Overall, her attitude was something in between that of a club bouncer and the cranky assistant at your doctor's office. This is not a good first impression for a restaurant.
author: dorna b.

description:
The hostess tonight was AWFUL. She was rude and disorganized. We called to be put on the list and she said it would be a 30 minute wait. When we arrived, she had lost our name on the list so she took down our name again after insisting we must have called the other restaurant location. Then after looking again when we showed her the text confirming our call to the correct location, she found our name and said it was another 45 minutes. After 45 minutes, she said it was another 20 minutes.  

Finally we were seated after an hour and a half wait and ordered carnitas (very delicious), the corn dish (tasted just like canned corn with some unmelted cheese-- no one liked this dish), the empanada (the shell was dry and tasteless) and some other appetizers that were not memorable.   Except for the carnitas, nothing tasted that good. Boring at best.  It was extremely loud and crowded and NOT a relaxed nor enjoyable experience for an end-of-the-week dinner. My friend noted we had to shout at each other the entire time to be heard and tables are communal and packed really close. The server was nice and pleasant, though.

Parking was $10.  At the end of the meal, I got a text saying my table was ready (for the second time we put down our name). Two hours later.  I've lived in SF for 6 years and know all about small, crowded, popular no-reservation restaurants.  All I am saying is be honest about the wait time and be worth the wait food-wise (hello, little star pizza down the street).
author: Kari L.

description: Tried their chorizo and brisket gordita from their tent at OTG Picnic at Presidio. The meats and flavor within the tortilla complemented each other - a bit of smokiness and spiciness. However, the corn tortilla took away from the entire gordita. It was way too thick and bit soggy from all meat juices.
author: Michelle L.

description: The Totopos. That's all you need to know. They make the spicy red sauce with locally sourced chilies, so you never know how spicy it's going to be. Man...it was "pico" but boy, was it so delicious. I have never had anything like that in my life, and I find myself craving them constantly, which is a problem, because I live out of state. I can't even tell you how hard it is for me to resist the urge to splurge on a plane ticket just for those. Also, the Carnitas are just......heaven. Really. I don't want to go to Heaven unless that plate of carnitas is there. The meat just melted in your mouth, and the flavor was out of this world. Not to mention the fact that the drinks are excellent.
author: LeeAnn C.

description: Nopalito was awesome! We got the carnitas which are phenomenal and the fish tacos which were super good as well. The staff was really friendly. We would definitely go back!
author: D J.

description:
The carnitas is out of this world! I am spoiled with good mexican food having lived in the mission for a number of years. Nopalito really impressed me. I was dreading a trip to the DMV (right across the street) but discovering this gem made it worth the pain of dealing with DMV incompetence. 

The server was super friendly and the food came out almost to fast(I was seated at 12:30 so peak lunch time hour).

I am defintly coming back!
author: patrick b.

description:
I've been to Nopalito twice and am generally impressed with the food.  The first time I went we ordered the totopos con chile which was really good.  Kind of like chilaquiles but w/o the eggs; I love that just softened but still crispy in the middle thick tortilla chip bite.  Good balanced flavors.

For my entree, I had the chicken mole enchiladas.  This version is just a touch sweeter than I expected it to be, but I could tell that the chef(s) but hours of love into that mole.  The chicken was tender and flavorful as well. No complaints.

The pozole, however, was a disappointment.  The broth really lacked depth and needed something to boost its yummy factor.  I didn't get a sense that the broth was made from slow-simmering veggies and protein for several hours; rather, it tasted like it was made in the last half hour.

The next time I went, I knew I had to try the carnitas.  Oh man, am I happy I did.  You see, I love pork.  If I had to pick one protein to eat the rest of my life, I would pick pork in all its glorious forms, carnitas being one of them.  This had great natural pork flavor and the crispy outside with just enough fattiness still remaining.  I could eat it for days.  It also doesn't look like a lot but it's plenty of food, which is great.

The pozole was a miss when I first went, but the other dishes I tried were great.  I love me some Mexican food and surely if I'm in the area Nopalito will be on my "to do/eat" list.
author: Naoko M.

description:
AVOID. I had a terrible experience at this place. I walked over from Mt. Zion after spending most of the day waiting for my spouse to get out of surgery, so my hope was to have a drink, a couple of courses, read for awhile, and decompress. As they say, the best laid plans of mice and men....Anyway, I arrived at 4PM to a mostly empty place. Someone shouted from the bar to "sit anywhere," and as I was just about to sit at a large table (the only place that didn't have direct sun) the waitron informed me that I was sitting at a group table that I would have to share if someone demanded to sit there, Um, it was 4PM and the place was empty. Oh yeah, and "hello" to you, too. I ordered a margarita--which was a good drink--and the manager actually came over and closed some of the window shades, which was helpful and nice.

But the waitperson was not warm or professional--what an attitude!  I ordered the appetizer fish taco ($5) which is a 2-3 oz piece of fish. It was okay--the texture was good, but not a lot of flavor. The tortilla was chewy in not a good way. Two bites into my app, my entree arrived. When I noted the timing, the waitperson sighed deeply and said, "I guess I can keep it in the oven for you." Blech. I was not happy, but frankly didn't trust her to take my food out of my sight. They certainly were not going to refire the dish. So the two chips in 3 oz of refried beans and the two enchiladas sat for about 4 minutes while I finished my app. Not much queso on the enchilada and the mole was sweet--very, very sweet and not a lot of depth of flavor. This tortilla was even chewier. On my third bite,  I bit into a big chicken bone. How did they miss that? 

I called the manager over, who couldn't have been more understanding--and she did the right thing with regards to the bill.  I was going to chalk it up to weird timing and a bad day in the kitchen. I don't think the waitperson is trainable (I literally grew up in a restaurant and have known waitresses all my life). As I was leaving the waitperson said, in a sarcastic voice, "have a really great rest of your day." Ew.  Avoid this place. A decent margarita, but mediocre food, and bad service.
PS--I wrote this three days later--my spouse has a chronic, life limiting condition, but the pain is mostly managed. Hopefully, he'll be up for another trip to Comal in a few weeks.
author: David C.

description:
Restaurants like Nopalito are arguably one of reasons I live in SF :) Pure bliss from meal start to meal end. 

Both visits have been dining standouts. We've sampled *almost* all of the menu, the carnitas are stellar, as are the quesadillas, and, drum roll please......the TOTOPOS. Seriously, get them. You will not be sorry, you will find and thank me :)

Nopalito is truly a gem.  Insider's tip for weekend dining: do a little math, decide when, at approximately 2 hours from the current time, you will be hungry, call, put your name in.

5+ stars for how they honor your place on the call in list, in person service, and of course, the grub.  I could go on...but please, just go see for yourself!
author: Brianna M.

description: I came here for lunch Sunday and boy did I leave with a happy tummy! The food was amazing! I tried out both locations and the food is equally as good! Highly recommended! Check it out for yourself! Guy Fiery did... ;-)
author: Sue L.

description:
Totally worth the wait! They suggest you get their chips and salsa (more like nachos) but the real move is to get chips with the six salsa sampler. The salsas are out of this world. 

The pulled pork sandwich is salty, savory and über delish! The veggie quesadilla was outstanding and light. This was not "high end Mexican", it was just "great food!"
author: Keith B.

description: Me an my friend went here after she seen it on foodnetwork. she was visiting from NYC. To us it was ok granted she is from Puerto Rico an I'm Cuban so we expected something amazing. But it was kool I guess if you not use to authentic Latin food. it is good food just not what we was expecting
author: Jay Y.

description:
I dropped by tonight to grab some dinner before heading home. Despite it being a weeknight, the place was packed -- I couldn't even manage to talk my way into a seat at the bar. Luckily, the takeout counter beckoned.

Fifteen bucks gets you a fist-sized portion of crisp-on-the-outside, tender-on-the-inside carnitas. The slow-braised pork is fatty and mouth-filling, and served with a cabbage salad (which could have used a touch more acid), perfectly pickled jalapeños and emerald-green tomatillo salsa. 

My one complaint about the takeout counter: Its tiny waiting area is also where diners queue up to go use the facilities. (You know: Where you pee-pee and/or poo-poo.)  As I stood by the counter to await my food, I was accosted by three different people asking whether I was waiting to use the men's room. 

"It's VACANT, you know," a sweaty, red-faced guy said, pointing to the door to the loo. 

"I know," I replied. "I'm not waiting for the restroom. Go ahead."

"GREAT, 'cause I NEED to get something out of my SYSTEM!" 

Which reminds me: Nopalito offers a wide selection of alcoholic beverages.
author: Henry F.

description:
Went here for a date night to try the famous carnitas plate. While the carnitas was was tasty, I didn't think it was amazing. The star of the night was definitely the Totopos con Chile (freshly made chips with a red salsa)! The chips were crispy and the salsa spicy. The cotija cheese and crema helped cool down the spice of the salsa a little bit, but the dish still had a good kick. The portion is very large, but I'd recommend that you try to eat it all because the leftovers did not reheat well.

Another bonus was that Nopalito had Hop Stoopid on tap.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Dear Nopalito,

Your service sucked today. And from what I'm hearing from friends, it's a consistent problem. It all started when we got an appetizer BEFORE our drinks! That's a fatal error, especially considering the fact we ordered two BEERS! They weren't labor intensive drinks, just crack open the can and give me my drink... please/thanks! Next, who is my server? I can appreciate the team effort, but seriously who is taking care of me? Who do I ask when I need something, when we were "helped" by no less than four people?!? 

With that being said, I came to eat not worry about establishing a close relationship with my server.... The "crispy pork belly" quesadilla- sounds good in theory but the execution is poor at best. It's not crispy pork belly! It's basically a shredded pork quesadilla with half ass "chicharones" that weren't even as good as pork rinds out of the bag! Furthermore, what's up with the greasy, seemingly fried tortilla? I will say my lady's torta was pretty damn good, and the carnitas plate looks bomb! Lastly, your michelada tastes like hickory smoke... not sure if that's what your going for but it left me highly bummed :(

Bottom Line- Get your service in check ASAP! I will return and order something different (Carnitas plate!), and then see if I can give you a 4 Star review update that so many feel you deserve. I'm sorry we didn't see eye to eye today, better luck next time?
author: Kevin D.

description: Perfect brunch place; love the eggs over black beans dish, the little cookies at the end of the meal, and the popsicles. Dogs are allowed on the inside patio. Great spot.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Cozy joint, covered outside patio with heat lamps, bar inside. Very packed on a Saturday night. Parking wasn't super difficult, there is a grocery parking lot next door and a lot outside of it (though not sure if it's for the restaurant). Hostess not the friendliest in the world, but service at the table was excellent.

They start you off with fried garbanzo beans, seasoned with some spices - really good! 

We had the following:
-Arroz a la Tumbada - this was the seafood stew with brown rice. Didn't see many reviews on it but decided to try it since I love seafood stews. This was really great - the flavor was not too sour, the seafood was fresh (the white fish was fantastic!), mixed very well with the rice at the bottom, and just went down great on a cold night. Would come back and get this again!

-Carnitas - having not read the review but going by my friend's recommendation, I was quite surprised to see two larges pieces of pork sitting in a paper tray. I was expecting something more shredded and covered in sauce like at my local taco joint. This was cooked very tenderly, lightly seasoned so you could taste the flavor of the meat, and overall was pretty great (especially for someone like me who usually doesn't enjoy pork). Eat it alone or put a little bit of the cabbage salad, jalapeno, and the sauce on it, roll it with the corn tortilla and it's a nice treat. Plus side, the corn tortilla is very finely milled and doesn't leave your fingers smelling like "tacos" all day!

At the end they give you a little almond cookie (like soft shortbread), yum!

Would come back :)
author: Linda L.

description:
I came here last week with my dad after attempting to go to Nopa for lunch and finding out they don't serve lunch. We had a great meal. 

We shared the chicken soup, chicken enchiladas, coffee and a popsicle. Everything seemed to be very fresh and tasted really good. I liked that the restaurant was modern and clean but still comfortable. They gave us little (almond?) cookies with our bill, this was awesome!
author: Chelsea L.

description:
I'm pretty picky about Latin food (upscale and street) and Nopalito delivered some ridiculously delicious plates at more ridiculously reasonable prices.

Carnitas were off the charts muy delicioso. Add a side of grilled corn and see big smiles after every forkful.

Carne Asada was the second best dish of the evening, a beautifully cooked skirt steak with a side of ground beef (surprise!). Great combo.

Enchiladas and Chicken mole were also respectable but were not standout.

The margaritas were a little weak (and they ran out of guacamole!!)  - but overall this was a very good meal with a very good price tag. Not worth the wait that I hear about, but if you can get a table quickly - it's a great spot.
author: Vivi T.

description: Worst restaurant ever! I walk in with my family party of 8 the girls in the front Emily and Alicia receive us with bad attitude and made us feel Discriminated because we are Latinos ...  We got there before a big party of 8 Emily and Alicia sit them down before us .. What a restaurant I'll give them a poor customer service ..
author: Juan M.

description: My fiancé and I came here because we saw this place featured on Triple D & I got to try a sample of their food at the SF Food Festival.  I was a little worried because I read reviews about how shitty the customer service was and I don't care how good food is, if this service is bad I won't go back. However, I must have gone on a good night because the staff was awesome, or food came quickly and it was delicious! Apparently the menu is different based on location, we really went to try the pambosa, but the waiter said it was at the other location. My margarita was a little sweet, but my quesadilla made up for that. Definitely going to try out the other location.
author: Angela C.

description:
When I walked in I was totally confused as to which direction I should go.  I started to wonder whether or not I should seat myself.  Then someone taps the hostess on the shoulder so that she'll acknowledge us.  When your back is turned to me and you're not dressed much differently than your patrons what do you expect me to do?

Anywho. As far as the service goes, the ladies at the door were nice. Very smiley.  My server, Ana, was less so.  When I go out to eat I would love it if you at least pretend to be happy to serve me.  I didn't get that here.  I didn't feel like she was very attentive and she moved sooooo slow.  

I wasn't blown away by the food either.  The reviews had me excited to eat here and I feel like the food is overrated.  My boy had chicken mole which he described as "lifeless."  It was edible though.  I wasn't starving that night so I had ceviche and a taco thingie.  The taco was alright, nothing special.  I felt like the ceviche was very, very boring.  There was nothing special about it.  There was nothing special about this place at all.

This place charges too much for boring food.  After eating, my boy just wanted our check so we could leave already.  

"I'll take it we're never coming back here?"

"Nope."
author: Aralyn A.

description: Love this place, but they don't take reservations and on most evenings the wait is at least 40 minutes.  Also wish they had more vegetarian options.  That said, the Totopos are amazing!
author: Jah F.

description: Really good fancy Mexican food.  Two problems- the chicarrones are the crispy kinda, not the fatty bacon kind, and it's a bit over priced for what it is.
author: Taylor P.

description: I visited here last week Tues June 28 during lunchtime.  It was very busy. Everyone was really nice.  The strawberry/lemonade drink was really good. I wanted to order the item that was made on DDD but it was only made at the original location so that really bummed me out.  I ended up ordering the Taco Arabe estilo Puebla and the flour tortilla was really good, I could tell it was homemade.  The meat was really really good, spicy, sweet and I could tell it was made on the grill. It filled me up and when we left I noticed we didn't get charged for my friends drink.  The only reason I would give it 4 stars was because I didn't get to order the item I really wanted and the prices were very high ($11 for the taco even though it was big) and my friends 2 carnita tacos were $12 bucks.
author: Kris H.

description:
I have to say I was a bit underwhelmed after all the hype I heard about this place (I see why it's 4 stars, not 4.5). I wanted to give it 5 stars for value going in (and they do deliver on decent prices and great ambiance), but the food didn't blow me away. It was good, but it didn't blow me away.

I ordered:
Totopa
Carnitas
Mole

I should have listened to the waiter when he said the Totopa would be too filling (maybe get it if you have 4 or more people), but I didn't and regretted it. The carnitas were good, but not as amazing as the waiter said they would be. The mole was the same story. 

This is a classic case of expectations: mine were too high, and I was let down. So go in expecting just a plain old taco joint, and maybe you'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: Mike G.

description: Had the carnitas and it was super moist and delicious!! Don't miss out on this gem of a place.
author: Jay J.

description: I live in Los Angeles but had to come to the city for work. A friend recommended this spot and I was blown away.
author: anne m.

description: Service was great and the food even better.  Really enjoyed my meal.  Was at DMV across the street.  So this place caught my eye.  I'm glad it did.  I'll be back
author: Kenneth G.

description:
I ate lunch here twice, two days in a row. Here were the delicious things I ate:
1. Little fried chickpeas. Spicy and a nice little something to tide you over as you're drooling over your neighbor's dishes.
2. Braised duck and mole tamal. I love duck and will almost always order it when I see it. Glad I did. Dark, rich, delish.
3. Gordita campechana (beef brisket & chorizo). This would be a perfect cheap little snack, filling enough as a light lunch with a margarita.
4. Quesadilla w/ pork belly. Amazing. You must order this!!
5. Chilaquilas. Some of the best I've had, but still a bit underwhelming compared to the other dishes.

Both times I came there was a line, but they take your cellphone number, and things seemed to move pretty quickly.
author: Heather J.

description:
First off, this place gets jam packed basically always, and they don't take reservations (annoying!) so to avoid milling about in front of Falletti's for 40 minutes, I suggest calling them and leaving your name and party number with them, or stopping by and putting your name on the list and then coming back in an hour. I think they will also give your cell a ring when your table is ready. In the meantime, go to Nopa and have a cocktail. Or the Page.

My favorite thing to get here is the consomme soup. It's unlike any soup I've ever had anywhere, lots of super fresh veggies, brewing in a very flavorful broth. Typically I'll get that, along with tequila and a chaser of sangrita. 

I noticed that people are mentioning this place to be overpriced, but I totally disagree, I think it's a super good price for what you get. In fact, I can't believe how cheap everything is. Then again, I usually only get one item. So, maybe I'm the minority.
author: Anna H.

description:
Nopalito is like a taco truck gone upscale.  The food is just as good as a taco truck but it's all organic and sustainably sourced.  The best of both worlds!  Although it's "pricey" let's keep things in perspective.  It's not a $5 lunch but a $10 lunch. 

If you go to Nopalito on the weekend, try to get here when it opens.  You can get a seat with no problem but it does fill up quickly.

For two people we ordered the Gordita Campechana and the Carnitas.  Honestly, we could have just stopped at the Gordita.  It would have been a nice light lunch to share.  But we couldn't pass up the Carnitas.  I'm not sure if other reviewers have mentioned this, but it is a big hunk of pork.  Hubby and I had to take leftovers home.  Not that we complained.  It was good.  
And they were nice and gave us extra tortillas (guess we weren't stuffing them full enough).  

Lunch was around $20 for two people plus leftovers.
author: Jean K.

description: This is one of my top three favorite brunch/lunch spots in SF. The food is all very inventive and I love the Mexican flare they give to all their dishes. I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich.
author: Kalib B.

description:
Short version : we really, really liked just about everything, but the portion sizes (for the price) were way too small.

Came in for lunch, 3 of us. We arrived around 12:15 or so and were seated immediately, given menus, and our drink order taken straight away. We ordered :

Tamal de Rajas con queso
Quesadilla de Calabacitas
Ceviche
Gazpacho de Fruta Estilo Morelia
Taco de Pescado

I have to agree with Sydney L, the Tamal de Rajas con Queso (vegetarian tamale) was good but not mind-boggling. It really could have used "something else" to add another layer of flavor.

The quesadilla was a *true* quesadilla (one tortilla folded over) and not a sincronizada (what is usually served in U.S. restaurants as a quesadilla - two tortillas with stuff between them). Corn tortilla, zucchini, several cheeses, spices. Tasty, but  small for $9.50.

Ceviche. Really delicious. Lots of fresh seafood and overflowing with flavor.

The gazpacho was a surprise to me, because I didn't order it and I didn't read the description - I just heard somebody order "the gazpacho". I expect gazpacho to be a finely "ground" soup - instead it was small chunks of different sorts of summer melons, swimming in a liquid sweet/tart orange/lime "dressing", and queso fresco. The sweet melons were really complimented by the tart orange/lime dressing. A great, light, summer dish.

The fish taco was tasty. The orange slice gave it an extra 'zing'.


The place was packed and there was a waiting list when we left at 1:20.

Overall food was really good. Normally I'd think it a little expensive for the portion sizes (the portions were smaller than I expected - except for the taco - just slightly larger than tapas portions) but maybe those are just SF prices, and I'm not used to them. At least they don't slip in the "healthy SF surcharge" on top of it, it's included in the menu prices. Service was pretty damn good too - polite, not overbearing, always seemed to show up at the right time. And she chased us down the sidewalk when we forgot something at the table.
author: Matthew C.

description: Food is delicious, but service stinks! Waitress acted like her job was way beneath her and couldn't comprehend leaving items off the torta for our kids. After we got our food we never saw her again. Had to wave down two staff members just to get our check.
author: Erin P.

description:
I went here with some friends that were in town - not having been before. 

It was a chilly Tuesday evening, we sat outside, but the heaters were on and it made for a great outdoor setting. 

We ordered a pitcher of the sangria - and it was weird. It was yellow/white, and did not taste like it was even made with wine. It was a bit sour, drinkable, but I wouldn't order it again. 

I had the Carnitas - they were exquisite!!!!
author: Chloé M.

description: The food was amazing! It was recommended to us by a colleague and it lived up to it! We had the queso flameado as an app and it was really good! The nopales gave it an added flavor. Husband got carnitas and I had pozole. Both were amazing!!! Service was decent. Our server was nice but he seemed to pay more attention to other tables. The bathroom situation was a little odd, you have to exit the restaurant and walk down the sidewalk to re-enter to bathroom. I found that quite odd especially not being from the area and not knowing how safe the neighborhood was. We would definitely come back though! Great flavors!!!
author: Anna K.

description: Restaurant is very nice, very welcoming.  The staff is friendly and make great recommendations. The recipes are actually pretty authentic, some pre-hispanic dishes with a new SF/gourmet twists to them. The margaritas worth a try, definitely drinkable. Small plates so it's perfect for sharing.
author: Travis I.

description:
Authentic, fresh and so super delicious!  This is not your hole-in-the-wall greasy mexican restaurant.  Everything from the fresh squeezed grapefruit for the palomas to the rustic corn tortillas is prepared with care and you can taste the difference!

We dropped in for a late lunch around 3 on a rainy Saturday and were seated within minutes at the bar  We started with palomas and went to town on a few menu items, followed by more tequila and mescal.  The mole was everything it should be, rich, dark, complex, and the crispy quesadilla was to die for.  We had a nice seafood stew that you could assemble and eat like a fish taco.  Nopalito is to SF as Loteria is to LA.
author: Elyse K.

description:
Ok, this place is good. Even better, it's in my neighborhood.
Here are my faves: the totopos - homemade tortilla chips bathed in spicy tomato sauce, sprinkled with grated white cheese, and served with lime and sour cream, the carnitas -- tender, flavorful, not super fatty, and the quesadilla de chicharones -- a quesadilla stuffed full of white cheese, pork belly and fried pork skin. Yum!
Bonus: you can call and put your name on the list up to an hour ahead. It's sort of like a last minute reservation...
author: Teryll H.

description: That was fun; expensive given the size of the servings but excellent quality and very good service.
author: David S.

description:
Came here with my friends Jack and Sari for dinner one night. Jack had mentioned that it was affiliated with Nopa and that it was supposed to be pretty good...and you know what? He was right, it was pretty good.

We ordered some drinks, a carafe of white wine sangria which also had frozen grapes which are quite fun to chew on after you are done drinking. Oh and we also ordered some beers. 

So this is what we had 

- Totopos con Chile, which are basically tortilla chips with grated cotija cheese and salso. Also comes with a side of cream..i think sour cream from what i can recall.

-Ceviche Verde de Pescado y Calamari, a ceviche with cod, calamari, avocado, lime and i think tomatillo..which is like a green fruit of some sort..anyways this dish was not my favorite..no wows here

-Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón, a tortilla with crispy pork belly, jack cheese and onions. This was very nice

-Carnitas, tender braised pork with salsa and some other stuff, which I dont really remember. The only thing I remember is this pork, it was so tender and i got a nice fatty piece. God i love pork fat....wrapped that with the soft tortilla and the pickled jalapeno and cabbage..it was soo good.

We also ordered a couple other things which were not  too shabby like the Gordita Picadillo which is a fried corn tortilla with beef and salsa and beans. and these tacos..which i can't seem to remember what they were called...So, the Ceviche was a miss, but the Carnitas, man very delicious..

Overall I thought this place was very good, not the best but very good. Heard a funny story about this place too, how the chef basically got most of the recipes from one of his mexican employees and tweaked them a bit and that is how Nopalito came about..hahaha well i thought it was funny..
author: phillip w.

description: I ordered Taquitos De papas and i personally thought it was ok. I usually stick to what I know. And this was different.  I wouldn't order 2nds for sure cuz it was not the real fill you up Mexican kinda food and they were really small. It just wasn't for me.
author: Rhea V.

description: So, decided to come here because I saw it on triple D. I wasn't impressed, don't get me wrong food was very good but the portions were small. My cousin ordered a horchata and they never brought it, the waiter didn't even ask what we would like to drink. Our food came quickly, we asked for salsa for our food, again the waiter forgot and didn't bring the salsa until after we finished our meal yet they charged us for it. Overall bad service but the food was good don't. Don't think ill be back.
author: Nanise N.

description: This was my favorite food pot in all of San Francisco. I love Mescal and they have an enormous menu to choose from. The food is all terrific but the empandas and Totopos con chile are the best.
author: Danny B.

description: Food wasn't bad, the fish tacos for the price seemed a tad bit to expensive for the quality and size. The staff was hot then cold...I felt it went from great service to so so service. Forgot a drink we ordered. Over all the atmosphere was nice.
author: Matthew F.

description: This place is amazing!!! The food awesome, you must try the carnitas!!!! The best and the service is super fast and super cool
author: Carlos A.

description:
This restaurant matches all the hype. If you want to avoid a long line, call 415-535-3969 to be added to the waitlist. We only had to wait for 15 minutes, compared to the standard hour. My favorite:
The TAMALE. Best I've ever had. 
Get the Totopos Con Chile (their version of nachos) to start. You won't regret it. I don't usually eat sour cream, but this is the one exception. It is brought in a bowl on the side.
CARNITAS. With their homemade corn tortillas.
author: Harmony P.

description: Had no problem getting a table on New Years Eve with a group of 6 people (just call ahead and put your name in and grab a drink if there is still a little wait). I was sooo excited to try the Tamal but sadly they sold out right before we were seated.  We were able to grab the last few of the Carnitas (very good but very salty), the Chicken Mole, and the delicious Totopos.  Great meal & the El Diablo was delicious.  Now that I know take-out is an option, I will be ordering from them again!
author: Raina D.

description:
The hostess here was so wonderful.. thank you my dear! 
Came here with a large group (10+) As you know, no reservations, but you can call in ahead to put yourself on the waitlist. We waited a while at the standing bar, sipping on their coctoles (honey bee was gross... tasted like gym socks) But they managed to seat all of us together!!! 

Onto the food:
Lamb: I devoured this lamb like it's nobody's business. I didn't wanna share. A+
Carnitas: I made my friend share... it was so tender and delicious. 
Ceviche: Fresca makes better ceviche, sorry.
Taco soup: lacking flavor
Chicken mole: yum, can't go wrong with mole!

Bathroom's outside, kinda weird, but at least nobody will hear or smell you doing your business...  lol
author: Emily T.

description: Awesome, awesome Mexican cuisine!  Carnitas, sauces, everything was fantastic.  I can see how they maintain a 4 star average with nearly a thousand reviews.  They even have easy parking AND kids friendly options (and accessories).  Will be back!  I did not love the mole, but there were so many things I did love I give them a pass.  Interesting cocktails made the evening perfect.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I gave this place two tries because I didn't want my experience the first time around to be the one I wrote about. But alas, they are that crummy. 
I'll write my most recent experience because that is much fresher in my memory: 

We we under quoted by 25 minutes and did not get anything from the hostess other than Hi, for 2. She looked like a manager, and now that I reflect I can see that is why Nopalito is doing so horribly service wise. If management can't make you feel welcome at the door then there is no hope.
We didn't mind the communal seating arrangement. 

The food arrived cold and over an hour after we had ordered it. The chefs in the kitchen seemed to be working their asses off so I'm uncertain as to the reason. Perhaps understaffed or poor server ordering. 
The people we sat with communally had about the same wait time on their dishes and made comments about the hostess that failed to show any signs of being hospitable. 

Our server, Pia or Pria, only made an appearance to get our orders and bring the check. I tried without success to flag her down for more tortillas and to order a drink and was lucky another server was able to multi-task but not actually follow through with our requests.

The food was standard but I could get waay better food elsewhere for less money and it would come with a larger side of service. 

We were asked at the end of our meal how the food was and when I told her it was cold when it arrived and we never got the tortillas we asked twice for she just smiled and said Oh goodness, I'm so sorry. 

I left the minimum tip hoping that the cooks get tip share because they were the only ones I could see actually completing tasks. 

Get more servers, or at least get ones that can do their job efficiently. 

Over priced Mexican food and unsatisfactory service topped with long unfriendly waits will make me never go back.
author: Karen M.

description: Don't know what all the hype is about. Long wait even calling ahead to put my name in, food was fine but for upscale Mexican I would pick Tacoliscious over it any day.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I had been dying to go to Nopalito. So I went.
They use all natural ingredients, and advertise grass-fed beef --which is a big plus.
We ordered a gordita, a fish taco, mole chicken, and the meatballs.
The mole was chocolicious, thought the chicken was a small portion. The only thing I affirmatively didn't like were the meatballs. They were a bit too salty.
The tortillas are fresh and yummy, but TOO MANY TORTILLAS -- w/ every dish it was overkill. Same goes for the rice. Too repetitive and I can't help but think they were trying to fills us up on carbs.
I thought the dried garbanzo beans and free little almond cookies were a nice touch.
Service was nice and unrushed.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The good days are over. One can really sense that this place has been discovered and hyped, rightly so. But now they're just living off that reputation, which really shows in the service and the food quality. In brief: you don't have to go, there are better places.

We can there 9.30ish and asked for a table. Were sent to the bar, ordered drinks. Already there not so good service altogether. Then they wanted to sit us at the bar, coming up with excuses (kitchen is closing blabla). We refused and said we'd leave after the drink. Then suddenly they had a table after a couple of minutes.

It would have been all good had the food been fantastic. Had cactus leave salad, which really was good. Cevice was good. But the fish taco--give me a break, awful!

So, you can have more fun and get better food elsewhere. Unless you like to go to a "trendy" place. Your pick.
author: Tobias K.

description:
Came here for date night with... a girl I'm seeing? Dating? It was her idea, actually, this date night. Although she's not my girlfriend per se, but then ag... well never mind. Not the right forum to discuss this.

We had the blood orange salad, fish taco, carnitas, and chicken mole. Everything was pretty good. Not mind-blowing, but solid. We especially liked the orange salad -- just be sure you're okay with Mexican cheese, as the fruit is generously topped with it.

The carnitas is one of the celebrated dishes here, and we were both eager to try it. Maybe our expectations were a bit too high because we thought it was... good? The meat is very well-cooked and is served as two large chunks in a little brown wax paper wrapping (as pictured). Very juicy, VERY tender, but maybe a little under-flavored? Especially as the other trimmings -- cabbage, picked vegetables, and salsa verde -- aren't especially robust either, we felt the meat could have been a little more memorable.

As for the mole, I ended up eating most of it because it's a personal favorite, but I'd call it fair -- no better than a hole-in-the-wall place in terms of flavor. The chicken was evenly cooked though and, although on the verge of being too dry with the first bite, ended up being just about right. 

For our drinks we had sangria and the "Killer Bee" cocktail, both of which were tasty. The best thing about this place is the vibe -- energetic and vibrant, not overwhelmingly loud, solid service, and a cheery crowd.

I'd come again. Hopefully with the same girl.
author: Albert L.

description:
Probably the best Mexican food I have ever had. Just perfect.  Pork Belly quesadilla FTW. 

Never stop being so awesome. You made a couple of New Yorkers just arriving into San Francisco delighted and happy.
author: Dan G.

description: Nopa's little Mexican brother. Large portions, fresh food, great margarita's, short wait, decent service (after the grumpy hostess that is...).
author: Karlijn V.

description: SO good! I went here recently for dinner and drinks with a friend, and both of us devoured our food. We started off with the ceviche (amazing) and got the carnitas and enchiladas. Both dishes were delicious. The ambiance is cute and warm, and the drinks were good as well. I will definitely be back!
author: Snigdha G.

description:
Imagine the DMV.  Got a picture of it in your head? Remember the lines?  Remember the surly service?  Remember feeling annoyed at the whole experience?

Nopalito is across the street from the DMV but whether or not they serve food seems to be the biggest difference between the spots.
author: Ivan L.

description:
While you can count on a decent wait (usually an hour or more), they are really reliable about giving you a time estimate. I've been to Nopalito on Broderick twice now and both times they've given great estimates on time. We were seated quickly when we returned. 

The food is awesome and the servers are even better really advising you on whether you're over- or under-ordering. The margaritas are amazing. And I've yet to have a dish that isn't awesome. Great fancy Mexican!
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Upscale Mexican restaurant and takeout counter...I have to say that I was skeptical but Nopalito's takeout counter was a pleasant surprise.  Their sauces are scrumptious and they offer things you won't find at your local taqueria.  The menu is fairly limited.  I placed my order which was ready in under 10 minutes.  They tucked in some complimentary cookies in the takeout bag.  I don't mind paying extra for quality and something unusual plus they (staff) were very sweet (free cookies too).

* Panucho pollo al pibil ($4.50):  This isn't a bad value because the bean stuffed blue corn tortilla is generously topped with shredded chicken in a slightly spicy sauce, crunchy pickled onions, finely shredded cabbage.  The corn tortilla was slightly crispy.  It was delicious.
* Taco pescado ($4.75):  It wasn't horrible but I wasn't a fan - the orange segments were too sweet, the hunk of fish was firm and dry, there wasn't enough cabbage or cilantro.  I did like how it was slightly spicy.  With a different kind of fish, more cabbage and smaller pieces of orange, I could see it working.
* Cookies: These were tiny almond cookies dusted lightly with powdered sugar.  They were very, very dry.  Definitely have these with tea or some other beverage.

I also like the location - as you wait for your order, you can get a cup of Peet's, a scoop of Humphry Slocombe ice cream or a mini cupcake at Falletti's.
author: Lolia S.

description:
With so much hype it's hard to live up to it and this is one of the few places that does it!

Nopalito is incredible.  You have never had food that tastes like this.  It's Mexican but it's also Californian and new-age and something else entirely.  It's worth the wait and worth every penny

They are actually really accommodating even given how popular they are.  It feels like they are glad each and every person is there and want to show you a good time.  One waitress told me that the owner's vision is that you feel like you're sitting at the family's kitchen table and you truly do!

HIGHLIGHTS:
Carnitas (I once tried to order something else and the waitress told me, "listen, the thing you really want is the carnitas" and she was RIGHT)  the hot chocolate with tiny almond tea cookies, the totopos con chile (the menu describes them so plainly but they are insanely good, I still can't understand how they get the flavor INSIDE the chip), Panucho de Pollo al Pibil- tangy little starter,

NO NEED TO TRY AGAIN:
taquitos de papa good just not mind-blowing, Caldo Tlalpeño con Pollo --smoky interesting flavor but too spicy for me and not good for sharing, quesadilla de primavera--pretty standard
author: Meg M.

description:
LONG REVIEW!

 Well for starters, my mom saw Diners, Drive-ins & Dives on tv and that's where she saw this place and she told the family if we wanted to eat there because we live near by. We all agreed and we were expecting for it to be a great restaurant with lots of great flavors. BUT WE WERE WRONG! Since we are of Mexican origin we practically know the real flavors of mexican food. And we were excited and looking foward to try  this place out. 

  The first thing we ordered as a group was the Totopos con Chile and I have to admit it was really good but nothing special. Then we all ordered separately, I ordered the Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón and I was expecting it to burst out in flavor but it was plain and nothing special. My brother and sister both ordered the Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo but asked for it to be in red sauce, by the time they both got their food they started eating and they did not like it because there only came two small enchiladas and the chicken was soggy and full of bones also they freaked out because there was sweet potato and they never ate sweet potato in a enchilada before, and there was also celery in it and they weren't expecting veggies in their enchiladas. My mom and dad both ordered the Empanada con Deshebrada de Res and they were not satisfied. My mom & dad were still hungry after that so they ordered the same thing i did and they found nothing special about either. They also ordered the Taquitos de Res and Gorditas de Chorizo and i can really say that after having eaten before in many different places in Mexico they only are about half as good as the real Mexican antojitos (snacks) because these types of food is what it really is, Mexican snacks that you can find all over Mexico and have a family of eight eat very well for a tenth of the price! 

  The waiters were very attentive but there was multiple waiters waiting our table (about 4 waiters). When we recieved our bill it also came with free cookies (those were good). OVERALL EXPERIENCE: Wouldn't reccomend to a friend, good service but plain food.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Great food at a decent price.  You'll have to wait for a table though--we waited about an hour on a Friday night at 8pm.  Luckily, there are plenty of bars in the area to entertain you while you wait.  They will text you once your table is ready, but you better be back within 10 minutes of that text or you could lose your table!

We had the mezcal and basil cocktail as well as house margaritas.  Both were good but the mezcal a clear winner.

For food, we ordered the Tamal de Rajas con Queso, Quesadilla con Flor de Calabacitas and the Carnitas.  All three were excellent.  The carnitas and tamal being the two standouts.  The Carnitas were especially flavorful.  I hear the Esquite Tostado is to die for, so I'll have to return to try that.

Overall, a great meal and I will return when I'm willing to wait an hour-plus for a table.
author: Caitlin T.

description:
Delicious! My absolute favorite meal while visiting San Francisco! 

I heard about this place on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, but by no means is it any of those things. The place was beautiful, the staff was friendly and the food and drinks were excellent! Everything was well made and thought-out. 

I would absolutely recommend this to anyone!
author: Jade E.

description: Went here on a saturday night with the girlfriend and had a good time. It's got a chill atmosphere that's pretty intimate. Portions are relatively small, but tasty.
author: Nick A.

description:
3.5 stars -rounding down in this case- Surly service with not even the hint of a smile, disappointing drinks, but awesome delicious food!!!
 Just don't expect friendly hospitality that you'd usually get at a restaurant of this purported caliber. Make sure you check in w the hostess first prior to setting foot at the bar or you will be promptly chastised and asked again w a scowl if you checked in or not. 
Food is certainly delectable!! Recommend food to go: Faster wait and no dealing with the  "just-business" service.
author: Alexa L.

description:
There was a 40 minute wait on a Monday night. They will, however, let you call and put your name on the list in advance, which is awesome! We finally got in the door. 

Margaritas. They tasted like I made them. I don't mean that in a good way.
