Appetizers: I got some chips that had been simmered in a sauce and had a shit town of cojita shredded over the top. These were really tasty, and very spicy considering they were just chips, and the bowl was way bigger than I expected. These were pretty awesome. She got an empanada, which was made with a crunchier tortilla than average and pretty good sized. It was tasty enough.

For diner, I got a beef soup. The broth was thin, very spicy, and had hominy, which I liked. She  thought it tasted like it hadn't decided what it was doing. The beef was a giant, fatty hunk I had to cut with a knife. I was okay with it, but not wowed. She got carne asada with asparagus. The carne was very tender, undercooked (in a restaurants-refuse-to-cook-steak-all-the-way-through way), and otherwise fairly bland. The asparagus was grilled and she liked it, but it wasn't Mexican in any way. She'll take the ingredients and make something better out of them tomorrow. 

The tortillas were corn, and they were good.

So, overall, a long wait for mostly unimpressive food, but decent spices. I wouldn't go back, and there's certainly better Mexican in town.
author: William C.

description:
EXCELLENT! I loved all the plates I tried and this is place that has a deep attention to detail. Every salsa, every side and every bit of food presented showed that somebody really cared about its flavor and its presentation.
We were a group of 5 so we could order multiple plates and try all of them. I will tell you which ones were the best: carnitas (don't forget to order the habanero salsa), empanada de picadillo, quesadilla de maíz y huitlacoche, and esquite tostado. The agua de horchata and the arroz con leche were ok but not outstanding. 
But what I really liked of this place is the price! Excellent value for money. You can have a relaxed dinner with tons of delicious food and not paying like you do in other restaurants.
I want to go back and try the whole menu.
author: Guillermo M.

description: This place looked really nice, the service was fast and attentive but the food wasn't that great. I like the fact that everything was organic but wasn't impressed with the "Mexican" food.
author: Rayna M.

description: Great spot! Not someone that generally craves or raves about Mexican cuisine but after being dragged here by friends 2/3 times I'm a fan. The food is scrumptious and has a good take on traditional plates. For the quality and quantity of food it's also reasonably priced. Only minor downside is there is generally a decent wait for it - but what good things don't you have to wait for!
author: Milan T.

description:
Gosh i wish i could give it 5 stars because the food is DELICIOUS!! But everything else was not as great as the food was. So with that said the 3 stars are for the kitchen staff. Upon arriving we were told that there was a wait of about 40 min which was fine we really wanted to try this place. The hostess told us that we could wait by the bar and have a drink while we waited. We stood at the bar and ordered a couple of drinks. The drinks were a bit watery not good enough to order another. As we waited a few more people came in by the bar. The bartender quickly engaged in conversation with them and brought over some chickpeas. We looked around and everyone had chickpeas except for us. Everyone was engaged in conversation with the bartender except for us. I don't know if the bartender is racist but honestly we were the only latinos there everyone else was white. Even when i asked where the restroom was he completely ignored me when i was right in front of him. Then when my husband asked again he answered in a rude way as if we were bothering him.

Once we got seated we asked our waitress for some chickpeas since the bartender decided not to give us any. Even at the table it took about 15 min to get the chickpeas. We ordered and waited, and waited, and waited, we were so disappointed at this point we honestly just wanted to get up and leave. Once we got our food it was so delicious we were sad that the service wasn't up to par with the food. We had ceviche, both quesadillas, corn bowl, and empanadas.

 Seemed the waitress was lost a little bit because she forgot a few things from the gentleman that was sitting next to us. Also, to get to the restroom one has to exit the building and go all the way around to the" to go" door which i didn't like much. The music that they were playing that night was a bit odd for the ambiance of the place, it didn't go with the theme of the place.

 I cant say that we will be going back soon but maybe next time we will just get the food to go and avoid the bad service and discrimination from the bartender.
author: J O.

description: really nice place uniue flare of mexican food, it was recomended by another witer in san francisco, pretty cool neighborhood aswell!
author: Mary H.

description: Waited ~20 minutes after putting our name on the list from home. The food was okay, but only a couple of the six things we tried stood out in any way. Most of the food *looked* Mexican, but didn't taste it. Not dying to go back, but wouldn't say no to a group trying to go there either.
author: Armen A.

description:
Nopalito isn't my favorite Mexican food ever (that prize is awarded to Great Mex in Newport Beach) but it gets 5 stars for being the best of a different breed of Mexican food:  An upscale breed with mid-range prices.

This isn't the place to go when you're looking for a burrito as big as your head (try the Mission for that) or when you want change back from your Benjamin, but rather, when you want to begin your meal with Sangria, move on to a delicious ceviche, pore over a menu of "ooh, everything sounds so  delcious... I can't decide!" get yourself to Nopalito.

Why else might I recommend it?  For starters, on-site free parking, really nice staff, and a warm and welcoming ambience.  Oh yeah... the food may not be traditional Mexican but it's delicious.  

Nopalito is a place I'll return to often.
author: Tracey A.

description:
There's always a tough dynamic between your Combo #17 type Mexican-American places and your hole-in-the-wall taco stand type places.  That's at least the standard in Atlanta, my home town.  We have some awesome more-authentic-type places (esp on Buford Highway), some reliable enchilada+taco plate type places, and a scattering here and there of some places that try to step it up a bit.
So I didn't know what to expect when I visited friends in San Francisco and tried this place.  I'd been to Nopa before, and love it, but here - oh here.

Best carnitas I've ever had.  One of the best margaritas.  Other mixed drinks were magnificent uses of agave-based liquors and just the right mixes and enhancements.  Totops con chile - trust me, it's worth every mega-calorie when you eat these sauce-soaked but still crisp chips with cheese.  Chicken mole.  Quesadillas.  Such simple ideas, but so different than what they'd mean almost anywhere else.  Every single dish had me licking my fingers, however uncouth that may be.  They were busy but wiggled and shimmied to get us in quickly, but then let us take our time drinking and eating.

It used to be our tradition to visit Nopa once a trip.  We may now have to alternate with Nopalito.  It's just that good.
author: Scott M.

description:
I'll admit it, I love Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. I disagree with his hair and all his dumb one-liners, but I completely agree with his restaurant choices. After seeing an episode on Nopalito, we decided to come here to try some "Mexican food with a fresh take".

Called in 2 hours before to put our name on the waiting list (we requested to be seated at 7:30pm) and when we arrived we were promptly seated. Points for that. Fresh and clean atmosphere, casual but still trendy without being pretentious. A place for dates but also families. 

Due to my dairy allergy, I don't eat much Mexican food, but they were very accommodating. Complimentary deep fried chick peas while we ordered:
Tostadas: MUST GET
Ensalada: Fresh butter lettuce with one bite of avocado and one bite of tomato. Sprinkled with peanuts and crispy tortilla strips. Not that tight. 
Fish taco: Pretty straightforward. Looked kinda small and sorry on the plate, but the fish was good and the mandarin oranges brightened the taste with a nice burst of citrus. But also not that tight. 
Quesadilla Rojas: Not for me obv because I'm allergic to cheese. He ordered this because it was featured on DDD. Good, but a little too salty (to be expected of pork belly). 
Carne Asada: Seasoned with spices I'm not normally used to (I'm sorry, we grew up on Gordo's and Chino's). The cactus was interesting, like stewed bell peppers. Good, but.. the leftovers are still in my fridge. 
Complimentary almond butter cookie dessert: Rich/dense
author: Kat N.

description: Came here on holiday when new to lower Haight. Nice food - excellent service. The margaritas are yummy. Portions not too huge - good size for a light meal but if you're super hungry you'll need extras.
author: Ali W.

description: Good food, friendly service, but don't expect to hold an intelligible conversation with a friend at dinner-- unless you bring a megaphone! This is one of the loudest restaurants I've ever been to, way too loud for me to try it again. And having to go OUTSIDE and around the building to use the restroom is just plain ridiculous. Are you serious? The restaurant couldn't be designed with a way to access the restroom from the inside? Really?!
author: ben p.

description:
More like 3.5 I'd say.

The carnitas get 5 stars. Can't bad mouth anything about that. Tender, flavorful, and a more than generous portion with enough sauces and tortillas to fill you up and even share with one other person

Other than that, nothing really stands out here. I've eaten in as well as ordered to-go a number of times, and aside from the carnitas, there's nothing that keeps me coming back, except I do keep coming back, like the dumped ex-bf/gf who doesn't get the point. It'll get better, I swear!

All that being said, I feel like there are 2-3 dishes I just haven't tried yet sitting on the menu that will make me a fan of Nopalito once again. And the Broderick location is a cool spot at the very least to have a nice lunch and enjoy some drinks with friends.

To be continued...
author: Stan A.

description: I love this Mexican food Empandas are good and fish tacos are delicious, The chicken Mole was the best. : )
author: LAgal_23 L.

description: I come here for the tequila, it's delicious, and I normally don't drink the stuff. I've been here many times: the menu changes, service is pretty good, the dessert menu isnt stellar but the Mexican tea cookies that you receive at the end of the meal are soooo goood :) Not the most exciting vegetarian options, usually just a few. The setting is casual, warm, and fun. Definitely a people pleaser, every person I have brought here has been happy with the experience.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Great food! Great service! I can't complain! When I am entertaining out of town guests, we come here. It's guaranteed to be a hit.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Really good and flavorful food. Although we were initially discouraged by the amount of people ahead of us in line (we didn't have a reservation) the time for us to get a table was very quick. 

The servings are quite large so we were very full after our late lunch.
author: T S.

description:
Listen and listen good: This is NOT authentic Mexican cuisine.  Nopalito provides Mexican-like dishes, but for anyone to say this is authentic, is straight out stupid. 

Now to the food.  The carnitas are delicious and the portions are reasonable.  The gordita de picadillo was bland and the "tomatillo" sauce they serve with it was tasteless.  My friend ordered the ceviche and we both found it to be average.  

Again....this place is ok.  Nothing more.
author: Anthony Xavier S.

description:
Nopalito has become my favourite middle-end (not quick to-go tacos, burritos) Mexican restaurant. I have been in the Nopa/Divis neighbourhood quite a bit lately (I passed my California driving test!) and try to stop in for my fix when I'm done at the DMV.

In an effort to keep ticking things off my 7 x 7 Big Eat 2012 list, I had to order the carnitas- braised pork, orange, bay leaf, milk, cinnamon and beer Cabbage salad, pickled jalapeño and salsa de tomatillo. They got it right adding this dish to the list. Ask for extra green salsa (I can't get enough of it) and be sure to mix it in with the pork. Don't forget to use the cabbage and pickled jalapeno in your taco... won't taste the same without it!
author: Seema M.

description: Great true Mexican fare. No reservations available so call in ahead to put your name on the wait list. The portion sizes are on the smallish side compared to your average Mexican restaurant, but include plenty. Most of the dishes had some heat to them!  Good prices. Our family of 7 ate for 70 dollars.
author: Jared C.

description:
Empanada, awesome.
Fish Taco, awesome.
Carnitas, awesome.

Not your typical empanada because it's made with corn masa. Light and crunchy on the outside and soft and sweet on the inside. Best empanda.
author: Jake E.

description:
My sis dragged me here after climbing. You can imagine my outfit! I was wearing a cap and a capri pants. I didn't look good for the crowd and I told my sis that I was uncomfy going in there, she just looked at me funny and that the end of that conversation.

I wasn't really hungry so she just ordered for the both of us. 

She got the following:
* Totopos con Chile = had one chip and it was freaking spicy! She didn't tell me that but my sis devoured it.
* Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón = I kinda liked and the only thing I didn't like was the cilantro.
* Carnitas = LOVED this! It was so tender and delicious. My sis ordered a side of rice + more tortillas = made our night. 

Overall, it was good - service could be a little faster. Will probably be back to take my Uncle and the rest of the familia again.
author: Cath M.

description:
I am a fan of their torta de chilorio and taco de pescado al pastorfor on their lunch menu. 
I have not been their for dinner yet.
author: Chris H.

description: My friend and I started with margaritas, which were delicious and totally hit the spot. They also gave us fried chickpeas while we sat at the bar waiting for our table. Our other friend met us and we were seated and ordered a few things to share - guacamole and chips, carnitas and trout. The dishes were all delicious but it was too much food for the three of us. We ate maybe half the chips and guac, 1/3 of the carnitas and the entire trout. I will definitely be back. There's so much more I want to try.
author: Madeline S.

description: Food was awesone. Nice variety and great quality. Service was very attentative and we all had a great tine in this casyal eatery. Easily a favorite spot. I ordered pretty much one of everything on the menu and it was not a disappointment. Ok I wish there was more variety for desert, but we liked the popsicles just the same.
author: Evelyn G.

description: Hands down, no doubt about it, 5 stars! I expected it to be good but it surprised and delighted! The pork belly quesadilla was a star! Great vibe, nice people and amazing food. We'll be back very soon!
author: Sarah M.

description:
7x7. 100 things to eat before you die. My adventure begins. 

I had the hardest time finding this place! I felt like such a tourist because I just circled around the block time and time again and I couldn't find Nopalito! The reason being... it is attached to a grocery store!

The wait was astronomical, over 2 hours... so what do we do... walk around in the fancy grocery store, Falletti's. They have great products but I'm here to review Nopalito.

You share tables. It's cute. The menu isn't too over the top and just right. The food quality, okay. What you consider to be fancy Mexican food isn't so fancy or great. I personally prefer Mamacita over Nopalito. The Carnitas was good, but not great. Maybe I was looking for something with more flavor and savory. It was juicy but missing ... something. The ceviche was okay ... and the portions were just fine. 

Was I satisfied? Eh. Would I come back? Maybe. 

Why on Earth have all of my food choices been sub-par??? 

Sigh.
author: Lisa L.

description:
After eating at Nopalito, definitely the most common conversation my friends and I had for the rest of the night was, "Is that place worth waiting two hours for?" Followed as a close second with, "holy fuck, that food was good."

Once we were seated, everything about the experience was perfect. Waiters were all casual but incredibly friendly; my mezcal cocktail was delicious; the food was to die for. On the recommendation of Yelpers, we started with the totopos con chile--kind of an upscale happy medium between chips and salsa and nachos--which was a great way to start the meal. For entrees, I had a lamb dish, which was the single most flavorful thing I have put in my mouth in recent memory. It's the kind of dish that reminds me just how wide a gap there is between ok-good food and a truly perfectly made dish. Everything worked together, the flavors playing in perfect harmony. It was difficult not to let out a satisfied groan with every bite.

So, is it worth it? The verdict is a strong maybe. If you're going on a Friday or other busy night, as we were, definitely call ahead with plenty of time before you actually want to eat. They were not kidding when they gave us a two hour wait estimate. Luckily, the maître d' was great about suggesting bars in the area to kill time, so all's well that ends well.

Oh, and as a P.S. -- yes; you do need to leave the restaurant, go around outside and re-enter through their takeout door in order to use the rest room. At first, this seemed ridiculous--which, for the record, it is--but by the end of the meal, it kind of grew on me, and the separation from the main space combined with the tight quarters for the waiting area meant that you almost had to small talk with strangers, which I think actually added to the convivial charm of the whole thing.
author: Ben K.

description:
Nopalito has some pretty amazing carnitas!  According to the menu the pork shoulder is marinated in beer, orange, bay leaf, and cinnamon, and then braised in pork fat.  The result is this beautiful chunk of meat served to you in parchment paper to keep all the yummy juice in.  So tender, so delicious, so good!  It comes with house-made tortillas and a delicious tomatillo salsa along with a cabbage salad with some traditional taqueria type sides...a pickled carrot, and jalapeno pepper.   Some of the other things our table enjoyed were the fish tacos, the blood orange salad as well as the crab soup and their specialty mole.  Don't forget the margaritas!  This place is sooooo good!

PS...the Mexican wedding cookies that come out with the bill are a nice touch too!
author: Kari S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  What I ended up liking was my Peet's coffee during the long wait.  Warning: since they don't take reservations, don't bother showing up between the hours of 7 and 9.  You'll have much better luck getting seated before or after the dinner rush.

It was one of those moments where I was so hungry that I stopped being hungry.  So when we finally got seated, nothing looked appetizing.

I ended up ordering the pork belly quesadilla [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/055dTcfz2AOAFPed_2KjEQ?select=lcHr_nrD4laCI9sXawAHKQ], which wasn't bad, but was a bit dry.  The others had the ceviche [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/055dTcfz2AOAFPed_2KjEQ?select=pBmAu945YuHBPHeLSvZ31Q] and swordfish taco [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/055dTcfz2AOAFPed_2KjEQ?select=0899MEMwMbVK_8PGzPBibA].

I get it.  It's high class Mexican food.  That's how they get away with charging 3x the price elsewhere.

Meh.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I really wanted to like you Nopalito. I really did. 

I know it's SF but just because it's "sustainable organic" Mexican cuisine doesn't mean you've sold me. 

If you charge twice the price for a taco I'm expecting twice the flavor. 

And for the record - I am absolutely in love with Nopalito's sister restaurant NOPA. 

I've always had misgivings about upscale Mexican food. Not that Mexican food isn't upscale - but if you're going to charge a premium I need to be able to say "damn, that was better than the taco truck outside my office in the Mission". Nopalito did not pass that test. 

The first thing that almost made me choke was the $3.95 almond horchata. Good god. Almost $4. Really? FAIL. My second thought on the horchata was that while it was good, it was more like Spanish horchata than the Mexican and Salvadorian horchatas I have tried (which I believe are cinnamon based). Just an observation. 

The Taco de Pescado al Pastor for $4.75 (Seared adobo swordfish, chile ancho, orange and salsa de morita y tomatillo) was good. A bit on the spicy side but good. The favorite app I had that night. Yes, one taco is close to $5. 

The Panucho de Pollo al Pibil at $4.50 Black bean stuffed tortilla, citrus-achiote chicken, cabbage, pickled red onion and salsa habanera. Yes, one tostada is close to $5. This one I can't rave about. I've had pollo pibil before at Poc Chuc but never as a tostada. I just wasn't feeling it. 

Also had the Tamal Enchilado de Puerco y Queso at $5.00 Housemade masa, stewed pork, queso fresco, chile ancho. It hurt me to pay $5 for a tamal. Initially I wasn't into it but it grew on me. The queso fresco was a great touch with the guacamole. I liked it but not twice as much as I would like a local tamale off the street. 

I'd be wiling to go back. Maybe I didn't order the right thing. Maybe.
author: Carlos A.

description:
The flavors were not very good. Also not a lot of choices for vegetarians and vegans. 

Good luck to you if you need to use the restroom: you have to leave the restaurant, walk down the block, go to their take-out window, and wait in line because there is only one single-occupancy restroom for the entire restaurant.
author: Jay D.

description: CARNITAS. It's all about the carnitas. OK, ok ... everything on the menu is good, but I keep coming back for the carnitas. Also, the "Totopos con Chile" are a great (and spicy) way to start your dining experience.
author: Matthew C.

description: I think I would have rated this place higher if it wasnt for the long wait, 1.45 hours and the people that took reservations at the front.  i understand that it's really busy but try to be respectful. i do appreciate the text we received after making our reservation though. we ended up going to both locations that night to make reservations. the food was just good andservice was friendly. we had the ceviche, fish tacos, and the sangria. the sangria was sweet but not strong. they also gave us dessert with a candle on it bc we were celebrating my fiances birthday which was cool. the ingredients are fresh and the ambiance was hip. would i come back again? yes, just to try the other dishes. possibly the dishes that were on guy fieri's show. nothing out of this world so far. could it be hype? we shall see. after my second visit. time to step it up!
author: michael c.

description: The food is wonderful. High quality ingredients.  The empanadas and the carnitas were by far our favorites. The pork was so tender and flavorful. All the dishes are fairly spicy. We personally love spicy so good with us but not so good for the kids. There were not great options for the kids and was a little too spicy for them.
author: Heather P.

description:
No....Unless you've never had good Mexican food. The best part of the meal was the ginger lemonade and the press pot coffee.  Everything else was blah.

*Totopos con Chile 6.00
Tortilla chips, salsa de arbol, cotija cheese, crema and lime...probably the best thing we tried beside the beverages.

*Taquitos de Papas Adobadas 5.50
Crispy rolled tortillas, potatoes in New Mexico chile adobo,
onion, guacamole, crema, queso fresco and salsa brava...rather tasteless

*Taco de Pescado al Pastor 4.75

*Seared fish in ancho chile adobo, orange, onion, cilantro
and salsa de morita y tomatillo...sounded good,again, did not have much flavor

The soups looked good....Maybe we just ordered wrong.

The place is lovely and very good service.
author: Bleep S.

description: Food was just "ok " nothing special what so ever . I could probably whip together better in my own kitchen. I just can't wrap my head around the hype. Obviously people enjoy it , so give it a shot for yourself. I was there on a Monday at 12:30 NO WAIT , def not worth the hour wait like others have  stated.
author: brian w.

description:
Had the carnitas and the hibiscus+valencia orange drink. Can I just admit straight up that I don't eat foods that are messy and therefore was at a tremendous loss at what to do with the tortillas that the server gave me? I made some "tacos" so that it would look like i knew what I was doing and a seasoned carnitas eater but I'm pretty sure I just looked pitiful. Was I even supposed to make tacos? Hahaha I don't know...

Anyways, carnitas are solely the meat portion right? It was cooked really well and when I poked at it with my fork, it pulled apart easily. I also had some mildly sour vegetable/carrot things for my "taco". This dish was expensive at $15 dollars though!

The restaurant itself is cute and reminded me of some of the shopping plazas back home.
author: Melody L.

description:
I went on my own and sat at the bar. I arrived on a Thursday at 6PM and there was no wait.

I had a beer, but after watching the bartender a while, I was jealous of those drinking margaritas and other cocktails.

I had the smashed shrimp enchilada and it was wonderful. Probably the best Mexican dish I've ever had.

There is plenty of free parking; a rarity in this neighborhood.

Highly recommended!
author: Dave L.

description:
Loved this place!!!

Service was efficient, friendly, and there when you need it. Food was great! We ordered several appetizers to start--all were dynamite. The Carnitas entree was delicious too, especially with plenty of fresh, warm tortillas. At the end of it all, the coffee service was great quality. It's really nice to see a mexican restaurant paying attention to all the finer details--I'll definitely be back.

PS: don't pass on the popsicles!
author: Marguerite B.

description: This is the second time I've been to Nopalito.  I would give it five stars for food (especially the carnitas and tacos al pastor).  However the service has been pretty appalling both times.  Will definitely get take out if I go back.
author: Emily Y.

description: I've been trying for the past two years to nudge my friend to get the waitresses number, very guapa! She has a resemblance to Penelope Cruz. She once cleaned our table and showed a little bit of cleavage by accident, it was nopalito love at first sight. If you come to Nopalito, you must, must, must, must, must order the CARNITAS! I've lived in Central America my whole childhood, and I have to say, BEST CARNITAS EVER! Braised pork, orange, bay leaf, milk, cinnamon and beer, cabbage salad, pickled jalapeño and salsa de tomatillo--$15. I would ignore everything else on the menu and get yourself 2 carnitas. But, if you want to order more, have the totopos,fish taco, and sangria. The restaurant is trendy, serves organic Mexican food, forget about Mexican Coke, they don't have it. Sneak one in, if you must ;).
author: Stephanie M.

description: Here's a great allergy friendly option in a city full of delicious restaurants.  The menu is constantly changing but never fails to satisfy.  The ceviche is always fresh and they always throw a little flare into it.  The empanadas, tomales, and tacos are equally amazing.  I'm glad they are small plates because I want to try everything!!
author: Karlito S.

description: Great, fresh food. Fast, friendly service. Prices were reasonable (cheap even!). Really happy we tried this place on a whim.
author: Christina E.

description:
NOT A GOOD PLACE FOR PEOPLE WHO LOVE THEIR DOGS

THE ATTITUDE:
We took a guest to Nopalito last night. We also brought our 5lb Chihuahua, in a shoulder bag, who is neurologically impaired, blind and very old. We take him everywhere. As soon as we got to the door, the host started telling us where we could tie up our dog outside. I don't have to explain how stupid that would be. When we said we were bringing him in, she started in with a list of rules. The manager joined her and restated ..."the dog must be kept on the floor' etc. They had no interest in good public relations. I wanted to leave, but our guest had picked the restaurant, so I had to be polite. The waiter was aloof as well.  The staff all appeared to think they were doing us a favor by letting us into their restaurant. Every employee we had contact with seemed to need an attitude adjustment.
I felt equally angered by the clients who left their dogs tied up outside in the light rain.

THE FOOD:
First they brought us a jug of warm water. I do not know if this is a gourmet thing. But we had to ask for ice.  My chicken was cooked perfectly. It was moist and tender, with no pink. The mole sauce was unexceptional and very little of it. The rice was awful. The tortilla was like damp cardboard. Altogether, I was very sorry I spend $17 on my entre and still had to eat dinner when I got home. 

THE BILL:
Then they add this 3% surcharge to the bill for employee benefits. Just include this in the price of the food. I don't want to pay $17 for my entre and then realize it is actually $17.51. So since this employee is getting an extra 3% of our bill on top of his wages, I reduced his tip by 3% to even it out.

I will not be eating there again.  I tip on a 10%-15%-20% sliding scale, so this place got 7%.
author: Blair C.

description:
Don't care for the wait or attitude. The food is good but that's it. The amount of time it took to wait for a table and customer service is not it worth it for me.


Had their version of the quesadilla which was very good. Not sure if I'd return though.
author: Noora T.

description: Mediocre food. Carnitas were good and mole was too herbal. The other dishes were forgettable, bland, and on the dry side. Service was ok.
author: Nette C.

description:
I've been here twice and it is excellent.  My boyfriend and I were able to call around 6:00 on a Friday night and get reservations at 7:30.  When we showed up, our table was not ready, but that was okay.  The current wait time without a reservation was 2 hours, so definitely call ahead.

The food is really, really good.  Great depth of flavor -- definitely something special.  Even things healthy things like brussels sprouts quesadillas feel rich and indulgent. I will be going back.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Chose the place in a pinch.  We were in the neighborhood, hungry, reviews looked good, and we were able to get a seat immediately.

Everything was, at best, "alright".  The carnitas were the only decent thing because the meat was so tender, but it lacked flavor.  Also, the carnitas only came with two tortillas, totally inadequate for the amount of meat and whatnot there.  I thought I heard another table offered extra tortillas, but our waiter wasn't around much to do any such offering.

The chips appetizer is fresh tortilla chips tossed in hot sauce, with a dusting of cheese and a side of sour cream.  They were ok, but I've had better chips set on my table for free.

Wife's quesadilla came unaccompanied, and she left still a bit hungry.

Also, to use the bathroom here you're required to walk outside, down to the end of the building, and around the corner.  On a brisk 55 degree, windy evening, it sort of kills the mood of dinner to need to bundle up to use the facilities.
author: John A.

description:
About Me: 
My star rating is based only on the quality / taste of the food and how well it lives up to what it's trying to be.  I don't care about service or ambiance if the food is good.

Nopalito apparently has two locations and after complaining about our food at this one, my girlfriend said that she thinks the same dishes are better at the other one.  With that preface...

Pros:  
* We had 3 dishes and the meat was cooked perfectly in each one.  The chicken in the Panucho de Pollo was awesome (in terms of juiciness and texture).
* The flavors are not bad and are present.

Cons:
* The flavors are distinctly lacking something.  Maybe it's just too classy for my personal tastes, but no dishes had any PUNCH...they were just there on the plate.  In addition to lacking soul, every dish was missing a taste that would unify the flavors.  You know?  Maybe if they'd just squeezed a lime over everything the dishes would have come together...but no.
* For what you pay, the portions are laughably small.  This would be excused if the taste was mind-blowing, but getting similar stuff like this on the street in Guatemala (or hell, even Redwood City and San Jose) and knowing how cheap it could be for something that tastes much better and then paying for this specific taste and amount; it's an insurmountable disappointment.  If you can't deliver the taste or keep the price down, at least deliver the volume.
* Ordered two kind of horchata.  The persimmon-almond one was saved by the persimmon, but the plain almond horchata was just not very good.  My experience with horchata is limited -- I've only had it maybe 10 times -- but this was easily the least good serving of the drink in my memory.  It's also the first time I've ordered horchata at a place where the wait-staff speaks fluent English.

Summary:
This place makes fancy food and thus everything tastes wimpy.  It might be what upper-class food tastes like in Mexico, I don't know, but my preferences are for the vibrancy of street food and this place was a disappointment.
author: Tom C.

description:
I came here late last night with MK after we tried to get into Nopa without reservations. (It was a last minute dinner date.)

We were immediately seated and attended to. Our server was such a sweetie. She recommended the tamal and empanada for me and he grabbed a steak. He also grabbed a margarita (which he went back and got seconds for) and i tried the organic almond horchata per her recommendation. SO GOOD. The food was amazing. The drinks were amazing (his margarita wasn't bad either!) and the company was perfect. :)

After eating, they didn't mind us going back for seconds, so we grabbed another order of ceviche to finish the night off. Note: salt the chips like crazy, use hot sauce like crazy, and lime juice everything. That made the ceviche rock.

During all of this, MK and I decided to act like kids. Some throwing of chick peas might have been involved. ...as was checking people out and wondering if others were on dates too. haha But, lucky us, nobody seemed to care.

ps. MK came here two nights ago as well. Apparently, it was packed with a long wait. My recommendation: book a reservation.
author: Angie M.

description:
Everyone is raving about this place. I am not feeling it.

It seems as if the servers were not prepared for the success of this restaurant. We were a big group, and some of us had to wait outside, due to some sort of restrictions. That's fine, even though we called ahead, emailed ahead. Whatever.

I also emailed ahead asking them what they serve that could accomodate a vegan. In their email response they said there were at least 5 dishes that were vegan.

I get to the restaurant and the dishes are appetizers, and when I ask the waitress about an idea I had with a dish, she scoffed at me and said "if you were in mexico, they wouldn't know what vegan is, and the kitchen is busy."

I'm not in effing mexico I'm in San Francisco, vegetarian capital of the world.

I'm sorry you are stressed, and the kitchen is stressed. It's a super popular restaurant. Be civil. I wasn't being annoying, just asking a question.
author: allison s.

description: I had the Quesadilla Roja and it was awesome! Unlike a previous reviewer, I don't think the tortilla was "overcooked" it was made intentionally crispy and worked really well with the delicious filling of pork, salsa, and cheese. And the chicharrons were great! (I usually hate chicharron...) It's the only place I've had to pay $3 for a Tecate and lime, but it was totally worth it because it added the perfect touch to an awesome meal.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Again with the pork.

Their highly touted carnitas as notably mentioned in the SF's 7x7 "100 Places to Try Before You Die" were a massive disappointment. I was expecting succulent and beyond juicy tenderness encapsulated by beautifully caramelized crispness - instead, it was slightly dry and surprisingly flavorless.

The usual warm, moist flesh dripping with well-seasoned savory flavors as a result from extensive marinating in luscious lard and flavorings were missing.  It was nicely presented but imperfectly executed.

We tried a variety of other dishes:
Taco de Pescado al Pastor
Marinated Fish, Lime, Tomatillo, Jalapeño, Cilantro,Avocado and Tortilla Chips
Panucho de Pollo al Pibil 
Mole Poblano con Pollo 

Nothing worth mentioning, however, it is the only "authentic" Mexican restaurant with a bathroom that doesn't induce hideous gasps - that alone deserves a second visit.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Just got back from dinner.  Had the Gordita, Ceviche and Carnitas.  All were great.  The Gordita was two thick corn tortillas mostly pressed into one, with a pocket at the top, filled with tomatoey-meaty beef stew.  The ceviche was a fishy white fish with a lot of crushed greens, probably cilantro and tomatillo, and the carnitas was a hunk of slow-roasted pork.

We each had a $9 margarita and then a $5 beer (two of each) and the total came to $70 with tax and tip.  Not bad for some of the best Mexican food in town!
author: Lauren J.

description: Every time I come here I'm always satisfied. You can go wrong with the ceviche, carnitias , Tacos de Pescado al Pastor, the torta, or the Birria de Res. Food is pricey for the quantity; but the quality is there so it makes up for it.
author: Beni R.

description:
Overall, a fantastic restaurant with more emphasis on the food than the experience.

Pro tip: call in ahead of time to get on the wait list

Service was surprisingly disappointing - wait time kept getting extended instead of them being straightforward with us ("your table is just being cleaned up, it'll be about five minutes" - when we saw the couple just finishing up dessert....it actually took about 30 minutes vs. the promised 5), kept forgetting order specifications, lagged on requests for condiments. 

Ambiance is modern but with an interesting patio area, but nothing to write home (or Yelp) about

Other than that, hats off to the chefs for putting together a creative and unique menu -- each dish had layers, depth, and richness. Fantastic. Also, a fabulous drinks list. 

Enjoy the culinary bit...accept the rest as part of the trade off
author: Meghana D.

description:
of all the uppity Mexican restaurants in sf, nopalito is the best.  the food is good and almost justifies the no reservations and long wait.

for drinks we tried the margarita and michelada.  both decent.  

for food we tried the  
Totopos Con Chile - comped because of the long wait!!! score!
Taco De Pescado Al Pastor - Seared fish in ancho chile adobo, orange, onion, cilantro and salsa de morita y tomatillo
Quesadilla Roja Con Chicharrón - Mulato chile-corn tortilla, crispy pork belly, salsa cascabel,jack cheese, queso fresco, onion and cilantro 
Pozole Rojo - Soup of pork shoulder, hominy, ancho chile, cabbage, radish Lime, onion, oregano and tortilla chips 
Birria con Costillas de Res- Short ribs stewed in ancho chile, roasted tomato, sesame seeds, spices, pickled onion, cilantro, rice and salsa de arbol
Mole Manchamanteles con Pato braised duck leg, toasted chilies, peanuts, roasted apples and plantains

everything was good!
author: claudia y.

description:
I think this place is overrated. I made the mistake of ordering the Totopos...basically just greasy tortilla chips with a cream sauce drizzled over them. I felt kind of sick after eating a handful of them. 
Then, unfortunately, I ordered the chilaquiles thinking it would be an eggy protein-rich delight with a bit of tortilla chip crunch. NOT the case. It was 95% tortilla chip, 5% egg. Not tasty, not satisfying, and definitely didn't sit well. 

I would give this place 1 star but I have a great respect for their handmade corn tortillas. Thick, fresh, delicious, and very hard to come by this day and age.
author: Zach B.

description:
Another attempt was made recently to allow this place to redeem itself.  I think the following have to be made clear before even we go any further: 

- Expect the wait to be 30 mins more than they say.  
- Then expect to be ignored by surly staff for the next 20 mins.  
- God forbid you should ask for some hot salsa or any other side to help salvage the meal... you will need to ask 3 different people, wait for at least 15 mins as your meal grows cold, and then get what you want after 2 incorrect attempts (first one sweet-ish, second one tapatio in a small bowl, third one (finally) a charm).
- You will be charged for all 3, including their "mistakes" (they did eventually correct that for us, though).

The following were ordered & consumed:

Panucho - very good
Fish Taco - good, but not rave-worthy
Torta de chilorio - friend described it as "almost as good as a sloppy joe out of a can"
Machaca -  lack luster

Now the reason I won't compare this place to a Mission taqueria is that at least one feels confident that the food is organic, good quality, etc. etc.  I'd pay the extra amount for that.  But PLEASE make it tasty!!!  And would it kill the staff to crack half a smile when talking to you?  All the time we were there, we felt like we had accidentally crashed a moment of extreme tragedy at the restaurant.

Unfortunately, this is going to have to join the ranks of "never again".
author: Vandana N.

description:
Piling on the Nopalito bandwagon.  All the good reviews are well-deserved.  We've gone a couple times (when we didn't get into Nopa) with our 6-month old daughter and they've always been cool about letting us sneak her car seat next to the table.

Love the unique chips and salsa, the ceviche was great as was the pozole rojo pork stew...but its all about the carnitas.  amazing.  crispy, tender, flavorful.  getting hungry now just thinking about it and its 9:30 in the morning...
author: Michael N.

description:
We came on a Friday night and there were 8 of us.  The place is not big and we had to wait awhile for a table since we had a big party.  We tried the white wine sangria and it tasted good. 

We ordered a lot of food. We had the shrimp enchilada, pork, corn with cheese, and a few other items that I can't name.  The food tasted good.

The reason why I'm giving this place a 3 star is because while I was waiting for a table, I left my drink on a table that was near the bar and a waitress came by to tell me that I can sit on the chair but not put my drink on the table because the table needs to be left clean for the next party.  I thought that was sort of rude and could have been handled better.  For instance, she could have given me a few napkins to put under my drink or even a coaster.  Instead, I may only sit and have to hold my drink in my hand the whole time.  This just means that if people are waiting for a table, DO NOT order a drink unless you're committed to holding the drink in your hand the whole time.  The bar is not an option because it is small and has no space for you to hang out.  

The ironic part about this situation was that the table I was about to dirty with my drink was actually for our party.  I sort of knew that table was going to be for us because it was one of the only few tables for 8 people.  

As a result, I probably wouldn't come back.  There are other places that have good food and better service.  Didn't really feel welcomed here.
author: Anh W.

description:
Some interesting tastes, (the green ceviche, the pork quesadilla), and the (not free) chips are quite thick and hearty. Unfortunately though, it was a once in a lifetime experience.

Stingy meat content for the price, and making the ceviche with about 75% squid instead of real fish was the last straw for me.

Finally, if you order the chips (totopos), be aware that they arrive 'pre-wettened' with sauce. This leads to premature  sogginess - and you no longer have control over how hot you want your nachos. Maybe you could request them with the sauce on the side. That would be better.
author: Davo W.

description: I live in the building above Nopalito and eat here often.  We usually walk in and have a great meal.  Tonight though we were met with attitude about how it is a long wait (which is fine we can wait), after I said we lived upstairs were asked if we were new the the neighborhood (no) since we didn't know the wait process and I said we had been in many times before and was told that we obviously came during non peak hours.  Granted after this encounter we were happy to venture to one of the many other good places in the area.   Nopalito is good, but not good enough to have this type of attitude.
author: Lesa W.

description: Had a great experience here. The vibe and food were both very good. Make sure to order the cheese quesadilla and the salsa platter. You won't be dissapointed.
author: Kim D.

description: Came here for a late lunch on a Sunday.  The ambiance is pretty relaxed and the service was very efficient and friendly.  I tried the taquitos and carnitas.  The taquitos were a bit too potato-y for me, but the carnitas were absolutely delicious.  I'm not usually a huge fan of pork but this was so tender I literally cut it with a fork.  I wish it came with guacamole, but otherwise it was perfect.
author: Denis S.

description: Really, really good. My fave was the chichronne quesadilla and second was the chips and salsa. The chips were lightly seasoned, not overly salty, and thick. It was crunchy with a little bit of chewiness, which I never thought was possible together. Service was good but a little slow. Reservations are needed for sure. The dinner bill for the four of us came out to be $175 total with tip, which included 6 shots of tequila. We were all full and satisfied. Great value and a great neighborhood restaurant!
author: Sylvia C.

description:
I wasn't wowed by anything I had here, but the food was certainly good enough that I'd go back again and try something new.

I really liked the totopos con chile, which was basically an alternative to the usual chips and salsa. The ceviche was nice and fresh, but I've definitely had better elsewhere. The quesadilla de primavera was OK.
author: Gloria B.

description:
I live pretty close to this place and find myself here every few months.  It is always on point and I've never had a bad meal here.  It is perfect for groups of 4 or so that want to order a bunch of plates and share or to go for your own entrees.  It's not terribly expensive, the quality of the food is very good and the portions are just right.

It gets pretty busy, and probably isn't worth a 2hr wait, but what is?  Call ahead and expect to wait 20 min when you get there.  Then order Totopos con Chili, pork-belly quesadilla, the lamb and the carnitas.  The chickpeas they give you to snack on are awesome and so are the little complementary cookies with the check.
author: Dan L.

description:
Why do restaurants have to be so loud?

Yes, the food was good, but we had to shout to have a conversation.  I left with a sort throat and ringing in my ears.  I will be hoarse tomorrow and my ears will be ringing all night.  Nothing is worth that.  There must be something they can do to reduce the noise level.  Whatever it is, they should do it already.
author: Bay G.

description:
After dining at Nopa, the bartender told me about Nopalito. I was meeting a friend from San Diego that is now a local but had not been. After looking up the menu, I knew I wanted to try this place. OMG...the food and service was AMAZING!!! The wait was  1/2 hour on Saturday night, however, they just call your cell phone when our table is ready so we decided to go around the block for a cocktail.
We were seated near the chef station at a bar like table, perfect for the two of us. We each enjoyed a glass of wine, split an appetizer and the flat iron steak for dinner. Yummy! Seriously, everything was so good!! We split dinner and still had leftovers to take back to my friends roomy. I can't wait to go here again and try more dishes. I also love how affordable it is for a place that seems so trendy and would seem overpriced...well, to our enjoyment, it was inexpensive and again, the service was beyond amazing!!!
author: Kellie N.

description:
I had a very enjoyable meal here and really like the atmosphere and staff.  The menu is set up to be able to share small plates.  I also definitely enjoyed my margaritas.  I split a couple of appetizers and the pozole all of which I thought was delicious.

However, I wouldn't bring my mother-in-law here because she would be very disappointed in the quality of flavors.  It is close but not quite authentic - definitely California cuisinified.
author: Jennie M.

description: Second time around, it was really nice. Excellent service. I really love this place as it is fast, clean and tasty. I wholly recommend the pepitos! Everything is presented so tastefully! Great parking... it's all very good!
author: Kevin F.

description:
Cal/Mex food.

[[ Carnitas ]] - 3 or 4 big chunks of pork shoulder served in baked parchment paper.  Very tender, the meat just comes apart so nicely.  Flavoring was good, but maybe just a tad bit dry.  The cabbage salad with jalapeños and salsa accompanied it quite well;  I wish there could have been more.
Came with 4 piping hot fresh corn tortillas, also in baked parchment paper.  The tortillas were a little bit too thick for my taste, and also a bit dry.
Overall, a relative disappointment for the 7x7 list.

[[ Tamal Enchilado ]] - holy moly - this was just rich.  They did not hold back on the queso fresco or creme.  Very tasty. 

Overall good food, but the price to tastiness ratio is just too high.
author: Jeanne L.

description: We had a thoroughly enjoyable meal here -- just what you'd expect from the folks who own the fabulous Nopa. Great food, friendly and fantastic service, and a cute space. The perfect place to go before or after a walk in the Panhandle.
author: E. G.

description:
So, for the first time ever, I couldn't finish my Carnitas (my fault, had a snack before coming here) and had to take the leftovers to-go.

You know what they did?! They wrote on the to-go box: Nopalito/ Carnitas/ 2-12-12. HOW AWESOME IS THAT.

Now that is some damn fine customer service to go with some damn fine food!
author: Rachel H.

description:
The owners of Nopa are staying true to the spirit of serving the fresh and sustainable food at their restaurants.  Both Nopalito's are up to par with serving the best quality food at a reasonable price to its patrons.  Yes! The carnitas are the best here, but thats not all.  The evening menu is quiet different from the midday choices, but there's nothing on the menu which isn't good.  All the prior reviews speak to the food and the high quality of service the Nopa family adheres to.

Both Nopalito's are great dining choices.
author: Vijay P.

description:
My vegetarian, environmentally-conscious college roommate came to the Bay Area to visit one day back when. She wanted to try this place and I thought, why not.

We drove over and immediately found street parking but upon arrival, soon realized that there was a garage right next to the restaurant (FAIL).

We then proceeded to the restaurant and there was a long long....like...long wait. We probably waited for about an hour and a half. For those of you that cannot and will not wait that long, I suggest you have a plan B.

Well, we walked next door to a grocery store to consume time and then chatted away until we were called, which was probably 8:30 (also, go super early so you wouldn't have to eat around 9).

We were seated and looked at their menu options. Everything seemed fresh and delicious. My roommate ordered a quesadilla (I think) and I ordered chicken soup. Both were good. I liked my chicken soup because it was super fresh, and unusual in that it had diced up avocados in it. 

The waitress was nice enough to explain the soup to me, indicating the spicy pepper that was part of the soup. I actually didn't care if it was spicy or not. However, curiosity got to me and I decided to squeeze the sh*t out of the pepper to test it out. Maybe it's because I am Asian and I can take a good amount of spice, but...it was not...spicy... at ...all. 

The restaurant crowd was casual. There were families and an unusually high proportion of the older crowd, rather than us post college students in jeans. There were two super dressed up girls next to us (bright red lipstick, matching jewelry, etc) talking non-stop about their boy troubles, which was super entertaining.

In terms of cost, prices were fair but I would rather spend my money on something else. My roommate, however, was hooked.
author: Lily Z.

description: The Bloody Maria is delicious! Food is good, but unfortunately not amazing. I've had better ceviche. Service is kind of slow and certainly not on par with a 4-star 1000+ review restaurant. I may return to try out different foods, and hopefully will have a better service experience.
author: Christina N.

description: Delicious, spicy, unique. Left me wanting more. Succulent flavors..I haven't been excited by eating out in a very long time. Nopalito got me excited and grateful for chefs out there making fresh, TASTY, and memorable dishes. Can't wait to go back.
author: Rupa V.

description: I'm a big fan of Nopa but it took me a long time to get to their smaller sister place. Always looking for a good new place for Mexican fare. There's certainly a new movement in finer versions of the fare and Nopalito is doing it justice. I don't usually eat very early but since I was in the area for a business meeting, we came here for some eats for the night. Good thing we did because the place was already a 20min wait around 6.30pm. Chicken Mole, Carne Asada, Albodigas, Ceviche, Empanadas, and Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón. Solid across the board. Got some chocolate and peach/nectarine paletas to finish the meal. Service is also friendly and efficient. After 7 the places it packed to the gills and from the business associate he said the wait could be two hours. That's just insane. Great food but go early or you'll be standing around for a great long while
author: Kim N.

description: Excellent upscale Mexican cuisine in SF! The topos con queso is probably one of the best thing I've ever had. Also spice chickpeas and almond cookies are included with the meal which tops the experience.
author: Ashley A.

description:
If you're a NoPa hater (the name of the neighborhood, not the restaurant), then you'll probably cringe even more at the overly precious-sounding "Nopalito." I am personally a fan of NoPa (the neighborhood) but after a couple of tries, not really of Nopalito (the restaurant, if that wasn't completely obvious).

First off, the wait on a late weekday evening is just as horrendous as at the parent restaurant, and unlike the latter you can't make reservations. Luckily though, you can put your name on the list, buy a 6-pack from the adjoined Faletti Foods, and enjoy a couple of cold ones in the tabled area outside the shopping center and restaurant. Plus points!

The venue is casual and small. There's covered outside seating, a tall communal table, and only a few individual tables inside. Service is slow and spotty. The setup definitely takes a strange turn when you have to actually exit the restaurant to use the restroom, which is accessible from Broderick Street and doubles up as a takeout window (well, the foyer to get to the bathroom, not the toilet itself... but basically!). Wee-yerd.

Taqueria-goers (*raises hand*) might see some familiar items on the menu, but many of them aren't what you expect. The quesadilla roja con chicarron does not come sliced into sections for you to share, but cut it up with your knife, have yourself a bite, and you won't care--it is SO yummy. We also tried the ceviche, which was good, though I've had better. The caldo tlalpeno is a tasty, spicy chicken and vegetable soup, but I wouldn't recommend it if you're hungry. The chicken mole that just got a shoutout in the June issue of San Francisco Magazine in my opinion was too bitter and nothing to write home about. I liked my chile chocolate milk more than my entree--served cold and flecked with red chiles (it's got a kick!). Finally, I preferred the tender, fatty carnitas (not the shredded kind you see in burritos) over the carne asada, which didn't wow me.

The lady sitting next to me at the communal table claimed that the homemade tortillas were the best she's ever had. I thought they were just ok. They're served in a brown paper bag which our server told us is both for blotting the oil and "presentation." This confuses me, as I could get an equally well-presented paper bag at Papalote up the street for much less. Which is what I think I will do from now on--Nopalito's organic Mexican has some high points, but it's just not really my thing.
author: Kate V.

description:
Quality, fancy Mexican food is one of my favorites, and Nopalito doesn't disappoint. I'm sure the menu is sexier if you eat meat, but even as a veggie I was happy with the available options. I tried: 

Totopos con chile - home made tortilla chips covered in spicy salsa and shaved cotija cheese with crema and lime;
Pepinos con chile y limón - salad of cucumber, radishes, pickled white onion, 
lime and chile;
taquitos de papas adobadas - Crispy rolled tortillas, potatoes in New Mexico chile adobo, onion, guacamole, crema, queso fresco and salsa brava.

The little shopping center it's in lacks a little personality, but the food makes up for it. 

They text you if you're waiting in line, which I appreciate.

Definitely head over if you're in the area.
author: Amber K.

description: Nopalito is one of my top favorite restaurants in the city. I absolutely love this place. Clean and has good vibes. The people who work there are friendly. The food is fresh and always consistently good. I can tell that a lot of love goes into the dishes. I am never disappointed with them.
author: Alejandra L.

description:
I can recommend this place with no reservations! Which is appropriate because they take no reservations.

Grown-ups don't complain about the wait at restaurants. Either because the wait means it's popular, and for whatever reason you want in on the action... or because you can always go elsewhere. That said, this place is muy popular, so call ahead and put yourself on the waiting list and then enjoy a drink somewhere else for the estimated wait time.

Once you're seated, order the totopos. Hand made chips from scratch by grinding the corn that morning, making masa, pressing into tortillas, cutting, frying. Think about the labor involved and stop wondering why this place is a bit more expensive than the corner taqueria that gets raw materials from Sysco and bags of chips from Costco.

Ordert the carnitas, because it is possibly the most wonderful piece of pork you'll ever eat, other than maybe bacon but that's an unfair comparison because bacon rules the universe. Seriously, get the carnitas. Thank me later.

Just about everything I've tried there has been great, so feel free to explore. Anything with crispy pork belly is great. Not totally sold on the pozole however, maybe it's just me but I like it with massive nuggets of hominy. Beer selection is great, as are the fresh juice concoctions.

Highly recommended.
author: d p.

description: This place has great food, my favorite is their topos and their horchata is so creamy. Its Mexican food with a twist! Its not your traditional Mexican place... this place has something extra for sure! Its a good place to have lunch or a casual dinner. My only complaint is that they are often very busy and you need to call ahead to make sure they can accommodate you. I have been there twice and the first time, they had an hour and a half wait but if you have the time... its worth it.
author: Andrea G.

description: Super delicious. Unique menu items. Great flavor. Fun stop for dinner. Friendly staff. Definitely recommend and will return!!
author: Erika Z.

description: By far the best Hispanic food I've ever had. My friend and I came from vegas and we were stunned. The ceviche, panucho de pollo al pibil, and the quesadilla al rojo de chicharrón. Absolutely stunned! Will be back!
author: Kenya B.

description:
I find the prices reasonable and service is great. And the food is every bit of yum that you'd find at Nopa, albeit staying within in a Mexicali theme.

Last time, I took a visiting family of five with me. The place is family friendly, complete with coloring books and colored pencils. And the waiter couldn't have been nicer about a two year-old throwing his water on the floor.
author: Gregory F.

description: I wish I did not live so close to this restaurant. I love everything on their menu and have tried them all. We always order the ceviche, empanada, and carnitas.
author: Carb Q.

description: Food was super delicious! Loved the quesadillas! Even the zucchini flower one! The queso appetizer was also delicious! So ummm everything was super yummy so I would totally recommend this place!
author: Veronica F.

description:
Dearest Nopalito, how I heart thee!

After my not-so-impressive Nopa experience, Nopalito came through and exceeded my expectations. First off, there was PARKING. Did you just read what I wrote? There is parking, like in a structured garage. In San Francisco. I don't have a car, but this is major brownie points for when and if I have one.

Thyme sangria, I adored. Totopos con Chile (light nachos) were delightful but too much filling food for a party of 2. The ceviche is an absolute must.

The carnitas were juicy and delicious. Enchiladas were not bad, but it was our 2nd choice after they had just run out of the seafood stew.

Service was super polite, warm, and accommodating. They even send you a text when your table is ready--how SF like! Nopalito, you have yourself a new, loyal fan.
author: Annie L.

description:
I am hesitant to write this review because I am afraid that Nopalito will be too popular if everyone finds out about it.

However, I will post this anyway. l loved the flavors of each of our dishes we ordered last night. The ceviche, the quesadilla and the carne asada were all excellent. It reminded me of the food I was so fond if when I spent a month travelling in Peru. 

Overall, the cuisine is excellent and I highly recommend trying this place out. The only reason I did not give five stars is because our to-go order took about 20 minutes longer than they specified and the restroom / to-go pickup location is awkward.
author: Charlie M.

description:
The margarita was mostly ice cubes, the guacamole was nice ( too bad our waitress took it away before we were done with it), the cucumber salad was ok. We ordered pozoli but we got the sea food stew ( our waitress was in la la land).
Nothing was worthy of coming back to put up with incompetent service .
author: Foodlover B.

description:
I love everything about Nopalito - the atmosphere, the food, the service, it was all amazing. 

You can call ahead to put your name on the list if they're running a wait - LOVE spots that do this.
The tequila selection is extensive and great! Our waiter helped us choose a great one to try. The margaritas are so good! And not sweet/cheapy tasting!
Onto the food - Carnitas, helllllllo, yes yes yes. I love carnitas and these are so so so good.
Totopos con Chile - really good - spicy
Quesadilla con Repollitos de Bruselas - surprisingly delicious and a unique taste!
Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón - realllllly tasty!
Carne Asada con Chorizo y Papas - omygod, this was so good, I could eat it everyday. If you like Chorizo AND Carne Asada, it doesn't get better!!

Nopalito, you're amazing.
author: Francesca F.

description: No matter how many times we've been there -- approx 3x a month since they opened -- the food, beverages and service have never been less than 5 stars. Last night we had guacamole and chips, ling cod tacos, trout tostada and for the first time we tried the flan. All crazy good. Brunch, lunch or dinner, there's never been a misstep. There's always a line but if you call in they will put your name on the list to save you some time.
author: Cydney B.

description:
Mmmmm, chilaquiles!

I've been working my way through some fantastic (and not so great) chilaquiles in this city and must add Nopalito's to the top of the list. Sure, it's a fancy pants version using the finest of ingredients instead of leftover tortillas but I'll put this up with the best the Mission has to offer. Order a plate of these bad boys with a homemade Michelada (beer with tomato, chili de arbol, salt, lime) and you can kiss your hangover goodbye.

A few useful facts: 
Nopalito usually runs a wait but you can call ahead and put your name on the list. And even though the patio is semi-enclosed, it is dog friendly. 

Hurray for puppies and cerveza!
author: phil h.

description: Amazing fresh flavors. The fish tacos had fresh oranges in them which took it to the next level of deliciousness, accompanied by a teaser of the marinated veggies, I was in heaven! My daughter loved her Totopos Con Chili and couldn't finish it, so I disagree with the portion size complaints in earlier reviews. Maybe they've increased their portions since earlier reviews. We were very happy with our meal.
author: Cristelle T.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy. Not your hole-in-the-wall Mexican food. Very good tasting dishes for dinner - we shared several items and drinks and the bill came to $60 total. This place is always busy, so I recommend calling ahead to put your name on the wait list. They will call / text you when your table is almost ready and are flexible if you need to walk over / find parking. I would highly recommend for dinner with friends or a date.

1. Queso Flameado con Chorizo y Nopales
(Flamed Oaxacan & jack cheese, house made red chorizo, seared cactus, onions and tortilla chips)
This dish was really good, but a little too cheesy / greasy for my taste. It is basically a cheese dip with chorizo. I would not order this again.

2. Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón
(Mulato chile-corn tortilla, crispy pork belly, salsa cascabel, jack cheese, queso fresco, onion and cilantro)
This chicken quesadilla was great and could be shared between 2 people. It was not overly full or cheesy. I would definitely order again.

3. Birria de Res
(Grass fed beef stewed in ancho chile, roasted tomatoes, sesame seeds, spices, pickled onion, cilantro, lime, Mexican rice and salsa de arbol)
The beef was tender and could be pulled apart with a fork. The dish was served with soft tortillas so you could make small tacos with the beef, rice, & salsa. Everything was perfectly seasoned and I would definitely order this dish again.
author: Lindsay N.

description:
Nopalito is Nopa's younger, hipper, more Latina little sister. 

The two dishes that were a standout were the empanadas and the carnitas. The empanada had a fried masa shell stuffed with tender cubes of beef and softened onions. This is great to share because it is very heavy. 

The carintas were out of control good; combined with the fresh homemade tortillas... Amazing. 

Since Nopalito is not technically a "tacqueria", I can't say, it is the cleanest tacqueria I've ever been. You can't compare it to say, El Farolito on 24th. 

The bathroom is not ideally located. You need to go outside, make a left, go through another door, make and a right at the singing bush...
author: Monica L.

description: Yum, yum super yum, specially their carnitas. I go to this place just for that. The Tamal con Birria de Pollo are also good and the paletas de chocolate (chocolate popsicle) ... yum! Seared fish tacos are also good. Traditional food with a twist; props to the cooks and whomever that put this together. Garbonzo beans instead of chips for a snack, free sparking water on tap and free parking wop, wop!
author: Moy V.

description:
The food here is okay, but ultimately mediocre. The ingredients are fresh, and some dishes are tasty while others are bland.

What really drags this place down is the service. The staff are rude and unhelpful, and are far more concerned with getting people in and out as quickly as possible than giving good service.

This restaurant has a really bad booking system that they need to sort out. You can't make bookings, but must call two hours in advance to put your name on a waitlist. They will not seat you unless your whole group is there even there are empty tables.
author: Lis M.

description: Food is delicious. Mezcal is realllllly good. Would come again. Prices not bad. Ordered the carnitas and not much food but really tasty
author: Sasha O.

description: Absolutely phenomenal. I can not give this place the praise it deserves. Going in to a trendy gluten free Mexican spot I didn't know what to expect, but everything we had was so so delicious. The empanada was wonderful, the carnitas were wonderful, the guacamole with pomegranate seeds was wonderful, it was all very fresh and delicious. The staff as well was so friendly and was glad to have a conversation with us and answer any questions we had. THIS PLACE IS A NECESSITY FOR DINNER IN THE CITY.
author: Amy D.

description: Trendy and fun restaurant. Our meals were delicious, and I love the traditional take on the Mexican food. Plus, any restaurant that has an open kitchen where you can see them making the food (and making the tortillas fresh) is a huge plus!
author: Brian H.

description: Its Mexican Food for hipsters. I'm a realist when it comes to my Mexican food i like amazingly fresh flavors and low cost. Nopalito has good food but I feel like its over priced for what you get. The menu is short and simple. A few tacos an empanada and a toastada and a few other tasty treats. The Enchiladas Mineras is good but not what you'd expect and the Birria con Costillas de Res is a nice short rib entree. i don't know if they have dessert, no one offered it to us. I might go back if you take me (yes i mean you, message me)
author: Kameelah R.

description: The nachos is amazing!!! Most authentic nachos I've ever tasted. The quesidilla is delicious. I'm vegetarian and I give it four stars because I didn't think it was filling but overall yummers!
author: Tulsi M.

description:
Ah, yes!! Some authentic Mexican food in the Bay Area. A San Diego girl's life just got a little brighter. I ate here last night and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Low-lit patio dining, strong margaritas, delicious food, and an attentive server.

I got the Pozole Rojo, and when that giant bowl was placed in front of me I knew I was in for a treat. It came with board stocked with extra seasonings & accompaniments that really took the stew over the top. The pork was unbelievably tender, and I don't know why I love hominy so damn much, but any dish that utilizes it this well is an instant winner in my book. Everyone in our group just about licked their plates clean. 

The prices are surprisingly reasonable considering the quality of the food. I can't wait to back here and try something new!
author: Brittany E.

description: I came here for the first time today. It's a pretty mellow laid back place. The food was really yummy. I had some dank butternut squash tequitos and a delicious quesadilla. The staff was super friendly and I can't wait to go back and try something new. I'd recommend trying 2 of the smaller dishes to get some variety and a full stomach for a decent price.
author: Harrison M.

description:
food was decent and definitely overpriced. 3 stars for VERY strong margaritas.

carnitas was probably the best dish, but everything else was pretty standard. didnt excite my palette.
author: Daniel S.

description:
The carnitas were delicious!! Everyone loved their food. The portion sizes were spot on, a bit pricey for the amount of food, but right on for the quality. Especially when dealing with heavy sauces and tortillas, smaller portion sizes are critical, and this place nailed it.

Margaritas were average, but it's not exactly a world class beverage to begin with. My own fault for ordering it.

Sat outside with heat lamps that I was near certain would boil my skin, waiter was very kind to turn them off/on in rotation to not fry all of us alive. Service was great, kind staff.
author: Michael F.

description:
When I first saw Nopalito, I admit I did not have high hopes.  It didn't look like a place that would serve good authentic Mexican food.  Perfect lesson learned -- don't judge a restaurant by its facade!

I rarely drink but decided to have a sangria.  I got the last glass...and wow, discovered firsthand why they were down to the last glass.  It was refreshing and not too sweet.  Perfect blend of fruit, wine...mmm.

My friends raved about the totopos all the way to the restaurant.  And for good reason, they were so good!  Freshly made tortilla chips soaked in a red chile sauce?  Count me in!  Everything we tried here was delicious -- the tostada, fish tacos, empanadas, ceviche and carnitas.  

We were a little disappointed with the dessert menu but ordered their homemade popsicles.  The chocolate was heavenly.  Very rich, dark chocolate, creamy, really really good.  I definitely want to go back.
author: Yuli B.

description:
Everything is sooooo good! Yes, it's pricey for Mexican food, but that's what happens when you open up a restaurant in San Francisco that uses local, organic and sustainable ingredients.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Had the ceviche verde and El Diablo cocktail. Ceviche was light and fresh - perfect! Cocktail was delicious too!
author: Chervey F.

description:
Went with two other couples, on a Friday night at 7. We were seated around 8:15, as they do not have a reservation system. We were able to stand at a small space near the bar where four of us order cocktails(margarita pitcher). We waited at the bar for about 30 minutes, 20 minutes waiting for the cocktails. Not sure if the bar-standers were second priority, but it certainly felt that way.

We were seated and ordered another round of drinks, the other two of us ordered their drinks(a beer and a margarita). 

We ordered family style and the food came quickly. The stand-outs for me were: the taquitos, the totopos con chile and the carnitas. The totopos were addicting! Wish I could make those well at home. The cabbage and salsa verde that came with the carnitas was outstanding. I wanted more. 

Most of the food came out before the cocktails my friends ordered. Maybe the bar was really backed up? This definitely was a tad annoying for my friends...but it didn't disparage the entire experience for us.

Overall, the food was really good. Will definitely go back for that, but possibly at lunch to avoid the wait/crowds/slow bar service.
author: Laura H.

description:
In love with this place! I recently came here for a small birthday dinner with friends and it was delicious. We shared pitchers of margaritas and a variety of small plates. They have plenty of vegetarian options, however, I believe the meat is their specialty. I have been back since and still had an amazing time.

Some stand out things we sampled: 
1. Ceviche Verde de Pescado - Marinated fish, lime, tomatillo, jalapeño, cilantro,               
avocado and tortilla chips

2. Quesadilla Roja con Chicharrón - Mulato chile-corn tortilla, crispy pork belly, salsa cascabel, jack cheese, queso fresco, onion and cilantro

3. Carnitas - Braised pork, orange, bay leaf, milk, cinnamon, beer, cabbage salad, pickled jalapeño and salsa de tomatillo

4. Empanada con Deshebrada de Res - Fried masa pastry, grass-fed beef, tomato, jalapeño, cabbage, avocado, queso fresco and salsa frita de guajillo

Our food always comes out quickly and the staff is very friendly, which makes for a great dining experience. One downside is that they don't take reservations and this place fills up fast. A quick tip would be to call before and put yourself on the "Call Waitlist". When a table opens up, they will call or text your cell to let you know. The last time we did this, our group walked down the street to the Page, and had a few beers before dinner.
 
Always an epic time at Nopalito.
author: Talia M.

description:
Let me preface this review, by saying I love Nopa, which is arguably my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.

So when I heard that Nopa had a Mexican restaurant offshot, Nopalito, I was intrigued and worried. Could the little brother of the behemoth Nopa, live up to the standards of their big brother? The answer is a resounding yes. If you are currently following the 2011 NBA playoffs I liken the Nopa and Nopalito relationship to Pau and Marc Gasol. Pau has been the headlining grabbing big brother for years now and Marc has always been the chubby little brother that no one thought would amount to anything special. But so far, as the 2011 NBA playoffs have shown, little brother got game! And that's how I feel about Nopalito, sure you stand in the shadows of your big brother, but baby it's time for you to shine!

Sure it is a pain in the ass to have to wait for a table; their are no reservations. Our wait was almost 2 hours. Irritating yes. But worth it in the end because this is best fancy Mexican food in the City. Hands down. Pardon my ignorance, but fancy Mexican food is an oxymoron when you are someone who is only familiar with the sour cream drenched and indigestion inducing foods of your local taqueria or taco truck. 

The dishes they serve up excel on so many levels, including texture, taste, and presentation. The food is elegant, but comforting. 

For starters we had the totopos con chile, in layman's terms tortilla chips and cheese dip. However, this was no ordinary chip. The chips were coated in a orange-y sauce that was both tangy and spicy. The sauce was baked on, so it wasn't messy. But man it sure enhanced the flavor of this super chip. The cheese was white and creamy. Honestly, I don't what I was eating, but man was it good. 

We also shared an empanada con deshebrada de res. I have no idea what this translates into, but the empanada was bomb dot com. I am big on texture and the empanada was super crispy and flaky. It was stuffed with grass fed beef and other super delicious and fresh ingredients, including queso and salsa. Again, pardon my ignorance, but I can't name half the things in this empanda, but my senses do not fail me, this was pure deliciousness. 

For my main entree, I had the quesadilla toja con chicharrón; a quesadilla made with pork belly. Only one human sound is guttural and visceral enough to describe the pleasure one gets from this dish, and that one sound is fughhhhhhh. Talk about pure mouthgasm food. Fughhhh. I am at lost with words trying to write out a description for this dish. I won't even bother. Just try this dish if you love pork belly or just plain good food. That is all.
