After walking by Nopalito in progress for almost 8? months and questioning whether they would compete with little Chihuaha (a big fav) we decided to finally try it out.
I wouldnt put it out as traditional Mexican having spent a LOT of time eating in Mexico, and not in Cancuen or other "authentic" destinations.
The freshness of the quality, the incredible taste of the meat, masa and other ingredients (have the carnitas!!!!) reminded me of what a meal in Mexico can taste like. 
Nothing smothered in cheese or mediocre tomato paste salsa (mexican place on Valencia and 16th). 
Definitely worth the wait- call ahead and go for a walk around the Panhandle, or head to Nopa for a margarita while you wait.
One star off for the lack of good alcoholic beverages- DONT get the rose and the bathroom situation- it kills the meal to go stand in a glorified telephone booth for 5 minutes witha drunk fellow customer breathing down your neck. Nopalito- pleease change the bathroom!

Otherwise I will be there at least once a week!
author: Alanna M.

description: Maybe they should hire staff based on skills rather than how many green shirts they own.
author: Katherine B.

description: I love this place.  It's as good as any expensive restaurant but the prices are so reasonable.
author: Anna K.

description: This place is incredible -- great location/atmosphere, really amazing and innovative food and a great, and very knowledgeable, staff. Even better? It is REALLY affordable. Two of us stuffed ourselves and had drinks and the tab was less than $30 total!
author: Wyatt H.

description: Fairly priced and food is good.  I had the goat once which wasn't as good as other places, but generally pleased with the quality of food.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Cheap & Cheerful!!
I loved this place, service was great,  and be sure to have the carnitas with the roasted cheesy corn it was deeelicious and perfect to share!
Will go back to try the quesidillas and the watermelon salad soon!!
author: julie b.

description: I absolutely love the Popsicles!!  Yummy place to grab lunch.
author: Jace K.

description: I've been to Nopalito several times and each one was amazing.  Their carnitas are great and a staple each time I go.  I also love the Totopos con Chile.  The sauce soaked in to the chips is amazing.  I've tried almost the entire menu and haven't had a bad plate yet.
author: Johnny O.

description: Great upscale Mexican food - don't miss the carnitas or the totopas!  This is the sister restaurant to NOPA and both are excellent.
author: Tom H.

description: This is not a taqueria.  If you want that go elsewhere.  I love the fact that they have magnolia beer, I don't love that they won't take reservations.  Portions on the meals are good sized but the price / volume /quality seems a bit off on the starters.    The carnitas and all of the fish dishes have been top of the mark, each and every time.
author: M M.

description: Great location, fast service, but my ancho chili steak was tough as nails. Flavor was great, but waay chewy. Wife had the Goat stew, she said it could be "goatier" we had quick service for them being as busy as they were. But the steak just blew a full star for me
author: Mike P.

description: I would give this 3 1/2 stars. I only had the Pozole Rojo, it was good, fresh tasting, although needed more seasoning. Just came here for a quick, cheaper eat so it was satisfying but not amazing.  The setting was nice, very modern/eco looking.
author: yolanda f.

description: My husband and entered the restaurant, which does not take reservations at 7pm and were immediately confused about where to leave our name for a table.  We waited 2-3 minutes and then flagged down a waiter to ask how we could get our name on the list for a table. He told us "you need to talk to that guy on the phone."  We waited another 5 minutes for the host to finish his phone call all while feeling we were in the way because there is no place to wait but in the middle of the action.  The system for seating people seemed very disorganized and tables were left empty while many people waited -and a party that arrived 10 minutes after us was seated before us.  After one hour of waiting, we finally got a table and waited 10 minutes to have anyone acknowledge us to take our order.  The food was acceptable, but certainly not worth the stress I felt.
author: libby a.

description: The food is good. . The carnitas are my favorite.. I wouldnt wait for a table to eat there because the wait is too long but they have a to go window thats much faster. The staff is friendly..Ill be going back .
author: Kristo V.

description: This is NOT  your typical Mexican restaurant!  Don't expect cheap tacos and burritos.  Instead, you can expect a changing menu of delicious dishes that show off the true complexity and depth of Mexican cuisine.  It's not cheap, but it's worth it!
author: Rob S.

description:
Ive heard a ton about this trendy "local, traditional etc..." new eatery in our neighborhood and was excited when we got there because it wasnt as crowded as I had expected.
The excitement ends there.
It was a billion degrees inside.
When our waiter finally came to the table he acted irritated and annoyed that we asked for a diet coke. It was hot inside and wanted a soda. He then proceeded to wave in the direction of our menus and insist that there are some great organic spritzers if we would just look better at the menu. Ok so we just ordered water. (It arrived warm- in a cute milk bottle though...) Then we ordered our meal. 
I got the albacore taco and the sweet corn tostada. My boyfriend ordered the chicken enchiladas.
My taco was miniature and overcooked but had good spicy flavor. My sweet corn tostada was really good until I realized it was a bowl of corn. Doesnt tostada mean there is at least a tortilla at the bottom? My boyfriend liked the chicken, it was moist and flavorful- the "enchiladas" were a joke. 
When we finished it took 20 minutes to get our bill.
This place was ok- I respect and understand what they are trying to do but not quite reaching it.
Pretentious and overrated. Felt like it should be in the Marina
author: Rocktavia H.

description:
Good Inventive mexican food with a twist.

The food is fresh and interesting, and they have a great strawberry Sangria. A great place to eat BEFORE you go shopping at the Faletti market
author: carol g.

description:
I loved this place! 

Not the typical Mexican restaurant. The food is quality not quantity, like you see in other places that try to make up for the crappy food by giving you a lot- not this place! 
The food is spiced to perfection. The presentation is simple and elegant, makes the perfectly cooked food shine! 
They have some traditional favorites that don't show up in ANY Mexican restaurants that I have seen here in the US. For example. the watermelon salad with lime and dusted with chile piquin. This is something my father (Mexican) would have for a snack or after a meal. Its comforting to see on the menu and a wonderful way to finish off a meal - no matter how full you are. Great way to cleans the pallet between plates too. 

We went with my high maintenance, squirmy 1 year old and the waitstaff was down to earth and all around AWESOME!!!! 
They anticipated her every need. They got her a hand made tortilla before anything so she would be less fussy. When I asked for some hot water for her bottle (anywhere else would usually bring me HOT water for tea), but the nice gentleman brought me warm water knowing it was for my little one. Anytime anyone antisipates my kids needs, you immediately get a gold star from me!
 At one point my fork fell and before I got up from fetching it, another awesome server was there with a fresh one. 
we ordered A LOT of food to share so we can all taste everything and I had NOTHING bad to say about any of it. 
My favorite thing I ate was the quesadillas with squash blossoms also the other quesadilla with chicharon definitely try the enjitomatada. sooooooo yummy! 
I LOVE every aspect of this place I cant wait to go back. 
wait .....I do have ONE complain - no place to change my baby's diaper in the bathroom. As a new mom I never realized how important that is! Requesting a baby changing station...
author: Ana M.

description: First go around....unimpressed, to say the least.  Had the no flavor havin' chilaquiles.  All chip....very little cheese and blando-o sauce.  Save your money.  One more chance, then I'm out.
author: Gabriel F.

description: Nopalito is one of the best Mexican restaurants in San Francisco. Food here is always fresh and delicious. If you are looking for authentic flavors with slight gourmet twist then you have found your place. When you come here please do not expect to find Americanized fare like the ones found in the taquerias of the bay area. This is real Mexican food that samples from the diverse cuisines found throughout Mexico.
author: Jaime O.

description: Growing up in Albuquerque, NM where greasy spoon Mexican food rules, I have always been ambivalent about higher-end Mexi-cuisine.  Nopalito brushes aside all that and delivers amazing faire.  Had three courses here.  Started with Totopos con Chile, flavored tortilla chip/nacho type appetizer that were so addictive and delicious that I was afraid I wasn't going to have room for the rest of my order.  A fish taco with sturgeon, that although small, seemed to have an internal barometer that screamed when it was perfectly seasoned, and the chefs listened.  Finished with a goat stew that was so saucy and delicious that my eyes watered.  Also, easy parking, great service, and fantastic ambiance.  See you there!
author: Josh B.

description:
5 stars for great service! Everyone was friendly, attentive, and helpful, and you can call ahead for the wait list.

5 stars for atmosphere! Check out the pretty succulents garden around the heated patio!

5 stars for presentation. They show a great commitment to keeping an authentic Mexican look.

5 stars for the appetizers! Try the ceviche, it's yummy!

4 stars for the entrees. The mole was great, but the dish didn't come with any veggies on the side...

4 stars for the dessert options. The Popsicle was great and all, but how about some more options and some coffee available? 

Overall I'm giving them 5 stars. Definitely worth it for a special treat. A little pricey for an every week type of date night, but once in a while, we'll definitely be back!
author: Alex M.

description:
this is not the place to go if you like mission taquerias.
the portions will disappoint and the prices will make you feel poor.
if you can put that aside,
the food is ok, nothing tasted BAD, but nothing made me happy either.
the mole was weirdly TANGY to me, the cabbage salad was plain & little too limey, the ceviche dish was good, but tiny.
and i found the chips a bit soggy.
but that's just me.
author: Kim Y.

description: My first try I ordered food to go.  I asked the waiter for suggestions on what to order to for 3 adults and 2 kids for dinner.  Arrived home to feast and found the portions embarrassingly small.  I should have took my $64 to a taco joint.
author: Karla D.

description: This is fancy and not cheap organic Mexican, but you can still wear jeans to the restaurant.  I love it.  I want to take their tortilla lady home with me and have her make me those awesome blue corn tortillas all day long.  The homemade horchata and popsicles are also excellent.  Entree wise the vegetarian offerings are slim, but hey it's a Mexican restaurant. The vegetarian quesadilla is always inventive and delicious, and there's a few other dishes they will make veggie if you ask.
author: saru k.

description: Like almost every restaurant, there are a few great items on the menu that make up for the really bad ones. After a much anticipated meal here, I was very disappointed. We started off with the totopos to share which were very tasty and would order again if I ever went back. My ceviche, on the other hand, was so cold I could hardly taste the flavors. My chicken tamale was pretty good, but nothing to write home about. I decided to order dessert since I'm Hispanic and love "arroz con leche". Well, this one was not the typical latin american arroz con leche. It was so overdone I couldn't even tell it was rice pudding. They had added so much vanilla, raisins and chocolate that the flavors were all over the place. My husband ordered the "carne asada" and he wasn't very impressed by it. So overall, it was a decent meal, just so over hyped I don't think I will be driving across the city again to eat there.
author: Gabriela H.

description: I love this place! It if wasn't for the long waits almost every night., I would give it 5 stars. I love the food, service and vibe!
author: Kimberlee L.

description:
A disappointment when I think about how much my fiance and I enjoyed Nopa.  We started with the Tamal Enchilado de Queso y Puerco. It was pretty good - nothing bad, but nothing spectacular either. 

I then had the Pozole Rojo which was soooo bland! I poured the entire salt dish into it with little luck in improving its flavor. 

My fiance faired a bit better. He ordered the Enchiladas Placeras. Again, the enchiladas were soooo bland!  However, the chicken breast was delicious - soooo flavorful and moist!  The imbalance was amazing. As he had the only thing we both enjoyed we shared his chicken, skipped on the homemade popsicles (I mean what if it was bland too?), and headed to Mitchell's for ice cream. 

** On a positive note, our server was cool, and the service was great.
author: PK H.

description: every time i go back to this place, it blows me away, so i'm changing this to 5 stars.
author: amanda a.

description:
...adobe tortilla chips with creme'..yummy!
tecate to accompany steamy pozole soup..eating with the longest spoon i've ever used! pozole toppings were missing the additional cilantro, red cabbage and additional radishes..but tasty & a bit overloaded with chipotle seasonings for "traditional" pozole. 
friendly service with  smiling cute people bringing cold beers just before the last ones were drained!
overall, i'd go back again n again.
...
author: irisholive o.

description: A great place for informal, relaxed healthy Mexican food at a convenient place.  To have free parking and a great supermarket next door makes it all the better.  The only drawback is that it gets a bit busy and crowded, as well as, way too many small children in the early dinner time (sorry parents).
author: Jeff R.

description:
We love this place! The casual but clean/contemporary decor, the neighborhood feel and the food are always appealing and yummy and we have never had a bad experience there. The service is warm and personalized (after we'd been a few times, all the wait staff started recognizing us and giving us a warm welcome) and we love the fact that you don't need reservations but you can call ahead and put your name on the list, thereby basically eliminating the wait if you get your act together ahead of time. 
As for the food, my favorites are the sumptuous carnitas, the delicious chicken tostada and the strawberry lemonade but everything I've tried (even the soup) is good. And don't miss the fun popsicles for dessert.
As we await our first baby, we also definitely plan to bring our little one here. This is not only a cute place for a casual date but if you're there on the early side, it's a great place to bring your urban baby/toddler! The under 5 set from Nopa/Cole Valley descends upon this place early in the evening.
author: nadia h.

description: Nopalito. I had the cod, tasted the chicken, ordered the ceviche for appetizer. Everything was good. The chips are homemade, and tasty, hard/cruncy...if you're in to that you'll be pleased. The seating area was strange in that it was small and the outside covered area had the heat going full blast, it literally felt like a sauna. Then moved to another area that was basically in the kitchen, not my preference. The waitresses were nice. I'll go again for their unique take on mexican food.
author: jay m.

description: Mexican food made modern. We loved all three of our main courses, includuing the carnitas, the goat, and my stew soup with hominy (least favorite). Also loved the simple desserts--very tasty Mexican hot chocolate and lime popsicle. Definitely worth recommending and going back again and again!
author: Steph W.

description: The owner of this fine establishment has the Midas touch. OK. So what's the big secret?? Great food, great staff and an owner who cares? Imagine that. Anyways, the carnitas is carnivore crack. Keep up the great work guys/gals...
author: Jeff B.

description: One of my and my husband's favorite Mexican restaurants!!  We actually prefer going to lunch over dinner because they have the mole chicken enchiladas on that menu.  But everything is fresh, tasty, and portion sizes are perfect.  Service has always been very good and friendly.
author: R N.

description: Really nice Mexican food with a gourmet twist; cool interior; good friendly service. Definitely recommended! The Carnitas were excellent.
author: Stephen B.

description: I really liked the small prices, understood them a little better when I saw the small portions. Being the American that I am, I was at first a little appalled to see the tiny thing.  After eating however I felt quite content.  Service was good. I liked the food menu, they could work on expanding the drink menu. One star off because the portion of chickpeas (I think that was what they were) which were served at the beginning of the meal was stupidly small. Really.  Otherwise I will be back.  They might consider trying to get some other customers than the all white yuppie crowd, it kind of irks me at a Mexican place to only see my people around me.
author: Max R.

description: This has become my favorite decor in the city. Rustic, hip, beautiful foods, great service. Tapas style. I seriously love Nopalito!  We had so much food its too much to name from Mole, to taco, to quesadilla. The drinks were okay but it didn't really matter!
author: lissy L.

description:
You know, this place has promise.  On better nights I'll bet the food here is downright delicious.  Unfortunately tonight it wasn't to be.  We waited almost an hour and a half for our table as a mere two-top, and once we sat down and our food arrived we were completely underwhelmed.  

I had the tostada with chicken and habanero salsa and pickled onions.  It was good, but the grease poured out when I bit into it, and it completely lacked seasoning.  It had an intense heat because of the habaneros, but I'm pretty sure there was no salt or pepper used on the meat.  I also had a blue corn taco with fried pork belly and queso fresco.  Sounds great, right?  Well, somehow it was horribly under seasoned and completely bland.  My fiancee had a fish taco that was similarly bland.  It was too bad, because the space was pretty cool and the service was good.  I especially liked the tecate in a can with lime and salt.  Ironic that the only salt I tasted tonight was in the beer!  I'll give this place one more chance because as I said, it has promise.
author: lars g.

description: I find this place very satisfying when we are in the mood for savoring a meal and are able to eat on the early side of meal time. I have ordered the flank steak, enchiladas mole and posole repeatedly. This place is tot-friendly when dining early, The queso (which is in everything) is pasteurized, so it is pregnant dining-friendly, too. One of the few places in SF that serves sangrita with tequila, and they have a decent tequila selection, too.
author: Michelle A.

description: This place rocks. I've only been for lunch, which I'm guessing is less of a scene than dinner. First time I had the carnitas, which are now my benchmark carnitas, the one to be beat. Loved the slaw served with it. Second time I had a gordita and the torta de chorizo verde. Wonderful. The people are all very nice, it's close to my house and they source local and natural/organic ingredients.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Conceptually this place would get 5 stars. I love Mexican food, and go all over SF searching for the perfect blend of freshness, authenticity, and delicious taste. So when I heard about Nopalito I was very excited. 

When you read the menu it sounds perfect. Authentic spices, peppers, onions, garlic pork, avocado.....traditional Mexican dishes but with quality local ingredients. 

The food however does not live up to the hype. The best tasting dish I received were the homemade chips - not a good sign. My enchiladas were undercooked, and while the sauce was nice, there was barely enough to coat the tortillas. There were four of us, and not one of us were very pleased with our dinners (unlike our experiences at Nopa.)
author: Sean R.

description: I can't remember the last time I had such good service. I went to dinner with two others and between us we had two vegetarians, two people who can't have dairy and one who can't eat gluten. The waiter was ah-mazing! Helpful, patient and attentive while not hovering. The menu is pricey but the service was worth it.
author: Emily R.

description:
yeah, i'm a fan of nopalito. this is one of those places where if you order right, you'll leave very happy, and without a completely decimated wallet.

this may mean staying away from mixed alcoholic beverages of some kinds, which are quite pricey and just ok. the non-alcoholic drinks, like the bergamot mint lemonade, are great. 

the food is very fresh, simple (in a complex way!), and satisfying. i've had the empanada (enormous--a meal in itself); caldo tlalpeno (utterly delicious); albondigas (these were pretty weird in color and consistency--wouldn't order them again); and the tamal (a couple different kinds--these are really, truly yummy). my dinner partners have enjoyed the taco de pescado, ceviche, and mole poblano de pollo. i'm looking forward to trying more dishes--like the much-talked-about carnitas--and some of the lunch items.

the flavored chick-pea snacks are great, and the tortillas are so wonderful i bring the extras home with me and eat them warm with a little honey. the paletas (popsicles) are divine, and the little cookies they give you at the end are very special, too. 

this place is busy so the service reflects that, but no complaints in that direction.... the servers and staff are really nice and down-to-earth. plus it's great that you can call ahead to be put on the waiting list. thumbs up all around!
author: Yelp Y.

description: wow. try the pozole rojo. it was so so good. i ate here over a week ago and i still think about this stew.  service was great, we asked for recommendations and were steered in the right direction.  i'll definitely be going back soon.
author: Evan R.

description: The atmosphere is fun, casual and modern.  The service was terrific and the food was very good.  My favorite is the carnitas.
author: L J.

description:
the carnitas. are necessary. so tender, so tasty. amazing. also, the chicken mole-- so tender, SO flavorful.

 sure, the wait can be long, but go in with the attitude expecting to have a drink or two. their drinks are amazing anyway (tried something with a smoky flavor- can't remember the name. half my party liked it, half did not-- but at the very least each of us deemed it quite interesting), and while we waited for a table a server actually approached us about drinks, allowing us to avoid the hecticness of the bar. service is great, food is excellent....and they have parking. i only take off one star because they don't take reservations...and for such a busy restaurant i really don't understand that.
author: Eryn R.

description: Considering the hype and raised expectations about this place from friends, my experience was meh. (Meh-xican food?).  The ling cod and the chicken enchiladas were very good, but not excellent. Balancing the quality of the food (quite good but not great) against the long wait (90 minutes), I was left wondering if perhaps I'd have been better off sticking to the tried and tested Mexican delights of the Mission.
author: Khao K.

description: Brilliant restaurant! I love the atmosphere, it's so quaint and cozy. The food is AMAZING!!! Great portions and the price is totally reasonable. Loving the location as well. Just an all around two-thumbs-up kind of a place. They give you these almond cookies at the end which are super delish too. Highly recommend this place! Fabulous !
author: AC Y.

description: I was very close to giving it 5 stars: If you didn't have to walk all around the corner and into Falletti foods to use the bathroom, then this would have been 5: 5 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service, 5 stars for the modern yet cozy and happy atmosphere. We tried three things and one was better than the other: The tamal de frijoles was a delicious vegetarian option with cheese and oyster mushrooms and a damn good red salsa. Tostada de tinga has perfectly cooked chicken, a not heavy at all fried tortilla and other delicious herbs and spices; the carnitas is the cleanest and most delicious I have tasted in SF, the marinade of beer, cinnamon and bay leaf is so good; they bring you hand-made tortillas right out of the oven. With the check you get a little mexican almond cookie - what a treat! I thought the prices were reasonable for what you get. And the portions are actually good, contrary to what some other yelpers say!
author: Chris D.

description: This place is good! Ordered the Almond Horchata. Very refreshing. Ordered the Totopos con Chile (Chips and Salsa) and pork belly quesadilla for appetizer. The chips and salsa had the right amount of kick to it. The pork belly in the quesadilla melted in my mouth. For entree, ordered the Carnitas. Delicious! Pork was super tender. No wonder it's on the 7x7 Food list. And to end, made in house watermelon popsicles. Pretty yummy!
author: Mel C.

description: This is my fourth time to Nopalito and I have to say my worst.  My boyfriend and I wanted to treat my family of 9 to dinner and thought this would be a good place since they rarely eat Mexican food (since we're Chinese).  I called in two hours before our dinner to put our name down and when we got there it took us ten minutes to get seated, not complaining.  The reason I'm giving 3 stars though is because of the service and food.  Our waiter forgot people's drinks so the drinks came out in 4 waves.  Our entrees took about 30 minutes to come out after our appetizers.  Coffee took another ten minutes but our waiter forgot an order so he brought one then we had to wait another ten for the second, so twenty minutes for two coffees.  The food all seemed too similar and we ordered almost everything on the menu so that's saying a lot.  It makes me sad because I wanted this experience to be amazing since I was treating but it really disappointed.  Probably won't be going back even though I used to LOVE this place :(
author: Monique C.

description: The wait staff are really friendly and helpful. The food overall is really good. Especially, the ceviche (this was some of the best I've had not too spicy or salty, done just right) and enchiladas plancheras. However, the albondigas (Mexican meatballs) were awful. I told the waitress and she apologized and took it off my bill. I would give Nopalito 3.5 stars.
author: blahblah h.

description: I think that this is a great little place. It's a little crammed, but I have never had a problem getting in and getting a table, or sitting at the bar. I think that there mixed drinks are a little too overpriced for what they are. Not to mention I think it is a bit ridiculous to charge over $3 dollars for a Popsicle. Other than that I think that the food and service is really good. I think that the carnitas is the best thing on the menu.
author: Cortney H.

description: It is kind of a "who cares?". There are too many other restaurants in San Francisco to bother with this place.  Quality of ingredient is good, but everything tasted the same.  Lots of fried tortillas and very little of anything else.  I encourage you to go for the tortilla chips alone.  All the rest is a "why bother?". Oh, and I haven't mentioned the bill.  It costs too much for what you get.  Save your money.  Go to Gordo's.
author: chad H.

description: Little international cousin of NOPA.  Seats 40 at the most and they serve drinks while you are waiting with heating lamps outside.  Delicious unique bites.  Prices are modest, $4 to $13 and the non-alcoholic drinks are delicious.  Hibiscus blood orange, almond horchata.  Servings are nice and neat and flavorful.  We had the chips, fish taco, gordita, pork tamale, cabbage salad, goat stew and carnitas.  Everything was well presented, a combination of spicy, tangy and saucy, as well as refreshing for people who have eaten everything in San Francisco.  We did share a 8 top bench and sat next to couples who were super friendly.  We coveted their crispy chicken and soup.  The staff was attentive and the restaurant was not too noisy, but pleasantly buzzing.  I'm looking foreward to lunch there.  This is not your local taqueria house.  This is a sit down place.  I'm not sure that I would go to go since the food is so pretty when laid out.
author: Diana L.

description: Loved it!! Ok, so I'd been wanting wanting wanting to try this place for SO long now! My beau and I decided to go out for a nice Sunday afternoon dinner to celebrate a new job I was starting the next day (GOOO ME!) So I suggested we check it out being as Nopa is our fave fave fave restie in SF. (So far....) Anyhoo, they of course do not take reservations so we said no prob you can find us at the bar when the table is ready! We're easy to please. I had a margarita which was dece. I mean come on how hard is it really to eff up a marg? The wait time was actually fairly short and we got a table shortly thereafter. We ordered a few things randomly just to share. THE MUSTS: Ceviche (unfortunately we ordered this at the end of the meal as we thought we needed JUST. ONE. MORE.) it was the best though. Pork belly quesadilla is also a must. Although I will warn you it is very heavy and meaty! Yum-o-rama! THE EH'S: something on the rib (maybe pork, I dunno, I'm not such a big meat eater... that's what she said.) enchiladas. Too heavy. It was good but after having the pork quesadilla, this little lady had entirely too much meat at that point. THE I WILL TRY THIS AT DEL TACO: the fish taco. Yup, pass that one up. I've had better at Rubio's. I'm just sayin.... Great ambiance, really good food and good company. Why not give it 4 stars!
author: Andrea Y.

description: i've been there once and had carnitas. it was awesome. the next time i went back they said it would be an hour wait for a table for three people... an hour wait for mexican food. give me a break. and they don't take reservations. i might be able to give it five stars if i could ever eat there again.
author: Geoff B.

description: deelicious.  the carnitas are grrreat and pretty much everything i've tried i've loved.  you must try the horchata as well.  great place for lunch or dinner.
author: a g.

description: I decided to give Nopalito a second chance because Michael Bauer was so effusive in his review.  This time I was much happier, but still if I had to use one word to characterize the food here it would be:   dry!!!   Totally missing is any trace of lard, oil, fat, etc...all the things that generally make Mexican food so tasty.   It's a bit like eating food where all the moisture has been sucked out leaving fibre and not much else.  However, because the enchiladas I ordered today came with a mole sauce this defect was somewhat ameliorated and the mole itself was one of the best I have ever had on this side of the border.   So I will have to say I am now willing to endorse Nopalito with the caveat that you should make sure that you avoid items that suffer too much from the dryness syndrome.
author: David T.

description: I thought it was just a tad pricey but the food was pretty good.  Carnitas and the quesadillas are my favorites.  Loved the homemade blood orange popsicle for dessert too. =)
author: Z T.

description: Really liked the ambiance, food and margaritas.  Great place for a first date.
author: J.A. T.

description: delicious food, cute little place, i like their message.  can't wait to go back.
author: Michelle B.

description: We sat at the bar yesterday around 6pm, did not have to wait. The waitress and hostess were very pleasant and welcoming. However, the folks in the kitchen didn't seem as happy. (except the tortilla cook and guy next to her who were smiling and having fun. Unfortunately, this dour kitchen feeling seemed to translate to the food. I'm all for serious cooking but its clear that when there is no joy at all in the food. We ordered juice drinks which were great. We also had the ceviche which was tasty. Then the gorditas ... they looked like they were going to be delicious, but just fell flat and were lacking that nice meat flavor. I think they may have forgotten to season the beef! Maybe it was an off day and they were tired but I hope they are able to handle the business and turn our tasty bites in the future!
author: Meghan W.

description: Amazing flavors in every dish we tried.  There are a few restaurants where you feel like you've had some really great flavor combinations and quality ingredients without spending a lot of money.  This is on a short list of those places, along with Beretta.
author: Tom Z.

description: Delicious and a nice upscale alternative to the tacoria.  My only complaint is that the wait list to get in is alway very long. Luckily there are delicious drinks to wait with.
author: Hilary P.

description: This place is perfect for the following reasons: the food is cheap considering sf standards, the food tastes spicy and delicious without being chock full of calories and fat a la taqueria food, and the atmosphere and waitstaff are enjoyable.  You can come here and have a filling lunch or dinner with a few drinks and not pay over $50.  Sure the Western Addition is being gentrified and Nopa is taking over, but who cares when you can have hot chilaquiles and a tecate on a patio across from the panhandle?  Not me.
author: Jessica K.

description: Happen to check this venue with close friends and it's decent. Cant make reservations though and  you just have to put your name down on the list with phone number and cross your fingers.  So not a good place to set an exact time for dinner or to meet. It's up in the air for a table which may take a couple hours as I did (2hrs). Great location and good thing there's a Peets coffee next door. So the decor is nice and food is so-so. Had the Carnitas and quesadilla- small portion and nothing special. Could probably get the same taste/ style in the MIssion but just not on a fancy plate. I was a nice place to try but nothing struck me to go again or it could just  be the no reservation policy.....I dont really see the poplularity of it besides the location and decor......My friends are what made it my night!
author: Edward B.

description: excellent food,great service,even though they were very busy.phoned in order,it was ready! great place
author: Holger B.

description: This place is the real deal. Actual Mexican flavors as opposed to grease. I had the Gordita de Picadillo and the Pescada a la Talla. Both were excellent. Service was good and wait wasn't too bad for SF standards. Go here if you like Mexican cuisine with quality ingrediants.
author: clay b.

description: I would have gladly dropped 3 1/2 stars here (if I could, side note: wtf yelp, I think we've all been waiting for the half star option long enough, get that shit done already) just based on the carnitas, however that's not all we ordered. Avoid the steak & avoid take out. We brought home two orders of the most inedible meat I've ever tripped over. It wasn't that it was just tough, it was that both orders were damn near 80% gristle. I'm not talking fat here, I'm talking undigestible misery. One piece and 10 minutes of chewing later I just gave up which isn't second nature to me, I'm a plow through it and smile kinda guy. The flavor wasn't bad mind you, just the meat. Bad meat. And I'll give them the benefit of the doubt on this one and not just because I'm getting married in Guanajuato next week, but  because I honestly believe that shit happens, meat goes wrong and cooks sometimes just don't care enough to notice (especially for take out). I'll also give them a star for responsiveness, we called to alert them to the problem ie. complain like a mutha, and the manager's response was perfectly apologetic and claimed to be sending us a gift cert. post haste (we shall see...) I want to like this place, I really do, the neighborhood needs it and the other reviews are great so...I'll try again, but mostly that's because I hate giving up.
author: crow s.

description: Don't order the Pozole; it's weak and insipid flavour reminded me of retooled leftovers. Think of broth overly spiced with cumino and chili powder.  Feeble attempt at mexican food, I'd say.  My friend ordered Huevos that were smothered in Green sauce; she spent the whole meal trying to remove the sauce from the eggs.  the beer was good.  Strange, this restaurant should do a much better job on the basics...the prices dictate expectations, and the prices are very high for bad mexican food in SF.
author: melanie m.

description:
I was excited to try Nopalito, since i'm a big fan of Nopa and I love Mexican food.  The wait wasn't too long; the waiter was kind enough to put the tab for the drinks under the name on the waitlist- that was very classy.
I was with 2 other friends and we were very intruiged with the appitizer list; we decided to order 7 of the 10 items.  We did enjoy them all, a few were a bit too"fried/oily" but the flavors were quite nice.  One thing that bothered all of us was that the wait staff came over and tried to clear our plates whenwe weren't done.  It wasn't as though we were taking foever; the pace of bringing out the food was nice.  They were just too anxious to clean the tables.  I had 1/4 glass of beer left and she wanted to take it away...This was after 3-4 times of almost taking away plates that still had food on it.
Unfortunatly, that experience took sway from the great taste of the food.
The wait staff needs to relax a bit.....
Not sure if I'll go back; perhaps I'll let them work out the kinks.
The prices are great, by the way!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Crazy good Mexican food! Great for brunch too. You just can't go wrong with any of the dishes.
author: Josh M.

description: One of my new favorites. Everything I've had has been good and fresh. I usually get the carnitas, which is Amazing. I don't even like Mexican food! I have had several things off of their menu, I also remember the goat stew being memorable. Their non-alcoholic drinks are also really good. On a recent trip we had a nice, dry rose that went well with Mexican. I think wine and Mexican is often hard to pair but this went well. Their ceviche was tasty and fresh and came in lime juice that tasted to fresh I wondered why I don't have fresh squeezed lime juice everyday. They also bring you as many corn tortillas as you want, which are always very hot and fresh. The spiced garbanzo beans at the beginning of every meal and the Mexican wedding cookies are also a nice touch. This last time we had the Popsicle for dessert. I had the chocolate cinnamon, which was like eating a chocolate bar on a stick. So good! It is a bit pricey (I think it is worth it) and you usually have to wait (depends on how hungry I am...).
author: Kathleen Y.

description: LOVE it, worth the long wait on a Wed night. the carnitas with fresh tortillas was awesome. nice to see Mexican served up the real way instead of the tex mex gut fest, fresh, organic and sustainable ingredients.
author: Linda Y.

description: Nopalito was fantastic; I don't particularly like Mexican food because most of the time one gets refried beans, rice and goo but i will keep going back to this restaurant when i want authentic Mexican food. The food was pure heaven, well seasoned and totally delicious.
author: roberta r.

description: Great menu, very authentic, flavorful, and healthy.  Carnitas cooked in parchment to lock in the flavor - outstanding!  The corn dish, side of pinto beans, appetizers all were very good.  Great prices and perhaps the best original mexican food in town.  I'm a definite fan.  Service, prics, portions (and i'm all about not being hungry after dinner), and atmosphere also good.
author: Michael C.

description: they make micheladas here - bloody-mary-like drink with beer, spices, lime, and salt rim!! for our late lunch, we tried their chipotle fish tacos, ceviche, and of course, their carnitas. all incredible and now we must go back to try every other item on their menu. who knows? maybe i'll even be adventurous enough to attempt their huitlacoche quesadilla.
author: Angi C.

description: Service is great. We sat at the bar but couldn't get a full view of the kitchen. It was pouring raining and since the bathroom is outside the restaurant I decided not to go (this part sucks big time). We had chips to start with and they were presented with some very dried cheese on top and sour cream, no sauce at all, good but dried. I had the enchiladas plate and I was very disappointed. It was totally different than what I expected. It came with a breast chicken on a side and two folded tortillas. Everything was dried, no sauce,no melted cheese,no salsa. The breast chicken was good. If you love enchiladas you'll be disappointed, this dish doesn't even get close to the idea of enchiladas. My husband had carnitas and he liked it even though he had to ask for salsa. What kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't automatically serve salsa ? Dessert was very disappointing as well They only serve homemade popsicle...kind of strange combination since that is not what I am craving after a Mexican dinner. I will go back again but I am hoping I will have a less "dried" and bland experience.
author: Biemme B.

description: I've eaten here twice and so far I like the place. I applaud the use of organic meats and veggies (hence the price) and the attentiveness that goes into homemade tortillas and drinks. What I don't applaud are the wait times... but OK, fine, it's a popular place! I've only ever gone here with larger parties (4+), which works out well because we get to sample a lot of different dishes. Their carnitas are pretty good, better than most places I've tried. Their re-fried beans are the best I've ever had (don't tell my grandma!) and I like the little touches across the board: the glass milk containers for water and ice tea, the hooks under the tables for your purse/coat. I don't like how some of the tables are so close together you get a stranger's ass/crotch in your face when getting in and out from the table. Some of the items on the menu are a bit of a stretch (and pretentious) as far as "traditional" Mexican food, but it's definitely a nice upscale Mexican restaurant which is hard to do around these parts, and they execute it very well.
author: Hotdogger G.

description: Tasty, good quality, reasonably priced Mexican interpretations.
author: Stephen S.

description: great atmosphere and drinks.  The food is a bit small and the menu is pricey.  Still a good spot to go for a fun group dinner.  Enjoyed the night very much.  Make sure to call ahead and put your name down on the weekend nights.  The wait can get long.
author: Tyler S.

description:
i am, admittedly, obsessed with nopa, so when we saw that the folks behind that place were opening up an authentic mexican outpost, i just about died with excitement. then i had to wait for months and months before they opened- again i almost died. and then we thought nopalito had finally opened- but no! it was just for special guests! another near death experience. it's pretty much a miracle that i've made it through the past year, what with all of the nopa-lito related excitement.
we FINALLY were able to try out the delicious eats at nopalito the other day, and man, it did not disappoint. the carnitas were absolutely insane  melt in your mouth goodness. and my lady got the chicken enchiladas- sounds tame, but again, amazingly good. the only drawback to nopalito is that it's pretty tiny, so the wait can be loooong. though they've added tables to the patio since we were there, which i'm sure has helped a teensy bit. i cannot wait to go back- they have take out now! the joy never ends.
author: oona m.

description: This place ROCKS.  My new favorite restaurant in SF.  Fresh, inventive, innovative, affordable and no-drama, friendly service.
author: David C.

description: We are fans.  The place is tough to get into and can be crowded feeling, but the food is really great and the table service is good.
author: Steve O.

description: met friends for lunch and it was delicious!!  they have small plates so order a couple if you're hungry.  the popscicle for dessert was yummy too.
author: jennifer l.

description: My experience was good - not great - good.  Good tasty food - good friendly service - easy to park - nice patio.  I would make no effort to go back - but if I was in the hood and hungry I would pop in and chow down.
author: stephanie d.

description: come on guys, really? this place is average at best. no bold flavors, no standout dishes, nothing here that convinces me they're trying all that hard. i was hoping for something a little more unique. nice place, good service, average food.
author: Adam F.

description: Finally, got into Nopalito to find out what all the hoopla was about and found out. From the handling of the waiting list at the door,  unusual and delicious mex/cal cuisine, great table service, attractive interior decor to an amazing chocolate cinnamon popsicle at the end, this place is awesome.
author: Dale D.

description: I wish I could give 3.5 stars but I'll round up.    I have been for lunch several times and dinner once.  The wait staff are great.  Very attentive and engaging and also great with kids (a big plus in the NoPA hood).   The food has pluses and minuses.  Mole, Tamal, Horchata and house made tortillas are all great.  Carnitas and several other items are good.  This is not your typical spicy gut bomb taqueria food.  If that is what you want there are many many choices.  Nopalito is more subtle.  My main critique is some of sides and lunch items are very small plates, with few garinishes.  And it seems that simplicty is a key - and some of the dishes seemed dry or needed "something".  All in all (atmosphere and staff included) I'd definitely say try it but don't expect typical bay area "mexican" food.
author: E. Z.

description: Had dinner here for the first time.  Arrived at 9:15pm (midweek).  Much to my surprise, the place was still packed.  After a short wait (10-15 min), we were seated at the bar area.  Menu was limited - I ordered the Cod ($15), a quesadilla ($8), sangria ($7).  Portions were terribly small - the quesadilla was gone in three bites.  Not a good start to the meal.  As I moved onto the cod, I had the unfortunate shock of realizing I was chewing more than just fish -- I extracted a long blond (presumably human) hair before swallowing the second portion of the (otherwise tasty) poached cod.  The apologetic waitress ordered me another cod -- thankfully, sans hair.  Quickly finished the meal and asked for the check (the cod was comp'ed).  Waitress claimed it was the "first time" she experienced something like this at Nopalito but reminded me that the cooks are not "robots" and it happens "all the time" at other restaurants.  We this reassurance, she expressed the hope I would return.  I think I'll pass.
author: Steve K.

description: no margaritas at a mexican restaurant? shit! brought our friend here for her 21st and we couldn't even get her any liquor. oh well, our fault for not checking. so we get a couple bottles of red wine (the only choice) and tried to get a little buzz. ordered and shared a bunch of dishes, but had to order more because portions were small. the mole was good, but didn't blow me away, ceviche was delicious and refreshing, quesadilla roja was yummy, carnitas were tender in the middle and a little crispy on the outside (but not chewy), just perfect! the "Panucho de Pollo al Pibil" was bomb too. Overall a great dinner!
author: N. M.

description: Holy cow, this place is awesome. I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally made it over today. The food is amazing. I was in a group of four and we tried six dishes (wanted to try about 12 dishes). Everything we ordered was REALLY good. Even the special drinks were yummy. The waiter we got was super-knowledgeable and more than willing to make some great recommendations. The interior design of space is very cool (clean design, but not sterile; nice use of warm materials and colors). The food here is nothing like the food at the taquerias in The Mission, so please go with the right expectations. This is authentic Mexican food, as opposed to Cal-Mex. The food is professionally prepared with all local/organic/sustainable ingredients. This last point explains the only slight negative of this place. Our lunch for four came out to roughly $85 with tax/tip. Again, don't think of it as eating Cal-Mex, but something a bit more refined and you won't get shock with your bill.
author: Joe C.

description: I had a craving for Mexican, but needed something more than a burrito so a bunch of friends and I decided on Nopalito.  I was a little nervous since the recent Yelp reviews had been mixed and thought that perhaps the restaurant was overwhelmed now that it had made Michael Bauer's Top 100 list.  We phoned 45 minutes before we arrived to get on the list and there was still a 35 minute wait?!  A burrito was starting to sound good!  I am glad we waited because we were not disappointed.  For starters we had the totopos (OK and the homemade cotija is a nice touch), ceviche (very good), and quesadilla azul (yummy!) and for mains we pretty much covered the options.  The outstanding dishes were the carnitas (crisp on the outside, but juicy and tender) and the birria (who knew goat could be so good!) - oh, and the homemade tortillas were delicious!  The pescado was very good, as was the mole, although note that it is an entire leg-thigh piece.  I had high expectations for the lamb barbacoa, but it was too gamey for me.  The service was excellent - some of the best wait staff I have experienced in the City.  Try it - but take a peek at the menu first, this isn't chips/salsa/guacamole Mexican and make sure to call in early to get on the waiting list. (Food 3.5 stars and Service 4.5 stars).
author: Lori G.

description: the complimentary roasted chickpeas to start are fantastic along with the blood orange sangria.  my most memorable dish here is the carnitas, it is tasty but  heavy so we don't get it everytime.  next time i go i am trying the pozole as the table for 4 next to me all came especially and ordered the pozole with ecstatic yums and wows. totopos are good but large, so be careful if it is only one or two people!  i didn't care much for the orange salad as it is only orange slices topped with queso fresco, i think it would be great on a hot day in LA, but was flat in SF.
author: kathleen A.

description: delicious, low fuss dishes are simple and are begged to be shared.  i order a few dishes so we can all share.  the ceviche is great, the white sangria is fresh and addicting.  i love the dessert popsicles!  cafe con leche, chocolate (which is like dense frozen fudge-like, or lime...mmmmm
author: Rene V.

description: enchillada was flavorless. pork was great. most of the dishes were great.  it's not the mexican food you're used to here. more authentic, not as poignant.  dont have a full bar but have creative drinks.  very small interior area. outside area is cold on a cold day. they dont take reservations so you have to wait.
author: Yelper S.

description: Great value for much a much-needed excellent Mexican food restaurant.  My boyfriend and I shared four plates and two drinks for $45 dollars, and the food was delicious!  I just moved here from AZ, so I've been missing the south-of-the-border cuisine.  We began with two house-made almond milk horchatas, which were thick and excellent.  Watching a cook make tortillas by hand at the grill, we waited 15 minutes (we called ahead to put our name on the list before we left the house).  The appetizer of chips with red sauce, cheese and sour cream was crunchy and spicy.  We also shared a pork tamale (A+, order it), chicken tostada (B+, chicken had interesting citris and spice flavor and was tender), and beef in red chile sauce (A, strips of grass fed beef, comes with beans and house-made tortillas, and fabulous pickled onions to make mini burritos).  I highly recommend this restaurant for interesting Mexican flavors, very nice wait staff, and a great value.  I think I'll try the mole next time!
author: Leah D.

description: Nopalito. Really nice, comfortable decor featuring very exciting and unusual food, artfully served by a so-so waitstaff.  The color choices of green, dark brown, and white got me ready for the food to come.  I could almost taste the the kind of nueva mexicana feel in before I even started eating.  Sitting at the bar was quite interesting because I was able to see the workings of the kitchen while I ate the food which they prepared.  I ordered the swordfish taco, which was very tasty, combining citrusy orange with the subtle flavor of the fish and the fresh corn tortilla. For my entree I had the tender and delicious carnitas, which I would recommend to anyone looking for some succulent and delectable pork.  The waiters and waitresses were very attentive and cordial.  There was, however one waitress who, when I attempted to order a drink, expressed her own dislike of it and convinced me to order something else.  I still do not know how I feel about this gesture, for it was most definitely meant to be helpful, but I found it a little perturbing that a member of the staff would openly criticize a menu item in front of the customer.  Aside form this occurence, I found the meal delightful.
author: Kirk J.

description: ordered chips, fish taco, pork belly quesadilla, ceviche, blood orange/grapefruit salad, carnitas, duck leg mole, and the braised rack of lamb special. can honestly say everything was good. the stand-outs for me were the pork belly quesadilla and the lamb. every bite of the quesadilla was a blissful mouthful of flavor and texture, and the lamb was perfectly cooked with a rich sauce/paste on the side. i was slightly disappointed with the carnitas because of the rave reviews here - it's respectable but not spectacular. i wish there were a larger selection for alcoholic beverages - few beers and wine but a delicious sangria that was just potent enough. the wait staff was excellent - attentive but not pushy. coffee flavored popsicle wrapped up a very satisfying meal. all in all the perfect neighborhood gem. i'd come here every week if i live in sf. this is a sit-down restaurant so dont compare the price to one of those that you get-in-line order-at-the-counter type of joint.
author: kenneth y.
